2344: indeed, He has full cognizance of them, and has numbered them with [unfailing] numbering;
2345: and every one of them will appear before Him on Resurrection Day in a lonely state.
2346: VERILY, those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds will the Most Gracious endow with love:
2347: and only to this end have We made this [divine writ] easy to understand, in thine own tongue, [O Prophet,] so that thou might convey thereby a glad tiding to the God-conscious, and warn thereby those who are given to [futile] contention:
2348: for, how many a generation have We destroyed before their time - [and] canst thou perceive any one of them [now], or hear any whisper of them?
2350: We did not bestow the Qur'an on thee from on high to make thee unhappy,
2351: but only as an exhortation to all who stand in awe [of God]:
2352: a revelation from Him who has created the earth and the high heavens
2353: the Most Gracious, established on the throne of His almightiness?
2354: Unto Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth, as well as all that is between them and all that is beneath the sod.
2355: And if thou say anything aloud, [He hears it] since, behold, He knows [even] the secret [thoughts of man] as well as all that is yet more hidden [within him].
2356: God-there is no deity save Him; His [alone] are the attributes of perfection!
2357: AND HAS the story of Moses ever come within thy ken?
2358: Lo! he saw a fire [in the desert]; and so he said to his family: "Wait here! Behold, I perceive a fire [far away]: perhaps I can bring you a brand there from, or find at the fire some guidance."
2359: But when he came close to it, a voice called out: "O Moses!
2360: Verily, I am thy Sustainer! Take off, then, thy sandals! Behold, thou art in the twice hallowed valley,
2361: and I have chosen thee [to be My apostle]: listen, then, to what is being revealed [unto thee].
2362: "Verily, I - I alone - am God; there is no deity save Me. Hence, worship Me alone, and be constant in prayer, so as to remember Me!
2363: "Behold, [although] I have willed to keep it hidden, the Last Hour is bound to come, so that every human being may be recompensed in accordance with what he strove for [in life].
2364: Hence, let not anyone who does not believe in its coming and follows [but] his own desires divert thee from [belief in] it, lest thou perish!
2365: "Now, what is this in thy right hand, O Moses?"
2366: He answered: "It is my staff; I lean on it; and with it I beat down leaves for my sheep; and [many] other uses have I for it."
2367: Said He: "Throw it down, O Moses!"
2368: So he threw it - and lo! it was a snake, moving rapidly.
2369: Said He: "Take hold of it, and fear not: We shall restore it to its former state.
2370: "Now place thy hand within thy armpit: it will come forth [shining] white, without blemish, as another sign [of Our grace],
2371: so that We might make thee aware of some of Our greatest wonders.
2372: "[And now] go thou unto Pharaoh: for, verily, he has transgressed all bounds of equity.
2373: Said [Moses]: "O my Sustainer! Open up my heart [to Thy light],
2374: and make my task easy for me,
2375: and loosen the knot from my tongue
2376: so that they might fully understand my speech,
2377: and appoint for me, out of my kinsfolk, one who will help me to bear my burden:
2379: Add Thou through him to my strength,
2380: and let him share my task,
2381: so that [together] we might abundantly extol Thy limitless glory
2383: Verily, Thou seest all that is within us!"
2384: Said He: "Thou art granted all that thou hast asked for, O Moses!
2385: "And, indeed, We bestowed Our favour upon thee at a time long since past,
2386: when We inspired thy mother with this inspiration:
2387: Place him in a chest and throw it into the river, and thereupon the river will cast him ashore, [and] one who is an enemy unto Me and an enemy unto him will adopt him. "And [thus early] I spread Mine Own love over thee -and [this] in order that thou might be formed under Mine eye.
2388: "[And thou wert under Mine eye] when thy sister went forth and said [to Pharaoh's people], 'Shall I guide you unto [a woman] who might take charge of him?'' And so We returned thee unto thy mother, so that her eye be gladdened, and that she might not sorrow [any longer]. "And [when thou camest of age, thou didst slay a man: but We did save thee from all grief, although We tried thee with various trials. "And then thou didst sojourn for years among the people of Madyan; and now thou hast come [here] as ordained [by Me], O Moses:
2389: for I have chosen thee for Mine Own service.
2390: "Go forth, [then,] thou and thy brother, with My messages, and never tire of remembering Me:
2391: go forth, both of you, unto Pharaoh: for, verily, he has transgressed all bounds of equity!
2392: But speak unto him in a mild manner, so that he might bethink himself or [at least] be filled with apprehension.
2393: The two [brothers] said: "O our Sustainer! Verily, we fear lest he act hastily with regard to us, or lest he [continue to] transgress all bounds of equity."
2394: Answered He: "Fear not! Verily, I shall be with you two, hearing and seeing [all].
2395: Go, then; you two unto him and say, `Behold, we are apostles sent by thy Sustainer: let, then, the children of Israel go with us, and cause them not to suffer [any longer]. We have now come unto thee with a message from thy Sustainer; and [know that His] peace shall be [only] on those who follow [His] guidance:
2396: for, behold, it has been revealed to us that [in the life to come] suffering shall befall all who give the lie to the truth and turn away [from it]!"'
2397: [But when God's message was conveyed unto Pharaoh,] he said: "Who, now, is this Sustainer of you two, O Moses?"
2398: He replied: "Our Sustainer is He who gives unto every thing [that exists] its true nature and form. and thereupon guides it [towards its fulfilment].
2399: Said [Pharaoh]: "And what of all the past generations?"
2400: [Moses] answered: "Knowledge thereof rests with my Sustainer [alone, and is laid down] in His decree; my Sustainer does not err, and neither does He forget."
2401: HE IT IS who has made the earth a cradle for you, and has traced out for you ways [of livelihood] thereon, and [who] sends down waters from the sky: and by this means We bring forth various kinds of plants.
2402: Eat, [then, of this produce of the soil,] and pasture your cattle [thereon]. In all this, behold, there are messages indeed for those who are endowed with reason:
2403: out of this [earth] have We created you, and into it shall We return you, and out of it shall We bring you forth once again.
2404: AND, INDEED, We made Pharaoh aware of all Our messages-but he gave them the lie and refused [to heed them].
2405: He said: "Hash thou come to drive us out of our land by thy sorcery, O Moses?
2406: In that case, we shall most certainly produce before thee the like thereof! Appoint, then, a tryst between us and thee - which we shall not fail to keep, nor [mayest] thou -at a suitable place!"
2407: Answered [Moses]: "Your tryst shall be the day of the Festival; and let the people assemble when the sun is risen high."
2408: Thereupon Pharaoh withdrew [with his counsellors] and decided upon the scheme which he would pursue; and then he came [to the tryst].
2409: Said Moses to them: "Woe unto you! Do not invent lies against God, lest He afflict you with most grievous suffering: for He who contrives [such] a lie is already undone!"
2410: So they debated among themselves as to what to do; but they kept their counsel secret,
2411: saying [to one another]: "These two are surely sorcerers intent on driving you from your land by their sorcery, and on doing away with your time-honoured way of life.
2412: Hence, [O sorcerers of Egypt,] decide upon the scheme which you will pursue, and then come forward in one single body: for, indeed, he who prevails today shall prosper indeed!"
2413: Said [the sorcerers]: "O Moses! Either thou throw (thy staff first], or we shall be the first to throw."
2414: He answered: "Nay, you throw [first]." And lo! by virtue of their sorcery, their [magic] ropes and staffs seemed to him to be moving rapidly:
2415: and in his heart Moses became apprehensive.
2416: [But] We said: "Fear not! Verily, it is thou who shalt prevail!
2417: And [now] throw that [staff] which is in thy right hand -it shall swallow up all that they have wrought: [for] they have wrought only a sorcerer's artifice, and the sorcerer can never come to any good, whatever he may aim at!"
2418: [And so it happened and down fell the sorcerers, prostrating themselves in adoration, [and] exclaimed: "We have come to believe in the Sustainer of Moses and Aaron!"
2419: Said [Pharaoh]: "Have you come to believe in him ere I have given you permission? Verily, he must be your master who has taught you magic! But I shall most certainly cut off your hands and feet in great numbers, because of [your] perverseness, and I shall most certainly crucify you in great numbers on trunks of palm-trees: and [I shall do this] so that you might come to know for certain as to which of us [two] can inflict a more severe chastisement, and [which] is the more abiding!"
2420: They answered: "Never shall we prefer thee to all the evidence of the truth that has come unto us, nor to Him who has brought us into being! Decree, then, whatever thou art going to decree: thou canst decree only [something that pertains to] this worldly life!
2421: As for us, behold, we have come to believe in our Sustainer, [hoping] that He may forgive us our faults and all that magic unto which thou hast forced us: for God is the best [to look forward to], and the One who is truly abiding."
2422: VERILY, as for him who shall appear before his Sustainer [on Judgment Day] lost in sin - his [portion], behold, shall be hell: he will neither die therein nor live;
2423: whereas he who shall appear before Him as a believer who has done righteous deeds - it is such that shall have lofty stations [in the life to come]:
2424: gardens of perpetual bliss, through which running waters flow, therein to abide: for that shall be the recompense of all who attain to purity.
2425: AND, INDEED, [a time came when] We thus inspired Moses: "Go forth with My servants by night, and strike out for them a dry path through the sea; [and] fear not of being overtaken, and dread not [the sea]."
2426: And Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts: and they were overwhelmed by the sea which was destined to overwhelm them.
2427: because Pharaoh had led his people astray and had not guided [them] aright.
2428: O children of Israel! [Thus] We saved you from your enemy, and [then] We made a covenant with you on the right-hand slope of Mount Sinai, and repeatedly sent down manna and quails unto you, [saying,]
2429: "Partake of the good things which We have provided for you as sustenance, but do not transgress therein the bounds of equity lest My condemnation fall upon you: for, he upon whom My condemnation falls has indeed thrown himself into utter ruin!"
2430: Yet withal, behold, I forgive all sins unto any who repents and attains to faith and does righteous deeds, and thereafter keeps to the right path.
2431: [AND GOD SAID:] "Now what has caused thee, O Moses, to leave thy people behind in so great a haste?"
2432: He answered: "They are treading in my footsteps while I have hastened unto Thee, O my Sustainer, so that Thou might be well-pleased [with me]."
2433: Said He: "Then [know that], verily, in thy absence We have put thy people to a test, and the Samaritan has led them astray."
2434: Thereupon Moses returned to his people full of wrath and sorrow, [and] exclaimed: "O my people! Did not your Sustainer hold out [many] a goodly promise to you? bid, then, [the fulfilment of] this promise seem to you too long in coming? Or are you, perchance, determined to see your Sustainer's condemnation fall upon you, and so you broke your promise to me?"
2435: They answered: "We did not break our promise to thee of our own free will, but [this is what happened:] we were loaded with the [sinful] burdens of the [Egyptian] people's ornaments, and so we threw them [into the fire], and likewise did this Samaritan cast [his into it]."
2436: But then, [so they told Moses, the Samaritan] had produced for them [out of the molten gold] the effigy of a calf, which made a lowing sound; and thereupon they said [to one another], "This is your deity, and the deity of Moses-but he has forgotten [his past]
2437: Why-did they not see that [the thing] could not give them any response, and had no power to harm or to benefit them?
2438: And, indeed, even before [the return of Moses] had Aaron said unto them: "O my people! You are but being tempted to evil by this [idol] -for, behold, your [only] Sustainer is the Most Gracious! Follow me, then, and obey my bidding!"
2439: [But] they answered: "By no means shall we cease to worship it until Moses comes back to us!"
2440: [And now that he had come back, Moses] said: "O Aaron! What has prevented thee, when thou didst see that they had gone astray,
2441: from [abandoning them and] following me? Hast thou, then, [deliberately] disobeyed my commandment?"
2442: Answered [Aaron]: "O my mother's son! Seize me not by my beard, nor by my head! Behold, I was afraid lest [on thy return] thou say, 'Thou hast caused a split among the children of Israel, and hast paid no heed to my bidding!"
2443: Said [Moses]: "What, then, didst thou have in view, O Samaritan?"
2444: He answered: "I have gained insight into something which they were unable to see: and so I took hold of a handful of the Apostle's teachings and cast it away: for thus has my mind prompted me [to act]."
2445: Said [Moses]; "Begone, then! And, behold, it shall be thy lot to say throughout [thy] life, `Touch me not! But, verily, [in the life to come] thou shalt be faced with a destiny from which there will be no escape! And [now] look at this deity of thine to whose worship thou hast become so devoted: we shall most certainly burn it, and then scatter [whatever remains of] it far and wide over the sea!
2446: Your only deity is God - He save whom there is no deity, [and whho] embraces all things within His knowledge!"
2447: THUS DO WE relate unto thee some of the stories of what happened in the past; and [thus] have We vouchsafed unto thee, out of Our grace, a reminder.
2448: All who shall turn away from it will, verily, bear a [heavy] burden on the Day of Resurrection:
2449: they will abide in this [state], and grievous for them will be the weight [of that burden] on the Day of Resurrection -
2450: on the Day when the trumpet is blown: for on that Day We will assemble all such as had been lost in sin, their eyes dimmed [by terror],
2451: whispering unto one another, "You have spent but ten [days on earth]
2452: [But] We know best what they will be saying when the most perceptive of them shall say, "You have spent [there] but one day!"
2453: AND THEY WILL ask thee about [what will happen to] the mountains [when this world comes to an end]. Say, then: "My Sustainer will scatter them far and wide,
2454: and leave the earths level and bare,
2455: [so that] thou wilt see no curve thereon, and no ruggedness.
2456: On that Day, all will. follow the summoning Voice from which there will be no escape; and all sounds will be hushed before the Most Gracious, and thou wilt hear nothing but a faint sough in the air.
2457: On that Day, intercession shall be of no avail [to any] save him in whose case the Most Gracious will have granted leave therefor, and whose word [of faith) He will have accepted:
2458: [for] He knows all that lies open before men and all that is hidden from them, whereas they cannot encompass Him with their knowledge.
2459: And [on that Day] all faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Self-Subsistent Fount of All Being; and undone shall be he who bears [a burden of] evildoing
2460: whereas anyone who will have done [whatever he could] of righteous deeds, and was a believer withal, need have no fear of being wronged or deprived [of aught of his merit].
2461: AND THUS have We bestowed from on high this [divine writ] as a discourse in the Arabic tongue, and have given therein many facets to all manner of warnings, so that men might remain conscious of Us, or that it give rise to a new awareness in them
2462: [Know,] then, [that) God is sublimely exalted. the Ultimate Sovereign, the Ultimate Truth and [knowing this,] do not approach the Qur'an in haste, ere it has been revealed unto thee in full, but [always) say: "O my Sustainer, cause me to grow in knowledge!
2463: AND, INDEED, long ago did We impose Our commandment on Adam; but he forgot it, and We found no firmness of purpose in him.
2464: For [thus it was:] when We told the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam!"- they all prostrated themselves, save Ibis, who refused [to do it];
2465: and thereupon We said: "O Adam! Verily, this is a foe unto thee and thy wife: so let him not drive the two of you out of this garden and render thee unhappy.
2466: Behold, it is provided for thee that thou shalt not hunger here or feel naked,
2467: and that thou shalt not thirst here or suffer from the heat of the sun."
2468: But Satan whispered unto him, saying: "O Adam! Shall I lead thee to the tree of life eternal; and [thus] to a kingdom that will never decay?"
2469: And so the two ate [of the fruit] thereof: and thereupon they became conscious of their nakedness and began to cover themselves with pieced-together leaves from the garden. And [thus] did Adam disobey his Sustainer, and thus did he fall into grievous error.
2470: Thereafter, [however,) his Sustainer elected him [for His grace], and accepted his repentance, and bestowed His guidance upon him,
2471: saying: "Down with you all from this [state of innocence, and be henceforth] enemies unto one another! None the less, there shall most certainly come unto you guidance from Me: and he who follows My guidance will not go astray, and neither will he be unhappy.
2472: But as for him who shall turn away from remembering Me - his shall be a life of narrow scope and on the Day of Resurrection We shall raise him up blind."
2473: [And so, on Resurrection Day, the sinner] will ask: "O my Sustainer! Why hast Thou raised me up blind, whereas [on earth] I was endowed with sight?"
2474: [God] will reply: "Thus it is: there came unto thee Our messages, but thou wert oblivious of them; and thus shalt thou be today consigned to oblivion!"
2475: For, thus shall We recompense him who wastes his own self and does not believe in his Sustainer's messages: and, indeed, the suffering [of such sinners] in the life to come shall be most severe and most enduring!
2476: CAN, THEN, they [who reject the truth] learn no lesson by recalling how many a generation We have destroyed before their time? - [people] in whose dwelling-places they [themselves now] walk about? In this, behold, there are messages indeed for those who are endowed with reason!
2477: Now were it not for a decree that has already gone forth from thy Sustainer, setting a term [for each sinner's repentance], it would inescapably follow [that all who sin must be doomed at once].
2478: Hence, bear with patience whatever they [who deny the truth] may say, and extol thy Sustainer's limitless glory and praise Him before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and extol His glory, too, during some of the hours of the night as well as during the hours of the day, so that thou might attain to happiness.
2479: And never turn thine, eyes [with longing] towards whatever splendour of this world's life We may have allowed so many others to enjoy in order that We might test them thereby: for the sustenance which thy Sustainer provides [for thee] is better and more enduring.
2480: And bid thy people to pray, and persevere therein. [But remember:] We do not ask thee to provide sustenance [for Us]: it is We who provide sustenance for thee. And the future belongs to the God-conscious.
2481: NOW THEY [who are blind to the truth] are wont to say, "If [Muhammad] would but produce for us a miracle from his Sustainer! [But] has there not come unto them a clear evidence [of the truth of this divine writ] in what is [to be found] in the earlier scriptures?
2482: For [thus it is:] had We destroyed them by means of a chastisement ere this [divine writ was revealed], they would indeed [be justified to] say [on Judgment Day]: "O our Sustainer! If only Thou hadst sent an apostle unto us, we would have followed Thy messages rather than be humiliated and disgraced [in the hereafter]!"
2483: Say: "Everyone is hopefully waiting [for what the future may bring]: wait, then, [for the Day of Judgment] for then you will come to know as to who has followed the even path, and who has found guidance!"
2484: CLOSER DRAWS unto men their reckoning: and yet they remain stubbornly heedless [of its approach].
2485: Whenever there comes unto them any new re¬≠minder from their Sustainer, they but listen to it with playful amusement,
2486: their hearts set on passing ¬≠delights; yet they who are [thus] bent on wrongdoing conceal their innermost thoughts [when they say to one another], ‚ÄúIs this [Muhammad] anything but a mortal like yourselves? Will you, then, yield to [his] spellbinding eloquence with your eyes open?‚Äù
2487: Say: ‚ÄúMy Sustainer knows whatever is spoken in heaven and on earth; and He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing.‚Äù
2488: ‚ÄúNay,‚Äù they say, ‚Äú[Muhammad propounds] the most involved and confusing of dreams!‚Äù ‚ÄúNay, but he has invented [all] this!‚Äù - ‚ÄúNay, but he is [only] a poet!‚Äù - [and,] ‚ÄúLet him, then, come unto us with a miracle, just as those [prophets] of old were sent [with miracles]?‚Äù
2489: Not one of the communities that We destroyed in bygone times would ever believe [their prophets]: will these, then, [be more willing to] believe?
2490: For [even] before thy time, [O Muhammad,] We never sent [as Our apostles] any but [mortal] men, whom We inspired - hence, [tell the deniers of the truth,] ‚ÄúIf you do not know this, ask the followers of earlier revelation‚Äù
2491: and neither did We endow them with bodies that could dispense with food nor were they immortal.
2492: In the end, We made good unto them Our promise, and We saved them and all whom We willed [to save], and We destroyed those who had wasted their own selves.
2493: [O MEN!] We have now bestowed upon you from on high a divine writ containing all that you ought to bear in mind will you not, then, use your reason?
2494: For, how many a community that persisted in evildoing have We dashed into fragments, and raised another people in its stead!
2495: And [every time,] as soon as they began to feel Our punishing might, lo! they tried to flee from it
2496: [and at the same time they seemed to hear a scornful voice]: ‚ÄúDo not try to flee, but return to all that [once] gave you pleasure and corrupted your whole being. and [return] to your homes, so that you might be called to account [for what you have done]!‚Äù
2497: And they could only cry: ‚ÄúOh, woe unto us! Verily, we were wrongdoers!‚Äù
2498: And that cry of theirs did not cease until We caused them to become [like] a field mown down, still and silent as ashes.
2499: AND [know that] We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in mere idle play:
2500: [for,] had We willed to indulge in a pastime, We would indeed have produced it from within Ourselves - if such had been Our will at all!
2501: Nay, but [by the very act of creation] We hurl the truth against falsehood, and it crushes the latter: and lo! it withers away. But woe unto you for all your [attempts at] defining [God] ‚Äì
2502: for, unto Him belong all [beings] that are in the heavens and on earth; and those that are with Him are never too proud to worship Him and never grow weary [thereof]:
2503: they extol His lim¬≠itless glory by night and by day, never flagging [therein].
2504: And yet some people choose to worship certain earthly things or beings as deities that [are supposed to] resurrect [the dead; and they fail to realize that],
2505: had there been in heaven or on earth any deities other than God, both [those realms would surely have fallen into ruin! But limitless in His glory is God, enthroned in His awesome almightiness far] above anything that men may devise by way of definition!
2506: He cannot be called to account for whatever He does, whereas they will be called to account:
2507: and yet, they choose to worship [imaginary] deities instead of Him! Say [O Prophet]: ‚ÄúProduce an evidence for what you are claiming: this is a reminder [unceasingly voiced] by those who are with me, just as it was a reminder [voiced] by those who came before me.‚Äù But nay, most of them do not know the truth, and so they stubbornly turn away [from it]
2508: and [this despite the fact that even] before thy time We never sent any apostle without having revealed to him that there is no deity save Me, - [and that,] therefore, you shall worship Me [alone]!
2509: And [yet,] some say, ‚ÄúThe Most Gracious has taken unto Himself a son‚Äù! Limitless is He in His glory! Nay, [those whom they regard as God‚Äôs ‚Äúoffspring‚Äù are but His] honoured servants:
2510: they speak not until He has spoken unto them, and [whenever they act,] they act at His behest.
2511: He knows all that lies open before them and all that is hidden from them: hence, they cannot intercede for any but those whom He has [already] graced with His goodly acceptance, since they themselves stand in reverent awe of Him.
2512: And if any of them were to say, ‚ÄúBehold, I am deity beside Him‚Äù - that one We should requite with hell: thus do We requite all [such] evildoers.
2513: ARE, THEN, they who are bent on denying the truth not aware that the heavens and the earth were [once] one single entity, which We then parted asunder? ‚Äì and [that] We made out of water every living thing? Will they not, then, [begin to] believe?
2514: And [are they not aware that] We have set up firm mountains on earth, lest it sway with them, and [that] We have appointed thereon broad paths, so that they might find their way,
2515: and [that] We have set up the sky as a canopy well-secured? And yet, they stubbornly turn away from [all] the signs of this [creation],
2516: and [fail to see that] it is He who has created the night and the day and the sun and the moon - all of them floating through space!
2517: AND [remind those who deny thee, O Prophet, that] never have We granted life everlasting to any mortal before thee: but do they, perchance, hope that al¬≠though thou must die, they will live forever?‚Äù
2518: Every human being is bound to taste death; and We test you [all] through the bad and the good [things of life] by way of trial: and unto Us you all must return.
2519: But [thus it is:] whenever they who are bent on denying the truth consider thee, they make thee but a target of their mockery, [saying to one another,] ‚ÄúIs this the one who speaks [so contemptuously] of your gods?‚Äù and yet, it is they themselves who, at [every] mention of the Most Gracious, are wont to deny the truth!
2520: Man is a creature of haste; [but in time] I shall make obvious to you [the truth of] My mes¬≠sages: do not, then, ask Me to hasten [it]!
2521: But they [who reject My messages are wont to] ask, ‚ÄúWhen is that promise [of God‚Äôs judgment] to be fulfilled? [Answer this, O you who believe in it,] if you are men of truth!‚Äù
2522: If they but knew - they who are bent on deny¬≠ing the truth - [that there will come] a time when they will not be able to ward off the fire from their faces, nor from their backs, and will not find any succour!
2523: Nay, but [the Last Hour] will come upon them of a sudden, and will stupefy them: and they will be unable to avert it, and neither wilt they be allowed any respite.
2524: And, indeed, [O Muhammad, even] before thy time have [God‚Äôs] apostles been derided - but those who scoffed at them were [in the end] overwhelmed by the very thing which they had been wont to deride.
2525: Say: ‚ÄúWho could protect you, by night or by day, from the Most Gracious?‚Äù And yet, from a remembrance of their Sustainer do they stubbornly turn away!
2526: Do they [really think that they] have deities that could shield them from Us? Those [alleged dei¬≠ties] are not [even] able to succour themselves: hence, neither can they [who worship them hope to] be aided [by them] against Us.
2527: Nay, We have allowed these [sinners] ‚Äì as [We allowed] their forebears ‚Äì to enjoy the good things of life for a great length of time: but then ‚Äì have they never yet seen how We visit the earth [with Our punishment], gradually depriving it of all that is best thereon? Can they, then, [hope to] be the winners?
2528: SAY [unto all men]: ‚ÄúI but warn you on the strength of divine revelation!‚Äù But the deaf [of heart] will not hearken to this call, however often they are warned.
2529: And yet, if but a breath of thy Sustainer‚Äôs chastisement touches them, they are sure to cry, ‚ÄúOh, woe unto us! Verily, we were evildoers!‚Äù
2530: But We shall set up just balance-scales on Resurrection Day, and no human being shall be wrong¬≠ed in the least: for though there be [in him but] the weight of a mustard-seed [of good or evil], We shall bring it forth; and none can take count as We do!
2531: AND, INDEED, We vouchsafed unto Moses and Aaron [Our revelation as] the standard by which to discern the true from the false, and as a [guiding] light and a reminder for the God-conscious
2532: who stand in awe of their Sustainer although He is beyond the reach of human perception, and who tremble at the thought of the Last Hour.
2533: And [like those earlier revelations,] this one, too, is a blessed reminder which We have bestowed from on high: will you, then, disavow it?
2534: AND, INDEED, long before [the time of Moses] We vouchsafed unto Abraham his consciousness of what is right; and We were aware of [what moved] him
2535: when he said unto his father and his people, ‚ÄúWhat are these images to which you are so intensely devoted?‚Äù
2536: They answered: ‚ÄúWe found our forefathers worshipping them.‚Äù
2537: Said he: ‚ÄúIndeed, you and your forefathers have obviously gone astray!‚Äù
2538: They asked: ‚ÄúHast thou come unto us [with this claim] in all earnest - or art thou one of those jesters?‚Äù
2539: He answered: ‚ÄúNay, but your [true] Sustainer is the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth - He who has brought them into being: and I am one of those who bear witness to this [truth]!‚Äù
2540: And [he added to himself.] ‚ÄúBy God, I shall most certainly bring about the downfall of your idols as soon as you have turned your backs and gone away!‚Äù
2541: And then he broke those [idols] to pieces, [all] save the biggest of them, so that they might [be able to] turn to it.
2542: [When they saw what had happened,] they said: ‚ÄúWho has done this to our gods? Verily, one of the worst wrongdoers is he!‚Äù
2543: Said some [of them]: ‚ÄúWe heard a youth speak of these [gods with scorn]: he is called Abraham.‚Äù
2544: [The others] said: ‚ÄúThen bring him before the peoples eyes, so that they might bear witness [against him]!‚Äù
2545: [And when he came.] they asked: ‚ÄúHast thou done this to our gods, O Abraham?‚Äù
2546: He answered: ‚ÄúNay, it was this one, the big¬≠gest of them, that did it: but ask them [yourselves] - provided they can speak!‚Äù
2547: And so they turned upon one another, saying, ‚ÄúBehold, it is you who are doing wrong.‚Äù
2548: But then they relapsed into their former way of thinking and said: ‚ÄúThou knowest very well that these [idols] cannot speak!‚Äù
2549: Said [Abraham]: ‚ÄúDo you then worship, instead of God, something that cannot benefit you in any way, nor harm you?
2550: Fie upon you and upon all that you worship instead of God! Will you not, then, use your reason?‚Äù
2551: They exclaimed: ‚ÄúBurn him, and [thereby] succour your gods, if you are going to do [anything]!‚Äù
2552: [But] We said: O fire! Be thou cool, and [a source of] inner peace for Abraham!‚Äù
2553: and whereas they sought to do evil unto him, We caused them to suffer the greatest loss:
2554: for We saved him and Lot, [his brother‚Äôs son, by guiding them] to the land which We have blessed for all times to come.
2555: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and [Isaacs son] Jacob as an additional gift and caused all of them to be righteous men,
2556: and made them leaders who would guide [others] in accordance with Our behest: for We inspired them [with a will] to do good works, and to be constant in prayer, and to dispense charity: and Us [alone] did they worship.
2557: AND UNTO Lot, too, We vouchsafed sound judg¬≠ment and knowledge [of right and wrong], and saved him from that community which was given to deeds of abomination. [We destroyed those people - forr,] verily, they were people lost in evil, depraved ‚Äì
2558: whereas him We admitted unto Our grace: for, behold, he was among the righteous.
2559: AND [remember] Noah - [how,] when He called out [unto Us], long before [the time of Abraham and Lot], We responded to him and saved him and his house¬≠hold from that awesome calamity;
2560: and [how] We succoured him against the people who had given the lie to Our messages: verily, they were people lost in evil - and [so] We caused them all to drown.
2561: AND [remember] David and Solomon - [how it was] when both of them gave judgment concerning the field into which some people‚Äôs sheep had strayed by night and pastured therein, and [how] We bore witness to their judgment:
2562: for, [though] We made Solomon understand the case [more profoundly] yet We vouchsafed unto both of them sound judgment and knowledge [of right and wrong]. And We caused the mountains to join David in extolling Our limitless glory, and likewise the birds: for We are able to do [all things].
2563: And We taught him how to make garments [of God- consciousness] for you, [O men,] so that they might fortify you against all that may cause you fear: but are you grateful [for this boon]?
2564: And unto Solomon [We made subservient] the stormy wind, so that it sped at his behest towards the land which We had blessed: for it is We who have knowledge of everything.
2565: And among the rebel¬≠lious forces [which We made subservient to him] there were some that dived for him [into the sea] and performed other works, besides: but it was We who kept watch over them.
2566: AND [remember] Job, when he cried out to his Sus¬≠tainer, ‚ÄúAffliction has befallen me: but Thou art the most merciful of the merciful!‚Äù
2567: whereupon We responded unto him and removed all the affliction from which he suffered; and We gave him new offspring, doubling their number as an act of grace from Us, and as a reminder unto all who worship Us.
2568: AND [remember] Ishmael and Idris and every one who [like them] has pledged himself [unto God]: they all were among those who are patient in adver¬≠sity,
2569: and so We admitted them unto Our grace: behold, they were among the righteous!
2570: AND [remember] him of the great fish when he went off in wrath, thinking that We had no power over him! But then heeded out in the deep darkness [of his distress]: ‚ÄúThere is no deity save Thee! Limit¬≠less art Thou in Thy glory! Verily, I have done wrong!‚Äù
2571: And so We responded unto him and delivered him from [his] distress: for thus do We deliver all who have faith.
2572: AND [thus did We deliver] Zachariah when he cried out unto his Sustainer: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Leave me not childless! But [even if Thou grant me no bodily heir, I know that] Thou wilt remain when all else has ceased to be!‚Äù
2573: And so We responded unto him, and bestowed upon him the gift of John, having made his wife fit to bear him a child: [and,] verily, these [three] would vie with one another in doing good works, and would call unto Us in yearning and awe; and they were always humble before Us.
2574: AND [remember] her who guarded her chastity, whereupon We breathed into her of Our spirit and caused her, together with her son, to become a symbol [of Our grace] unto all people.
2575: VERILY, [O you who believe in Me,] this community of yours is one single community, since I am the Sustainer of you all: worship, then, Me [alone]!
2576: But men have torn their unity wide asunder, [forgetting that] unto Us they all are bound to return.
2577: And yet, whoever does [the least] of righteous deeds and is a believer withal, his endeavour shall not be disowned: for, behold, We shall record it in his favour.
2578: Hence, it has been unfailingly true of any community whom We have ever destroyed that they [were people who] would never turn back [from their sinful ways]
2579: until such a time as Gog and Magog are let loose [upon the world] and swarm down from every corner [of the earth],
2580: the while the true promise [of resurrection] draws close [to its fulfillment]. But then, lo! the eyes of those who [in their lifetime] were bent on denying the truth will stare in horror, [and they will exclaim:] ‚ÄúOh, woe unto us! We were indeed heedless of this [promise of resur¬≠rection]! - nay, we were [bent on] doing evil!‚Äù
2581: [Then they will be told:] ‚ÄúVerily, you and all that you [were wont to] worship instead of God are but the fuel of hell: that is what you are destined for.
2582: If those [false objects of your worship] had truly been divine, they would not have been destined for it: but [as it is, you] all shall abide therein!‚Äù
2583: Moaning will be their lot therein, and nothing [else] will they hear therein.
2584: [But,] behold, as for those for whom [the decree of] ultimate good has already gone forth from Us these will be kept far away from that [hell]:
2585: no sound thereof will they hear; and they will abide in all that their souls have ever desired.
2586: The supreme awesomeness [of the Day of Resurrection] will cause them no grief, since the angels will receive them with the greeting. ‚ÄúThis is your Day [of triumph - the Day] which you were promised!‚Äù
2587: On that Day We shall roll up the skies as written scrolls are rolled up; [and] as We brought into being the first creation, so We shall bring it forth anew a promise which We have willed upon Our¬≠selves: for, behold, We are able to do [all things]!
2588: AND, INDEED, after having exhorted [man], We laid it down in all the books of divine wisdom that My righteous servants shall inherit the earth:
2589: herein, behold, there is a message for people who [truly] worship God.
2590: And [thus, O Prophet,] We have sent thee as [an evidence of Our] grace towards all the worlds.
2591: Say: ‚ÄúIt has but been revealed unto me that your God is the One and Only God: will you, then, surrender yourselves unto Him?‚Äù
2592: But if they turn away, say: ‚ÄúI have proclaimed this in equity unto all of you alike; but I do not know whether that [judgment] which you are promised [by God] is near or far [in time].
2593: ‚ÄúVerily, He knows all that is said openly, just as He [alone] knows all that you would conceal.
2594: But [as for me,] I do not know whether, perchance, this [delay in God‚Äôs judgment] is but a trial for you, and a [merciful] respite for a while.‚Äù
2595: Say: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Judge Thou in truth!‚Äù - and [say]: ‚ÄúOur Sustainer is the Most Gracious, the One whose aid is ever to be sought against all your [attempts at] defining [Him]!‚Äù
2596: O men! Be conscious of your Sustainer: for, verily the violent convulsion of the Last Hour will be an awesome thing!
2597: On the Day when you behold it, every woman that feeds a child at her breast will utterly forget her nursling, and every woman heavy with child will bring forth her burden [before her time]; and it will seem to thee that all mankind is drunk, although they will not be drunk - but vehement will be [their dread of] God‚Äôs chastisement.
2598: And yet, among men there is many a one who argues about God without having any knowledge [of Him], and follows every rebellious satanic force
2599: about which it has been decreed that whoever entrusts himself to it, him will it lead astray and guide towards the suffering of the blazing flame!
2600: O MEN! If you are in doubt as to the [truth of] resurrection, [remember that,] verily, We have created [every one of] you out of dust, then out of a drop of sperm, then out of a germ-cell, then out of an embryonic lump complete [in itself] and yet incom¬≠plete so that We might make [your origin] clear unto you. And whatever We will [to be born] We cause to rest in the [mothers‚Äô] wombs for a term set [by Us], and then We bring you forth as infants and [allow you to live] so that [some of] you might attain to maturity: for among you are such as are caused to die [in childhood], just as many a one of you is reduced in old age to a most abject state, ceasing to know anything of what he once knew so well. And [if, O man, thou art still in doubt as to resur¬≠rection, consider this:] thou canst see the earth dry and lifeless - and [suddenly,] when We send down waters upon it, it stirs and swells and puts forth every kind of lovely plant!
2601: All this [happens] because God alone is the Ultimate Truth, and because He alone brings the dead to life, and because He has the power to will anything.
2602: And [know, O man] that the Last Hour is bound to come, beyond any doubt, and that God will [in¬≠deed] resurrect all who are in their graves.
2603: And yet, among men there is many a one that argues about God without having any knowledge [of Him], without any guidance, and without any light-giving revelation ‚Äì
2604: scornfully turning aside [from the truth] so as to lead [others] astray from the path of God. Disgrace [of the spirit] is in store for him in this world; and on the Day of Resurrection We shall make him taste suffering through fire;
2605: [and he shall be told:] ‚ÄúThis is an outcome of what thine own hands have wrought - for, never does God do the least wrong to His creatures!‚Äù
2606: And there is, too, among men many a one who worships God on the border-line [of faith]: thus, if good befalls him, he is satisfied with Him; but if a trial assails him, he turns away utterly, losing [thereby both] this world and the life to come: [and] this, indeed, is a loss beyond compare!
2607: [By behaving thus,] he invokes, instead of God, something that can neither harm nor benefit him: [and] this is indeed the utmost one can go astray.
2608: [And sometimes] he invokes [another human being] one that is far more likely to cause harm than benefit: vile, indeed, is such a patron and vile the follower!
2609: VERILY, God will admit those who have attained to faith and have done righteous deeds into gardens through which running waters flow: for, behold, God does whatever He wills.
2610: If anyone thinks that God will not succour him in this world and in the life to come, let him reach out unto heaven by any [other] means and [thus try to] make headway: and then let him see whether this scheme of his will indeed do away with the cause of his anguish.
2611: And thus have We bestowed from on high this [divine writ] in the shape of clear messages: for [thus it is] that God guides him who wills [to be guided].
2612: Verily, as for those who have attained to faith [in this divine writ], and those who follow the Jewish faith, and the Sabians, and the Christians, and the Magians, [on the one hand,] and those who are bent on ascribing divinity to aught but God, [on the other,] verily, God will decide between them on Resurrection Day: for, behold, God is witness unto everything.
2613: ART THOU NOT aware that before God prostrate themselves all [things and beings] that are in the heavens and all that are on earth the sun, and the moon, and the stars, and the mountains, and the trees, and the beasts? And many human beings [submit to God con¬≠sciously], whereas many [others, having defied Him,] will inevitably have to suffer [in the life to come]; and he whom God shall scorn [on Resur¬≠rection Day] will have none who could bestow honour on him: for, verily, God does what He wills.
2614: These two contrary kinds of man have become engrossed in contention about their Sus¬≠tainer! But [thus it is:] as for those who are bent on denying the truth garments of fire shall be cut out for them [in the life to come]; burning despair will be poured over their heads,
2615: causing all that is within their bodies, as well as the skins, to melt away.
2616: And they shall be held [in this state as if] by iron grips;
2617: and every time they try in their anguish to come out of it, they shall be returned thereto and [be told]: ‚ÄúTaste suffering through fire [to the full]!‚Äù
2618: [As against this,] behold, God will admit those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds into gar¬≠dens through which running waters flow, wherein they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and where silk will be their raiment:
2619: for they were [willing to be] guided towards the best of all tenets, and so they were guided onto the way that leads to the One unto whom all praise is due.
2620: BEHOLD, as for those who are bent on denying the truth and bar [others] from the path of God and from the Inviolable House of Worship which We have set up for all people alike - [both] those who dwell there and those who come from abroad - and all who seek to profane it by [deliberate] evildoing: [all] such shall We cause to taste grievous suffering in the life to come.]
2621: For, when We assigned unto Abraham the site of this Temple, [We said unto him:] ‚ÄúDo not ascribe divinity to aught beside Me!‚Äù and: ‚ÄúPurify My Temple for those who will walk around it, and those who will stand before it [in meditation], and those who will bow down and prostrate themselves [in prayer].‚Äù
2622: Hence, [O Muhammad,] proclaim thou unto all people the [duty of] pilgrimage: they will come unto thee on foot and on every [kind of] fast mount, coming from every far-away point [on earth],
2623: so that they might experience much that shall be of benefit to them, and that they might extol the name of God on the days appointed [for sacrifice], over whatever heads of cattle He may have provided for them [to this end]: eat, then, thereof, and feed the unfortunate poor.
2624: Thereafter let them bring to an end their state of self-denial, and let them fulfill the vows which they [may] have made, and let them walk [once again] around the Most Ancient Temple.
2625: All this [is ordained by God]; and if one houours God‚Äôs sacred commandments, it will redound to his own good in his Sustainer‚Äôs sight. And all [kinds of] cattle have been made lawful to you [for sacrifice and food], save what is mentioned to you [as forbidden]. Shun, then, [all that God has forbidden and, most of all,] the loathsome evil of idolatrous beliefs and practices; and shun every word that is untrue,
2626: [inclining] towards God, [and] turning away from all that is false, without ascribing divine qualities to aught beside Him: for he who ascribes divinity to aught but God is like one who is hurtling down from the skies - whereupon the birds carry him off, or the wind blows him away onto a far-off place.
2627: This is [to be borne in mind]. And anyone who honours the symbols set up by God [shall know that] verily, these [symbols derive their value] from the God-consciousness in the [believers‚Äô] hearts.
2628: In that [God-consciousness] you shall find benefits until a term set [by Him is fulfilled], and [you shall know that] its goal and end is the Most Ancient Temple.
2629: And [thus it is:] unto every community [that has ever believed in Us] have We appointed [sacrifice as] an act of worship, so that they might extol the name of God over whatever heads of cattle He may have provided for them [to this end]. And (always bear in mind:) your God is the One and Only God: hence, surrender yourselves unto Him. And give thou the glad tiding [of God‚Äôs acceptance] unto all who are humble ‚Äì
2630: all whose hearts tremble with awe whenever God is mentioned, and all who patiently bear whatever ill befalls them, and all who are constant in prayer and spend on others out of what We provide for them as sustenance.
2631: And as for the sacrifice of cattle, We have ordained it for you as one of the symbols set up by God, in which there is [much] good for you. Hence, extol the name of God over them when they are lined up [for sacrifice]; and after they have fallen lifeless to the ground, eat of their flesh, and feed the poor who is contented with his lot (and does not beg), as well as him who is forced to beg. It is to this end that We have made them subservient to your needs, so that you might have cause to be grateful.
2632: [But bear in mind:] never does their flesh reach God, and neither their blood: it is only your God-consciousness that reaches Him. It is to this end that We have made them subservient to your needs, so that you might glorify God for all the guidance with which He has graced you. And give thou this glad tiding unto the doers of good:
2633: Verily, God will ward off [all evil] from those who attain to faith; [and,] verily, God does not love anyone who betrays his trust and is bereft of gratitude.
2634: PERMISSION [to fight] is given to those against whom war is being wrongfully waged and, verily, God has indeed the power to succour them -:
2635: those who have been driven from their homelands against all right for no other reason than their saying. ‚ÄúOur Sustainer is God!‚Äù For, if God had not enabled people to defend themselves against one another, all] monasteries and churches and synagogues and mosques - in [all of] which Gods name is abundantly extolled - would surely have been destroyed [ere now]. And God will most certainly succour him who suc¬≠cours His cause: for, verily, God is most powerful, almighty,
2636: [well aware of] those who, [even] if We firmly establish them on earth, remain constant in prayer, and give in charity, and enjoin the doing of what is right and forbid the doing of what is wrong; but with God rests the final outcome of all events.
2637: AND IF THEY [who are bent on denying the truth] give thee the lie, [O Muhammad, remember that, long] before their time, the people of Noah and [the tribes of] Ad and Thamud gave the lie [to their prophets],
2638: as did the people of Abraham, and the people of Lot,
2639: and the dwellers of Madyan; and [so, too,] Moses was given the lie [by Pharaoh]. And [in every ease] I gave rein, for a while, to the deniers of the truth: but then I took them to task - and how awesome was My denial [of them,]!
2640: And how many a township have We destroyed because it had been immersed in evildoing - and now they [all] lie deserted, with their roofs caved in! And how many a well lies abandoned, and how many a castle that [once] stood high!
2641: Have they, then, never journeyed about the earth, letting their hearts gain wisdom, and causing their ears to hear? Yet, verily, it is not their eyes that have become blind - but blind have become the hearts that are in their breasts!
2642: And [so, O Muhammad,] they challenge thee to hasten the coming upon them of [God‚Äôs] chastisement: but God never fails to fulfill His promise - and, behold, in thy Sustainer‚Äôs sight a day is like a thousand years of your reckoning.
2643: And to how many a community that was im¬≠mersed in evildoing have I given rein for a while! But then I took it to task: for with Me is all journeys‚Äô end!
2644: SAY [O Muhammad]: ‚ÄúO men! I am but a plain warner [sent by God] unto you!‚Äù
2645: And [know that] those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds shall be granted forgiveness of sins and a most excellent sustenance;
2646: whereas those who strive against Our messages, seeking to defeat their purpose - they are destined for the blazing fire.
2647: Yet whenever We sent forth any apostle or prophet before thee, and he was hoping [that his warnings would be heeded], Satan would cast an asper¬≠sion on his innermost aims: but God renders null and void whatever aspersion Satan may cast; and God makes His messages clear in and by themselves for God is all-knowing, wise.
2648: [And He allows doubts to arise] so that He might cause whatever aspersion Satan may cast [against His prophets] to become a trial for all in whose hearts is disease and all whose hearts are hardened: for, verily, all who are [thus] sinning [against themselves] are most deeply in the wrong.
2649: And [God renders Satan‚Äôs aspersions null and void] so that they who are endowed with [innate] knowledge might know that this [divine writ] is the truth from thy Sustainer, and that they aught believe in it, and that their hearts might humbly submit unto Him. For, behold, God does guide onto a straight way those who have attained to faith ‚Äì
2650: whereas those who are bent on denying the truth will not cease to be in doubt about Him until the Last Hour comes suddenly upon them and [supreme] suffering befalls them on a Day void of all hope.
2651: On that Day, all dominion shall [visibly] belong to God, He shall judge [all men and make a distinction] between them: thus, all who had attained to faith and did righteous deeds shall find themselves in gardens of bliss,
2652: whereas for those who were bent on denying the truth and gave the lie to Our messages, there shall be shameful suffering in store.
2653: AND AS FOR those who forsake the domain of evil (and strive) in God‚Äôs cause, and then are slain or die - God will most certainly provide for them a goodly sustenance [in the life to come] for, verily, God - He alone - is the best of providers;
2654: [and] He will most certainly cause them to enter upon a state (of being) that shall please them well: for, verily, God is all-knowing, most forbearing.
2655: Thus shall it be. And as for him who responds to aggression only to the extent of the attack levelled against him, and is thereupon [again] treacherously attacked - God will most certainly succour him: for, behold, God is indeed an absolver of sins, much-forgiving.
2656: Thus it is, because God [is almighty the One who] makes the night grow longer by shortening the day, and makes the day grow longer by shortening the night; and because God is all-hearing, all-seeing.
2657: Thus it is, because God alone is the Ultimate Truth, so that all that men invoke beside Him is sheer falsehood, and because God alone is exalted, great!
2658: Art thou not aware that it‚Äôs God who sends down water from the skies, whereupon the earth becomes green? Verily, God is unfathomable [in His wisdom], all-aware.
2659: Unto Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth; and, verily, God - He alone - is self-sufficient, the One to whom all praise is due.
2660: Art thou not aware that it is God who has made subservient to you all that is on earth, and the ships that sail through the sea at His behest - and [that it is He who] holds the celestial bodies [in their orbits], so that they may not fall upon the earth otherwise than by His leave? Verily, God is most compassionate towards men, a dispenser of grace ‚Äì
2661: seeing that it is He who gave you life, and then will cause you to die, and then will bring you back to life: [but,] verily, bereft of all gratitude is man!
2662: UNTO every community have We appointed [different] ways of worship, which they ought to observe. Hence, [O believer,] do not let those [who follow ways other than thine] draw thee into disputes on this score, but summon [them all] unto thy Sustainer: for, behold, thou art indeed on the right way.
2663: And if they [try to] argue with thee, say [only]: ‚ÄúGod knows best what you are doing.‚Äù
2664: [For, indeed,] God will judge between you [all] on Resurrection Day with regard to all on which you were wont to differ.
2665: Dost thou not know that God knows all that occurs in heaven as well as on earth? All this, behold, is in [God‚Äôs] record: verily, [to know] all this is easy for God.
2666: And yet they [who claim to believe in Him often] worship [other beings or forces] beside God - something for which He has never bestoweed any warrant from on high, and [of the reality] whereof they cannot have any knowledge: and such evildoers shall have none to succour them [on Judgment Day].
2667: As it is, whenever Our messages are conveyed unto them in all their clarity, thou canst perceive utter repugnance on the faces of those who are bent on denying the truth: they would almost assault those who convey Our messages unto them! Say: ‚ÄúShall I, then, tell you of something worse than what you feel at present? It is the fire [of the hereafter] that God has promised to those who are bent on denying the truth: and how vile a journey‚Äôs end!‚Äù
2668: O MEN! A parable is set forth [herewith]; hearken, then, to it! Behold, those beings whom you invoke instead of God cannot create [as much as] a fly, even were they to join all their forces to that end! And if a fly robs them of anything, they cannot [even] rescue it from him! Weak indeed is the seeker, and [weak] the sought!
2669: No true understanding of God have they [who err in this way]: for, verily, God is most powerful, almighty!
2670: [In His almightiness,] God chooses message-bearers from among the angels as well as from among men. But, behold, God [alone] is all-hearing, all-see¬≠ing:
2671: [whereas their knowledge is limited,] He knows all that lies open before them and all that is hidden from them for all things go back to God [as their source].
2672: O YOU who have attained to faith! Bow down and prostrate yourselves, and worship your Sustainer [alone], and do good, so that you might attain to a happy state!
2673: And strive hard in God‚Äôs cause with all the striving that is due to Him: it is He who has elected you [to carry His message], and has laid no hardship on you in [anything that pertains to religion, [and made you follow] the creed of your forefather Abraham. It is He who has named you in bygone times as well as in this [divine writ] ‚Äì ‚Äúthose who have surrendered themselves to God‚Äù, so that the Apostle might bear witness to the truth before you, and that you might bear witness to it before all mankind. Thus, be constant in prayer, and render the purifying dues, and hold fast unto God. He is your Lord Supreme: and how excellent is this Lord Supreme, and how excellent this Giver of Succour!
2674: TRULY, to a happy state shall attain the believers:
2675: those who humble themselves in their prayer,
2676: and who turn away from all that is frivolous,
2677: and who are intent on inner purity;
2678: and who are mindful of their chastity,
2679: [not giving way to their desires] with any but their spouses - that is, those whom they rightfully possess [through wedlock]: for then, behold, they are free of all blame,
2680: whereas such as seek to go beyond that [limit] are truly transgressors;
2681: and who are faithful to their trusts and to their pledges,
2682: and who guard their prayers [from all worldly intent].
2683: It is they, they who shall be the inheritors
2684: that will inherit the paradise; [and] therein shall they abide.
2685: NOW, INDEED, We create man out of the essence of clay,
2686: and then We cause him to remain as a drop of sperm in [the wombs] firm keeping,
2687: and then We create out of the drop of sperm a germ-cell, and then We create out of the germ-cell an embryonic lump, and then We create within the embryonic lump bones, and then We clothe the bones with flesh - and then We bring [all] this into being as a new creation: hallowed, therefore, is God, the best of artisans!
2688: And then, behold! after all this, you are destined to die;
2689: and then, behold! you shall be raised from the dead on Resurrection Day.
2690: And, indeed, We have created above you seven [celestial] orbits: and never are We unmindful of [any aspect of Our] creation.
2691: And We send down water from the skies in accordance with a measure [set by Us], and then We cause it to lodge in the earth: but, behold, We are most certainly able to withdraw this [blessing]!
2692: And by means of this [water] We bring forth for you gardens of date-palms and vines, wherein you have fruit abundant and whereof you eat,
2693: as well as a tree that issues from [the lands adjoining] Mount Sinai, yielding oil and relish for all to eat.
2694: And, behold, in the cattle [too] there is indeed a lesson for you: We give you to drink of that [milk] which is within their bellies; and you derive many [other] uses from them: for, you eat of their flesh,
2695: and by them - as by the ships [over the sea] - you are borne [overland].
2696: AND, INDEED, We sent forth Noah unto his people and he said: ‚ÄúO my people! Worship God alone]: you have no deity other than Him. Will you not, then, become conscious of Him?‚Äù
2697: But the great ones among his people, who refused to acknowledge the truth, replied: ‚ÄúThis [man] is nothing but a mortal like yourselves who wants to make himself superior to you! For, if God had willed [to convey a message unto us], He would surely have sent down angels; [moreover,] we have never heard [any¬≠thing like] this from our forebears of old!
2698: He is nothing but a madman: so bear with him for a while.‚Äù
2699: Said [Noah]: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Succour me against their accusation of lying!‚Äù
2700: Thereupon We inspired him thus: ‚ÄúBuild, un¬≠der Our eyes and according to Our inspiration, the ark [that shall save thee and those who follow thee]. And when Our judgment comes to pass, and waters gush forth in torrents over the face of the earth, place on board of this [ark] one pair of each [kind of animal] of either sex, as well as thy family - excepting those on whom sentence has already been passed; and do not appeal to Me [any more] in behalf of those who are bent on evildoing - for, behold, they are destined to be drowned!
2701: ‚ÄúAnd as soon as thou and those who are with thee are settled in the ark, say: ‚ÄòAll praise is due to God, who has saved us from those evildoing folk!‚Äô
2702: ‚ÄúAnd say: ‚ÄòO my Sustainer! Cause me to reach a destination blessed [by Thee] for Thou art the best to show man how to reach his [true] destination!‚Äô‚Äù
2703: In this [story], behold, there are messages indeed [for those who think]: for, verily, We always put [man] to a test.
2704: AND AFTER those [people of old] We gave rise to new generations;
2705: and [every time] We sent unto them an apostle from among themselves, [he told them:] ‚ÄúWorship God [alone]: you have no deity other than Him. Will you not, then, become conscious of Him?‚Äù
2706: And [every time] the great ones among his people, who refused to acknowledge the truth and gave the lie to the announcement of a life to come - [simply] because We had granted them ease and plenty in [their] worldly life, and they had become corrupted by it [every time] they would say: ‚ÄúThis [man] is nothing hut a mortal like yourselves, eating of what you eat, and drinking of what you drink:
2707: and, indeed, if you pay heed to a mortal like your¬≠selves, you will surely be the losers!
2708: Does he promise you that, after you have died and become [mere] dust and bones, you shall be brought forth [to a new life]?
2709: Far-fetched, far-fetched indeed is what you are promised!
2710: There is no life beyond our life in this world: we die and we live [but once], and we shall never be raised from the dead!
2711: He is nothing but a man who attributes his own lying in¬≠ventions to God, and we are not going to believe him!‚Äù
2712: [Whereupon the prophet] would say: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Succour me against their accusation of lying!‚Äù
2713: [And God] would say: ‚ÄúAfter a little while they will surely be smitten with remorse!‚Äù
2714: And then the blast [of Our punishment] over¬≠took them, justly and unavoidably, and We caused them to become as the flotsam of dead leaves and the scum borne on the surface of a torrent: and so - away with those evildoing folk!
2715: AND AFTER them We gave rise to new genera¬≠tions:
2716: [for,] no community can ever forestall [the end of] its term - and neither can they delay [its coming].
2717: And We sent forth Our apostles, one after another: [and] every time their apostle came to a community, they gave him the lie: and so We caused them to follow one another [into the grave], and let them become [mere] tales: and so - away with the folk who would not believe!
2718: AND THEN We sent forth Moses and his brother Aaron with Our messages and a manifest authority [from Us]
2719: unto Pharaoh and his great ones; but these behaved with arrogance, for they were people wont to glorify [only] themselves.
2720: And so they said: ‚ÄúShall we believe [them] two mortals like ourselves - although their people are our slaves?‚Äù
2721: Thus, they gave the lie to those two, and earned (thereby) their place among the doomed:
2722: for, indeed, We had vouchsafed revelation unto Moses in order that they might find the right way.
2723: And [as We exalted Moses, so, too,] We made the son of Mary and his mother a symbol [of Our grace], and provided for both an abode in a lofty place of lasting restfulness and unsullied springs.
2724: O YOU APOSTLES! Partake of the good things of life, and do righteous deeds: verily, I have full knowledge of all that you do.
2725: And, verily, this community of yours is one single community, since I am the Sustainer of you all: remain, then, conscious of Me!
2726: But they (who claim to follow you) have torn their unity wide asunder, piece by piece, each group delighting in [but] what they themselves possess [by way of tenets].
2727: But leave them alone, lost in their ignorance, until a [future] time.
2728: Do they think that by all the wealth and offspring with which We provide them
2729: We [but want to] make them vie with one another in doing [what they consider] good works? Nay, but they do not perceive [their error]!
2730: Verily, [only] they who stand in reverent awe of their Sustainer,
2731: and who believe in their Sus¬≠tainer‚Äôs messages,
2732: and who do not ascribe divinity to aught but their Sustainer,
2733: and who give whatever they [have to] give with their hearts trembling at the thought that unto their Sustainer they must return:
2734: it is they who vie with one another in doing good works, and it is they who outrun [all others] in attaining to them!
2735: And [withal.] We do not burden any human being with more than he is well able to bear: for with Us is a record that speaks the truth [about what men do and can do]; and none shall be wronged.
2736: NAY, [as for those who have torn asunder the unity of faith] - their hearts are lost in ignorance of all this! But apart from that [breach of unity] they have [on their conscience even worse] deeds; and they will [continue to] commit them
2737: until - after We shall have taken to task, through suffering, those from among them who [now] are lost in the pursuit of pleasures - they cry out in [belated] supplication.
2738: [But they will be told:] ‚ÄúCry not in supplication today: for, behold, you shall not he succoured by Us!
2739: Time and again were My messages conveyed unto you, but [every time] you would turn about on your heels
2740: [and,] impelled by your arrogance, you would talk senselessly far into the night.‚Äù
2741: Have they, then, never tried to understand this word [of God]? Or has there [now] come to them something that never came to their forefathers of old?
2742: Or is it, perchance, that they have not recog¬≠nized their Apostle, and so they disavow him?
2743: Or do they say. ‚ÄúThere is madness in him‚Äù? Nay, he has brought them the truth - and the truth do most of them detest!
2744: But if the truth were in accord with their own likes and dislikes, the heavens and the earth would surely have fallen into ruin, and all that lives in them [would long ago have perished]! Nay, [in this divine writ] We have conveyed unto them all that they ought to bear in mind: and from this their reminder they [heedlessly] turn away!
2745: Or dost thou [O Muhammad] ask of them any worldly recompense? But [they ought to know that] recompense from thy Sustainer is best, since He is the best of providers!
2746: And, verily, thou callest them onto a straight way ‚Äì
2747: but, behold, those who will not believe in the life to come are bound to deviate from that way.
2748: And even were We to show them mercy and remove whatever distress might befall them [in this life], they would still persist in their overweening arrogance, blindly stumbling to and fro.
2749: And, indeed, We tested them through suffer¬≠ing, but they did not abase themselves before their Sustainer; and they will never humble them¬≠selves
2750: until We open before them a gate of [truly] severe suffering [in the life to come]: and then, lo! they will be broken in spirit.
2751: [O MEN! Pay heed to God‚Äôs messages,] for it is He who has endowed you with hearing, and sight, and minds: [yet] how seldom are you grateful!
2752: And He it is who has caused you to multiply on earth; and unto Him you shall be gathered.
2753: And He it is who grants life and deals death; and to Him is due the alternation of night and day. Will you not, then, use your reason?
2754: But nay, they speak as the people of olden times did speak:
2755: they say: ‚ÄúWhat! After we have died and become mere dust and bones, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead?
2756: Indeed, this [very thing] we have been promised - we and our forefathers - long ago! This is nothing but fables of ancient times!‚Äù
2757: Say: ‚ÄúUnto whom belongs the earth and all that lives there on? [Tell me this] if you happen to know [the answer]!‚Äù
2758: [And they will reply: ‚ÄúUnto God.‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúWill you not, then, bethink yourselves [of Him]?‚Äù
2759: Say: ‚ÄúWho is it that sustains the seven heavens and is enthroned in His awesome almightiness?‚Äù
2760: [And] they will reply: ‚Äú[All this power belongs] to God.‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúWill you not, then, remain conscious of Him?‚Äù
2761: Say: ‚ÄúIn whose hand rests the mighty dominion over all things, and who is it that protects, the while there is no protection against Him? [Tell me this] if you happen to know [the answer]!‚Äù
2762: [And] they will reply: ‚Äú[All this power belongs] to God.‚Äù Say: ‚ÄòHow, then, can you be so deluded?‚Äù
2763: Nay, We have conveyed unto them the truth: and yet, behold, they are intent on lying [to them¬≠selves]!
2764: Never did God take unto Himself any offspring, nor has there ever been any deity side by side with Him: [for, had there been any,] lo! each deity would surely have stood apart [from the others] in whatever it had created, and they would surely have [tried to] overcome one another! Limitless in His glory is God, [far] above anything that men may devise by way of definition,
2765: knowing all that is beyond the reach of a created being‚Äôs perception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature‚Äôs senses or mind and, hence, sublimely exalted is He above anything to which they may ascribe a share in His divinity!
2766: SAY: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! If it be Thy will to let me witness [the fulfillment of] whatever they [who blaspheme against Thee] have been promised [to suffer] ‚Äì
2767: do not, O my Sustainer, let me be one of those evildoing folk!‚Äù
2768: [Pray thus] for, behold, We are most cer¬≠tainly able to let thee witness [the fulfillment, even in this world, of] whatever We promise them!
2769: [But whatever they may say or do,] repel the evil [which they commit] with something that is bet¬≠ter: We are fully aware of what they attribute [to Us].
2770: And say: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! I seek refuge with Thee from the promptings of all evil impulses;
2771: and I seek refuge with Thee, O my Sustainer, lest they come near unto me!‚Äô
2772: [AS FOR THOSE who will not believe in the life to come, they go on lying to themselves] until, when death approaches any of them, he prays: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Let me return, let me return [to life],
2773: so that I might act righteously in whatever I have failed [aforetime]!‚Äù Nay, it is indeed but a [meaningless] word that he utters: for behind those [who leave the world] there is a barrier [of death] until the Day when all will be raised from the dead!
2774: Then, when the trumpet [of resurrection] is blown, no ties of kinship will on that Day prevail among them, and neither will they ask about one another.
2775: And they whose weight [of righteousness] is heavy in the balance - it is they, they who will have attained to a happy state;
2776: whereas they whose weight is light in the balance - it is they who will have squandered their own selves, [destined] to abide in hell:
2777: the fire will scorch their faces, and they will abide therein with their lips distorted in pain.
2778: [And God will say:] ‚ÄúWere not My messages conveyed unto you, and were you [not] wont to give them the lie?‚Äù
2779: They will exclaim: ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! Our bad luck has overwhelmed us, and so we went astray!
2780: O our Sustainer! Cause us to come out of this [suffering] - and then, if ever We revert [to sinning], may we truly be [deemed] evildoers!‚Äù
2781: [But] He will say: ‚ÄúAway with you into this [ignominy]! And speak no more unto Me!
2782: ‚ÄúBehold, there were among My servants such as would pray, ‚ÄòO our Sustainer! We have come to believe [in Thee]; forgive, then, our sins and bestow Thy mercy on us: for Thou art the truest bestower of mercy!‚Äô
2783: - but you made them a target of your derision to the point where it made you forget all remembrance of Me; and you went on and on laugh¬≠ing at them.
2784: [But,] behold, today I have rewarded them for their patience in adversity: verily, it is they, they who have achieved a triumph!‚Äù
2785: [And] He will ask [the doomed]: ‚ÄúWhat number of years have you spent on earth?‚Äù
2786: They will answer: ‚ÄòWe have spent there a day, or part of a day; but ask those who [are able to] count [time] ‚Ä¶‚Äù
2787: [Whereupon] He will say: ‚ÄúYou have spent there but a short while: had you but known [how short it was to be]!
2788: Did you, then, think that We created you in mere idle play, and that you would not have to return to Us?‚Äù
2789: [KNOW,] then, [that] God is sublimely exalted, the Ultimate Sovereign, the Ultimate Truth: there is no deity save Him, the Sustainer, in bountiful almightiness enthroned!
2790: Hence, he who invokes, side by side with God, any other deity [- a deity] for whose existence he has no evidence - shall but find his reckoning with his Sustainer: [and,] verily, such deniers of the truth will never attain to a happy state!
2791: Hence, [O believer,] say: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Grant [me] forgiveness and bestow Thy mercy [upon me]: for Thou art the truest bestower of mercy!‚Äù
2792: A Surah [is this] which We have bestowed from on high, and which We have laid down in plain terms; and in it have We bestowed from on high messages which are clear [in themselves], so that you might keep [them] in mind.
2793: AS FOR the adulteress and the adulterer flog each of them with a hundred stripes, and let not compassion with them keep you from [carrying out] this law of God, if you [truly] believe in God and the Last Day; and let a group of the believers witness their chastisement.
2794: [Both are equally guilty:] the adulterer couples with none other than an adulteress - that is, a woman who accords [to her own lust] a place side by side with God; and with the adulteress couples none other than an adulterer - that is, a man who accords [to his own lust] a place side by side with God: and this is forbidden unto the believers.
2795: And as for those who accuse chaste women [of adultery], and then are unable to produce four witnesses [in support of their accusation], flog them with eighty stripes and ever after refuse to accept from them any testimony - since it is they, they that are truly depraved!
2796: excepting [from this interdict] only those who afterwards repent and made amends: for, behold, God is much forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
2797: And as for those who accuse their own wives [of adultery], but have no witnesses except them¬≠selves, let each of these [accusers] call God four times to witness that he is indeed telling the truth,
2798: and the fifth time, that God‚Äôs curse be upon him if he is telling a lie.
2799: But [as for the wife, all] chastisement shall be averted from her by her calling God four times to witness that he is indeed telling a lie,
2800: and the fifth [time], that God‚Äôs curse be upon her if he is telling the truth,
2801: AND WERE it not for God‚Äôs favour upon you, [O man,] and His grace, and that God is a wise acceptor of repentance...!
2802: Verily, numerous among you are those who would falsely accuse others of unchastity: [but, O you who are thus wronged,] deem it not a bad thing for you: nay, it is good for you! [As for the slanderers,] unto every one of them [will be accounted] all that he has earned by [thus] sinning; and awesome suffering awaits any of them who takes it upon himself to enhance this [sin]!
2803: Why do not the believing men and women, whenever such [a rumour] is heard, think the best of one another and say, ‚ÄúThis is an obvious falsehood‚Äù?
2804: why do they not [demand of the accusers that they] their allegation? for, if they do not produce such wit¬≠nesses, it is those [accusers] who, in the sight of God, are liars indeed!
2805: And were it not for God‚Äôs favour upon you, [O men,] and His grace in this world and in the life to come, awesome suffering would indeed have afflicted you in result of all [the calumny] in which you indulge
2806: when you take it up with your tongues, uttering with your mouths something of which you have no knowledge, and deeming it a light matter whereas in the sight of God it is an awful thing!
2807: And [once again]: Why do you not say, whenever you hear such [a rumour], ‚ÄúIt does not behove us to speak of this, O Thou who art limitless in Thy glory: this is an awesome calumny‚Äù?
2808: God admonishes you [hereby] lest you ever revert to the like of this [sin], if you are [truly] believers;
2809: for God makes [His] messages clear unto you - and God is all-knowing, Wise!
2810: Verily, as for those who like [to hear] foul slander spread against [any of] those who have attained to faith grievous suffering awaits them in this world and in the life to come: for God knows [the full truth], whereas you know [it] not.
2811: And were it not for God‚Äôs favour upon you and His grace, and that God is compassionate, a dispenser of grace...!
2812: O You who have attained to faith! Follow not Satan‚Äôs footsteps: for he who follows Satan‚Äôs foot¬≠steps [will find that], behold, he enjoins but deeds of abomination and all that runs counter to reason. And were it not for God‚Äôs favour upon you and His grace, not one of you would ever have remained pure. For [thus it is:] God who causes whomever He wills to grow in purity: for God is all-hearing, all-¬≠knowing.
2813: Hence, [even if they have been wronged by slander,] let not those of you who have been graced with God‚Äôs favour and ease of life ever become remiss in helping [the erring ones among] their near of kin, and the needy, and those who have forsaken the domain of evil for the sake of God, but let them pardon and forbear. [For,] do you not desire that God should forgive you your sins, seeing that God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace?
