2814: [But,] verily, those who [falsely, and without repentance,] accuse chaste women who may have been unthinkingly careless but have remained true to their faith, shall be rejected [from God‚Äôs grace] in this world as well as in the life to come: and awesome suffering awaits them
2815: on the Day when their own tongues and hands and feet will bear witness against them by [recalling] all that they did!
2816: On that day God will pay them in full their just due, and they will come to know that God alone is the Ultimate Truth, manifest, and manifesting [the true nature of all that has ever been done].
2817: [In the nature of things,] corrupt women are for corrupt men, and corrupt men, for corrupt women - just as good women are for good men, and good men, for good women. [Since God is aware that] these are innocent of all that evil tongues may impute to them, forgiveness of sins shall be theirs, and a most excellent sustenance!
2818: O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not enter houses other than your own unless you have obtained permission and greeted their inmates. This is [enjoined upon you] for your own good, so that you might bear [your mutual rights] in mind.
2819: Hence, [even] if you find no one within [the house], do not enter it until you are given leave; and if you are told, ‚ÄúTurn back,‚Äù then turn back. This will be most conducive to your purity; and God has full knowledge of all that you do.
2820: [On the other hand,] you will incur no sin if you [freely] enter houses not intended for living in but serving a purpose useful to you: but [always remember that] God knows all that you do openly, and all that you would conceal.
2821: Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and to be mindful of their chastity: this will be most con¬≠ducive to their purity ‚Äì [and,] verily, God is aware of all that they do.
2822: And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and to be mindful of their chastity, and not to display their charms [in public] beyond what may [decently] be apparent thereof; hence, let them draw their head-coverings over their bosoms. And let them not display [more of] their charms to any but their husbands, or their fathers, or their husbands‚Äô fathers, or their sons, or their husbands‚Äô Sons, or their brothers, or their brothers‚Äô sons, or their sisters‚Äô sons, or their womenfolk, or those whom they rightfully possess, or such male attendants as are beyond all sexual desire, or children that are as yet unaware of women‚Äôs nakedness; and let them not swing their legs [in walking] so as to draw attention to their hidden charms And [always], O you believers - all of you - turn unto God in repentance, so that you might attain to a happy state!
2823: AND [you ought to] marry the single from among you as well as such of your male and female slaves as are fit [for marriage]. If they [whom you intend to marry] are poor, [let this not deter you;] God will grant them sufficiency out of His bounty - for God is infinite [in His mercy], all-knowing.
2824: And as for those who are unable to marry, let them live in continence until God grants them sufficiency out of His bounty, And if any of those whom you rightfully possess desire [to obtain] a deed of freedom, write it out for them if you are aware of any good in them: and give them [their share of the wealth of God which He has given you. And do not, in order to gain some of the fleeting pleasures of this worldly life, coerce your [slave] maidens into whoredom if they happen to be desirous of marriage; and if anyone should coerce them, then, verily, after they have been compelled [to submit in their helplessness], God will be much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
2825: AND, INDEED, from on high have We bestowed upon you messages clearly showing the truth, and [many] a lesson from [the stories of] those who have passed away before you, and [many] an admonition to the God-conscious.
2826: God is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of His light is, as it were, that of a niche containing a lamp; the lamp is [enclosed] in glass, the glass [shining] like a radiant star: [a lamp] lit from a blessed tree - an olive-tree that is neither of the east nor of the west the oil whereof [is so bright that it] would well-nigh give light [of itself] even though fire had not touched it: light upon light! God guides unto His light him that wills [to be guided]; and [to this end] God propounds parables unto men, since God [alone] has full knowledge of all things.
2827: IN THE HOUSES [of worship] which God has allowed to be raised so that His name be remembered in them, there [are such as] extol His limitless glory at morn and evening ‚Äì
2828: people whom neither [worldly] commerce nor striving after gain can divert from the remembrance of God, and from con¬≠stancy in prayer, and from charity: [people] who are filled with fear [at the thought] of the Day On which all hearts and eyes will be convulsed,
2829: [and who only hope] that God may reward them in accordance with the best that they ever did, and give them, out of His bounty, more [than they deserve]: for, God grants sustenance unto whom He wills, beyond all reckon¬≠ing.
2830: But as for those who are bent on denying the truth, their [good] deeds are like a mirage in the desert, which the thirsty supposes to be water ‚Äì until, when he approaches it, he finds that it was nothing: instead, he finds [that] God [has always been present] with him, and [that] He will pay him his account in full - for God is swift in reckoning!
2831: Or [else, their deeds are] like the depths of darkness upon an abysmal sea, made yet more dark by wave billowing over wave, with [black] clouds above it all: depths of darkness, layer upon layer, [so that] when one holds up his hand, he can hardly see it: for he to whom God gives no light, no light whatever has he!
2832: ART THOU NOT aware that it is God whose limit¬≠less glory all [creatures] that are in the heavens and on earth extol, even the birds as they spread out their wings? Each [of them] knows indeed how to pray unto Him and to glorify Him; and God has full knowledge of all that they do:
2833: for, God‚Äôs is the dominion over the heavens and the earth, and with God is all journeys‚Äô end.
2834: Art thou not aware that it is God who causes the clouds to move onward, then joins them together, then piles them up in masses, until thou can see rain come forth from their midst? And He it is who sends down from the skies, by degrees, mountainous masses [of clouds] charged with hail, striking therewith whomever He wills and averting it from whomever He wills, [the while] the flash of His lightning well-nigh deprives [men of their] sight!
2835: It is God who causes night and day to alter¬≠nate: in this [too], behold, there is surely a lesson for all who have eyes to see!
2836: And it is God who has created all animals out of water; and [He has willed that] among them are such as crawl on their bellies, and such as walk on two legs, and such as walk on four. God creates what He will: for, verily, God has the power to will anything.
2837: INDEED, from on high have We bestowed messages clearly showing the truth; but God guides onto a straight way [only] him that wills [to be guided].
2838: For, [many are] they [who] say, ‚ÄúWe believe in God and in the Apostle, and we pay heed!‚Äù - but then, some of them turn away after this [assertion]: and these are by no means [true] believers.
2839: And [so it is that] whenever they are summoned unto God and His Apostle in order that [the divine writ] might judge between them, lo! some of them turn away;
2840: but if the truth happens to be to their liking, they are quite willing to accept it!
2841: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they begun to doubt [that this is a divine writ]? Or do they fear that God and His Apostle might deal unjustly with them? Nay, it is [but] they, they who are doing wrong [to themselves]!
2842: The only response of believers, whenever they are summoned unto God and His Apostle in order that [the divine writ] might judge between them, can be no other than, ‚ÄúWe have heard, and we pay heed!‚Äù- and it is they, they who shall attain to a happy state:
2843: for, they who pay heed unto God and His Apostle, and stand in awe of God and are conscious of Him, it is they, they who shall triumph [in the end]!
2844: Now [as for those half-hearted ones,] they do swear by God with their most solemn oaths that if thou [O Apostle] shouldst ever bid them to do so, they would most certainly go forth [and sacrifice themselves]. Say: ‚ÄúSwear not! Reasonable compliance [with God‚Äôs message is all that is required of you]. Verily, God is aware of all that you do!‚Äù
2845: Say: ‚ÄúPay heed unto God, and pay heed unto the Apostle.‚Äù And if you turn away [from the Apostle, know that] he will have to answer only for whatever he has been charged with, and you, for what you have been charged with; but if you pay heed unto him, you will be on the right way. Withal, the Apostle is not bound to do more than clearly deliver the message [entrust¬≠ed to him].
2846: God has promised those of you who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds that, of a certainty, He will cause them to accede to power on earth, even as He caused [some of] those who lived before them to accede to it; and that, of a certainty, He will firmly establish for them the religion which He has been pleased to bestow on them; and that, of a certainty, He will cause their erstwhile state of fear to be replaced by a sense of security [seeing that] they worship Me [alone], not ascribing divine powers to aught beside Me. But all who, after [having understood] this, choose to deny the truth - it is they, they who are truly iniquitous!
2847: Hence, [O believers,] be constant in prayer, and render the purifying dues, and pay heed unto the Apostle, so that you might be graced with God‚Äôs mercy.
2848: [And] think not that those who are bent on denying the truth can elude [their final reckoning even if they remain unscathed] on earth: the fire is their goal [in the life to come] - and vile indeed is such a journey‚Äôs end!
2849: O YOU who have attained to faith! At three times [of day], let [even] those whom you rightfully pos¬≠sess, as well as those from among you who have not yet attained to puberty, ask leave of you [before intruding upon your privacy]: before the prayer of daybreak, and whenever you lay aside your garments in the middle of the day, and after the prayer of nightfall: the three occasions on which your nakedness is likely to be bared. Beyond these [occasions], neither you nor they will incur any sin if they move [freely] about you, attending to [the needs of] one another. In this way God makes clear unto you His mes¬≠sages: for God is all-knowing, wise!
2850: Yet when the children among you attain to puberty, let them ask leave of you [at all times], even as those [who have reached maturity] before them have been enjoined to ask it. In this way God makes clear unto you His mes¬≠sages: for God is all-knowing, wise!
2851: AND [know that] women advanced in years, who no longer feel any sexual desire, incur no sin if they discard their [outer] garments, provided they do not aim at a showy display of [their] charms. But [even so,] it is better for them to abstain [from this]: and God is all-hearing, all-knowing.
2852: [ALL OF YOU, O believers, are brethren: hence.] no blame attaches to the blind, nor does blame attach to the lame, nor does blame attach to the sick [for accepting charity from the hale], and neither to your¬≠selves for eating [whatever is offered to you by others, whether it be food obtained] from your [chil¬≠dren‚Äôs] houses, or your fathers‚Äô houses, or your mothers‚Äô houses, or your brothers‚Äô houses, or your sisters‚Äô houses, or your paternal uncles‚Äô houses, or your paternal aunts‚Äô houses, or your maternal uncles‚Äô houses, or your maternal aunts‚Äô houses, or [houses] the keys whereof are in your charge! or [the house] of any of your friends; nor will you incur any sin by eating in company or separately. But whenever you enter [any of these] houses, greet one another with a blessed, goodly greeting, as enjoined by God. In this way God makes clear unto you His mes¬≠sages, so that you might [learn to] use your reason.
2853: [TRUE BELIEVERS are only they who have attained to faith in God and His Apostle, and who, whenever they are [engaged] with him upon a matter of concern to the whole community do not depart [from whatever has been decided upon] unless they have sought [and obtained] his leave. Verily, those who [do not abstain from the agreed ¬≠upon action unless they] ask leave of thee - it is [only] they who [truly] believe in God and His Apostle! Hence, when they ask leave of thee for some [valid] reason of their own, grant thou this leave to whomsoever of them thou choose [to grant it], and ask God to forgive them: for, behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
2854: DO NOT regard the Apostles summons to you [in the same light] as a summons of one of you to another: God is indeed aware of those of you who would withdraw surreptitiously: so let those who would go against His bidding beware, lest a [bitter] trial befall them [in this world] or grievous suffering befall them [in the life to come].
2855: Oh, verily, unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: well does He know where you stand and at what you aim! And one Day, all [who have ever lived] will be brought back unto Him, and then He will make them [truly] understand all that they were doing [in life]: for, God has full knowledge of everything.
2856: Hallowed is He who from on high, step by step, has bestowed upon His servant the standard by which to discern the true from the false, so that to all the world it might be a warning:
2857: He to whom the dominion over the heavens and the earth belongs, and who begets no offspring, and has no partner in His dominion: for it is He who creates every thing and determines its nature in accordance with [His own] design.
2858: And yet, some choose to worship, instead of Him, imaginary deities that cannot create anything but are themselves created, and have it not within their power to avert harm from, or bring benefit to, themselves, and have no power over death, nor over life, nor over resurrection!
2859: Moreover, those who are bent on denying the truth are wont to say, ‚ÄúThis [Qur‚Äôan] is nothing but a lie, which he [himself] has devised with the help of other people, who thereupon have perverted the truth and brought a falsehood into being.‚Äù
2860: And they say, ‚ÄúFables of ancient times which he has caused to be written down, so that they might be read out to him at morn and evening!‚Äù
2861: Say [O Muhammad]: ‚ÄúHe who knows all the mysteries of the heavens and the earth has bestowed from on high this [Qur‚Äôan upon me]! Verily, He is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!‚Äù
2862: Yet they say: What sort of apostle is this [man] who eats food [like all other mortals] and goes about in the market places? Why has not an angel [visibly] been sent down unto him, to act as a warner together with him?‚Äù
2863: Or: ‚Äú[Why has not] a treasure been granted to him [by God]?‚Äù Or: ‚ÄúHe should [at least] have a [bountiful] garden, so that he could eat thereof [without effort]!‚Äù And so these evildoers say [unto one another], ‚ÄúIf you were to follow [Muhammad, you would follow] but a man bewitched!‚Äù
2864: See to what they liken thee, [O Prophet, simply] because they have gone astray and are now unable to find a way to the truth]!
2865: Hallowed is He who, if it be His will, shall give thee something better than that [whereof they speak] - gardens through which running waters flow - and shall assign to thee mansions [of bliss in the life to come].
2866: But nay! It is [the very coming of] the Last Hour to which they give the lie! However, for such as give the lie to [the announce¬≠ment of] the Last Hour We have readied a blazing flame:
2867: when it shall face them from afar, they will hear its angry roar and its hiss;
2868: and when they are flung, linked [all] together, into a tight space within, they will pray for extinction there and then!
2869: [But they will be told:] ‚ÄúPray not today for one single extinction, but pray for many extinctions!‚Äù
2870: Say: ‚ÄúWhich is better - that, or the paradise of life abiding which has been promised to the God-conscious as their reward and their journey‚Äôs end ‚Äì
2871: a promise given by thy Sustainer, [always] to be prayed for?‚Äù
2872: BUT [as for people who are oblivious of thy Sus¬≠tainer‚Äôs oneness -] one Day He will gather them together with all that they [now] worship instead of God, and will ask [those to whom divinity was falsely ascribed]: ‚ÄúWas it you who led these My creatures astray, or did they by themselves stray from the right path?‚Äù
2873: They will answer: ‚ÄúLimitless art Thou in Thy glory! It was inconceivable for us to take for our masters anyone but Thyself! But [as for them -] Thou didst allow them and their forefathers to enjoy [the pleasures of] life to such an extent that they forgot all remembrance [of Thee]: for they were people devoid of all good.‚Äù
2874: [Thereupon God will say:] ‚ÄúAnd now, they [whom you regarded as divine] have given the lie to all your [past] assertions, and you can neither ward off [your punishment] nor obtain any succour! For, whoever of you has committed [such] evil, him shall We cause to taste great suffering!‚Äù
2875: AND [even] before thee, [O Muhammad,] We never sent as Our message-bearers any but [mortal men] who indeed ate food [like other human beings] and went about in the market places: for [it is thus that] We cause you [human beings] to be a means of testing one another. Are you able to endure [this test] with patience? For [remember, O man,] thy Sustainer is truly all-seeing!
2876: But those who do not believe that they are destined to meet Us are wont to say, ‚ÄúWhy have no angels been sent down to us?‚Äù ‚Äì or, ‚ÄúWhy do we not see our Sustainer?‚Äù Indeed, they are far too proud of themselves, hav¬≠ing rebelled [against God‚Äôs truth] with utter disdain!
2877: [Yet] on that Day - the Day on which they shall see the angels there will be no glad tiding for those who were lost in sin; and they will exclaim, ‚ÄúBy a forbidding ban [are we from God‚Äôs grace debarred]!‚Äù ‚Äì
2878: for We shall have turned towards all the [supposedly good] deeds they ever wrought, and shall have transformed them into scattered dust ‚Äì
2879: [whereas] on that same Day those who are destined for paradise will be graced with the best of abodes and the fairest place of repose.
2880: And on the Day on which the skies, together with the clouds, shall burst asunder, and the angels are made to descend in a mighty descent ‚Äì
2881: on that Day [it will become obvious to all that] true sover¬≠eignty belongs to the Most Gracious [alone]: hence, a Day of distress will it be for all who deny the truth,
2882: and a Day on which the evildoer will bite his hands [in despair], exclaiming: ‚ÄúOh, would that I had followed the path shown to me by the apostle!
2883: Oh, woe is me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so for a friend!
2884: Indeed, he led me astray from the remembrance [of God] after it had come unto me!‚Äù For [thus it is:] Satan is ever a betrayer of man.
2885: AND [on that Day] the Apostle will say: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Behold, [some of] my people have come to regard this Qur‚Äôan as something [that ought to be] discarded!‚Äù
2886: For so it is that against every prophet We have set up enemies from among those who are lost in sin: yet none can guide and give succour as thy Sustainer does!
2887: Now they who are bent on denying the truth are wont to ask. ‚ÄúWhy has not the Qur‚Äôan been bestowed on him from on high in one single re¬≠velation?‚Äù [it has been revealed] in this manner so that We might strengthen thy heart thereby - for We have so arranged its component parts that they form one consistent whole -
2888: and [that] they [who deny the truth] might never taunt thee with any deceptive half-truth without Our conveying to thee the [full] truth and [providing thee] with the best explanation.
2889: [And so, tell those who are bent on denying the truth that] they who shall be gathered unto hell upon their faces ‚Äì it is they who [in the life to come] will be worst in station and still farther astray from the path [of truth]!
2890: AND, INDEED, [long before Muhammad] We vouchsafed revelation unto Moses, and appointed his brother Aaron to help him to bear his burden;
2891: and We said, ‚ÄúGo you both unto the people who have given the lie to Our messages!‚Äù - and thereupon We broke those [sinners] to smithereens.
2892: And [think of] the people of Noah: when they gave the lie to [one of] the apostles, We caused them to drown, and made them a symbol for all mankind: for, grievous suffering have We readied for all who [knowingly] do wrong!
2893: And [remember how We punished the tribes of] Ad and Thamud and the people of Ar-Rass, and many generations [of sinners] in-between:
2894: and unto each of them did We proffer lessons and each of them did We destroy with utter destruction.
2895: And they [who now deny Our messages] must surely have come across that town which was rained upon by a rain of evil: have they, then, never beheld it [with their minds eye]? But nay, they would not believe in resurrection!
2896: Hence, whenever they consider thee, [O Muhammad,] they but make thee a target of their mockery, [saying:] ‚ÄúIs this the one whom God has sent as an apostle?
2897: Indeed, he would well-nigh have led us astray from our deities, had we not been [so] steadfastly attached to them!‚Äù But in time, when they see the suffering [that awaits them], they will come to know who it was that went farthest astray from the path [of truth]!
2898: Hast thou ever considered [the kind of man] who makes his own desires his deity? Couldst thou, then, [O Prophet,] be held responsible for him?
2899: Or dost thou think that most of them listen [to thy message] and use their reason? Nay, they are but like cattle - nay, they are even less conscious of the right way!
2900: Art thou not aware of thy Sustainer [through His works]? - how He causes the shadow to lengthen [towards the night] when, had He so willed, He could indeed have made it stand still: but then, We have made the sun its guide;
2901: and then, [after having caused it to lengthen,] We draw it in towards Our¬≠selves with a gradual drawing-in.
2902: And He it is who makes the night a garment for you, and [your] sleep a rest, and causes every [new] day to be a resurrection.
2903: And He it is who sends forth the winds as a glad tiding of His coming grace; and [thus, too,] We cause pure water to descend from the skies,
2904: so that We may bring dead land to life thereby, and give to drink thereof to many [beings] of Our creation, beasts as well as humans.
2905: And, indeed, many times have We repeated [all] this unto men, so that they might take it to heart: but most men refuse to be aught but ingrate.
2906: Now had We so willed. We could have [con¬≠tinued as before and] raised up a [separate] warner in every single community:
2907: hence, do not defer to [the likes and dislikes of] those who deny the truth, but strive hard against them, by means of this [divine writ], with utmost striving.
2908: AND HE it is who has given freedom of movement to the two great bodies of water ‚Äì the one sweet and thirst-allaying, and the other salty and bitter - and yet has wrought between them a barrier and a forbidding ban.
2909: And He it is who out of this [very] water has created man, and has endowed him with [the con¬≠sciousness of] descent and marriage-tie: for thy Sustainer is ever infinite in His power.
2910: And yet, some people worship, instead of God, things that can neither benefit them nor harm them: thus, he who denies the truth does indeed turn his back on his Sustainer!
2911: Yet [withal, O Prophet,] We have sent thee only as a herald of glad tidings and a warner.
2912: Say: ‚ÄúFor this, no reward do I ask of you [- no reward] other than that he who so wills may unto his Sustainer find a way!‚Äù
2913: Hence, place thy trust in the Living One who dies not, and extol His limitless glory and praise: for none is as aware as His creatures‚Äô sins as He ‚Äì
2914: He who has created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six aeons, and is established on the throne of His almightiness: the Most Gracious! Ask, then, about Him, [the] One who is [truly] aware.
2915: Yet when they [who are bent on denying the truth! are told, ‚ÄúProstrate yourselves before the Most Gracious.‚Äù they are wont to ask, ‚ÄúAnd [who and] what is the Most Gracious? Are we to prostrate ourselves before whatever thou biddest us [to worship]?‚Äù - and so [thy call] but increases their aversion,
2916: HALLOWED is He who has set up in the skies great constellations, and has placed among them a [radiant] lamp and a light-giving moon.
2917: And He it is who causes the night and the day to succeed one another, [revealing Himself in His works] unto him who has the will to take thought - that is has the will to be grateful.
2918: For, [true] servants of the Most Gracious are [only] they who walk gently on earth, and who, whenever the foolish address them, reply with [words of] peace;
2919: and who remember their Sustainer far into the night, prostrating themselves and standing;
2920: and who pray: ‚ÄúO our Sustainer, avert from us the suffering of hell - for, verily, the suffering caused by it is bound to be a torment dire:
2921: verily, how evil an abode and a station!‚Äù -;
2922: and who, whenever they spend on others, are neither wasteful nor niggardly but [remember that] there is always a just mean between those [two extremes];
2923: and who never invoke any [imaginary] deity side by side with God, and do not take any human beings life - [the life] which God has willed to be sacred - otherwise than in [the pursuit of] justice, and do not commit adultery. And [know that] he who commits aught thereof shall [not only] meet with a full requital
2924: [but] shall have his suffering doubled on Resurrection Day: for on that [Day] he shall abide in ignominy.
2925: Excepted, however, shall be they who repent and attain to faith and do righteous deeds: for it is they whose [erstwhile] bad deeds God will transform into good ones - seeing that God is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace,
2926: and seeing that he who repents and [thenceforth] does what is right has truly turned unto God by [this very act of] repent¬≠ance.
2927: And [know that true servants of God are only] those who never bear witness to what is false, and [who], whenever they pass by [people engaged in] frivolity, pass on with dignity;
2928: and who, whenever they are reminded of their Sustainer‚Äôs messages, do not throw themselves upon them [as if] deaf and blind;
2929: and who pray ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! Grant that our spouses and our offspring be a joy to our eyes, and cause us to be foremost among those who are conscious of Thee!‚Äù
2930: [Such as] these will be rewarded for all their patient endurance [in life] with a high station [in paradise], and will be met therein with a greeting of welcome and peace,
2931: therein to abide: [and] how goodly an abode and [how high] a station!
2932: SAY [unto those who believe]: ‚ÄúNo weight or value would my Sustainer attach to you were it not for your faith [in Him]!‚Äù And say unto those who deny the truth:] ‚ÄúYou have indeed given the lie [to God‚Äôs message], and in time this [sin] will cleave unto you!‚Äù
2934: THESE ARE MESSAGES of the divine writ, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth!
2935: Wouldst thou, perhaps, torment thyself to death [with grief] because they [who live around thee] refuse to believe [in it]?
2936: Had We so willed, We could have sent down unto them a message from the skies, so that their necks would [be forced to] bow down before it in humility.
2937: [But We have not willed it:] and so, whenever there comes unto them any fresh reminder from the Most Gracious, they [who are blind of heart] always - turn their backs upon it:
2938: thus, indeed, have they given the lie (to this message as well). But [in time] they will come to understand what it was that they were wont to deride!
2939: Have they, then, never considered the earth - how much of every noble kind [of life] We have caused to grow thereon?
2940: In this, behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
2941: But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
2942: HENCE, [remember how it was] when thy Sustainer summoned Moses: ‚ÄúGo unto those evil doing people.
2943: the people of Pharaoh, who refuse to be con¬≠scious of Me!‚Äù
2944: He answered: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Behold, I fear that they will give me the lie,
2945: and then my breast will be straitened and my tongue will not be free: send, then, [this Thy command] to Aaron.
2946: Moreover, they keep a grave charge [pending] against me, and I fear that they will slay me.‚Äù
2947: Said He: ‚ÄúNot so, indeed! Go forth, then, both of you, with Our messages: verify, We shall be with you, listening [to your call]!
2948: And go, both of you, unto Pharaoh and say, ‚ÄòBehold, we bear a message from the Sustainer of all the worlds:
2949: Let the children of Israel go with us!‚Äô‚Äù
2950: [But when Moses had delivered his message, Pharaoh] said: ‚ÄúDid we not bring thee up among us when thou wert a child? And didst thou not spend among us years of thy [later] life?
2951: And yet thou didst commit that [heinous] deed of thine, and [hast thus shown that] thou art one of the ingrate!‚Äù
2952: Replied [Moses]: ‚ÄúI committed it while I was still going astray;
2953: and I fled from you because I feared you. But [since] then my Sustainer has endowed me with the ability to judge [between right and wrong], and has made me one of [His] message-¬≠bearers.
2954: And [as for] that favour of which thou so tauntingly remindest me - [was it not] due to thy having enslaved the children of Israel?‚Äù
2955: Said Pharaoh: ‚ÄúAnd what [and who] is that ‚ÄòSustainer of all the worlds‚Äô?‚Äù
2956: [Moses] answered: ‚Äú[He is] the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them: if you would but [allow yourselves to] be convinced!‚Äù
2957: Said [Pharaoh] unto those around him: ‚ÄúDid you hear [what he said]?‚Äù
2958: [And Moses] continued: ‚Äú[He is] your Sus¬≠tainer, [too,] as well as the Sustainer of your fore¬≠fathers of old!‚Äù
2959: [Pharaoh] exclaimed: ‚ÄúBehold, [this] your ‚Äòapostle‚Äô who [claims that he] has been sent unto you is mad indeed!
2960: [But Moses] went on: ‚Äú[He of whom I speak is] the Sustainer of the east and the west and of all that is between the two‚Äù- as you would know] if you would but use your reason!‚Äù
2961: Said [Pharaoh]: ‚ÄúIndeed, if thou choose to worship any deity other than me, I shall most cer¬≠tainly throw thee into prison!
2962: Said he: ‚ÄúEven if I should bring about before thee something that clearly shows the truth?‚Äù
2963: [Pharaoh] answered: ‚ÄúProduce it, then, if thou art a man of truth!‚Äù
2964: Thereupon [Moses] threw down his staff - and lo! it was a serpent, plainly visible;
2965: and he drew forth his hand - and lo! it appeared [shining] white to the beholders.
2966: Said [pharaoh] unto the great ones around him: ‚ÄúVerily, this is indeed a sorcerer of great knowledge
2967: who wants to drive you out of your land by his sorcery. What, then, do you advise?‚Äù
2968: They answered: ‚ÄúLet him and his brother wait a while, and send unto all cities heralds
2969: who shall assemble before thee all sorcerers of great knowl¬≠edge‚Äù
2970: And so the sorcerers were assembled at a set time on a certain day,
2971: and the people were asked: Are you all present,
2972: so that we might follow [in the footsteps of] the sorcerers if it is they who prevail?‚Äù
2973: Now when the sorcerers came, they said unto Pharaoh: ‚ÄúVerily, we ought to have a great reward if it is we who prevail.
2974: Answered he: ‚ÄúYea - and, verily, in that case you shall be among those who are near unto me.
2975: [And] Moses said unto them: ‚ÄúThrow whatever you are going to throw!‚Äù
2976: Thereupon they threw their [magic ropes and their staffs, and said: ‚ÄúBy Pharaoh‚Äôs might, behold, it is we indeed who have prevailed!‚Äù
2977: [But] then Moses threw his staff - and lo! it swallowed up all their deceptions.
2978: And down fell the sorcerers, prostrating them¬≠selves in adoration,
2979: [and] exclaimed: ‚ÄúWe have come to believe in the Sustainer of all the worlds,
2980: the Sustainer of Moses and Aaron!‚Äù
2981: Said [Pharaoh]: ‚ÄúHave you come to believe in him ere I have given you permission? Verily, he must be your master who has taught you magic! But in time you shall come to know [my revenge]: most certainly shall I cut off your hands and your feet in great numbers, because of [your] perverseness, and shall most certainly crucify you in great numbers, all together!‚Äù
2982: They answered: ‚ÄúNo harm [canst thou do to us]: verily, unto our Sustainer do we turn!
2983: Behold, we [but] ardently desire that our Sustainer forgive us our faults in return for our having been foremost among the believers!‚Äù
2984: AND [there came a time when] We inspired Moses thus: ‚ÄúGo forth with My servants by night: for, behold, you will he pursued!‚Äù
2985: And Pharaoh sent heralds unto all cities,
2986: [bidding them to call out his troops and to proclaim:] ‚ÄúBehold, these [children of Israel] are but a contemptible band;
2987: but they are indeed filled with hatred of us
2988: seeing that we are, verily, a nation united, fully prepared against danger ‚Äì
2989: and so we have [rightly] driven them out of [their] gardens and springs,
2990: and [deprived them of their erstwhile] station of honour!‚Äù
2991: Thus it was: but [in the course of time] We were to bestow all these [things] as a heritage on the children of Israel.
2992: And so [the Egyptians] caught up with them at sunrise;
2993: and as soon as the two hosts came in sight of one another, the followers of Moses exclaimed: ‚ÄúBehold, we shall certainly be overtaken [and defeated]!‚Äù
2994: He replied: Nay indeed! My Sustainer is with me, [and] He will guide me!‚Äù
2995: Thereupon We inspired Moses thus: Strike the sea with thy staff!‚Äù- whereupon it parted, and each part appeared like a mountain vast.
2996: And We caused the pursuers to draw near unto that place:
2997: and We saved Moses and all who were with him,
2998: and then We caused the others to drown.
2999: In this [story] behold, there is a message [unto all men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
3000: And yet, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
3001: And convey unto them the story of Abraham ‚Äì
3002: [how it was] when he asked his father and his people, ‚ÄúWhat is it that you worship?‚Äù
3003: They answered: We worship idols, and we remain ever devoted to them.‚Äù
3004: Said he: ‚ÄúDo [you really think that] they hear you when you invoke them,
3005: or benefit you or do you harm?‚Äù
3006: They exclaimed: But we found our fore¬≠fathers doing the same!‚Äù
3007: Said [Abraham]: ‚ÄúHave you, then, ever con¬≠sidered what it is that you have been worshipping
3008: you and those ancient forebears of yours?
3009: ‚ÄúNow [as for me, I know that,] verily, these [false deities] are my enemies, [and that none is my helper] save the Sustainer of all the worlds,
3010: who has created me and is the One who guides me,
3011: and is the One who gives me to eat and to drink,
3012: and when I fall ill, is the One who restores me to health,
3013: and who will cause me to die and then will bring me back to life ‚Äì
3014: and who, [hope, will forgive me my faults on Judgment Day!
3015: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Endow me with the ability to judge [between right and wrong], and make me one with the righteous,
3016: and grant me the power to convey the truth unto those who will come after me,
3017: and place me among those who shall inherit the garden of bliss!
3018: ‚ÄúAnd forgive my father - for, verily, he is among those who have gone astray ‚Äì

3235: BEHOLD, this Qur‚Äôan explains to the children of Israel most [of that] whereon they hold divergent views;
3236: and, verily, it is a guidance and a grace unto all who believe [in it].
3237: Verily, [O believer,] thy Sustainer will judge between them in His wisdom - for He alone is almighty, all-knowing.
3238: Hence, place thy trust in God [alone] - for, behold, that in which thou believest is truth self-evident.
3239: [But,] verily, thou canst not make the dead hear: and [so, too,] thou canst not make the deaf [of heart] hear this call when they turn their backs [on thee] and go away,
3240: just as thou canst not lead the blind [of heart] out of their error; none canst thou make hear save such as [are willing to] believe in Our messages, and thus surrender themselves unto Us.
3241: Now, [as for the deaf and blind of heart ‚Äì] when the word [of truth] stands revealed against them, We shall bring forth unto them out of the earth a creature, which will tell them that mankind had no real faith in Our messages.
3242: And on that Day We shall gather from within every community a host of those who gave the lie to Our messages; and they will be grouped [according to the gravity of their sins]
3243: until such a time as they shall come [to be judged. And] He will say: ‚ÄúDid you give the lie to My messages even though you failed to encompass them with [your] knowledge? Or what was it that [you thought] you were doing?‚Äù
3244: And the word [of truth] will stand revealed against them in the face of all the wrong which they had committed, and they will not [be able to] utter a single word [of excuse]:
3245: for, were they not aware that it is We who had made the night for them, so that they might rest therein, and the day, to make [them] see? In this, behold, there are messages indeed for peo¬≠ple who will believe!
3246: And on that Day the trumpet [of judgment] will be sounded, and all [creatures] that are in the heavens and all that are on earth will be stricken with terror, except such as God wills [to exempt]: and in utter lowliness all will come unto Him.
3247: And thou wilt see the mountains, which [now] thou deemest so firm, pass away as clouds pass away: a work of God, who has ordered all things to per¬≠fection! Verily, He is fully aware of all that you do!
3248: Whoever shall come [before Him] with a good deed will gain [further] good there from; and they will be secure from the terror of that Day.
3249: But they who shall come with evil deeds ‚Äì their faces will be thrust into the fire, [and they will be asked:] ‚ÄúIs this aught but a just requital for what you were doing [in life]?‚Äù
3250: [SAY, O Muhammad:] ‚ÄúI have been bidden to worship the Sustainer of this City ‚Äì Him who has made it sacred, and unto whom all things belong: and I have been bidden to be of those who surrender themselves to Him,
3251: and to convey this Qur‚Äôan [to the world].‚Äù Whoever, therefore, chooses to follow the right path, follows it but for his own good; and if any wills to go astray, say [unto him]: ‚ÄúI am only a warner.
3252: And say: ‚ÄúAll praise is due to God! In time He will make you see [the truth of] His messages, and then you shall know them [for what they are].‚Äù And thy Sustainer is not unmindful of whatever you all may do.
3254: These are messages of a divine writ clear in itself and clearly showing the truth.
3255: We [now] convey unto thee some of the story of Moses and Pharaoh, setting forth the truth for [the benefit of] people who will believe.
3256: Behold, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and divided its people into castes. One group of them he deemed utterly low; he would slaughter their sons and spare (only) their women: for, behold, he was one of those who spread corruption [on earth].
3257: But it was Our will to bestow Our favour upon those [very people] who were deemed [so] utterly low in the land, and to make them forerunners in faith. and to make them heirs [to Pharaoh‚Äôs glory],
3258: and to establish them securely on earth, and to let Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts experience through those [children of Israel] the very thing against which they sought to protect themselves.
3259: And so, [when he was born,] We inspired [thus] the mother of Moses: Suckle him [for a time], and then, when thou hast cause to fear for him, cast him into the river, and have no fear and do not grieve - for We shall restore him to thee, and shall make him one of Our message-bearers!‚Äù
3260: And [some of] Pharaoh‚Äôs household found [and spared] him: for [We had willed] that he becomes an enemy unto them and [a source of] grief, seeing that Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were sinners indeed!
3261: Now the wife of Pharaoh said: ‚ÄúA joy to the eye [could this child be] for me and thee! Slay him not: he may well be of use to us, or we may adopt him as a son!‚Äù And they had no presentiment [of what he was to become].
3262: On the morrow, however, an aching void grew up in the heart of the mother of Moses, and she would indeed have disclosed all about him had We not endowed her heart with enough strength to keep alive her faith [in Our promise].
3263: And so she said to his sister, ‚ÄúFollow him‚Äù - and [the girl] watched him from afar, while they [who had taken him in] were not aware of it,
3264: Now from the very beginning We caused him to refuse the breast of [Egyptian] nurses; and [when his sister came to know this,] she said: ‚ÄúShall I guide you to a family that might rear him for you, and look after him with good will?‚Äù
3265: And thus We restored him to his mother, so that her eye might he gladdened, and that she might grieve no longer, and that she might know that God‚Äôs promise always comes true - even though most of them know it not!
3266: Now when [Moses] reached full manhood and had become mature [of mind]. We bestowed upon him the ability to judge [between right and wrong] as well as [innate] knowledge: for thus do We reward the doers of good.
3267: And [one day] he entered the city at a time when [most of] its people were [resting in their houses,] unaware of what was going on [in the streets]; and there he encountered two men fighting with one another - one of his own people, and the other of his enemies. And the one who belonged to his own people cried out to him for help against him who was of his enemies - whereupon Moses struck him down with his fist, and [thus] brought about his end. [But then] he said [to himself]: ‚ÄúThis is of Satan‚Äôs doing! Verily, he is an open foe, leading [man] astray!‚Äù
3268: [And] he prayed: O my Sustainer! Verily, I have sinned against myself! Grant me, then, Thy forgiveness!‚Äù And He forgave him - for, verily, He alone is truly forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
3269: Said he: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! [I vow] by all the blessings which Thou hast bestowed on me: Never¬≠more shall I aid such as are lost in sin!‚Äù
3270: And next morning he found himself in the city, looking fearfully about him, when lo! the one who had sought his help the day before [once again] cried out to him [for help whereupon] Moses said unto him: ‚ÄúBehold, thou art indeed, most clearly, deeply in the wrong!
3271: But then as soon as he was about to lay violent hands on the man who was their [common] enemy, the latter exclaimed: ‚ÄúO Moses, dost thou intend to slay me as thou didst slay another man yesterday? Thy sole aim is to become a tyrant in this land, for thou dost not care to be of those who would set things to rights!‚Äù
3272: And [then and there] a man came running from the farthermost end of the city, and said: ‚ÄúO Moses! Behold, the great ones [of the kingdom] are deli¬≠berating upon thy case with a view to killing thee! Begone, then: verily, I am of those who wish thee well!‚Äù
3273: So he went forth from thence, looking fearfully about him, and prayed: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Save me from all evildoing folk!‚Äù
3274: And as he turned his face towards Madyan, he said [to himself]: ‚ÄúIt may well be that my Sustainer will [thus] guide me onto the right path‚Äù
3275: NOW WHEN he arrived at the wells of Madyan, he found there a large group of men who were watering [their herds and flocks]; and at some distance from them he came upon two women who were keeping back their flock. He asked [them]: ‚ÄúWhat is the matter with you?‚Äù They answered: ‚ÄúWe cannot water [our animals] until the herdsmen drive [theirs] home - for [we are weak and] our father is a very old man.‚Äù
3276: So he watered [their flock] for them: and when he withdrew into the shade and prayed: ‚ÄúO my Sus¬≠tainer! Verily, in dire need am I of any good which Thou mayest bestow upon me!‚Äù
3277: [Shortly] afterwards, one of the two [maidens] approached him, walking shyly, and said: ‚ÄúBehold, my father invites thee, so that he might duly reward thee for thy having watered [our flock] for us.‚Äù And as soon as [Moses] came unto him and told him the story [of his life], he said: ‚ÄúHave no fear! Thou art now safe from those evildoing folk!‚Äù
3278: Said one of the two [daughters]: ‚ÄúO my father! Hire him: for, behold, the best [man] that thou couldst hire is one who is [as] strong and worthy of trust [as he]!‚Äù
3279: [After some time, the father] said: ‚ÄúBehold, I am willing to let thee wed one of these two daughters of mine on the understanding that thou wilt remain eight years in my service; and if thou shouldst com¬≠plete ten [years], that would be [an act of grace] from thee, for I do not want to impose any hardship on thee: [on the contrary,] thou wilt find me, if God so wills, righteous in all my dealings.‚Äù
3280: Answered [Moses]: ‚ÄúThus shall it be between me and thee! Whichever of the two terms I fulfill, let there be no ill will against me. And God be witness to all that we say!‚Äù
3281: And when Moses had fulfilled his term and was wandering with his family [in the desert], he per¬≠ceived a fire on the slope of Mount Sinai; [and so] he said to his family: ‚ÄúWait here. Behold, I perceive a fire [far away]; perhaps I may bring you from there some tiding, or [at least] a burning brand from the fire, so that you might warm yourselves.
3282: But when he came close to it, a call was sounded from the right-side bank of the valley, out of the tree [burning] on blessed ground: ‚ÄúO Moses! Verily, I am God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!‚Äù
3283: And [then He said]: ‚ÄúThrow down thy staff!‚Äù But as soon as [Moses] saw it move rapidly, as if it were a snake, he drew back [in terror], and did not [dare to] return. [And God spoke to him again:] ‚ÄúO Moses! Draw near, and have no fear - for, behold, thou art of those who are secure [in this world and in the next]!
3284: ‚Äú[And now] put thy hand into thy bosom: it will come forth [shining] white, without blemish. And [henceforth] hold thine arm close to thyself, free of all fear. ‚ÄúThese, then, shall be the two signs [of thy bearing a message] from thy Sustainer unto Pharaoh and his great ones - for, behold, they are people depraved!‚Äù
3285: Said [Moses] ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! I have slain one of them, and so I fear that they will slay me.
3286: And my brother Aaron - he is far better in speech than I am. Send him, therefore, as a helper, so that he might [more eloquently] bear witness to my speaking the truth: for I fear indeed that they will give me the lie.‚Äù
3287: Said He: ‚ÄúWe shall strengthen thine arm through thy brother, and endow both of you with power, so that they will not be able to touch you: by virtue of Our messages shall you two, and all who follow you, prevail!‚Äù
3288: But as soon as Moses came unto them with Our clear messages [Pharaoh and his great ones] said: ‚ÄúAll this is nothing but spellbinding eloquence devised [by man]: and never did we hear [the like of] this, [nor has it ever been heard of] in the time of our forebears of old!‚Äù
3289: And Moses replied: ‚ÄúMy Sustainer knows best as to who comes with guidance from Him, and to whom the future belongs! Verily, never will evil¬≠doers attain to a happy state!‚Äù
3290: Whereupon Pharaoh said: ‚ÄúO you nobles! I did not know that you could have any deity other than myself Well, then, O Haman, kindle me a fire for [baking bricks of] clay, and then build me a lofty tower, that haply I may have a look at the god of Moses although, behold, I am convinced that he is of those who [always] tell lies!‚Äù
3291: Thus arrogantly, without the least good sense, did he and his hosts behave on earth - just as if they thought that they would never have to appear before Us [for judgment]!
3292: And so We seized him and his hosts and cast them into the sea: and behold what happened in the end to those evildoers:
3293: [We destroyed them,] and We set them up as archetypes [of evil] that show the way to the fire [of hell]; and [whereas] no succour will come to them on Resurrection Day,
3294: We have caused a curse to follow them in this world as well; and on Resurrection Day they will find themselves among those who are bereft of all good.
3295: And [then,] indeed, after We had destroyed those earlier generations [of sinners], We vouchsafed unto Moses [Our] revelation as a means of insight for men, and as a guidance and grace, so that they might bethink themselves [of Us].
3296: NOW [as for thee, O Muhammad,] thou wert not present on the sunset slope [of Mount Sinai] when We imposed the Law upon Moses, nor wert thou among those who witnessed [his times]:
3297: nay, but [between them and thee] We brought into being [many] generations, and long was their span of life. And neither didst thou dwell among the people of Madyan, conveying Our messages unto them: nay, but We have [always] been sending [Our message-bearers unto man].
3298: And neither wert thou present on the slope of Mount Sinai when We called out [to Moses]: but [thou, too, art sent] as an act of thy Sustainer‚Äôs grace, to warn people to whom no warner has come before thee, so that they might bethink themselves [of Us];
3299: and [We have sent thee] lest they say [on Judg¬≠ment Day], when disaster befalls them as an outcome of what their own hands have wrought, ‚ÄúO our Sus¬≠tainer, if only Thou had sent an apostle unto us, we would have followed Thy messages, and would have been among those who believe!‚Äù
3300: And yet, now that the truth has come unto them from Us, they say, ‚ÄúWhy has he not been vouch¬≠safed the like of what Moses was vouchsafed?‚Äù But did they not also, before this, deny the truth of what Moses was vouchsafed? [For] they do say, ‚ÄúTwo examples of delusion, [seemingly] supporting each other!‚Äù And they add, ‚ÄúBehold, we refuse to accept either of them as true!‚Äù
3301: Say: ‚ÄúProduce, then, [another] revelation from God which would offer better guidance than either of these two [and] I shall follow it, if you speak the truth!‚Äù
3302: And since they cannot respond to this thy challenge, know that they are following only their own likes and dislikes: and who could be more astray than he who follows [but] his own likes and dislikes without any guidance from God? Verily, God does not grace with His guidance peo¬≠ple who are given to evildoing!
3303: NOW, INDEED, We have caused this word [of Ours] to reach mankind step by step, so that they might [learn to] keep it in mind.
3304: As for those unto whom We have vouchsafed revelation aforetime - they [are bound to] believe in this one [as well];
3305: and whenever it is [clearly] conveyed unto them, they [are bound to] profess, ‚ÄúWe have come to believe in it, for, behold, it is the truth from our Sustainer - and, verily, even before this have we surrendered ourselves unto Him!‚Äù
3306: These it is that shall receive a twofold reward for having been patient in adversity, and having repelled evil with good, and having spent on others out of what We provided for them as sus¬≠tenance,
3307: and, whenever they heard frivolous talk, having turned away from it and said: ‚ÄúUnto us shall be accounted Our deeds, and unto you, your deeds. Peace be upon you - [but] we do not seek out such as are ignorant [of the meaning of right and wrong].‚Äù
3308: VERILY, thou canst not guide aright everyone whom thou lovest: but it is God who guides him that wills [to be guided]; and He is fully aware of all who would let themselves be guided.
3309: Now some say, ‚ÄúIf we were to follow the guidance to which thou invitest us, we would be torn away from our very soil!‚Äù Why - have We not established for them a sanc¬≠tuary secure, to which, as a provision from Us, shall be gathered the fruits of all (good) things? But most of them are unaware [of this truth].
3310: And how many a community that [once] exult¬≠ed in its wanton wealth and ease of life have We destroyed, so that those dwelling-places of theirs ‚Äì all but a few - have never been dwelt-in after them: for it is indeed We alone who shall remain when all else will have passed away!
3311: Yet, withal, thy Sustainer would never destroy a community without having [first] raised in its midst an apostle who would convey unto them Our mes¬≠sages; and never would We destroy a community unless its people are wont to do wrong [to one another].
3312: And [remember:] whatever you are given [now] is but for the [passing] enjoyment of life in this world, and for its embellishment - whereas that which is with God is [so much] better and more enduring. Will you not, then, use your reason?
3313: Is, then, he to whom We have given that goodly promise which he shall see fulfilled [on his resurrection] comparable to one on whom We have bestowed [all] the enjoyments of this worldly life but who, on Resurrection Day, will find himself among those that shall be arraigned [before Us]?
3314: For, on that Day He will call unto them, and will ask: ‚ÄúWhere, now, are those [beings or powers] whom you imagined to have a share in My divinity?‚Äù
3315: [whereupon] they against whom the word [of truth] shall thus stand revealed will exclaim: O our Sustainer! Those whom we caused to err so grievously, we but caused to err as we our¬≠selves had been erring. We [now] disavow them before Thee: it was not us that they worshipped!‚Äù
3316: And [they] will be told: ‚ÄúCall [now] unto those [beings or powers] to whom you were wont to ascribe a share in God‚Äôs divinity!‚Äù and they will call unto them [for help], but those [fake objects of worship] will not respond to them: whereupon they will see the suffering [that awaits them - the suffering which could have been avoided] if only they had allowed them¬≠selves to be guided!
3317: And on that Day He will call unto them, and will ask: ‚ÄúHow did you respond to My message¬≠ bearers?‚Äù
3318: but all arguments and excuses will by then have been erased from their minds, and they will not [be able to] obtain any [helpful] answer from one another.
3319: But as against this - anyone who repents and attains to faith and does righteous deeds may well [hope to] find himself among those who achieve a happy state [in the life to come].
3320: AND [thus it is:] thy Sustainer creates whatever He wills; and He chooses [for mankind] whatever is best for them. Limitless is God in His glory, and sub¬≠limely exalted above anything to which they may ascribe a share in His divinity!
3321: And thy Sustainer knows all that their hearts conceal as well as all that they bring into the open:
3322: for He is God, save whom there is no deity. Unto Him all praise is due, at the beginning and at the end [of time]; and with Him rests all judgment; and unto Him shall you all be brought back.
3323: Say: ‚ÄúHave you ever considered [this]: If God had willed that there should always be night about you, without break, until the Day of Resurrection - is there any deity other than God that could bring you light? Will you not, then, listen [to the truth]?‚Äù
3324: Say: ‚ÄúHave you ever considered [this]: If God had willed that there should always be daylight about you, without break, until the Day of Resurrection - is there any deity other than God that could bring you [the darkness of] night, wherein you might rest? Will you not, then, see [the truth]?‚Äù
3325: For it is out of His grace that He has made for you the night and the day, so that you might rest therein as well as seek to obtain [what you need] of His bounty: and [He gave you all this] so that you might have cause to be grateful.
3326: AND ON THAT DAY He will call unto those [that shall have been arraigned before His judgment seat], and will ask: ‚ÄúWhere, now, are those [beings or powers] whom you imagined to have a share in My divinity?‚Äù
3327: And [they will remain silent: for by then] We will have called forth witnesses from within every community, and will have said [unto the sinners]: ‚ÄúProduce an evidence for what you have been claim¬≠ing!‚Äù And so they will come to understand that all truth is God‚Äôs [alone]; and all their false imagery will have forsaken them.
3328: [NOW,] BEHOLD, Qarun was one of the people of Moses; but he arrogantly exalted himself above them - simply because We had granted him such riches that his treasure-chests alone would surely have been too heavy a burden for a troop of ten men or even more. When [they perceived his arrogance,] his people said unto him: ‚ÄúExult not [in thy wealth], for, verily, God does not love those who exult [in things vain]!
3329: Seek instead, by means of what God has granted thee, [the good of] the life to come, without forget¬≠ting, withal, thine own [rightful] share in this world; and do good [unto others] as God has done good unto thee; and seek not to spread corruption on earth: for, verily, God does not love the spreaders of corruption!‚Äù
3330: Answered he: ‚ÄúThis [wealth] has been given to me only by virtue of the knowledge that is in me!‚Äù Did he not know that God had destroyed [the arrogant of] many a generation that preceded him - people who were greater than he in power, and richer in what they had amassed? But such as are lost in sin may not be asked about, their sins.
3331: And so he went forth before his people in all his pomp; [and] those who cared only for the life of this world would say, ‚ÄúOh, if we but had the like of what Qarun has been given! Verily, with tremendous good fortune is he endowed!‚Äù
3332: But those who had been granted true knowl¬≠edge said: ‚ÄúWoe unto you! Merit in the sight of God is by far the best for any who attains to faith and does what is right: but none save the patient in adversity can ever achieve this [blessing].‚Äù
3333: And thereupon We caused the earth to swallow him and his dwelling; and he had none and nothing to succour him against God, nor was he of those who could succour themselves.
3334: And on the morrow, those who but yesterday had longed to be in his place exclaimed: ‚ÄúAlas [for our not having been aware] that it is indeed God [alone] who grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, unto whichever He wills of His crea¬≠tures! Had not God been gracious to us, He might have caused [the earth] to swallow us, too! Alas [for our having forgotten] that those who deny the truth can never attain to a happy state!‚Äù
3335: As for that [happy] life in the hereafter, We grant it [only] to those who do not seek to exalt themselves on earth, nor yet to spread corruption: for the future belongs to the God-conscious.
3336: Whosoever shall come [before God] with a good deed will gain [further] good there from; but as for any who shall come with an evil deed - [know that] they who do evil deeds will not be requited with more than [the like of] what they have done.
3337: VERILY, [O believer,] He who has laid down this Qur‚Äôan in plain terms, making it binding on thee, will assuredly bring thee back [from death] to a life renewed. Say [unto those who reject the truth]: My Sus¬≠tainer knows best, as to who is right-guided and who is obviously lost in error!‚Äù
3338: Now [as for thyself, O believer,] thou couldst never foresee that this divine writ would [one day] be offered to thee: but [it did come to thee] by thy Sustainer‚Äôs grace. Hence, never uphold those who deny the truth [of divine guidance],
3339: and never let them turn thee away from God‚Äôs messages after they have been bestowed upon thee from on high: instead summon [all men] to thy Sustainer. And never be of those who ascribe divinity to aught but Him,
3340: and never call upon any other deity side by side with God. There is no deity save Him. Everything is bound to perish, save His [eternal] self. With Him rests all judgment; and unto Him shall you all be brought back.
3342: DO MEN THINK that on their [mere] saying, ‚ÄúWe have attained to faith‚Äù, they will be left to themselves, and will not be put to a test?
3343: Yea, indeed, We did test those who lived before them; and so, [too, shall be tested the people now living: and] most certainly will God mark out those who prove themselves true, and most certainly will He mark out those who are lying.
3344: Or do they think - they who do evil deeds [while claiming to have attained to faith] - that they can escape Us? Bad, indeed, is their judgment!
3345: Whoever looks forward [with hope and awe] to meeting God [on Resurrection Day, let him be ready for it]: for, behold, the end set by God [for every¬≠one‚Äôs life] is bound to come - and He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing!
3346: Hence, whoever strives hard [in God‚Äôs cause] does so only for his own good: for, verily, God does not stand in need of anything in all the worlds!
3347: And as for those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds, We shall most certainly efface their [previous] bad deeds, and shall most certainly reward them in accordance with the best that they ever did.
3348: Now [among the best of righteous deeds which] We have enjoined upon man [is] goodness towards his parents; yet [even so,] should they endeavour to make thee ascribe divinity, side by side with Me, to something which thy mind cannot accept [as divine], obey then, not: [for] it is unto Me that you all must return, whereupon I shall make you [truly] understand [the right and wrong of] all that you were doing [in life].
3349: But as for those who have attained to faith and have done righteous deeds, We shall most certainly cause them to join the righteous [in the hereafter as well].
3350: Now there is among men many a one who says [of himself and of others like him], ‚ÄúWe do believe in God‚Äù - but whenever he is made to suffer in God‚Äôs cause, he thinks that persecution at the hands of man is as [much to be feared, or even more than,] God‚Äôs chastisement; whereas, if succour from thy Sustainer comes [to those who truly believe] he is sure to say. ‚ÄúBehold, we have always been with you!‚Äù Is not God fully aware of what is in the hearts of all creatures?
3351: [Yea-] and most certainly will God mark out those who have [truly] attained to faith, and most certainly will He mark out the hypocrites.
3352: And [He is aware, too, that] they who are bent on denying the truth speak [thus, as it were,] to those who have attained to faith: ‚ÄúFollow our way [of life], and we shall indeed take your sins upon ourselves!‚Äù But never could they take upon themselves aught of the sins of those [whom they would thus mislead]: behold, they are liars indeed!
3353: Yet most certainly will they have to bear their own burdens, and other burdens besides their own; and most certainly will they be called to account on Resurrection Day for all their false assertions!
3354: And, indeed, [in times long past] We sent forth Noah unto his people, and he dwelt among them a thousand years bar fifty; and then the floods over¬≠whelmed them while they were still lost in evildoing:
3355: but We saved him, together with all who were in the ark, which We then set up as a symbol [of Our grace] for all people [to remember].
3356: And Abraham, [too, was inspired by Us] when he said unto his people: ‚ÄúWorship God, and be conscious of Him: this is the best for you, if you but knew it!
3357: You worship only [lifeless] idols instead of God, and [thus] you give visible shape to a lie! Behold, those [things and beings] that you worship instead of God have it not in their power to provide sustenance for you: seek, then, all [your] sustenance from God, and worship Him [alone] and be grateful to Him: [for] unto Him you shall be brought back!
3358: ‚ÄúAnd if you give [me] the lie - well, [other] communities have given the lie [to Gods prophets] before your time: but no more is an apostle bound to do than clearly deliver the message [entrusted to him].‚Äù
3359: Are then they [who deny the truth] not aware of how God creates [life] in the first instance, and then brings it forth anew? This, verily, is easy for God!
3360: Say: ‚ÄúGo all over the earth and behold how [wondrously] He has created [man] in the first in¬≠stance: and thus, too, will God bring into being your second life for, verily, God has the power to will anything!
3361: He causes to suffer whomever He wills, and bestows His mercy on whomever He wills; and unto Him you shall be made to return:
3362: and never - not on earth and not in the skies - can you [hope to] elude Him: and you have none to protect you from God, and none to bring you succour.‚Äù
3363: And [thus it is:] they who are bent on denying the truth of God‚Äôs messages and of their [ultimate] meeting with Him - it is they who abandon all hope of My grace and mercy: and it is they whom grievous suffering awaits [in the life to come].
3364: Now [as for Abraham,] his people‚Äôs only answer was, ‚ÄúSlay him, or burn him!‚Äù ‚Äì but God saved him from the fire. Behold, in this [story] there are messages indeed for people who will believe!
3365: And [Abraham] said: ‚ÄúYou have chosen to worship idols instead of God for no other reason than to have a bond of love in the life of this world, between yourselves [and your forebears]: but then, on Resurrection Day, you shall disown one another and curse one another - for the goal of you all will be the fire, and you will have none to succour you.
3366: Thereupon [his brother‚Äôs son] Lot came to believe in him and said: ‚ÄúVerily, I [too] shall forsake the domain of evil [and turn] to my Sustainer: for, verily, He alone is almighty, truly wise!‚Äù
3367: And [as for Abraham,] We bestowed upon him Isaac and [Isaac‚Äôs son] Jacob, and caused pro¬≠phethood and revelation to continue among his offspring. And We vouchsafed him his reward in this world; and, verily, in the life to come [too] he shall find himself among the righteous.
3368: And Lot, [too, was inspired by Us] when he said unto his people: ‚ÄúVerily, you commit abominations such as none in all the world has ever committed before you!

3370: [And] he prayed: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Succour Thou me against these people who spread corrup¬≠tion!‚Äù
3371: And so, when Our [heavenly] messengers came to Abraham with the glad tiding [of the birth of Isaac], they [also] said, ‚ÄúBehold, we are about to destroy the people of that land, for its people are truly evildoers!‚Äù
3372: [And when Abraham] exclaimed, ‚ÄúBut Lot lives there!‚Äù - they answered: We know fully well who is there; most certainly we shall save him and his household - all but his wife: she will indeed be among those that stay behind.‚Äù
3373: And when Our messengers came unto Lot, he was sorely grieved on their account, seeing that it was beyond his power to shield them; but they said: ‚ÄúFear not, and grieve not! Behold, we shall save thee and thy household - all but thy wife: she will indeed be among those that stay behind.
3374: Verily, we shall bring down upon the people of this land a horror from heaven in requital of all their iniquitous doings!‚Äù

3376: AND UNTO [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu‚Äôayb who thereupon said: ‚ÄúO my peo¬≠ple! Worship God [alone], and look forward to the Last Day, and do not act wickedly on earth by spreading corruption!‚Äù
3377: But they gave him the lie. Thereupon an earthquake overtook them: and then they lay lifeless, in their very homes, on the ground.
3378: AND [the tribes of] Ad and Thamud [too, did We destroy -] as should have become obvious to you from [whatever there remains of] their dwellings. 3379: And [thus, too, did We deal with] Qarun and Pharaoh, and Haman: to them had come Moses with all evidence of the truth, but they behaved arrogantly on earth [and rejected him]; and withal, they could not escape [Us].
3380: For, every one of them, did We take to task for his sin: and so, upon some of them We let loose a deadly storm wind; and some of them were overtaken by a [sudden] blast; and some of them We caused to be swallowed by the earth: and some of them We caused to drown. 3381: The parable of those who take [beings or forces] other than God for their protectors is that of the spider which makes for itself a house: for, behold, the frailest of all houses is the spiders house. Could they but understand this!
3382: Verily, God knows whatever it is that men invoke instead of Him for He alone is almighty, truly wise.
3383: And so We propound these parables unto man: but none can grasp their innermost meaning save those who [of Us] are aware
3384: [and hence are certain that] God has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an inner] truth: for, behold, in this [very creation] there is a message indeed for all who believe [in Him].
3385: CONVEY [unto others] whatever of this divine writ has been revealed unto thee, and be constant in prayer: for, behold, prayer restrains [man] from loathsome deeds and from all that runs counter to reason; and remembrance of God is indeed the greatest [good]. And God knows all that you do.
3386: And do not argue with the followers of earlier revelation otherwise than in a most kindly manner - unless it be such of them as are bent on evildoing and say: ‚ÄúWe believe in that which has been be¬≠stowed from on high upon us, as well as that which has been bestowed upon you: or our God and your God is one and the same, and it is unto Him that We [all] surrender ourselves.‚Äù
3387: For it is thus that We have bestowed this divine writ from on high upon thee [O Muhammad]. And they to whom we have vouchsafed this divine writ believe in it just as among those [followers of earlier revelation] there are some who believe in it. And none could knowingly reject Our messages unless it be such as would deny [an obvious] truth:
3388: for, [O Muhammad,] thou hast never been able to recite any divine writ ere this one [was revealed], nor didst thou ever transcribe one with your own hand or else, they who try to disprove the truth [of thy revelation] might indeed have had cause to doubt [it].
3389: Nay, but this [divine writ] consists of messages clear to the hearts of all who are gifted with [innate] knowledge and none could knowingly reject Our messages unless it be such as would do wrong [to themselves].
3390: And yet they say, ‚ÄúWhy have no miraculous signs ever been bestowed upon him from on high by his Sustainer?‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúMiracles are in the power of God alone; and as for me - I am but a plain warner.‚Äù
3391: Why - is it not enough for them that We have bestowed this divine writ on thee from on high, to be conveyed [by thee] to them? For, verily, in it is [manifested Our] grace, and a reminder to people who will believe.
3392: Say [unto those who will not believe]: ‚ÄúGod is witness enough between me and you! He knows all that is in the heavens and on earth; and they who are bent on believing in what is false and vain, and thus on denying God - it is they, they who shall be the losers!‚Äù
3393: Now they challenge thee to hasten the coming upon them of [God‚Äôs] chastisement: and indeed, had not a term been set [for it by God], that suffering would already have come upon them! But indeed, it will most certainly come upon them of a sudden, and they will be taken unawares.
3394: They challenge thee to hasten the coming upon them of [God‚Äôs] chastisement: but, verily, hell is bound to encompass all who deny the truth ‚Äì
3395: [encompass them] on the Day when suffering will overwhelm them from above them and from beneath their feet, whereupon He shall say: ‚ÄúTaste [now the fruit of] your own doings!‚Äù
3396: O YOU servants of Mine who have attained to faith! Behold, wide is Mine earth: worship Me, then, Me alone!
3397: Every human being is bound to taste death, [and] in the end unto Us shall all be brought back:
3398: whereupon unto those who have attained to faith and wrought good works We shall most certainly assign mansions in that paradise through which run¬≠ning waters flow, therein to abide: how excellent a reward for those who labour ‚Äì
3399: those who are patient in adversity and in their Sustainer place their trust!
3400: And how many a living creature is there that takes no thought of its own sustenance; [the while] God provides for it as [He provides] for you - since He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing.
3401: And thus it is [with most people]: if thou ask them, ‚ÄúWho is it that has created the heavens and the earth, and made the sun and the moon subservi¬≠ent [to His laws]?‚Äù - they will surely answer, ‚ÄúGod.‚Äù How perverted, then, are their minds!
3402: God grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, to whichever He wills of His crea¬≠tures: for, behold, God has full knowledge of every¬≠thing.
3403: And thus it is: if thou ask them, ‚ÄúWho is it that sends down water from the skies, giving life thereby to the earth after it had been lifeless?‚Äù - they will surely answer, ‚ÄúGod.‚Äù Say thou: ‚Äú[Since this is so,] all praise is due to God [alone]!‚Äù But most of them will not use their reason:
3404: for, [if they did, they would know that] the life of this world is nothing but a passing delight and a play - whereas, behold, the life in the hereafter is indeed the only [true] life: if they but knew this!
3405: And so, when they embark on a ship [and find themselves in danger], they call unto God, [at that moment] sincere in their faith in Him alone; but as soon as He has brought them safe ashore, they [begin to] ascribe to imaginary powers a share in His divinity:
3406: and thus they show utter ingratitude for all that We have vouchsafed them, and go on [thoughtlessly] enjoying their worldly life.
3407: Are they, then, not aware that We have set up a sanctuary secure [for those who believe in Us], the while all around them men are being carried away [by fear and despair]? Will they, then, [continue to] believe in things false and vain, and thus deny God‚Äôs blessings.
3408: And who could be more wicked than he who attributes his own lying inventions to God, or gives the lie to the truth when it comes unto him [through revelation]? Is not hell the [proper] abode for all who [thus] deny the truth?

3412: in the lands close-by; yet it is they who, notwithstanding this their defeat, shall be victorious
3413: within a few years: [for] with God rests all power of decision, first and last. And on that day will the believers [too, have cause to] rejoice

3417: Have they never learned to think for them¬≠selves? God has not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them without [an inner] truth and a term set [by Him]: and yet, behold, there are many people who stubbornly deny the truth that they are destined to meet their Sustainer!
3418: Have they, then, never journeyed about the earth and beheld what happened in the end to those [deniers of the truth] who lived before their time? 3420: GOD CREATES [man] in the first instance, and then brings him forth anew: and, in the end, unto Him you all will be brought back.

3426: EXTOL, then, God‚Äôs limitless glory when you enter upon the evening hours, and when you rise at morn;

3428: He [it is who] brings forth the living out of that which is dead, and brings forth the dead out of that which is alive, and gives life to the earth after it had been lifeless: and even thus will you be brought forth [from death to life]

3431: And among his wonders is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the diversity of your tongues and colours: for in this, behold, there are messages indeed for all who are possessed of [innate] knowledge!

3433: And among His wonders is this: He displays before you the lightning, giving rise to [both] fear and hope, and sends down water from the skies, giving life thereby to the earth after it had been lifeless: in this, behold, there are messages indeed for people who use their reason!
3434: And among His wonders is this: the skies and the earth stand firm at His behest. [Remember all this: for] in the end, when He will call you forth from the earth with a single call - lo! you will [all] emerge [for judgment].
3435: For, unto Him belongs every being that is in the heavens and on earth; all things devoutly obey His will.
3436: And He it is who creates [all life] in the first instance, and then brings it forth anew: and most easy is this for Him, since His is the essence of all that is most sublime in the heavens and on earth, and He alone is almighty, truly wise.
3437: He propounds unto you a parable drawn from your own life: Would you [agree to] have some of those whom your right hands possess as [full-fledged] partners in whatever We may have bestowed upon you as sustenance, so that you [and they] would have equal shares in it, and you would fear [to make use of it without consulting] them, just as you might fear [the more powerful of] your equals? 3438: But nay - they who are bent on evildoing fol¬≠low but their own desires, without having any knowl¬≠edge (of the truth). And who could guide those whom God has [thus] let go astray, and who (thereupon) have none to succour them?
3439: AND SO, set thy face steadfastly towards the [one ever-true] faith, turning away from all that is false, in accordance with the natural disposition which God has instilled into man: [for,] not to allow any change to corrupt what God has thus created this is the [purpose of the one] ever-true faith; but most people know it not.
3440: [Turn, then, away from all that is false,] turn¬≠ing unto Him [alone]; and remain conscious of Him, and be constant in prayer, and be not among those who ascribe divinity to aught beside Him,

3442: NOW [thus it is:] when affliction befalls men, they cry out unto their Sustainer, turning unto Him [for help]; but as soon as He lets them taste of His grace, lo! some of them [begin to] ascribe to other powers a share in their Sustainer‚Äôs divinity,

3449: IT IS GOD who has created you, and then has provided you with sustenance, and then will cause you to die, and then will bring you to life again.
