3455: for among His wonders is this: He sends forth [His messages as He sends forth] the winds that bear glad tidings, so that He might give you a taste of His grace [through life-giving rains], and that ships might sail at His behest, and that you might go about in quest of some of His bounties, and that you might have cause to be grateful.
3456: And indeed, [O Muhammad, even] before thee did We send forth apostles - each one unto his own people and they brought them all evidence of the truth: and then, [by causing the believers to triumph,] We inflicted Our retribution upon those who [de¬≠liberately] did evil: for We had willed it upon Our¬≠selves to succour the believers.
3457: It is God who sends forth the winds [of hope], so that they raise a cloud - whereupon He spreads it over the skies as He wills, and causes it to break up so that thou seest rain issue from within it: and as soon as He causes it to fall upon whomever He wills of His servants - lo! they rejoice,

3459: Behold, then, [O man,] these signs of God‚Äôs grace - how He gives life to the earth after it had been lifeless! Verily, this Selfsame [God] is indeed the One that can bring the dead back to life: for He has the power to will anything!

3461: And, verily, thou canst not make the dead hear: and [so, too,] thou canst not make the deaf [of heart] hear this call when they turn their backs [on thee] and go away,

3463: IT IS GOD who creates you [all in a states of weak¬≠ness, and then, after weakness, ordains strength [for you], and then, after [a period of] strength, ordains [old-age] weakness and grey hair. He creates what He wills; and He alone is all-knowing, infinite in His power.
3464: [He it is who will cause you to die, and in time will resurrect you.] And when the Last Hour dawns, those who had been lost in sin will swear that they had not tarried [on earth] longer than an hour: thus were they wont to delude themselves [all their lives]!
3465: But those who [in their lifetime] were endowed with knowledge and faith will say: ‚ÄúIndeed, you have been tardy in [accepting as true] what God has revealed, [and you have waited] until the Day of Resurrection: this, then, is the Day of Resurrection: but you - you were determined not to know it!

3467: AND, INDEED, We have propounded unto men all kinds of parables in this Qur‚Äôan. But thus it is: if thou approach them with any [such] message, those who are bent on denying the truth are sure to say, ‚ÄúYou are but making false claims!‚Äù

3469: Remain, then, patient in adversity: verily, Gods promise [of resurrection] is true indeed - so let not those who are devoid of all inner certainty disquiet thy mind!
3471: THESE ARE MESSAGES of the divine writ, full of wisdom,
3472: providing guidance and grace unto the doers of good
3473: who are constant in prayer and dispense charity: for it is they, they who in their innermost are certain of the life to come!
3474: It is they who follow the guidance [that comes to them] from their Sustainer; and it is they, they who shall attain to a happy state!
3475: But among men there is many a one that prefers a mere play with words [to divine guidance], so as to lead [those] without knowledge astray from the path of God, and to turn it to ridicule: for such there is shameful suffering in store.

3479: He [it is who] has created the skies without any supports that you could see, and has placed firm mountains upon the earth, lest it sway with you, and has caused all manner of living creatures to multiply thereon. 3480: [All] this is God‚Äôs creation: show Me, then, what others than He may have created! Nay, but the evildoers are obviously lost in error!

3483: ‚ÄúAnd [God says:] ‚ÄòWe have enjoined upon man goodness towards his parents: his mother bore him by bearing strain upon strain, and his utter dependence on her lasted two years: [hence, O man,] be grateful towards Me and towards thy parents, [and remember that] with Me is all journeys‚Äô end.
3484: ‚Äú‚Äò[Revere thy parents;] yet should they endeavour to make thee ascribe divinity, side by side with Me, to something which thy mind cannot accept [as divine], obey them not; but [even then] bear them company in this world‚Äôs life with kindness, and follow the path of those who turn towards Me. 3485: ‚ÄúO my dear son,‚Äù [continued Luqman,] ‚Äúverily, if there be but the weight of a mustard-seed, and though it be [hidden] in a rock, or in the skies, or in the earth, God will bring it to light: for, behold, God is unfathomable [in His wisdom], all-aware
3486: ‚ÄúO my dear son! Be constant in prayer, and enjoin the doing of what is right and forbid the doing of what is wrong, and bear in patience whatever [ill] may befall thee: this, behold, is something to set one‚Äôs heart upon!
3487: ‚ÄúAnd turn not thy cheek away from people in [false] pride, and walk not haughtily on earth: for, behold, God does not love anyone who, out of self- conceit, acts in a boastful manner.
3488: ‚ÄúHence, be modest in thy bearing, and lower thy voice: for, behold, the ugliest of all voices is the [loud] voice of asses‚Ä¶‚Äù
3489: ARE YOU NOT aware that God has made subservient to you all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth, and has lavished upon you His blessings, both outward and inward? And yet, among men there is many a one that argues about God without having any knowledge [of Him], without any guidance, and without any light-giving revelation;
3490: and when such [people] are told to follow that which God has bestowed from on high, they answer, ‚ÄúNay, we shall follow that which we found our forefathers believing in and doing!‚Äù Why - [would you follow your forefathers] even if Satan had invited them unto the suffering of the blazing flame?
3491: Now whoever surrenders his whole being unto God, and is a doer of good withal, has indeed taken hold of a support most unfailing: for with God rests the final outcome of all events.
3492: But as for him who is bent on denying the truth - let not his denial grieve thee: unto Us they must return, and then We shall make them [truly] understand all that they were doing [in life]: for, verily, God has full knowledge of what is in the hearts [of men].
3493: We will let them enjoy them¬≠selves for a short while - but in the end We shall drive them into suffering severe.
3494: AND THUS it is [with most people]: if thou ask them, ‚ÄúWho is it that has created the heavens and the earth?‚Äù - they will surely answer, ‚ÄúGod.‚Äù Say: ‚Äú[Then you ought to know that] all praise is due to God!‚Äù- for most of them do not know [what this implies].
3495: Unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth. Verily, God alone is self-sufficient, the One to whom all praise is due!
3496: And if all the trees on earth were pens, and the sea [were] ink, with seven [morel seas yet added to it, the words of God would not be exhausted: for, verily, God is almighty, wise.
3497: [For Him,] the creation of you all and the resurrection of you all is but like [the creation and resurrection of] a single soul: for, verily, God is all-hearing, all-seeing.
3498: Art thou not aware that it is God who makes the night grow longer by shortening the day, and makes the day grow longer by shortening the night, and that He has made the sun and the moon subservient [to His laws], each running its course for a term set [by Him] and that God is fully aware of all that you do?
3499: Thus it is, because God alone is the Ultimate Truth, so that all that men invoke instead of Him is sheer falsehood; and because God alone is exalted, truly great!
3500: Art thou not aware how the ships speed through the sea by God‚Äôs favour, so that He might show you some of His wonders? Herein, behold, there are messages indeed for all who are wholly patient in adversity and deeply grate¬≠ful [to God].
3501: For [thus it is with most men:] when the waves engulf them like shadows [of death], they call unto God, sincere [at that moment] in their faith in Him alone: but as soon as He has brought them safe ashore, some of them stop half-way [between belief and unbelief] Yet none could knowingly reject Our messages unless he be utterly perfidious, ingrate.
3502: O MEN! Be conscious of your Sustainer, and stand in awe of the Day on which no parent will be of any avail to his child, nor a child will in the least avail his parent! Verily, God‚Äôs promise [of resurrection] is true in¬≠deed: let not, then, the life of this world deludes you, and let not [your own] deceptive thoughts about God delude you!
3503: Verily, with God alone rests the knowledge of when the Last Hour will come: and He [it is who] sends down rain; and He [alone] knows what is in the wombs: whereas no one knows what he will reap tomorrow, and no one knows in what land he will die, Verily. God [alone] is all-knowing, all-aware.
3505: The bestowal from on high of this divine writ issues, beyond any doubt, from the Sustainer of all the worlds:
3506: and yet, they [who are bent on denying the truth] assert, ‚Äú[Muhammad] has invented it!‚Äù Nay, but it is the truth from thy Sustainer, enabling thee to warn [this] people to whom no warner has come before thee, so that they might follow the right path.
3507: IT IS GOD who has created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six aeons, and is established on the throne of His almightiness. You have none to protect you from God, and none to intercede for you [on Judgment Day]: will you not, then, bethink yourselves?
3508: He governs all that exists, from the celestial space to the earth; and in the end all shall ascend unto Him [for judgment] on a Day the length whereof will be [like] a thousand years of your reckoning.
3509: Such is He who knows all that is beyond the reach of a created being‚Äôs perception, as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature‚Äôs senses or mind: the Almighty, the Dispenser of Grace,
3510: who makes most excellent everything that He creates. Thus, He begins the creation of man out of clay;
3511: then He causes him to be begotten out of the essence of a humble fluid;
3512: and then He forms him in accordance with what he is meant to be, and breathes into him of His spirit: and [thus, O men,] He endows you with hearing, and sight, and feelings as well as minds: [yet] how seldom are you grateful!
3513: For, [many are] they [who] say, ‚ÄúWhat! After we have been [dead and] lost in the earth, shall we indeed be [restored to life] in a new act of crea¬≠tion?‚Äù Nay, but [by saying this] they deny the truth that they are destined to meet their Sustainer!
3514: Say: ‚Äú[One day,] the angel of death who has been given charge of you will gather you, and then unto your Sustainer you will be brought back.‚Äù
3515: If thou couldst but see [how it will be on Judgment Day], when those who are lost in sin will hang their heads before their Sustainer, [saying:] ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! [Now] we have seen, and we have heard! Return us, then, [to our earthly life] that we may do good deeds: for [now], behold, we are certain [of the truth]!‚Äù
3516: Yet had We so willed, We could indeed have imposed Our guidance upon every human being: but [We have not willed it thus - and so] that word of Mine has come true: ‚ÄúMost certainly will I fill hell with invisible beings as well as with humans, all together!‚Äù
3517: [And He will say unto the sinners:] ‚ÄúTaste, then, [the recompense] for your having been obli¬≠vious of the coming of this your Day [of Judgment] - for, verily, We are [now] oblivious of you: taste, then, [this] abiding suffering for all [the evil] that you were wont to do!‚Äù
3518: ONLY THEY [truly] believe in Our messages who, whenever they are conveyed to them, fall down, prostrating themselves in adoration, and extol their Sustainer‚Äôs limitless glory and praise; and who are never filled with false pride;
3519: [and] who are im¬≠pelled to rise from their beds [at night] to call out to their Sustainer in fear and hope; and who spend on others out of what We provide for them as sus¬≠tenance.
3520: And [as for all such believers,] no human being can imagine what blissful delights, as yet hidden, await them [in the life to come] as a reward for all that they did.
3521: Is, then, he who [in his earthly life] was a believer to be compared with one who was in¬≠iquitous? [Nay,] these two are not equal!
3522: As for those who attain to faith and do right¬≠eous deeds - gardens of rest await them, as a wel¬≠come [from God], in result of what they did;
3523: but as for those who are lost in iniquity - their goal is the fire: as oft as they will try to come out of it, they will be thrown back into it; and they will be told, ‚ÄúTaste [now] this suffering through fire which you were wont to call a lie!‚Äù
3524: However, ere [We condemn them to] that supreme suffering, We shall most certainly let them taste of a suffering closer at hand, so that they might [repent and] mend their ways.
3525: And who could be more wicked than he to whom his Sustainer‚Äôs messages are conveyed and who thereupon turns away from them? Verily, We shall inflict Our retribution on those who are [thus] lost in sin!
3526: AND, INDEED, [O Muhammad,] We did vouchsafe revelation unto Moses [as well]: so be not in doubt of [thy] having met with the same [truth in the revelation vouchsafed to thee]. And [just as] We caused that [earlier revelation] to be a guidance for the children of Israel,
3527: and [as] We raised among them leaders who, so long as they bore themselves with patience and had sure faith in Our messages, guided [their people] in accordance with Our behest [so, too, shall it be with the divine writ revealed unto thee, O Muhammad.]
3528: VERILY, it is God alone who will decide between men on Resurrection Day with regard to all on which they were wont to differ.
3529: [But] can, then, they [who deny the truth] learn no lesson by recalling how many a generation We have destroyed before their time? [people] in whose dwelling-places they [themselves now] walk about? In this, behold, there are messages indeed: will they not, then, listen?
3530: Are they not aware that it is We who drive the rain onto dry land devoid of herbage, and thereby bring forth herbage of which their cattle and they themselves do eat? Can they not, then, see [the truth of resurrection]?
3531: But they answer: ‚ÄúWhen will that final decision take place, if what you [believers] say is true?‚Äù
3532: Say: ‚ÄúOn the Day of the Final Decision, their [newly-found] faith will be of no use to those who [in their lifetime] were bent on denying the truth, nor will they be granted respite!‚Äù ‚Äì
3533: and then leave them alone, and wait [for the truth to unfold as] they, behold, are waiting.
3534: PROPHET! Remain conscious of God, and defer not to the deniers of the truth and the hypo¬≠crites: for God is truly all-knowing, wise.
3535: And follow [but] that which comes unto thee through revelation from thy Sustainer: for God is truly aware of all that you do, [O men].
3536: And place thy trust in God [alone]: for none is as worthy of trust as God.
3537: NEVER has God endowed any man with two hearts in one body: and [just as] He has never made your wives whom you may have declared to be ‚Äúas unlawful to you as your mothers‚Äô bodies‚Äù [truly] your mothers, so, too, has He never made your adopted sons [truly] your sons: these are but [figures of] speech uttered by your mouths - whereas God speaks the [absolute] truth: and it is He alone who can show [you] the right path.
3538: [As for your adopted children,] call them by their [real] fathers‚Äô names: this is more equitable in the sight of God; and if you know not who their fathers were, [call them] your brethren in faith and your friends. However, you will incur no sin if you err in this respect: [what really matters is] but what your hearts intend - for God is indeed much-forgiv¬≠ing, a dispenser of grace!
3539: The Prophet has a higher claim on the believers than [they have on] their own selves, [seeing that he is as a father to them] and his wives are their mothers: and they who are [thus] closely related have, in accordance with God‚Äôs decree, a higher claim upon one another than [was even the case between] the believers [of Yathrib] and those who had migrated [there for the sake of God]. None the less, you are to act with utmost goodness towards your [other] close friends as well: this [too] is written down in God‚Äôs decree.
3540: AND LO! We did accept a solemn pledge from all the prophets from thee, [O Muhammad,] as well as from Noah, and Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary -: for We accepted a most weighty, solemn pledge from [all of] them,
3541: so that [at the end of time] He might ask those men of truth as to [what response] their truthfulness [had received on earth]. And grievous suffering has He readied for all who deny the truth!
3542: O YOU who have attained to faith! Call to mind the blessings which God bestowed on you (at the time) when [enemy] hosts came down upon you, where¬≠upon We let loose against them a storm wind and [heavenly] hosts that you could not see: yet God saw all that you did.
3543: [Remember what you felt] when they came upon you from above you and from below you, and when [your] eyes became dim and [your] hearts came up to [your] throats, and [when] most conflicting thoughts about God passed through your minds:
3544: [for] there and then were the believers tried, and shaken with a shock severe.
3545: And [remember how it was] when the hypo¬≠crites and those with hearts diseased said [to one another], ‚ÄúGod and His Apostle have promised us nothing but delusions!‚Äù
3546: and when some of them said, ‚ÄúO you people of Yathrib! You cannot withstand [the enemy] here: hence, go back [to your homes]!‚Äù ‚Äî Whereupon a party from among them asked leave of the Prophet, saying, ‚ÄúBehold, our houses are exposed [to attack]!‚Äù ‚Äî The while they were not [really] exposed: they wanted nothing but to flee.
3547: Now if their town had been stormed, and they had been asked [by the enemy] to commit apos¬≠tasy, [the hypocrites] would have done so without much delay
3548: although ere that they had vowed before God that they would never turn their backs [on His message]: and a vow made to God must surely be answered for!
3549: Say: ‚ÄúWhether you flee from [natural] death or from being slain [in battle], flight will not profit you - for, however you fare, you are not [allowed] to enjoy life for more than a little while!‚Äù
3550: Say: ‚ÄúWho is there that could keep you away from God if it be His will to harm you, or if it be His will to show you mercy?‚Äù For, [do they not know that] besides God they can find none to protect them, and none to bring them succour?
3551: God is indeed aware of those of you who would divert others [from fighting in His cause], as well as of those who say to their brethren, ‚ÄúCome hither to us [and face the enemy]!‚Äù ‚Äî The while they [themselves] join battle but seldom,
3552: begrudging you all help. But then, when danger threatens, thou canst see them looking to thee [for help, O Prophet], their eyes rolling [in terror] like [the eyes of] one who is overshadowed by death: yet as soon as the danger has passed, they will assail you [believers] with sharp tongues, begrudging you all that is good! [People like] these have never known faith - and therefore God will cause all their works to come to nought: for this is indeed easy for God.
3553: They think that the Confederates have not [really] withdrawn; and should the Confederates return, these [hypocrites] would prefer to be in the desert, among the bedouin, asking for news about you, [O believers, from far away;] and even were they to find themselves in your midst, they would but make a pretence at fighting [by your side].
3554: VERILY, in the Apostle of God you have a good example for everyone who looks forward [with hope and awe] to God and the Last Day, and remembers God unceasingly.
3555: And [so,] when the believers saw the Con¬≠federates [advancing against them], they said, ‚ÄúThis is what God and His Apostle have promised us!‚Äù- and, ‚ÄúTruly spoke God and His Apostle!‚Äù and all this but increased their faith and their readiness to surrender themselves unto God.
3556: Among the believers are men who have [always] been true to what they have vowed before God; and among them are such as have [already] redeemed their pledge by death, and such as yet await [its fulfillment] without having changed [their resolve] in the least.
3557: [Such trials are imposed upon man] so that God may reward the truthful for having been true to their word, and cause the hypocrites to suffer - if that be His will - or [if they repent,] accept their repen¬≠tance: for, verily, God is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
3558: Thus, for all their fury, God repulsed those who were bent on denying the truth; no advantage did they gain, since God was enough to [protect] the believers in battle - seeing that God is most powerful, almighty;
3559: and He brought down from their strongholds those of the followers of earlier reve¬≠lation who had aided the aggressors, and cast terror into their hearts: some you slew, and some you made captive;
3560: and He made you heirs to their lands, and their houses, and their goods - and [promised you] lands on which you had never yet set foot: for God has indeed the power to will anything.
3561: O PROPHET! Say unto thy wives: ‚ÄúIf you desire [but] the life of this world and its charms - well, then, I shall provide for you and release you in a becoming manner;
3562: but if you desire God and His Apostle, and [thus the good of] the life in the hereafter, then [know that], verily, for the doers of good among you God has readied a mighty reward!‚Äù
3563: O wives of the Prophet! If any of you were to become guilty of manifestly immoral conduct, double [that of other sinners] would be her suffering [in the hereafter]: for that is indeed easy for God.
3564: But if any of you devoutly obeys God and His Apostle and does good deeds, on her shall We bestow her reward twice-over: for We shall have readied for her a most excellent sustenance [in the life to come].
3565: O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any of the [other] women, provided that you remain [truly] conscious of God. Hence, be not over-soft in your speech, lest any whose heart is diseased should be moved to desire [you]: but, withal, speak in a kindly way.
3566: And abide quietly in your homes, and do not flaunt your charms as they used to flaunt them in the old days of pagan ignorance; and be constant in prayer, and render the purifying dues, and pay heed unto God and His Apostle: for God only wants to remove from you all that might be loathsome, O you members of the [Prophet‚Äôs] household, and to purify you to utmost purity.
3567: And bear in mind all that is recited in your homes of God‚Äôs messages and [His] wisdom: for God is unfathomable [in His wisdom], all-aware.
3568: VERILY, for all men and women who have sur¬≠rendered themselves unto God, and all believing men and believing women, and all truly devout men and truly devout women, and all men and women who are true to their word, and all men and women who are patient in adversity, and all men and women who humble themselves [before God], and all men and women who give in charity, and all self-denying men and self-denying women, and all men and women who are mindful of their chastity, and all men and women who remember God unceasingly: for [all of] them has God readied forgiveness of sins and a mighty reward.
3569: Now whenever God and His Apostle have decided a matter, it is not for a believing man or a believing woman to claim freedom of choice insofar as they themselves are concerned: for he who [thus] rebels against God and His Apostle has already, most obviously, gone astray.
3570: AND LO, [O Muhammad,] thou didst say unto the one to whom God had shown favour and to whom thou hadst shown favour, ‚ÄúHold on to thy wife, and remain conscious of God!‚Äù And [thus] wouldst thou hide within thyself something that God was about to bring to light for thou didst stand in awe of [what] people [might think], whereas it was God alone of whom thou shouldst have stood in awe! [But] then, when Zayd had come to the end of his union with her, We gave her to thee in marriage, so that [in future] no blame should attach to the be¬≠lievers for [marrying] the spouses of their adopted children when the latter have come to the end of their union with them. And [thus] God‚Äôs will was done.
3571: [Hence,] no blame whatever attaches to the Prophet for [having done] what God has ordained for him. [Indeed, such was] God‚Äôs way with those that have passed away aforetime and [remember that] God‚Äôs will is always destiny absolute-;
3572: [and such will always be His way with] those who convey God‚Äôs messages [to the world], and stand in awe of Him, and hold none but God in awe: for none can take count [of man‚Äôs doings] as God does!
3573: [And know, O believers, that] Muhammad is not the father of any one of your men, but is God‚Äôs Apostle and the Seal of all Prophets. And God has indeed full knowledge of everything.
3574: O YOU who have attained to faith! Remember God with unceasing remembrance,
3575: and extol His limitless glory from morn to evening.
3576: He it is who bestows His blessings upon you, with His angels [echoing Him], so that He might take you out of the depths of darkness into the light. And, indeed, a dispenser of grace is He unto the believers.
3577: On the Day when they meet Him, they will be welcomed with the greeting, ‚ÄúPeace‚Äù; and He will have readied for them a most excellent reward.
3578: [And as for thee,] O Prophet - behold, We have sent thee as a witness [to the truth], and as a herald of glad tidings and a warner,
3579: and as one who summons [all men] to God by His leave, and as a light-giving beacon.
3580: And [so,] convey to the believers the glad tiding that a great bounty from God awaits them;
3581: and defer not to [the likes and dislikes of] the deniers of the truth and the hypocrites, and disregard their hurtful talk, and place thy trust in God: for none is as worthy of trust as God.
3582: O YOU who have attained to faith! If you marry believing women and then divorce them ere you have touched them, you have no reason to expect, and to calculate, any waiting period on their part: hence, make [at once] provision for them, and release them in a becoming manner.
3583: O PROPHET! Behold, We have made lawful to thee thy wives unto whom thou hast paid their dowers, as well as those whom thy right hand has come to possess from among the captives of war whom God has bestowed upon thee. And [We have made lawful to thee] the daughters of thy paternal uncles and aunts, and the daughters of thy maternal uncles and aunts, who have migrated with thee [to Yathrib]; and any believing woman who offers herself freely to the Prophet and whom the Prophet might be willing to wed: [this latter being but] a privilege for thee, and not for other believers - [seeing that] We have already made known what We have enjoined upon them with regard to their wives and those whom their right hands may possess. [And] in order that thou be not burdened with [undue] anxiety - for God is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace ‚Äì
3584: [know that] thou mayest put off for a time whichever of them thou pleasest, and mayest take unto thee whichever thou pleasest; and [that,] if thou seek out any from whom thou hast kept away [for a time], thou wilt incur no sin [thereby]: this will make it more likely that their eyes are gladdened [whenever they see thee], and that they do not grieve [whenever they are overlooked], and that all of them may find contentment in whatever thou hast to give them: for God [alone] knows what is in your hearts - and God is indeed all-knowing, for¬≠bearing.
3585: No [other] women shall henceforth be lawful to thee nor art thou [allowed] to supplant [any of] them by other wives, even though their beauty should please thee greatly -: [none shall be lawful to thee] beyond those whom thou [already] hast come to possess. And God keeps watch over everything.
3586: O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not enter the Prophet‚Äôs dwellings unless you are given leave; [and when invited] to a meal, do not come [so early as] to wait for it to be readied: but whenever you are invited, enter [at the proper time]; and when you have partaken of the meal, disperse without lingering for the sake of mere talk: that, behold, might give offence to the Prophet, and yet he might feel shy of [asking] you [to leave]: but God is not shy of [teaching you] what is right. And [as for the Prophet‚Äôs wives,] whenever you ask them for anything that you need, ask them from behind a screen: this will but deepen the purity of your hearts and theirs. Moreover, it does not behove you to give offence to God‚Äôs Apostle - just as it would not behove you ever to marry his widows after he has passed away: that, verily, would be an enormity in the sight of God.
3587: Whether you do anything openly or in secret, [remember that,] verily, God has full knowledge of everything.
3588: [However,] it is no sin for them [to appear freely] before their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their brothers‚Äô sons, or their sisters‚Äô sons, or their womenfolk, or such [male slaves] as their right hands may possess. But [always, O wives of the Prophet,] remain con¬≠scious of God - for, behold, God is witness unto everything.
3589: Verily, God and His angels bless the Prophet: [hence,] O you who have attained to faith, bless him and give yourselves up [to his guidance] in utter self-surrender!
3590: Verily, as for those who [knowingly] affront God and His Apostle - God will reject them in this world and in the life to come; and shameful suffering will He ready for them.
3591: And as for those who malign believing men and believing women without their having done any wrong - they surely burden themselves with the guilt of calumny, and [thus] with a flagrant sin!
3592: O Prophet! Tell thy wives and thy daughters, as well as all [other] believing women, that they should draw over themselves some of their outer garments [when in public]: this will be more con¬≠ducive to their being recognized [as decent women] and not annoyed. But [withal,] God is indeed much- forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
3593: THUS IT IS: if the hypocrites, and they in whose hearts is disease, and they who, by spreading false rumours, would cause disturbances in the City [of the Prophet] desist not [from their hostile doings]. We shall indeed give thee mastery over them, [O Muhammad] - and then they will not remain thy neighbours in this [city] for more than a little while:
3594: bereft of God‚Äôs grace, they shall be seized wherever they may be found, and slain one and all.
3595: Such has been God‚Äôs way with those who [sinned in like manner and] passed away aforetime - and never wilt thou find any change in God‚Äôs way!
3596: PEOPLE will ask thee about the Last Hour. Say: ‚ÄúKnowledge thereof rests with God alone; yet for all thou knowest, the Last Hour may well be near!‚Äù
3597: Verily, God has rejected the deniers of the truth, and has readied for them a blazing fire,
3598: therein to abide beyond the count of time: no protec¬≠tor will they find, and none to bring them succour.
3599: On the Day when their faces shall be tossed about in the fire, they will exclaim, ‚ÄúOh, would that we had paid heed unto God, and paid heed unto the Apostle!‚Äù
3600: And they will say: ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! Behold, we paid heed unto our leaders and our great men, and it is they who have led us astray from the right path!
3601: O our Sustainer! Give them double suffering, and banish them utterly from Thy grace!‚Äù
3602: O YOU who have attained to faith! Be not like those [children of Israel] who gave offence to Moses, and [remember that] God showed him to be innocent of whatever they alleged [against him or demanded of him]: for of great honour was he in the sight of God.
3603: O you who have attained to faith! Remain conscious of God, and [always] speak with a will to bring out [only] what is just and true -
3604: [whereupon] He will cause your deeds to be virtuous, and will forgive you your sins. And [know that] whoever pays heed unto God and His Apostle has already attained to a mighty triumph.
3605: Verily, We did offer the trust [of reason and volition] to the heavens, and the earth, and the mountains: but they refused to bear it because they were afraid of it. Yet man took it up - for, verily, he has always been prone to be most wicked, most foolish.
3606: [And so it is] that God imposes suffering on the hypocrites, both men and women, as well as on the men and women who ascribe divinity to aught beside Him. And [so, too, it is] that God turns in His mercy unto the believing men and believing women: for God is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
3607: ALL PRAISE is due to God, to whom all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth belongs; and to Him will be due all praise in the life to come. For He alone is truly wise, all-aware:
3608: He knows all that enters the earth, and all that comes out of it, as well as all that descends from the skies, and all that ascends to them. And He alone is a dispenser of grace, truly-forgiving.
3609: And yet, they who are bent on denying the truth assert, ‚ÄúNever will the Last Hour come upon us!‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúNay, by my Sustainer! By Him who knows all that is beyond the reach of a created being‚Äôs perception: it will most certainly come upon you!‚Äù Not an atom‚Äôs weight [of whatever there is] in the heavens or on earth escapes His knowledge; and neither is there anything smaller than that, or larger, but is recorded in [His] clear decree,
3610: to the end that He may reward those who believe and do right¬≠eous deeds: [for] it is they whom forgiveness of sins awaits, and a most excellent sustenance
3611: whereas for those who strive against Our messages, seeking to defeat their purpose, there is grievous suffering in store as an outcome of [their] vileness.
3612: NOW THEY who are endowed with [innate] knowl¬≠edge are well aware that whatever has been be¬≠stowed upon thee from on high by thy Sustainer is indeed the truth, and that it guides onto the way that leads to the Almighty, the One to whom all praise is due!
3613: As against this, they who are bent on denying the truth say [unto all who are of like mind]: ‚ÄúShall we point out to you a man who will tell you that [after your death,] when you will have been scattered in countless fragments, you shall - lo and behold! - be [restored to life] in a new act of creation?
3614: Does he [knowingly] attribute his own lying inventions to God - or is he a madman?‚Äù Nay, [there is no madness in this Prophet -] but they who will not believe in the life to come are [bound to lose themselves] in suffering and in a profound aberration.
3615: Are they, then, not aware of how little of the sky and the earth lies open before them, and how much is hidden from them? [or that,] if We so willed, We could cause the earth to swallow them, or cause fragments of the sky to fall down upon them? In all this, behold, there is a message indeed for every servant [of God] who is wont to turn unto Him [in repentance].
3616: AND [thus], indeed, did We grace David with Our favour: ‚ÄúO you mountains! Sing with him the praise of God! And [likewise] you birds!‚Äù And We softened all sharpness in him,
3617: [and inspired him thus:] ‚ÄúDo good deeds lavishly, without stint, and give deep thought to their steady flow.‚Äù And [thus should you all, O believers,] do righteous deeds: for, verily, I see all that you do!
3618: AND UNTO Solomon [We made subservient] the wind: its morning course [covered the distance of] a month‚Äôs journey, and its evening course, a month‚Äôs journey. And We caused a fountain of molten copper to flow at his behest; and [even] among the invisible beings there were some that had [been constrained] to labour for him by his Sustainer‚Äôs leave and whichever of them deviated from Our command, him would We let taste suffering through a blazing flame -:
3619: they made for him whatever he wished of sanctuaries, and statues, and basins as [large as] great watering - troughs, and cauldrons firmly anchored. [And We said:] ‚ÄúLabour, O David‚Äôs people, in gratitude [towards Me] and [remember that] few are the truly grateful [even] among My servants!‚Äù
3620: Yet [even Solomon had to die; but] when We decreed that he should die, nothing showed them that he was dead except an earthworm that gnawed away his staff. And when he fell to the ground, those invisible beings [subservient to him] saw clearly that, had they but understood the reality which was be¬≠yond the reach of their perception, they would not have continued [to toil] in the shameful suffering [of servitude]
3621: INDEED, in [the luxuriant beauty of] their homeland, the people of Sheba had an evidence [of God‚Äôs grace] two [vast expanses of] gardens, to the right and to the left, [calling out to them, as it were:] ‚ÄúEat of what your Sustainer has provided for you, and render thanks unto Him: a land most goodly, and a Sustainer much-forgiving!‚Äù
3622: But they turned away [from Us], and so We let loose upon them a flood that overwhelmed the dams, and changed their two [expanses of luxuriant] gardens into a couple of gardens yielding bitter fruit, and tamarisks, and some few [wild] lote-trees:
3623: thus We requited them for their having denied the truth. But do We ever requite [thus] any but the utterly ingrate?
3624: Now [before their downfall,] We had placed between them and the cities which We had blessed [many] towns within sight of one another; and thus We had made traveling easy [for them, as if to say]: ‚ÄúTravel safely in this [land], by night or by day!‚Äù
3625: But now they would say, ‚ÄúLong has our Sus¬≠tainer made the distance between our journey- stages!‚Äù - for they had sinned against themselves. And in the end We caused them to become [one of those] tales [of things long past], and scattered them in countless fragments. Herein, behold, there are messages indeed for all who are wholly patient in adversity and deeply grate¬≠ful [to God].
3626: Now, indeed, Iblis did prove that his opinion of them had been right: for [when he called them,] they followed him - all but some of the believers [among them].
3627: And yet, he had no power at all over them: [for if We allow him to tempt man,] it is only to the end that We might make a clear distinction between those who [truly] believe in the life to come and those who are in doubt thereof: for thy Sustainer watches over all things.
3628: SAY: ‚ÄúCall upon those [beings] whom you imagine [to be endowed with divine powers] beside God: they have not an atom‚Äôs weight of power either in the heavens or on earth, nor have they any share in [governing] either, nor does He [choose to] have any helper from among them.‚Äù
3629: And, before Him, intercession can be of no avail [to any] save one in whose case He may have granted leave [there for]: so much so that when the terror [of the Last Hour] is lifted from their hearts, they [who have been resurrected] will ask [one an¬≠other], ‚ÄúWhat has your Sustainer decreed [for you]?‚Äù - [to which] the others will answer, ‚ÄúWhatever is true and deserved - for He alone is exalted, great!‚Äù
3630: Say: ‚ÄúWho is it that provides for you sus¬≠tenance out of the heavens and the earth?‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúIt is God. And, behold, either we [who believe in Him] or you [who deny His oneness] are on the right path, or have clearly gone astray!‚Äù
3631: Say: ‚ÄúNeither shall you be called to account for whatever we may have become guilty of, nor shall we be called to account for whatever you are doing.‚Äù
3632: Say: ‚ÄúOur Sustainer will bring us all together [on Judgment Day], and then He will lay open the truth between us, in justice - for He alone is the One who opens all truth, the All-Knowing!‚Äù
3633: Say: ‚ÄúPoint out to me those [beings] that you have joined with Him [in your minds] as partners [in His divinity]! Nay - nay, but He [alone] is God, the Almighty, the Wise!‚Äù
3634: NOW [as for thee, O Muhammad,] We have not sent thee otherwise than to mankind at large, to be a herald of glad tidings and a warner; but most people do not understand [this],
3635: and so they ask, ‚ÄúWhen is this promise [of resurrection and judgment] to be fulfilled? [Answer this, O you who believe in it,] if you are men of truth!‚Äù
3636: Say: ‚ÄúThere has been appointed for you a Day, which you can neither delay nor advance by a single moment.‚Äù
3637: And [yet,] those who are bent on denying the truth do say, ‚ÄúWe shall never believe in this Qur‚Äôan, and neither in whatever there still remains of earlier revelations!‚Äù But if thou couldst only see [how it will be on Judgment Day,] when these evildoers shall be made to stand before their Sustainer, hurling reproaches back and forth at one another! Those [of them] who had been weak [on earth] will say unto those who had gloried in their arrogance: ‚ÄúHad it not been for you, we would certainly have been believers!‚Äù
3638: [And] those who were wont to glory in their arrogance will say unto those who had been weak: ‚ÄúWhy - did we keep you [forcibly] from following the right path after it had become obvious to you? Nay, it was but you [yourselves] who were guilty!‚Äù
3639: But those who had been weak will say unto those who had gloried in their arrogance: ‚ÄúNay, [what kept us away was your] devising of false arguments, night and day, [against God‚Äôs messages- as you did] when you persuaded us to blaspheme against God and to claim that there are powers that could rival Him!‚Äù And when they see the suffering [that awaits them], they will [all] be unable to express [the full depth of] their remorse: for We shall have put shackles around the necks of those who had been bent on denying the truth: [and] will this be aught but a [just] requital for what they were doing?
3640: For [thus it is:] whenever We sent a warner to any community, those of its people who had lost themselves entirely in the pursuit of pleasures would declare, ‚ÄúBehold, we deny that there is any truth in [what you claim to be] your message!‚Äù ‚Äì
3641: and they would add, ‚ÄúRicher [than you] are we in wealth and in children, and [so] we are not going to be made to suffer!‚Äù
3642: Say: ‚ÄúBehold, my Sustainer grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, unto whomever He wills: but most men do not understand [God‚Äôs ways].‚Äù
3643: For, it is neither your riches nor your children that can bring you nearer to Us: only he who attains to faith and does what is right and just [comes near unto Us]; and it is [such as] these whom multiple recompense awaits for all that they have done; and it is they who shall dwell secure in the mansions [of paradise] ‚Äì
3644: whereas all who strive against Our messages, seeking to defeat their purpose, shall be given over to suffering.
3645: Say: ‚ÄúBehold, my Sustainer grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, unto whomever He wills of His servants; and whatever it be that you spend on others, He [always] replaces it: for He is the best of providers.‚Äù
3646: And [as for those who now deny the truth,] one Day He will gather them all together, and will ask the angels, ‚ÄúWas it you that they were wont to worship?‚Äù
3647: They will answer: ‚ÄúLimitless art Thou in Thy glory! Thou [alone] art close unto us, not they! Nay, [when they thought that they were worshipping us,] they were but [blindly] worshipping forces concealed from their senses; most of them believed in them.‚Äù
3648: And [on that Day God will say]: ‚ÄúNone of you [created beings] has today any power to benefit or to harm another!‚Äù And [then] We shall say unto those who had been bent on evildoing: ‚ÄúTaste [now] that suffering through fire which you were wont to call a lie!‚Äù
3649: For [thus it is:] whenever Our messages are conveyed unto them in all their clarity, they [who are bent on denying the truth] say [to one another], ‚ÄúThis [Muhammad] is nothing but a man who wants to turn you away from what your forefathers were wont to worship!‚Äù And they say, ‚ÄúThis [Qur‚Äôan] is nothing but a falsehood invented [by man]!‚Äù And [finally,] they who are bent on denying the truth speak thus of the truth when it comes to them: ‚ÄúThis is clearly nothing but spellbinding eloquence!‚Äù
3650: And yet, [O Muhammad,] never have We vouchsafed them any revelations which they could quote, and neither have We sent unto them any warner before thee.
3651: Thus, too, gave the lie to the truth [many of] those who lived before them; and although those [earlier people] had not attained to even a tenth of [the evidence of the truth] which We have vouch¬≠safed unto these [late successors of theirs], yet when they gave the lie to My apostles, how awesome was My rejection!
3652: Say: ‚ÄúI counsel you one thing only: Be [ever¬≠ conscious of] standing before God, whether you are in the company of others or alone; and then bethink yourselves [that] there is no madness in [this pro¬≠phet,] your fellow-man: he is only a warner to you of suffering severe to come.‚Äù
3653: Say: ‚ÄúNo reward have I ever asked of you [out of anything] that is yours: my reward rests with none but God, and He is witness unto everything!‚Äù
3654: Say: ‚ÄúVerily, my Sustainer hurls the truth [against all that is false] He who fully knows all the things that are beyond the reach of a created being‚Äôs perception!‚Äù
3655: Say: ‚ÄúThe truth has now come [to light, and falsehood is bound to wither away]: for, falsehood cannot bring forth anything new, nor can it bring back [what has passed away].‚Äù
3656: Say: ‚ÄúWere I to go astray, I would but go astray [due to my own self, and] to the hurt of myself; but if I am on the right path, it is but by virtue of what my Sustainer reveals unto me: for, verily, He is all-hearing, ever-near!‚Äù
3657: IF THOU couldst but see [how the deniers of the truth will fare on Resurrection Day,] when they will shrink in terror, with nowhere to escape - since they will have been seized from so close nearby
3658: and will cry, ‚ÄúWe do [now] believe in it!‚Äù But how can they [hope to] attain [to salvation] from so far away,
3659: seeing that aforetime they had been bent on denying the truth, and had been wont to cast scorn, from far away, on something that was beyond the reach of human perception?
3660: And so, a barrier will be set between them and all that they had [ever] desired, as will be done to such of their kind as lived before their time: for, behold, they [too] were lost in doubt amounting to suspicion.
3661: ALL PRAISE is due to God, Originator of the heavens and the earth, who causes the angels to be (His) message-bearers, endowed with wings, two, or three, or four. [Unceasingly] He adds to His creation whatever He wills: for, verily, God has the power to will anything.
3662: Whatever grace God opens up to man, none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds, none can henceforth release: for He alone is almighty, truly wise.
3663: O men! Call to mind the blessings which God has bestowed upon you! Is there any creator, other than God, that could provide for you sustenance out of heaven and earth? There is no deity save Him: and yet, how perverted are your minds!
3664: But if they [whose minds are perverted] give thee the lie, [O Prophet, remember that] even so, before thy time, have [other] apostles been given the lie: for [the unbelievers always refuse to admit that] all things go back to God [as their source].
3665: O men! Verily, God‚Äôs promise [of resurrection] is true indeed: let not, then, the life of this world delude you, and let not [your own] deceptive thoughts about God delude you!
3666: Behold, Satan is a foe unto you: so treat him as a foe. He but calls on his followers to the end that they might find themselves among such as are des¬≠tined for the blazing flame ‚Äì
3667: [seeing that] for those who are bent on denying the truth there is suffering severe in store, just as for those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds there is forgiveness of sins, and a great reward.
3668: Is, then, he to whom the evil of his own doings is [so] alluring that [in the end] he regards it as good [anything but a follower of Satan]? For, verily, God lets go astray him that wills [to go astray], just as He guides him that wills [to be guided]. Hence, [O believer,] do not waste thyself in sorrowing over them: verily, God has full knowledge of all that they do!
3669: AND [remember:] it is God who sends forth the winds, so that they raise a cloud, whereupon We drive it towards dead land and thereby give life to the earth after it had been lifeless: even thus shall resur¬≠rection be!
3670: He who desires might and glory [ought to know that] all might and glory belong to God [alone]. Unto Him ascend all good words, and the righteous deed does He exalt. But as for those who cunningly devise evil deeds - suffering severe awaits them; and all their devising is bound to come to nought.
3671: And [remember:] God creates [every one of] you out of dust, then out of a drop of sperm; and then He fashions you into either of the two sexes. And no female conceives or gives birth unless it be with His knowledge; and none that is long-lived has his days lengthened - and neither is aught lessened of his days - unless it be thus laid down in [God‚Äôs] decree: for, behold, all this is easy for God.
3672: [Easy is it for Him to create likeness and variety:] thus, the two great bodies of water [on earth] are not alike the one sweet, thirst-allaying, pleasant to drink, and the other salty and bitter: and yet, from either of them do you eat fresh meat, and [from either] you take gems which you may wear; and on either thou canst see ships ploughing through the waves, so that you might [be able to] go forth in quest of some of His bounty, and thus have cause to be grateful.
3673: He makes the night grow longer by shortening the day, and He makes the day grow longer by shortening the night; and He has made the sun and the moon subservient [to His laws], each running its course for a term set [by Him]. Thus is God, your Sustainer: unto Him belongs all dominion - whereas those whom you invoke instead of Him do not own so much as the husk of a date-stone!
3674: If you invoke them, they do not hear your call; and even if they could hear, they would not [be able to] respond to you. And [withal,] on the Day of Resurrection they will utterly disown your having associated them with God. And none can make thee understand [the truth] like the One who is all-aware.
3675: O men! It is you, who stand in need of God, whereas He alone is self-sufficient, the One to whom all praise is due.
3676: If He so wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new mankind [in your stead]:
3677: nor is this difficult for God.
3678: AND NO BEARER of burdens shall be made to bear another‚Äôs burden; and if one weighed down by his load calls upon [another] to help him carry it, nothing thereof may be carried [by that other], even if it be one‚Äôs near of kin. Hence, thou canst [truly] warn only those who stand in awe of their Sustainer although He is beyond the reach of their perception, and are constant in prayer, and [know that] whoever grows in purity, attains to purity but for the good of his own self, and [that] with God is all journeys‚Äô end.
3679: For [thus it is:] the blind and the seeing are not equal;
3680: nor are the depths of darkness and the light;
3681: nor the [cooling] shade and the scorching heat:
3682: and neither are equal the living and the dead [of heart]. Behold, [O Muhammad,] God can make hear whomever He wills, whereas thou canst not make hear such as are [dead of heart like the dead] in their graves:
3683: thou art nothing but a warner.
3684: Verily, We have sent thee with the truth, as a bearer of glad tidings and a warner: for there never was any community but a warner has [lived and] passed away in its midst.
3685: And if they give thee the lie - even so gave the lie to the truth [many of] those who lived before their time, [when] there came unto them their apostles with all evidence of the truth, and with books of divine wisdom, and with light-giving revelation;
3686: [but] in the end I took to task all those who were bent on denying the truth: and how awesome was My rejection!
3687: ART THOU NOT aware that God sends down water from the skies, whereby We bring forth fruits of many hues - just as in the mountains there are streaks of white and red of various shades, as well as (others) raven-black,
3688: and (as) there are in men, and in crawling beasts, and in cattle, too, many hues? Of all His servants, only such as are endowed with [innate] knowledge stand [truly] in awe of God: [for they alone comprehend that,] verily, God is almighty, much-forgiving.
3689: (It is) they who [truly] follow God‚Äôs revelation, and are constant in prayer, and spend on others, secretly and openly, out of what We provide for them as sustenance - it is they who may look forward to a bargain that can never fail,
3690: since He will grant them their just rewards, and give them yet more out of His bounty: for, verily, He is much-forgiving, ever-responsive to gratitude.
3691: And [know that] all of the divine writ with which We have inspired thee is the very truth, confirming the truth of whatever there still remains of earlier revelations for, behold, of [the needs of] His servants God is fully aware, all-seeing.
3692: And so, We have bestowed this divine writ as a heritage unto such of Our servants as We chose: and among them are some who sin against themselves; and some who keep half-way [between right and wrong]; and some who, by God‚Äôs leave, are fore¬≠most in deeds of goodness: [and] this, indeed, is a merit most high!
3693: [Hence,] gardens of perpetual bliss will they enter, therein to be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and therein to be clad in raiments of silk;
3694: and they will say: ‚ÄúAll praise is due to God, who has caused all sorrow to leave us: for, verily, our Sustainer is indeed much-forgiving, ever-responsive to gratitude ‚Äì
3695: He who, out of His bounty, has made us alight in this abode of life enduring, wherein no struggle can assail us, and wherein no weariness can touch us!‚Äù
3696: But as for those who are bent on denying the truth - the fire of hell awaits them: no end shall be put to their lives so that they could die, nor shall aught of the suffering caused by that [fire] be lightened for them: thus shall We requite all who are bereft of gratitude.
3697: And in that [hell] they will cry aloud: ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! Cause us to come out [of this suffering]! We shall [henceforth] do good deeds, not such as we were wont to do [aforetime]!‚Äù [But We shall answer:] ‚ÄúDid We not grant you a life long enough so that whoever was willing to take thought could bethink himself? And [withal,] a war¬≠ner had come unto you! Taste, then, [the fruit of your evil deeds]: for evildoers shall have none to succour them!‚Äù
3698: Verily, God knows the hidden reality of the heavens and the earth: [and,] behold, He has full knowledge of what is in the hearts [of men].
3699: He it is who has made you inherit the earth. Hence, he who is bent on denying the truth [of God‚Äôs oneness and uniqueness ought to know that] this denial of his will fall back upon him: for their [per¬≠sistent] denial of this truth does but add to the deniers‚Äô loathsomeness in their Sustainer‚Äôs sight and, thus, their denial of this truth does but add to the deniers‚Äô loss.
3700: Say: ‚ÄúHave you ever [really] considered those beings and forces to whom you ascribe a share in God‚Äôs divinity, [and] whom you invoke beside God? Show me what it is that they have created on earth - or do [you claim that] they have a share in [govern¬≠ing] the heavens?‚Äù Have We ever vouchsafed them a divine writ on which they could rely as evidence [in support of their views]? Nay, [the hope which] the evildoers hold out to one another [is] nothing but a delusion.
3701: Verily, it is God [alone] who upholds the celestial bodies and the earth, lest they deviate [from their orbits] - for if they should ever deviate, there is none that could uphold them after He will have ceased to do so. [But,] verily, He is ever-forbearing, much-for¬≠giving!
3702: As it is, they [who are averse to the truth often] swear by God with their most solemn oaths that if a warner should ever come to them, they would follow his guidance better than any of the communities [of old had followed the warner sent to them]: but now that a warner has come unto them, [his call] but increases their aversion,
3703: their arro¬≠gant behaviour on earth, and their devising of evil [arguments against God‚Äôs messages]. Yet [in the end,] such evil scheming will engulf none but its authors: and can they expect anything but [to be made to go] the way of those [sinners] of olden times? Thus [it is]: no change wilt thou ever find in God‚Äôs way; yea, no deviation wilt thou ever find in God‚Äôs way!
3704: Have they never journeyed about the earth and beheld what happened in the end to those [deniers of the truth] who lived before their time and were [so much] greater than they in power? And [do they not see that the will of] God can never be foiled by anything whatever in the heavens or on earth, since, verily, He is all-knowing, infinite in His power?
3705: Now if God were to take men [at once] to task for whatever [wrong] they commit [on earth], He would not leave a single living creature upon its surface. However, He grants them respite for a term set [by Him]: but when their term comes to an end - then, verily, [they come to know that] God sees all that is in [the hearts of] His servants.
3707: Consider this Qur‚Äôan full of wisdom:
3708: verily, thou art indeed one of God‚Äôs message-bearers,
3710: by [virtue of] what is being bestowed from on high by the Almighty, the Dispenser of Grace,
3711: [bestowed upon thee] so that thou mayest warn people whose forefathers had not been warned, and who therefore are unaware [of the meaning of right and wrong].
3712: Indeed, the word [of God‚Äôs condemnation] is bound to come true against most of them: for they will not believe.
3713: Behold, around their necks We have put shack¬≠les, reaching up to their chins, so that their heads are forced up;
3714: and We have set a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, and We have enshrouded them in veils so that they cannot see:
3715: thus, it is all one to them whether thou warnest them or dost not warn them: they will not believe.
3716: Thou canst [truly] warn only him who is willing to take the reminder to heart, and who stands in awe of the Most Gracious although He is beyond the reach of human perception: unto such, then, give the glad tiding of [God‚Äôs] forgiveness and of a most excellent reward!
3717: Verily, We shall indeed bring the dead back to life; and We shall record whatever [deeds] they have sent ahead, and the traces [of good and evil] which they have left behind: for of all things do We take account in a record clear.
3718: AND SET FORTH unto them a parable - [the story of how] the people of a township [behaved] when [Our] message-bearers came unto them.
3719: Lo! We sent unto them two [apostles], and. they gave the lie to both; and so We strengthened [the two] with a third; and thereupon they said: ‚ÄúBehold, we have been sent unto you [by God]!‚Äù
3720: [The others] answered: ‚ÄúYou are nothing but mortal men like ourselves; moreover, the Most Gracious has never bestowed aught [of revelation] from on high. You do nothing but lie!‚Äù
3721: Said [the apostles]: ‚ÄúOur Sustainer knows that we have indeed been sent unto you;
3722: but we are not bound to do more than clearly deliver the mes¬≠sage [entrusted to us].‚Äù
3723: Said [the others]: ‚ÄúTruly, we augur evil from you! Indeed, if you desist not, we will surely stone you, and grievous suffering is bound to befall you at our hands!‚Äù
3724: [The apostles] replied: ‚ÄúYour destiny, good or evil, is [bound up] with yourselves! [Does it seem evil to you] if you are told to take [the truth] to heart? Nay, but you are people who have wasted their own selves!‚Äù
3725: At that, a man came running from the farthest end of the city, [and] exclaimed: ‚ÄúO my people! Follow these message-bearers!
3726: Follow those who ask no reward of you, and themselves are rightly guided!
3727: ‚Äú[As for me,] why should I not worship Him who has brought me into being, and to whom you all will be brought back?
3728: Should I take to worship¬≠ping [other] deities beside Him? [But then,] if the Most Gracious should will that harm befall me, their intercession could not in the least avail me, nor could they save me:
3729: and so, behold, I would have indeed, most obviously, lost myself in error!
3730: ‚ÄúVerily, [O my people,] in the Sustainer of you all have I come to believe: listen, then, to me!‚Äù
3731: [And] he was told, ‚Äú[Thou shalt] enter paradise!‚Äù - [whereupon] he exclaimed: ‚ÄúWould that my people knew
3732: how my Sustainer has forgiven me [the sins of my past], and has placed me among the honoured ones!‚Äù
3733: And after that, no host out of heaven did We send down against his people, nor did We need to send down any:
3734: nothing was [needed] but one single blast [of Our punishment] - and lo! they became as still and silent as ashes.
3735: OH, THE REGRETS that [most] human beings will have to bear! Never has an apostle come to them without their deriding him!
3736: Are they not aware of how many a generation We have destroyed before their time, [and] that those [that have perished] will never return to them,
3737: and [that] all of them, all together, will [in the end] before Us be arraigned?
3738: And [yet,] they have a sign [of Our power to create and to resurrect] in the lifeless earth which We make alive, and out of which We bring forth grain, whereof they may eat;
3739: and [how] We make gardens of date-palms and vines [grow] thereon, and cause springs to gush [forth] within it,
3740: so that they may eat of the fruit thereof, though it was not their hands that made it. Will they not, then, be grateful?
3741: Limitless in His glory is He who has created opposites in whatever the earth produces, and in men‚Äôs own selves, and in that of which [as yet] they have no knowledge.
3742: And [of Our sway over all that exists] they have a sign in the night: We withdraw from it the [light of] day - and lo! they are in darkness.
3743: And [they have a sign in] the sun: it runs in an orbit of its own [and] that is laid down by the will of the Almighty, the All-Knowing;
3744: and [in] the moon, for which We have determined phases [which it must traverse] till it becomes like an old date-stalk, dried-up and curved:
3745: [and] neither may the sun overtake the moon, nor can the night usurp the time of day, since all of them float through space [in accordance with Our laws].
3746: And [it ought to be] a sign for them that We bear their offspring [over the seas] in laden ships,
3747: and [that] We create for them things of a similar kind, on which they may embark [in their travels];
3748: and [that,] if such be Our will, We may cause them to drown, with none to respond to their cry for help: and [then] they cannot be saved,
3749: unless it be by an act of mercy from Us and a grant of life for a [further span of] time.
3750: And [yet,] when they are told, ‚ÄúBeware of [God‚Äôs insight into] all that lies open before you and all that is hidden from you, so that you might be graced with His mercy,‚Äù [most men choose to remain deaf;]
3751: and no message of their Sustainer s messages ever reaches them without their turning away from it.
3752: Thus, when they are told, ‚ÄúSpend on others out of what God has provided for you as sus¬≠tenance,‚Äù those who are bent on denying the truth say unto those who believe, ‚ÄúShall we feed anyone whom, if [your] God had so willed, He could have fed [Himself]? Clearly, you are but lost in error!‚Äù
3753: And they add, ‚ÄúWhen is this promise [of resurrection] to be fulfilled? [Answer this] if you are men of truth!‚Äù
3754: [And they are unaware that] nothing awaits them beyond a single blast [of God‚Äôs punishment], which will overtake them while they are still arguing - [against resurrection]:
3755: and so [sudden will be their end that] no testament will they be able to make, - nor to their own people will they return!
3756: And [then] the trumpet [of resurrection] will be blown - and lo! out of their graves towards their Sustainer will they all rush forth!
3757: They will say: ‚ÄúOh, woe unto us! Who has roused us from our sleep [of death]?‚Äù [Whereupon they will be told:] ‚ÄúThis is what the Most Gracious has promised! And His message-bearers spoke the truth!‚Äù
3758: Nothing will there have been but one single blast - and lo! before Us will all of them be arraigned [and be told]:
3759: ‚ÄúToday, then, no human being shall be wronged in the least, nor shalt you be requited for aught but what you were doing [on earth].
3760: ‚ÄúBehold, those who are destined for paradise shall today have joy in whatever they do:
3761: in happiness will they and their spouses on couches recline;
3762: [only] delight will there be for them, and theirs shall be all that they could ask for:
3763: peace and fulfillment through the word of a Sustainer who dispenses all grace.
3764: ‚ÄúBut stand aside today, O you who were lost in sin!
3765: Did I not enjoin on you, O you children of Adam, that you should not worship Satan ‚Äì since, verily, he is your open foe
3766: and that you should worship Me [alone]? This would have been a straight way!
3767: And [as for Satan -] he had already led astray a great many of you: could you not, then, use your reason?
3768: ‚ÄúThis, then, is the hell of which you were warned again and again:
3769: endure it today as an outcome of your persistent denial of the truth!‚Äù
3770: On that Day We shall set a seal on their mouths but their hands will speak unto Us, and their feet will bear witness to whatever they have earned [in life].
3771: NOW HAD IT BEEN Our will [that men should not be able to discern between right and wrong], We could surely have deprived them of their sight, so that they would stray forever from the [right] way: for how could they have had insight [into what is true]?
3772: And had it been Our will [that they should not be free to choose between right and wrong], We could surely have given them a different nature [and created them as beings rooted] in their places, so that they would not be able to move forward, and could not turn back.]
3773: But [let them always remember that] if We lengthen a human being‚Äôs days, We also cause him to decline in his powers [when he grows old]: will they not, then, use their reason?
3774: AND [thus it is:] We have not imparted to this [Prophet the gift of] poetry, nor would [poetry] have suited this [message]: it is but a reminder and a [divine] discourse, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth,
3775: to the end that it may warn everyone who is alive [of heart], and that the word [of God] may bear witness against all who deny the truth.
3776: Are they, then, not aware that it is for them that We have created, among all the things which Our hands have wrought, the domestic animals of which they are [now] masters? ‚Äì
3777: and that We have subjected them to men‚Äôs will, so that some of them they may use for riding and of some they may eat,
3778: and may have [yet other] benefits from them, and [milk] to drink? Will they not, then, be grateful? (
3779: But [nay,] they take to worshipping deities other than God, [hoping] to be succoured [by them, and not knowing that]
3780: they are unable to succour their devotees, even though to them they may [appear to] be hosts drawn up [for succour].
3781: However, be not grieved by the sayings of those [who deny the truth]: verily, We know all that they keep secret as well as all that they bring into the open.
3782: IS MAN, then, not aware that it is We who create him out of a [mere] drop of sperm - whereupon, lo! he shows himself endowed with the power to think and to argue?
3783: And [now] he [argues about Us, and] thinks of Us in terms of comparison, and is oblivious of how he himself was created! [And so] he says, ‚ÄúWho could give life to bones that have crumbled to dust?‚Äù
3784: Say: ‚ÄúHe who brought them into being in the first instance will give them life [once again], seeing that He has full knowledge of every act of creation:
3785: He who produces for you fire out of the green tree, so that, lo! you kindle [your fires] therewith.‚Äù
3786: Is, then, He who has created the heavens and the earth not able to create [anew] the like of those [who have died]? Yea, indeed - for He alone is the all-knowing Crea¬≠tor:
3787: His Being alone is such that when He wills a thing to be, He but says unto it, ‚ÄúBe‚Äù ‚Äî and it is.
3788: Limitless, then, in His glory is He in whose hand rests the mighty dominion over all things; and unto Him you all will be brought back!
3789: CONSIDER these [messages] ranged in serried ranks,
3790: and restraining [from evil] by a call to restraint,
3791: and conveying [to all the world] a reminder:
3792: Verily, most surely, your God is One ‚Äì
3793: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them, and the Sustainer of all the points of sunrise!
3794: Behold, We have adorned the skies nearest to the earth with the beauty of stars,
3795: and have made them secure against every rebellious, satanic force,
3796: [so that] they [who seek to learn the unknowable] should not be able to overhear the host on high, but shall be repelled from all sides,
3797: cast out [from all grace], with lasting suffering in store for them [in the life to come];
3798: but if anyone does succeed in snatching a glimpse [of such knowledge], he is [henceforth] pursued by a piercing flame.
3799: AND NOW ask those [who deny the truth] to enlight¬≠en thee: Were they more difficult to create than all those [untold marvels] that We have created? - for, behold, them have We created out of [mere] clay commingled with water!
3800: Nay, but whereas thou dost marvel, they [only] scoff;
3801: and when they are reminded [of the truth], they refuse to take it to heart;
3802: and when they become aware of a [divine] message, they turn it to ridicule
3803: and say: ‚ÄúThis is clearly nothing but [a mortal‚Äôs] spellbinding eloquence!
3804: Why - after we have died and become mere dust and bones, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead? ‚Äì
3805: and perhaps also our forebears of old?‚Äù
3806: Say: ‚ÄúYea, indeed - and most abject will you then be!‚Äù ‚Äì
3807: for that [resurrection which they deride] will be [upon them of a sudden, as if it were] but a single accusing cry - and then, lo! they will begin to see [the truth]
3808: and will say: ‚ÄúOh, woe unto us! This is the Day of Judgment!‚Äù
3809: [And they will be told:] ‚ÄúThis is the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false - the Day] which you were wont to call a lie!‚Äù
3810: [And God will thus command:] ‚ÄúAssemble all those who were bent on evildoing, together with others of their ilk and [with] all that they were wont to worship
3811: instead of God, and lead them all onto the way to the blazing fire,
3812: and halt them [there]!‚Äù [And then,] behold, they shall be asked,
3813: ‚ÄúHow is it that [now] you cannot succour one another?‚Äù
3814: Nay, but on that Day they would willingly surrender [to God];
3815: but [since it will be too late,] they will turn upon one another, demanding of each other [to relieve them of the burden of their past sins].
3816: Some [of them] will say: ‚ÄúBehold, you were wont to approach us [deceptively] from the right!‚Äù
3817: [To which] the others will reply: ‚ÄúNay, you yourselves were bereft of all faith!
3818: Moreover, we had no power at all over you: nay, you were people filled with overweening arrogance!
3819: But now our Sustainer‚Äôs word has come true against us [as well]: verily, we are bound to taste [the fruit of our sins].
3820: So then, [if it be true that] we have caused you to err grievously - behold, we ourselves had been lost in grievous error!‚Äù
3821: And, verily, on that Day they all will share in their common suffering.
3822: Verily, thus shall We deal with all who were lost in sin:
3823: for, behold, whenever they were told, ‚ÄúThere is no deity save God,‚Äù they would glory in their arrogance
3824: and would say, ‚ÄúShall we, then, give up our deities at the bidding of a mad poet?‚Äù
3825: Nay, but he [whom you call a mad poet] has brought the truth; and he confirms the truth of [what the earlier of God‚Äôs] message-bearers [have taught].
3826: Behold, you will indeed taste grievous suffering [in the life to come],
3827: although you shall not be requited for aught but what you were wont to do.
3828: Not so, however, God‚Äôs true servants:
3829: [in the hereafter,] theirs shall be a sustenance which they will recognize
3830: as the fruits [of their life on earth]; and honoured shall they be
3832: facing one another [in love] upon thrones of happiness.
3833: A cup will be passed round among them [with a drink] from unsullied springs,
3834: clear, delightful to those who drink it:
3835: no headiness will be in it, and they will not get drunk thereon.
3836: And with them will be mates of modest gaze, most beautiful of eye,
3837: [as free of faults] as if they were hidden [ostrich] eggs.
3838: And they will all turn to one another, asking each other [about their past lives].
3839: One of them speaks thus: ‚ÄúBehold, I had [on earth] a close companion
3840: who was wont to ask [me], ‚ÄòWhy - art thou really one of those who believe it to be true
3841: [that] after we have died and become mere dust and bones we shall, forsooth, be brought to judgment?‚Äù‚Äô
3842: [And] he adds: ‚ÄúWould you like to look [and see him]?‚Äù ‚Äì
3843: and then he looks and sees that [companion of his] in the midst of the blazing fire,
3844: and says: ‚ÄúBy God! Verily, thou hast almost destroyed me [too, O my erstwhile companion]
3845: for had it not been for my Sustainer‚Äôs favour, I would surely be [now] among those who are given over [to suffering]!
3846: But then, [O my friends in paradise,] is it [really] so that we are not to die
3847: [again,] beyond our previous death, and that we shall never [again] be made to suffer?
3848: Verily, this - this indeed - is the triumph supreme!‚Äù
3849: For the like of this, then, let them labour, those who labour [in God‚Äôs way]!
3850: Is such [a paradise] the better welcome - or the [hellish] tree of deadly fruit?
3851: Verily, We have caused it to be a trial for evildoers:
3852: for, behold, it is a tree that grows in the very heart of the blazing fire [of hell],
3853: its fruit [as repulsive] as satans‚Äô heads;
3854: and they [who are lost in evil] are indeed bound to eat thereof, and to fill their bellies therewith.
3855: And, behold, above all this they will be confounded with burning des¬≠pair!
3856: And once again: Verily, the blazing fire is their ultimate goal ‚Äì
3857: for, behold, they found their forebears on a wrong way,
3858: and [now] they make haste to follow in their footsteps!
3859: Thus, indeed, most of the people of old went astray before them,
3860: although, verily, We had sent warners unto them:
3861: and behold what happened in the end to those that had been warned [to no avail]!
3862: EXCEPT for God‚Äôs true servants, [most people are apt to go astray.]
3863: And, indeed, [it was for this reason that] Noah cried unto Us - and how excellent was Our response:
3864: for We saved him and his household from that awesome calamity,
3865: and caused his offspring to endure [on earth];
3866: and We left him thus to be remembered among later generations:
3867: ‚ÄúPeace be upon Noah throughout all the worlds!‚Äù
3868: Verily, thus do We reward the doers of good ‚Äì
3869: for he was truly one of our believing servants:
3870: [and so We saved him and those who followed him] and then We caused the others to drown.
3871: AND, BEHOLD, of his persuasion was Abraham, too,
3872: when he turned to his Sustainer with a heart free of evil,
3873: and [thus] spoke to his father and his people: ‚ÄúWhat is it that you worship?
3874: Do you want [to bow down before] a lie - [before] deities other than God?
3875: What, then, do you think of the Sustainer of all the worlds?‚Äù
3876: Then he cast a glance at the stars,
3877: and said, ‚ÄúVerily, I am sick [at heart]!‚Äù
3878: and at that they turned their backs on him and went away.
3879: Thereupon he approached their gods stealthily and said, ‚ÄúWhat! You do not eat [of the offerings placed before you]?
3880: What is amiss with you that you do not speak?‚Äù
3881: And then he fell upon them, smiting them with his right hand.
3882: [But] then the others came towards him hur¬≠riedly [and accused him of his deed].
3883: He answered: ‚ÄúDo you worship something that you [yourselves] have carved,
3884: the while it is God who has created you and all your handiwork?‚Äù
3885: They exclaimed: ‚ÄúBuild a pyre for him, and cast him into the blazing fire!‚Äù
3886: But whereas they sought to do evil unto him, We [frustrated their designs, and thus] brought them low?
3887: And [Abraham] said: ‚ÄúVerily, I shall [leave this land and] go wherever my Sustainer will guide me!‚Äù
3888: [And he prayed:] ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Bestow upon me the gift of [a son who shall be] one of the righteous!‚Äù ‚Äì
3889: whereupon We gave him the glad tiding of a boy-child gentle [like himself]?
3890: And [one day,] when [the child] had become old enough to share in his [father‚Äôs] endeavours, the latter said: ‚ÄúO my dear son! I have seen in a dream that I should sacrifice thee: consider, then, what would be thy view!‚Äù [Ishmael] answered: ‚ÄúO my father! Do as thou art bidden: thou wilt find me, if God so wills, among those who are patient in adversity!‚Äù
3891: But as soon as the two had surrendered themselves to [what they thought to be] the will of God, and [Abraham] had laid him down on his face,
3892: We called out to him: ‚ÄúO Abraham,
3893: thou hast already fulfilled [the purpose of] that dream- vision!‚Äù Thus, verily, do We reward the doers of good:
3894: for, behold, all this was indeed a trial, clear in itself.
3895: And We ransomed him with a tremendous sacrifice,
3896: and left him thus to be remembered among later generations:
3898: Thus do We reward the doers of good ‚Äì
3899: for he was truly one of our believing servants.
3900: And [in time] We gave him the glad tiding of Isaac, [who, too, would be] a prophet, one of the righteous;
3901: and We blessed him and Isaac: but among the offspring of these two there were [des¬≠tined] to be both doers of good and such as would glaringly sin against themselves.
3902: THUS, INDEED, did We bestow Our favour upon Moses and Aaron;
3903: and We saved them and their people from the awesome calamity [of bondage],
3904: and succoured them, so that [in the end] it was they who achieved victory.
3905: And We gave them the divine writ that made [right and wrong] distinct,
3906: and guided them the straight way,
3907: and left them thus to be remem¬≠bered among later generations:
3909: Thus do We reward the doers of good ‚Äì
3910: for those two were truly among Our believing ser¬≠vants.
3911: AND, BEHOLD, Elijah [too] was indeed one of Our message-bearers
3912: when he spoke [thus] to his people: ‚ÄúWill you not remain conscious of God?
