3913: Will you invoke Baal and forsake [God,] the best of artisans -
3914: God, your Sustainer and the Sustainer of your forebears of old?‚Äù
3915: But they gave him the lie: and therefore they will most surely be arraigned [on Judgment Day],
3916: excepting only [those who were] God‚Äôs true servants;
3917: and him We left thus to be remem¬≠bered among later generations:
3918: ‚ÄúPeace be upon Elijah and his followers!‚Äù
3919: Verily, thus do We reward the doers of good ‚Äì
3920: for he was truly one of Our believing servants!
3921: AND, BEHOLD, Lot was indeed one of Our mes¬≠sage-bearers;
3922: [and so,] when [We decreed the doom of his sinful town,] We saved him and his household,
3923: except an old woman who was among those that stayed behind;
3924: and then We utterly destroyed the others:
3925: and, verily, [to this day] you pass by the remnants of their dwellings at morning-time
3926: and by night. Will you not, then, use your reason?
3927: AND, BEHOLD, Jonah was indeed one of Our mes¬≠sage-bearers
3928: when he fled like a runaway slave onto a laden ship.
3929: And then they cast lots, and he was the one who lost;
3930: [and they cast him into the sea,] whereupon the great fish swallowed him, for he had been blameworthy.
3931: And had he not been of those who [even in the deep darkness of their distress are able to] extol God‚Äôs limitless glory,
3932: he would indeed have remained in its belly till the Day when all shall be raised from the dead:
3933: but We caused him to be cast forth on a desert shore, sick [at heart] as he was,
3934: and caused a creeping plant to grow over him [out of the barren soil].
3935: And [then] We sent him [once again] to [his people,] a hundred thousand [souls] or more:
3936: and [this time] they believed [in him] and so We allowed them to enjoy their life during the time allotted to them?
3937: AND NOW ask them to enlighten thee: Has thy Sustainer daughters, whereas they would have [only] sons?
3938: - or is it that We have created the angels female, and they [who believe them to be divine] have witnessed [that act of creation]?
3939: Oh, verily, it is out of their own [inclination to] falsehood that some people assert,
3940: ‚ÄúGod has begotten [a son]‚Äù; and, verily, they are lying [too, when they say],
3941: ‚ÄúHe has chosen daughters in preference to sons‚Äù!
3942: What is amiss with you and your judgment?
3943: Will you not, then, bethink yourselves?
3944: Or have you, perchance, a clear evidence [for your assertions]?
3945: Produce, then, that divine writ of yours, if you are speaking the truth!
3946: And some people have invented a kinship between Him and all manner of invisible forces although [even] these invisible forces know well that, verily, they [who thus blaspheme against God] shall indeed be arraigned [before Him on Judgment Day: for]
3947: limitless is God in His glory, above anything that men may devise by way of definition!
3948: Not thus, however, [behave] God‚Äôs true ser¬≠vants:
3949: for, verily, neither you [blasphemers] nor the objects of your worship
3950: can cause anyone to fall prey to your temptation
3951: unless it be such as rushes towards the blazing fire [of his own accord]!
3952: [All forces of nature praise God and say:] ‚ÄúAmong us, too, there is none but has a place assigned to it [by Him];
3953: and, verily, we too are ranged [before Him in worship];
3954: and, verily, we too extol His limitless glory!‚Äù
3955: AND, INDEED, they [who deny the truth] have always been wont to say,
3956: ‚ÄúIf only we had a tradition [to this effect] from our forebears,
3957: we would certainly be true servants of God.‚Äù
3958: And yet, [now that this divine writ has been placed before them,] they refuse to acknowledge it as true! In time, however, they will come to know [what it was that they had rejected]:
3959: for, long ago has Our word gone forth unto Our servants, the message- bearers,
3960: that, verily, they - they indeed - would be succoured,
3961: and that, verily, Our hosts - they indeed - would [in the end] be victorious!
3962: Hence, turn thou aside for a while from those [who deny the truth],
3963: and see them [for what they are]; and in time they [too] will come to see [what they do not see now].
3964: Do they, then, [really] wish that Our chas¬≠tisement be hastened on?
3965: But then, once it alights upon them, hapless will be the awakening of those who were warned [to no avail]!
3966: Hence, turn thou aside for a while from them,
3967: and see [them for what they are]; and n time they [too] will come to see [what they do not see now].
3968: LIMITLESS in His glory is thy Sustainer, the Lord of almightiness, [exalted] above anything that men may devise by way of definition!
3969: And peace be upon all His message-bearers!
3970: And all praise is due to God alone, the Sus¬≠tainer of all the worlds!
3971: Sad. CONSIDER this Qur‚Äôan, endowed with all that one ought to remember!
3972: But nay - they who are bent on denying the truth are lost in [false] pride, and [hence] deeply in the wrong.
3973: How many a generation have We destroyed before their time [for this very sin]! And [how] they called [unto Us] when it was too late to escape!
3974: Now these [people] deem it strange that a warner should have come unto them from their own midst - and [so] the deniers of the truth are saying: ‚ÄúA [mere] spellbinder is he, a liar!
3975: Does he claim that all the deities are [but] one God? Verily, a most strange thing is this!‚Äù
3976: And their leaders launch forth [thus]: ‚ÄúGo ahead, and hold steadfastly onto your deities: this, behold, is the only thing to do!
3977: Never did we hear of [a claim like] this in any faith of latter days! It is nothing but [a mortal man‚Äôs] invention!
3978: What! Upon him alone from among all of us should a [divine] reminder have been bestowed from on high?‚Äù Nay, but it is My Own reminder that they distrust! Nay, they have not yet tasted the suffering which I do impose!
3979: Or do they [think that they] own the treasures of thy Sustainer‚Äôs grace - [the grace] of the Almighty, the Giver of Gifts?
3980: Or [that] the dominion over the heavens and the earth and all that is between them is theirs? Why, then, let them try to ascend [to God-like power] by all [conceivable] means!
3981: [But] there it is: any and all human beings, however [strongly] leagued together, are bound to suffer defeat [whenever they refuse to accept the truth].
3982: To the truth gave the lie aforetime Noah‚Äôs people, and [the tribe of] Ad, and Pharaoh of the [many] tent-poles,
3983: and [the tribe of] Thamud, and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan]: they all were leagued together, [as it were, in their unbelief:]
3984: not one [was there] but gave the lie to the apostles - and thereupon My retribution fell due.
3985: And they [who now deny the truth - they, too,] have but to wait for one single blast [of punishment to overtake them]: it shall not be delayed a whit.
3986: As it is, they say [mockingly]: ‚ÄúO our Sus¬≠tainer! Hasten on to us our share [of punishment even] before the Day of Reckoning!‚Äù
3987: [But] bear thou with patience whatever they may say, and remember Our servant David, him who was endowed with [so much] inner strength! He, verily, would always turn unto Us:
3988: [and for this,] behold, We caused the mountains to join him in extolling Our limitless glory at eventide and at sun¬≠rise,
3989: and [likewise] the birds in their assemblies: [together] they all Would turn again and again unto Him [who had created them].
3990: And We streng¬≠thened his dominion, and bestowed upon him wisdom and sagacity in judgment.
3991: AND YET, has the story of the litigants come within thy ken - [the story of the two] who surmounted the walls of the sanctuary [in which David prayed]?
3992: As they came upon David, and he shrank back in fear from them, they said: ‚ÄúFear not! [We are but] two litigants. One of us has wronged the other: so judge thou between us with justice, and deviate not from what is right, and show [both of] us the way to rectitude.
3993: ‚ÄúBehold, this is my brother: he has ninety-nine ewes, whereas I have [only] one ewe - and yet he said, ‚ÄòMake her over to me,‚Äô and forcibly prevailed against me in this [our] dispute.‚Äù
3994: Said [David]: ‚ÄúHe has certainly wronged thee by demanding that thy ewe be added to his ewes! Thus, behold, do many kinsmen wrong one another [all] save those who believe [in God] and do righteous deeds: but how few are they!‚Äù And [suddenly] David understood that We had tried him: and so he asked his Sustainer to forgive him his sin, and fell down in prostration, and turned unto Him in repentance.
3995: And thereupon We forgave him that [sin]: and, verily, nearness to Us awaits him [in the life to come], and the most beauteous of all goals!
3996: [And We said:] ‚ÄúO David! Behold, We have made thee a [prophet and, thus, Our] vicegerent on earth: judge, then, between men with justice, and do not follow vain desire, lest it lead thee astray from the path of God: verily, for those who go astray from the path of God there is suffering severe in store for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning!‚Äù
3997: AND [thus it is:] We have not created heaven and earth and all that is between them without meaning and purpose, as is the surmise of those who are bent on denying the truth: but then, woe from the fire [of hell] unto all who are bent on denying the truth!
3998: [For,] would We treat those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds in the same manner as [We shall treat] those who spread corruption on earth? Would We treat the God-conscious in the same manner as the wicked?
3999: [All this have We expounded in this] blessed divine writ which We have revealed unto thee, [O Muhammad,] so that men may ponder over its mes¬≠sages, and that those who are endowed with insight may take them to heart.
4000: AND UNTO DAVID We granted Solomon [as a son - and] how excellent a servant [of Ours he grew up to be]! Behold, he would always turn unto Us -
4001: [and even] when, towards the close of day, nobly-bred, swift-footed steeds were brought before him,
4002: he would say, ‚ÄúVerily, I have come to love the love of all that is good because I bear my Sustainer in mind!‚Äù [repeating these words as the steeds raced away,] until they were hidden by the veil [of distance - whereupon he would command],
4003: ‚ÄúBring them back unto me!‚Äù- and would [lovingly] stroke their legs and their necks.
4004: But [ere this], indeed, We had tried Solomon by placing upon his throne a [lifeless] body; and thereupon he turned [towards Us; and]
4005: he prayed: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Forgive me my sins, and bestow upon me the gift of a kingdom which may not suit anyone after me: verily, Thou alone art a giver of gifts!‚Äù
4006: And so We made subservient to him the wind, so that it gently sped at his behest whithersoever he willed,
4007: as well as all the rebellious forces [that We made to work for him] - every kind of builder and diver -
4008: and others linked together in fetters.
4009: [And We told him:] ‚ÄúThis is Our gift, for thee to bestow freely on others, or to withhold, without [having to render] account!‚Äù
4010: And, verily, nearness to Us awaits him [in the life to come], and the most beauteous of all goals!
4011: AND CALL to mind Our servant Job, [how it was] when he cried out to his Sustainer, ‚ÄúBehold, Satan has afflicted me with [utter] weariness and suffering!‚Äù
4012: [and thereupon was told:] ‚ÄúStrike [the ground] with thy foot: here is cool water to wash with and to drink!‚Äù
4013: And We bestowed upon him new offspring, doubling their number as an act of grace from Us, and as a reminder unto all who are endowed with insight.
4014: [And finally We told him:] ‚ÄúNow take in thy hand a small bunch of grass, and strike therewith, and thou wilt not break thine oath!‚Äù for, verily, We found him full of patience in adversity: how excellent a servant [of Ours], who, behold, would always turn unto Us!
4015: AND CALL to mind Our servants Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, [all of them] endowed with inner strength and vision:
4016: for, verily, We purified them by means of a thought most pure: the remembrance of the life to come.
4017: And, behold, in Our sight they were indeed among the elect, the truly good!
4018: And call to mind Ishmael and Elisha, and every one who [like them] has pledged himself [unto Us]: for, each of them was of the truly good!
4019: LET [all] this be a reminder [to those who believe in God] - for, verily, the most beauteous of all goals awaits the God-conscious:
4020: gardens of perpetual bliss, with gates wide-open to them,
4021: wherein they will recline, [and] wherein they may [freely] call for many a fruit and drink,
4022: having beside them well-matched mates of modest gaze.‚Äù
4023: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning:
4024: this, verily, shall be Our provision [for you], with no end to it!
4025: All this [for the righteous]: but, verily, the most evil of all goals awaits those who are wont to transgress the bounds of what is right:
4026: hell will they have to endure - and how vile a resting-place!
4027: This, [then, for them -] so let them taste it: burning despair and ice-cold darkness
4028: and, coupled with it, further [suffering] of a similar nature.
4029: [And they will say to one another: ‚ÄúDo you see] this crowd of people who rushed headlong [into sin] with you? No welcome to them! Verily, they [too] shall have to endure the fire!‚Äù
4030: [And] they [who had been seduced] will exclaim: ‚ÄúNay, but it is you! No welcome to you! It is you who have prepared this for us: and how vile a state to abide in!‚Äù
4031: [And] they will pray: ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! Who¬≠ever has prepared this for us, double Thou his suffering in the fire!‚Äù
4032: And they will add: ‚ÄúHow is it that we do not see [here any of the] men whom we were wont to count among the wicked,
4033: [and] whom we made the target of our derision? Or is it that [they are here, and] our eyes have missed them?‚Äù
4034: Such, behold, will in truth be the [confusion and] mutual wrangling of the people of the fire!
4035: SAY [O Muhammad]: ‚ÄúI am only a warner; and there is no deity whatever save God, the One, who holds absolute sway over all that exists,
4036: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Almighty, the All-Forgiving!‚Äù
4038: [how can] you turn away from it?‚Äù
4039: [Say, O Muhammad:] ‚ÄúNo knowledge would I have had of [what passed among] the host on high when they argued [against the creation of man],
4040: had it not been revealed unto me [by God] - to no other end than that I might convey [unto you] a plain warning.
4041: [For,] lo, thy Sustainer said unto the angels: ‚ÄúBehold, I am about to create a human being out of clay;
4042: and when I have formed him fully and breathed into him of My spirit, fall you down before him in prostration!‚Äù
4043: Thereupon the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together,
4044: save Iblis: he gloried in his arrogance, and [thus] became one of those who deny the truth.
4045: Said He: ‚ÄúO Iblis! What has kept thee from prostrating thyself before that [being] which I have created with My hands? Art thou too proud [to bow down before another created being], or art thou of those who think [only] of themselves as high?‚Äù
4046: Answered [Iblis]: ‚ÄúI am better than he: Thou hast created me out of fire, whereas him Thou hast created out of clay.‚Äù
4047: Said He: ‚ÄúGo forth, then, from this [angelic state] - for, behold, thou art henceforth accursed,
4048: and My rejection shall be thy due until the Day of Judgment!‚Äù
4049: Said [Iblis]: ‚ÄúThen, O my Sustainer, grant me a respite till the Day when all shall be raised from the dead!‚Äù
4050: Answered He: ‚ÄúVerily, so [be it:] thou shalt be among those who are granted respite
4051: till the Day the time whereof is known [only to Me].‚Äù
4052: [Whereupon Iblis] said: ‚ÄúThen [I swear] by Thy very might: I shall most certainly beguile them all into grievous error ‚Äì
4053: [all] save such of them as are truly Thy servants!‚Äù
4054: [And God] said: ‚ÄúThis, then, is the truth! And this truth do I state:
4055: Most certainly will I fill hell with thee and such of them as shall follow thee, all together!‚Äù
4056: SAY [O Prophet]: ‚ÄúNo reward whatever do I ask of you for this [message]; and I am not one of those who claim to be what they are not.
4057: This [divine writ], behold, is no less than a reminder to all the worlds ‚Äî
4058: and you will most certainly grasp its purport after a lapse of time!‚Äù
4059: THE BESTOWAL from on high of this divine writ issues from God, the Almighty, the Wise:
4060: for, behold, it is We who have bestowed this revela¬≠tion upon thee from on high, setting forth the truth: so worship Him, sincere in thy faith in Him alone!
4061: Is it not to God alone that all sincere faith is due? And yet, they who take for their protectors aught beside Him [are wont to say], ‚ÄúWe worship them for no other reason than that they bring us nearer to God.‚Äù Behold, God will judge between them [on Resur¬≠rection Day] with regard to all wherein they differ [from the truth]: for, verily, God does not grace with His guidance anyone who is bent on lying [to himself and is] stubbornly ingrate!
4062: Had God willed to take Unto Himself a son, He could have chosen anyone that He wanted out of whatever He has created - [but] limitless is He in His glory! He is the One God, the One who holds absolute sway over all that exists!
4063: He it is who has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an inner] truth. He causes the night to flow into the day, and causes the day to flow into the night; and He has made the sun and the moon subservient [to His laws], each running its course for a term set [by Him]. Is not He the Almighty, the All-Forgiving?
4064: He has created you [all] out of one living entity, and out of it fashioned its mate; and he has be¬≠stowed upon you four kinds of cattle of either sex; [and] He creates you in your mothers‚Äô wombs, one act of creation after another, in threefold depths of darkness. Thus is God, your Sustainer: unto Him belongs all dominion: there is no deity save Him: how, then, can you lose sight of the truth?
4065: If you are ingrate behold, God has no need of you; none the less, He does not approve of in¬≠gratitude in His servants: whereas, if you show grati¬≠tude, He approves it in you. And no bearer of burdens shall be made to bear another‚Äôs burden. In time, unto your Sustainer you all must return, and then He will make you [truly] understand all that you were doing [in life]: for, verily, He has full knowledge of what is in the hearts [of men].
4066: NOW [thus it is:] when affliction befalls man, he is likely to cry out to his Sustainer, turning unto Him [for help]; but as soon as He has bestowed upon him a boon by His grace, he forgets Him whom he in¬≠voked before, and claims that there are other powers that could rival God - and thus leads [others] astray from His path. Say [unto him who sins in this way]: ‚ÄúEnjoy thyself for a while in this thy denial of the truth; [yet,] verily, thou art of those who are destined for the fire!
4067: Or [dost thou deem thyself equal to] one who devoutly worships [God] throughout the night, prostrating himself or standing [in prayer], ever- mindful of the life to come, and hoping for his Sustainer‚Äôs grace?‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúCan they who know and they who do not know be deemed equal?‚Äù [But] only they who are endowed with insight keep this in mind!
4068: Say: ‚Äú[Thus speaks God:] ‚ÄòO you servants of Mine who have attained to faith! Be conscious of your Sustainer! Ultimate good awaits those who per¬≠severe in doing good in this world. And [remember:] wide is God‚Äôs earth, [and,] verily, they who are patient in adversity will be given their reward in full, beyond all reckoning!‚Äô‚Äù
4069: Say [O Muhammad]: ‚ÄúBehold, I am bidden to worship God, sincere in my faith in Him alone;
4070: and I am bidden to be foremost among those who surrender themselves unto God.‚Äù
4071: Say: ‚ÄúBehold, I would dread, were I to rebel against my Sustainer, the suffering [which would befall me] on that awesome Day [of Judgment].‚Äù
4072: Say: ‚ÄúGod alone do I worship, sincere in my faith in Him alone -
4073: and [it is up to you, O sinners, to] worship whatever you please instead of Him!‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúBehold, the [true] losers will be they who shall have lost their own selves and their kith and kin on Resurrection Day: for is not this, this, the [most] obvious loss?
4074: Clouds of fire will they have above them, and [similar] clouds beneath them‚Ä¶‚Äù In this way does God imbue His servants with fear. O you servants of Mine! Be, then, conscious of Me -
4075: seeing that for those who shun the powers of evil lest they [be tempted to] worship them, and turn unto God instead, there is the glad tiding [of happiness in the life to come]. Give, then, this glad tiding to [those of] My ser¬≠vants
4076: who listen [closely] to all that is said, and follow the best of it: [for] it is they whom God has graced with His guidance, and it is they who are [truly] endowed with insight!
4077: On the other hand, could one on whom [God‚Äôs] sentence of suffering has been passed [be rescued by man]? Couldst thou, perchance, save one who is [already, as it were,] in the fire?
4078: As against this they who of their Sustainer are conscious shall [in the life to come] have man¬≠sions raised upon mansions high, beneath which run¬≠ning waters flow: [this is] God‚Äôs promise - [and] never does God fail to fulfill His promise.
4079: ART THOU NOT aware that it is God who sends down water from the skies, and then causes it to travel through the earth in the shape of springs? And then He brings forth thereby herbage of various hues; and then it withers, and thou canst see it turn yellow; and in the end He causes it to crumble to dust. Verily, in [all] this there is indeed a reminder to those who are endowed with insight!
4080: Could, then, one whose bosom God has opened wide with willingness towards self-surrender unto Him, so that he is illumined by a light [that flows] from his Sustainer, [be likened to the blind and deaf of heart]? Woe, then, unto those whose hearts are hardened against all remembrance of God! They are most obviously lost in error!
4081: God bestows from on high the best of all teachings in the shape of a divine writ fully consistent within itself, repeating each statement [of the truth] in manifold forms [a divine writ] whereat shiver the skins of all who of their Sustainer stand in awe: [but] in the end their skins and their hearts do soften at the remembrance of [the grace of] God. Such is God‚Äôs guidance: He guides therewith him that wills [to be guided] whereas he whom God lets go astray can never find any guide
4082: Could, then, one who shall have nothing but is [bare] face to protect him from the awful suffering [that will befall him] on Resurrection Day [be likened to the God-conscious]? [On that Day,] the evildoers will be told: ‚ÄúTaste [now] what you have earned [in life]!‚Äù
4083: Those who lived before them did [too] give the lie to the truth - whereupon suffering befell them without their having perceived whence it came:
4084: and thus God let them taste ignominy [even] in the life of this world. Yet [how] much greater will be the [sinners‚Äô] suffering in the life to come - if they [who now deny the truth] but knew it!
4085: THUS, INDEED, have We propounded unto men all kinds of parables in this Qur‚Äôan, so that they might bethink themselves; [and We have revealed it]
4086: as a discourse in the Arabic tongue, free of all devious¬≠ness, so that they might become conscious of God.
4087: [To this end,] God sets forth a parable: A man who has for his masters several partners, [all of them] at variance with one another, and a man depending wholly on one person: can these two be deemed equal as regards their condition? [Nay,] all praise is due to God [alone]: but most of them do not understand this.
4088: Yet, verily, thou art bound to die, [O Muhammad,] and, verily, they, too, are bound to die:
4089: and then, behold, on the Day of Resurrection you all shall place your dispute before your Sustainer.
4090: And who could be more wicked than he who invents lies about God? and gives the lie to the truth as soon as it has been placed before him? Is not hell the [proper] abode for all who deny the truth?
4091: But he who brings the truth, and he who wholeheartedly accepts it as true - it is they, they, who are [truly] conscious of Him!
4092: All that they have ever yearned for awaits them with their Sustainer: such will be the reward of the doers of good.
4093: And to this end, God will efface from their record the worst that they ever did, and give them their reward in accordance with the best that they were doing [in life].
4094: IS NOT God enough for His servant? And yet, they would frighten thee with those [imaginary divine powers which they worship] beside Him! But he whom God lets go astray can never find any guide,
4095: whereas he whom God guides aright can never be led astray. Is not God almighty, an avenger of evil?
4096: And thus it is [with most people]: if thou ask them, ‚ÄúWho is it that has created the heavens and the earth?‚Äù - they will surely answer, ‚ÄúGod.‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúHave you, then, ever considered what it is that you invoke instead of God? If God wills that harm should befall me, could those [imaginary powers] remove the harm inflicted by Him? Or, if He wills that grace should alight on me, could they withhold His grace [from me]?‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúGod is enough for me! In Him [alone] place their trust all who have trust [in His existence].‚Äù
4097: Say: ‚ÄúO my [truth-denying] people! Do yet all that may be within your power, [whereas] I, behold, shall labour [in God‚Äôs way]: in time you will come to know
4098: who it is that shall be visited [in this world] by suffering which will cover him with ignominy, and upon whom long-lasting suffering shall alight [in the life to come]!‚Äù
4099: BEHOLD, from on high have We bestowed upon thee this divine writ, setting forth the truth for [the benefit of all] mankind. And whoever chooses to be guided [thereby], does so for his own good, and whoever chooses to go astray, goes but astray to his own hurt; and thou hast not the power to determine their fate.
4100: It is God [alone that has this power - He] who causes all human beings to die at the time of their [bodily] death, and [causes to be as dead], during their sleep, those that have not yet died: thus, He withholds [from life] those upon whom He has decreed death, and lets the others go free for a term set [by Him]. In [all] this, behold, there are messages indeed for people who think!
4101: And yet, they choose [to worship], side by side with God, [imaginary] intercessors!‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúWhy - even though they have no power over anything, and no understanding?‚Äù
4102: Say: ‚ÄúGod‚Äôs alone is [the power to bestow the right of] intercession: His [alone] is the dominion over the heavens and the earth; and, in the end, Unto Him you will all be brought back.‚Äù
4103: And yet, whenever God alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who will not believe in the life to come contract with bitter aversion - whereas, when those [imaginary powers] are mentioned side by side with Him, lo, they rejoice!
4104: Say: ‚ÄúO God! Originator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of all that is beyond the reach of a created being‚Äôs perception, as well as of all that can be witnessed by a creature‚Äôs senses or mind! It is Thou who wilt judge between Thy servants [on Resurrection Day] with regard to all on which they were wont to differ!‚Äù
4105: But if those who are bent on evildoing posses¬≠sed all that is on earth, and twice as much, they would surely offer it as ransom from the awful suffering [that will befall them] on the Day of Resur¬≠rection: for, something with which they had not reckoned before will [by then] have been made obvious to them by God;
4106: and obvious to them will have become the evil that they had wrought [in life]: and thus shall they be overwhelmed by the very truth which they were wont to deride.
4107: NOW [thus it is:] when affliction befalls man, he cries out unto Us for help; but when We bestow upon him a boon by Our grace, he says [to himself], ‚ÄúI have been given [all] this by virtue of [my own] wisdom!‚Äù Nay, this [bestowal of grace] is a trial: but most of them understand it not!
4108: The same did say [to themselves many of] those who lived before their time; but of no avail to them was all that they had ever achieved:
4109: for all the evil deeds that they had wrought fell [back] upon them. And [the same will happen to] people of the present time who are bent on wrongdoing: all the evil deeds that they have ever wrought will fall [back] upon them, and never will they be able to elude [God]!
4110: Are they, then, not aware that it is God who grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, unto whomever He wills? In this, behold, there are messages indeed for peo¬≠ple who will believe!
4111: SAY: ‚Äú[Thus speaks God:] ‚ÄòO you servants of Mine who have transgressed against your own selves! Despair not of God‚Äôs mercy: behold, God forgives all sins - for, verily, He alone is much-forgiving, a dis¬≠penser of grace!‚Äô‚Äù
4112: Hence, turn towards your Sustainer [alone] and surrender yourselves unto Him ere the suffering [of death and resurrection] comes upon you, for then you will not be succoured.
4113: And ere that suffering comes upon you of a sudden, without your being aware [of its approach], follow the most goodly [teaching] that has been revealed unto you by your Sustainer,
4114: lest any human being should say [on Judgment Day], ‚ÄúAlas for me for having been remiss in what is due to God, and for having been indeed one of those who scoffed [at the truth]!‚Äù
4115: or lest he should say, ‚ÄúIf God had but guided me, I would surely have been among those who are conscious of Him!‚Äù-
4116: or lest he should say, when he becomes aware of the suffering [that awaits him], ‚ÄúWould that I had a second chance [in life], so that I could be among the doers of good!‚Äù
4117: [But God will reply:] ‚ÄúYea, indeed! My mes¬≠sages did come unto thee; but thou gavest them the lie, and wert filled with false pride, and wert among those who deny the truth!‚Äù
4118: And [so,] on the Day of Resurrection thou wilt see all who invented lies about God [with] their faces darkened [by grief and ignominy]. Is not hell the [proper] abode for all who are given to false pride?
4119: But God will safeguard all who were conscious of Him, [and will grant them happiness] by virtue of their [inner] triumphs; no evil shall ever touch them, and neither shall they grieve.
4120: GOD is the Creator of all things, and He alone has the power to determine the fate of all things.
4121: His are the keys [to the mysteries] of the heavens and the earth: and they who are bent on denying the truth of God‚Äôs messages - it is they, they, who are the losers!
4122: Say: ‚ÄúIs it, then, something other than God that you bid me to worship, O you who are unaware [of right and wrong]?‚Äù
4123: And yet, it has already been revealed to thee [O man,] as well as to those who lived before thee, that if thou ever ascribe divine powers to aught but God, all thy works shall most certainly have been in vain: for [in the life to come] thou shalt most certainly be among the lost.
4124: Nay, but thou shalt worship God [alone], and be among those who are grateful [to Him]!
4125: And no true understanding of God have they [who worship aught beside Him], inasmuch as the whole of the earth will be as a [mere] handful to Him on Resurrection Day, and the heavens will be rolled up in His right hand: limitless is He in His glory, and sublimely exalted above anything to which they may ascribe a share in His divinity!
4126: And [on that Day,] the trumpet [of judgment] will be sounded, and all [creatures] that are in the heavens and all that are on earth will fall down senseless, unless they be such as God wills [to exempt]. And then it will sound again - and lo! standing [before the Seat of Judgment], they will begin to see [the truth]!
4127: And the earth will shine bright with her Sus¬≠tainer‚Äôs light. And the record [of everyone‚Äôs deeds] will be laid bare, and all the prophets will be brought forward, and all [other] witnesses; and judgment will be passed on them all in justice. And they will not be wronged,
4128: for every human being will be repaid in full for whatever [good or evil] he has done: and He is fully aware of all that they do.
4129: And those who were bent on denying the truth will be urged on in throngs towards hell till, when they reach it, its gates will be opened, and its keepers will ask them, ‚ÄúHave there not come to you apostles from among yourselves, who conveyed to you your Sustainer‚Äôs messages and warned you of the coming of this your Day [of Judgment]?‚Äù They will answer: ‚ÄúYea, indeed!‚Äù But the sentence of suffering will [already] have fallen due upon the deniers of the truth;
4130: [and] they will be told, ‚ÄúEnter the gates of hell, therein to abide!‚Äù And how vile an abode for those who were given to false pride!
4131: But those who were conscious of their Sus¬≠tainer will be urged on in throngs towards paradise till, when they reach it, they shall find its gates wide- open; and its keepers will say unto them, ‚ÄúPeace be upon you! Well have you done: enter, then, this [paradise], herein to abide!‚Äù
4132: And they will exclaim: ‚ÄúAll praise is due to God, who has made His promise to us come true, and has bestowed upon us this expanse [of bliss] as our portion, so that we may dwell in paradise as we please!‚Äù And how excellent a reward will it be for those who laboured [in God‚Äôs way]!
4133: And thou wilt see the angels surrounding the throne of [God‚Äôs] almightiness, extolling their Sus¬≠tainer‚Äôs glory and praise. And judgment will have been passed in justice on all [who had lived and died], and the word will be spoken: ‚ÄúAll praise is due to God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!‚Äù
4135: THE BESTOWAL from on high of this divine writ issues from God, the Almighty, the All-Know¬≠ing,
4136: forgiving sins and accepting repentance, severe in retribution, limitless in His bounty. There is no deity save Him: with Him is all jour¬≠neys‚Äô end.
4137: NONE BUT THOSE who are bent on denying the truth would call God‚Äôs messages in question. But let it not deceive thee that they seem to be able to do as they please on earth:
4138: to the truth gave the lie, before their time, the people of Noah and, after them, all those [others] who were leagued together [against God‚Äôs message-bearers]; and each of those com¬≠munities schemed against the apostle sent unto them, aiming to lay hands on him; and they contended [against his message] with fallacious arguments, so as to render void the truth thereby: but then I took them to task - and how awesome was My retribution!
4139: And thus shall thy Sustainer‚Äôs word come true against all who are bent on denying the truth: they shall find themselves in the fire [of hell].
4140: THEY WHO BEAR [within themselves the knowl¬≠edge of] the throne of [God‚Äôs] almightiness, as well as all who are near it, extol their Sustainer‚Äôs limitless glory and praise, and have faith in Him, and ask forgiveness for all [others] who have attained to faith: ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! Thou embracest all things within [Thy] grace and knowledge: forgive, then, their sins unto those who repent and follow Thy path, and preserve them from suffering through the blazing fire!
4141: ‚ÄúAnd, O our Sustainer, bring them into the gardens of perpetual bliss which Thou hast promised them, together with the righteous from among their forebears, and their spouses, and their offspring - for, verily, Thou alone art almighty, truly wise ‚Äì
4142: and preserve them from [doing] evil deeds: for anyone whom on that Day [of Judgment] Thou wilt have preserved from [the taint of] evil deeds, him wilt Thou have graced with Thy mercy: and that, that will be the triumph supreme!‚Äù
4143: [But,] behold, as for those who are bent on denying the truth - [on that same Day] a voice will call out unto them: ‚ÄúIndeed, greater than your [present] loathing of yourselves was God‚Äôs loathing of you [at the time] when you were called unto faith but went on denying the truth!‚Äù
4144: [Whereupon] they will exclaim: ‚ÄúO our Sus¬≠tainer! Twice hast Thou caused us to die, just as twice Thou hast brought us to life!
4145: [And they will be told:] ‚ÄúThis [has befallen you] because, whenever the One God was invoked, you denied this truth; whereas, when divinity was ascribed to aught beside Him, you believed [in it]! But all judgment rests with God, the Exalted, the Great!‚Äù
4146: HE IT IS who shows you His wonders [in all nature], and sends down sustenance for you from the sky: but none bethinks himself [thereof] save those who are wont to turn to God.
4147: Invoke, then, God, sincere in your faith in Him alone, however hateful this may be to those who deny the truth!
4148: High above all orders [of being] is He, in almightiness enthroned. By His Own will does He bestow inspiration upon whomever He wills of His servants, so as to warn [all human beings of the coming] of the Day when they shall meet Him
4149: the Day when they shall come forth [from death], with nothing of themselves hidden from God. With whom will sovereignty rest on that Day? With God, the One who holds absolute sway over all that exists!
4150: On that Day will every human being be requited for what he has earned: no wrong [will be done] on that Day: verily, swift in reckoning is God!
4151: Hence, warn them of that Day which draws ever nearer, when the hearts will chokingly come up to the throats: no loving friend will the evildoers have, nor any intercessor who would be heeded:
4152: [for] He is aware of the [most] stealthy glance, and of all that the hearts would conceal.
4153: And God will judge in accordance with truth and justice, whereas those [beings] whom they invoke beside Him cannot judge at all: for, verily, God alone is all-hearing, all-seeing.
4154: Have they, then, never journeyed about the earth and beheld what happened in the end to those [deniers of the truth] who lived before their time? Greater were they in power than they are, and in the impact which they left on earth: but God took them to task for their sins, and they had none to defend them against God:
4155: this, because their apostles had come to them with all evidence of the truth, and yet they rejected it: and so God took them to task - for, verily, He is powerful, severe in retribution!
4156: THUS, INDEED, did We send Moses with Our mes¬≠sages and a manifest authority [from Us]
4157: unto Pharaoh, and Haman, and Qarun; but they [only] said, ‚ÄúA spellbinder is he, a liar!‚Äù
4158: Now [as for Pharaoh and his followers,] when he came to them, setting forth the truth from Us, they said, ‚ÄúSlay the sons of those who share his beliefs, and spare [only] their women!‚Äù - but the guile of those deniers of the truth could not lead to aught but failure.
4159: And Pharaoh said: ‚ÄúLeave it to me to slay Moses - and let him invoke his [alleged] sustainer! Behold, I fear lest he cause you to change your religion, or lest he cause corruption to prevail in the land!‚Äù
4160: But Moses said: ‚ÄúWith [Him who is] my Sus¬≠tainer as well as your Sustainer have I indeed found refuge from everyone who, immersed in false pride, will not believe in [the coming of] the Day of Reckon¬≠ing!‚Äù
4161: At that, a believing man of Pharaoh‚Äôs family, who [until then] had concealed his faith, exclaimed: ‚ÄúWould you slay a man because he says, ‚ÄòGod is my Sustainer‚Äô - seeing, withal, that he has brought you all evidence of this truth from your Sustainer? Now if he be a liar, his lie will fall back on him; but if he is a man of truth, something [of the punishment] whereof he warns you is bound to befall you: for, verily, God would not grace with His guidance one who has wasted his own self by lying [about Him].
4162: ‚ÄúO my people! Yours is the dominion today, [and] most eminent are you on earth: but who will rescue us from God‚Äôs punishment, once it befalls us?‚Äù Said Pharaoh: ‚ÄúI but want to make you see what I see myself; and I would never make you follow any path but that of rectitude!‚Äù
4163: Thereupon exclaimed he who had attained to faith: ‚ÄúO my people! Verily, I fear for you the like of what one day befell those others who were leagued together [against God‚Äôs truth] ‚Äì
4164: the like of what happened to Noah‚Äôs people, and to [the tribes of] Ad and Thamud and those who came after them! And, withal, God does not will any wrong for His crea¬≠tures.
4165: ‚ÄúAnd, O my people, I fear for you [the coming of] that Day of [Judgment - the Day when you will be] calling unto one another [in distress] ‚Äì
4166: the Day when you will [wish to] turn your backs and flee, having none to defend you against God: for he whom God lets go astray can never find any guide.
4167: ‚ÄúAnd [remember:] it was to you that Joseph came aforetime with all evidence of the truth; but you never ceased to throw doubt on all [the messages] that he brought you - so much so that when he died, you said, ‚ÄòNever will God send any apostle [even] after him!‚Äô ‚ÄúIn this way God lets go astray such as waste their own selves by throwing suspicion [on His revela¬≠tions] ‚Äì
4168: such as would call God‚Äôs messages in question without having any evidence therefor: [a sin] exceedingly loathsome in the sight of God and of those who have attained to faith. It is in this way that God sets a seal on every arrogant, self-exalting heart.‚Äù
4169: But Pharaoh said: ‚ÄúO Haman! Build me a lofty tower, that haply I may attain to the [right] means
4170: the means of approach to the heavens - and that [thus] I may have a look at the god of Moses: for, behold, I am indeed certain that he is a liar!‚Äù And thus, goodly seemed unto Pharaoh the evil of his own doings, and so he was barred from the path [of truth]: and Pharaoh‚Äôs guile did not lead to aught but ruin.
4171: Still, the man who had attained to faith went on: ‚ÄúO my people! Follow me: I shall guide you onto the path of rectitude!
4172: ‚ÄúO my people! This worldly life is but a brief enjoyment, whereas, behold, the life to come is the home abiding.
4173: [There,] anyone who has done a bad deed will be requited with no more than the like thereof, whereas anyone, be it man or woman, who has done righteous deeds and is a believer withal - all such will enter paradise, wherein they shall be blest with good beyond all reckoning!
4174: ‚ÄúAnd, O my people, how is it that I summon you to salvation, the while you summon me to the fire?
4175: - [for] you call upon me to deny [the one¬≠ness of] God and to ascribe a share in His divinity to aught of which I cannot [possibly] have any knowl¬≠edge the while I summon you to [a cognition of] the Almighty, the All-Forgiving!
4176: ‚ÄúThere is no doubt that what you summon me to is something that has no claim to being invoked either in this world or in the life to come - as [there is no doubt] that unto God is our return, and that they who have wasted their own selves shall find them¬≠selves in the fire:
4177: and at that time you will [have cause to] remember what I am telling you [now]. ‚ÄúBut [as for me,] I commit myself unto God: for, verily, God sees all that is in [the hearts of] His servants.‚Äù
4178: And God preserved him from the evil of their scheming, whereas suffering vile was to encompass Pharaoh‚Äôs folk:
4179: the fire [of the hereafter - that fire] which they had been made to contemplate [in vain], morning and evening: for on the Day when the Last Hour dawns [God will say], ‚ÄúMake Phar¬≠aoh‚Äôs folk enter upon suffering most severe!‚Äù
4180: AND LO! They [who in life were wont to deny the truth] will contend with one another in the fire [of the hereafter]; and then the weak will say unto those who had gloried in their arrogance, ‚ÄúBehold, we were but your followers: can you, then, relieve us of some [of our] share of this fire?‚Äù
4181: [to which] they who had [once] been arrogant will reply, ‚ÄúBehold, we are all in it [together]! Verily, God has judged between His creatures!‚Äù
4182: And they who are in the fire will say to the keepers of hell, ‚ÄúPray unto your Sustainer that He lighten, [though it be] for one day [only], this suffering of ours!‚Äù
4183: [But the keepers of hell] will ask, ‚ÄúIs it not [true] that your apostles came unto you with all evidence of the truth?‚Äù Those [in the fire] will reply, ‚ÄúYea, indeed.‚Äù [And the keepers of hell] will say, ‚ÄúPray, then!‚Äù - for the prayer of those who deny the truth cannot lead to aught but delusion.
4184: BEHOLD, We shall indeed succour Our apostles and those who have attained to faith, [both] in this world‚Äôs life and on the Day when all the witnesses shall stand up
4185: the Day when their excuses will be of no avail to the evildoers, seeing that their lot will be rejection from all that is good, and a woeful hereafter.
4186: And, indeed, We bestowed aforetime [Our] guidance on Moses, and [thus] made the children of Israel heirs to the divine writ [revealed to him]
4187: as a [means of] guidance and a reminder for those who were endowed with insight:
4188: hence, remain thou patient in adversity - for, verily, God‚Äôs promise always comes true - and ask forgiveness for thy sins, and extol thy Sustainer‚Äôs glory and praise by night and by day.
4189: Behold, as for those who call God‚Äôs messages in question without having any evidence therefore in their hearts is nothing but overweening self-con¬≠ceit, which they will never be able to satisfy: seek thou, then, refuge with God - for, verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-seeing!
4190: Greater indeed than the creation of man is the creation of the heavens and the earth: yet most men do not understand [what this implies].
4191: But [then,] the blind and the seeing are not equal; and neither [can] they who have attained to faith and do good works and the doers of evil [be deemed equal]. How seldom do you keep this in mind!
4192: Verily, the Last Hour is sure to come: of this there is no doubt; yet most men will not believe it.
4193: But your Sustainer says: ‚ÄúCall unto Me, [and] I shall respond to you! Verily, they who are too proud to worship Me will enter hell, abased!‚Äù
4194: IT IS GOD who has made the night for you, so that you might rest therein, and the day, to make [you] see. Behold, God is indeed limitless in His bounty unto man - but most men are ungrateful.
4195: Such is God, your Sustainer, the Creator of all that exists: there is no deity save Him. How perverted, then, are your minds!
4196: [For] thus it is: perverted are the minds of those who knowingly reject God‚Äôs messages.
4197: It is God who has made the earth a resting- place for you and the sky a canopy, and has formed you - and formed you so well and provided for you sustenance out of the good things of life. Such is God, your Sustainer: hallowed, then, is God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!
4198: He is the Ever-Living; there is no deity save Him: call, then, unto Him [alone], sincere in your faith in Him. All praise is due to God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!
4199: Say: ‚ÄúSince all evidence of the truth has come to me from my Sustainer, I am forbidden to worship [any of] those beings whom you invoke instead of God; and I am bidden to surrender myself to the Sustainer of all the worlds.‚Äù
4200: It is He who creates you out of dust, and then out of a drop of sperm, and then out of a germ-cell; and then He brings you forth as children; and then [He ordains] that you reach maturity, and then, that you grow old - though some of you [He causes to] die earlier -: and [all this He ordains] so that you might reach a term set [by Him], and that you might [learn to] use your reason.
4201: It is He who grants life and deals death; and when He wills a thing to be, He but says unto it, ‚ÄúBe‚Äù - and it is.
4202: ART THOU NOT aware of how far they who call God‚Äôs messages in question have lost sight of the truth?
4203: they who give the lie to this divine writ and [thus] to all [the messages] with which We sent forth Our apostles [of old]? But in time they will come to know [how blind they have been: they will know it on Judgment Day],
4204: when they shall have to carry the shackles and chains [of their own making] around their necks,
4205: and are dragged into burning despair, and in the end become fuel for the fire [of hell].
4206: And then they will be asked: ‚ÄúWhere now are those [powers] to which you were wont to ascribe divinity
4207: side by side with God?‚Äù They will answer: ‚ÄúThey have forsaken us - or, rather, what we were wont to invoke aforetime did not exist at all!‚Äù And they will be told:] ‚ÄúIt is thus that God lets the deniers of the truth go astray:
4208: this is an out¬≠come of your having arrogantly exulted on earth without any [concern for what is] right, and of your having been so full of self-conceit!
4209: Enter [now] the gates of hell, therein to abide: and how vile an abode for all who are given to false pride!‚Äù
4210: HENCE, remain thou patient in adversity - for, verily, God‚Äôs promise always comes true. And whether We show thee [in this world] something of what We hold in store for those [deniers of the truth], or whether We cause thee to die [ere that retribution takes place - know that, in the end], it is unto Us that they will be brought back.
4211: And, indeed, [O Muhammad,] We sent forth apostles before thy time; some of them We have mentioned to thee, and some of them We have not mentioned to thee. And it was not given to any apostle to bring forth a miracle other than by God‚Äôs leave. Yet when God‚Äôs will becomes manifest, judgment will [already] have been passed in all justice, and lost will be, then and there, all who tried to reduce to nothing [whatever they could not understand].
4212: It is God who [at all times works wonders for you: thus, He] provides for you [all manner of] livestock, so that on some of them you may ride, and from some derive your food,
4213: and find [yet other] benefits in them; and that through them you may attain to the fulfillment of [many] a heartfelt need: for on them, as on ships, you are borne [through life].
4214: And [thus] He displays His wonders before you: which, then, of God‚Äôs wonders can you still deny?
4215: HAVE THEY, then, never journeyed about the earth and beheld what happened in the end to those [deniers of the truth] who lived before their time? More numerous were they, and greater in power than they are, and in the impact which they left on earth: but all that they ever achieved was of no avail to them ‚Äì
4216: for when their apostles came to them with all evidence of the truth, they arrogantly exulted in whatever knowledge they [already] possessed: and [so, in the end,] they were overwhelmed by the very thing which they were wont to deride.
4217: And then, when they [clearly] beheld Our punishment, they said: ‚ÄúWe have come to believe in the One God, and we have renounced all belief in that to which we were wont to ascribe a share in His divinity!‚Äù
4218: But their attaining to faith after they had beheld Our punishment could not possibly benefit them such being the way of God that has always obtained for His creatures -: and so, then and there, lost were they who had denied the truth.
4220: THE BESTOWAL from on high [of this revelation] issues from the Most Gracious, the Dis¬≠penser of Grace:
4221: a divine writ, the messages whereof have been clearly spelled out as a discourse in the Arabic tongue for people of [innate] knowl¬≠edge,
4222: to be a herald of glad tidings as well as a warning. And yet, [whenever this divine writ is offered to men,] most of them turn away, so that they cannot hear [its message];
4223: and so they say, [as it were:] ‚ÄúOur hearts are veiled from whatever thou callest us to, [O Muhammad,] and in our ears is deafness, and between us and thee is a barrier. Do, then, [whatever thou wilt, whereas,] behold, we shall do [as we have always done]!‚Äù
4224: Say thou, [O Prophet:] ‚ÄúI am but a mortal like you. It has been revealed to me that your God is the One God: go, then, straight towards Him and seek His forgiveness!‚Äù And woe unto those who ascribe divinity to aught beside Him,
4225: [and] those who do not spend in charity: for it is they, they who [thus] deny the truth of the life to come!
4226: [But,] verily, they who have attained to faith and do good works shall have a reward unending!
4227: SAY: ‚ÄúWould you indeed deny Him who has created the earth in two aeons? And do you claim that there is any power that could rival Him, the Sustainer of all the worlds?‚Äù
4228: For He [it is who, after creating the earth,] placed firm mountains on it, [towering] above its surface, and bestowed [so many] blessings on it, and equitably apportioned its means of subsistence to all who would seek it: [and all this He created] in four aeons.
4229: And He [it is who] applied His design to the skies, which were [yet but] smoke; and He [it is who] said to them and to the earth, ‚ÄúCome [into being], both of you, willingly or unwillingly!‚Äù - to which both responded, ‚ÄúWe do come in obedience.‚Äù
4230: And He [it is who] decreed that they become seven heavens in two aeons, and imparted unto each heaven its function. And We adorned the skies nearest to the earth with lights, and made them secure: such is the ordaining of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.
4231: BUT IF they turn away, say: ‚ÄúI warn you of [the coming of] a thunderbolt of punishment like the thunderbolt [that fell upon the tribes] of Ad and Thamud!‚Äù
4232: Lo! There came unto them [God‚Äôs] apostles, speaking of what lay open before them and what was [still] beyond their ken, [and calling unto them,] ‚ÄúWorship none but God!‚Äù They answered: ‚ÄúIf our Sustainer had willed [us to believe in what you say], He would have sent down angels [as His message-bearers]. As it is, behold, we deny that there is any truth in what you [claim to] have been sent with!‚Äù
4233: Now as for [the tribe of] Ad, they walked arrogantly on earth, [offending] against all right, and saying, ‚ÄúWho could have a power greater than ours?‚Äù Why - were they, then, not aware that God, who created them, had a power greater than theirs? But they went on rejecting Our messages;
4234: and thereupon We let loose upon them a storm wind raging through days of misfortune, so as to give them, in the life of this world, a foretaste of suffering through humiliation: but [their] suffering in the life to come will be far more humiliating, and they will have none to succour them.
4235: And as for [the tribe of] Thamud, We offered them guidance, but they chose blindness in pre¬≠ference to guidance: and so the thunderbolt of shame¬≠ful suffering fell upon them as an outcome of all [the evil] that they had wrought;
4236: and We saved [only] those who had attained to faith and were conscious of Us.
4237: Hence, [warn all men of] the Day when the enemies of God shall be gathered together before the fire, and then shall be driven onward,
4238: till, when they come close to it, their hearing and their sight and their [very] skins will bear witness against them, speaking of what they were doing [on earth].
4239: And they will ask their skins, ‚ÄúWhy did you bear witness against us?‚Äù - [and] these will reply: ‚ÄúGod, who gives speech to all things, has given speech to us [as well]: for He [it is who] has created you in the first instance - and unto Him you are [now] brought back.
4240: And you did not try to hide [your sins] lest your hearing or your sight or your skins bear witness against you: nay, but you thought that God did not know much of what you were doing ‚Äì
4241: and that very thought which you thought about your Sustainer has brought you to perdition, and so now you find yourselves among the lost!‚Äù
4242: And then, [even] if they endure [their lot] in patience, the fire will still be their abode; and if they pray to be allowed to make amends, they will not be allowed to do so:
4243: for [when they became obli¬≠vious of Us,] We assigned to them [their own evil impulses as their] other selves, and these made appear goodly to them whatever lay open before them and whatever was beyond their ken. And so, the sentence [of doom] will have fallen due upon them together with the [other sinful] com¬≠munities of invisible beings and humans that passed away before their time: verily, they [all] will indeed be lost!
4244: NOW THOSE who are bent on denying the truth say [unto one another]: ‚ÄúDo not listen to this Qur‚Äôan, but rather talk frivolously about it, so that you might gain the upper hand!‚Äù
4245: But We shall most certainly give those who are [thus] bent on denying the truth a taste of suffering severe, and We shall most certainly requite them according to the worst of their deeds!
4246: That requital of God‚Äôs enemies will be the fire [of the hereafter]: in it will they have an abode of immeasurable duration as an outcome of their having knowingly rejected Our messages.
4247: And they who [in their life on earth] were bent on denying the truth will [thereupon] exclaim: ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! Show us those of the invisible beings and humans that have led us astray: we shall trample them underfoot, so that they shall be the lowest of all!‚Äù
4248: [But,] behold, as for those who say, ‚ÄúOur Sustainer is God,‚Äù and then steadfastly pursue the right way - upon them do angels often descend, [say¬≠ing:] ‚ÄúFear not and grieve not, but receive the glad tiding of that paradise which has been promised to you!
4249: We are close unto you in the life of this world and [will be so] in the life to come; and in that [life to come] you shall have all that your souls may desire, and in it you shall have all that you ever prayed for,
4250: as a ready welcome from Him who is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!‚Äù
4251: And who could be better of speech than he who calls [his fellow-men] unto God, and does what is just and right, and says, ‚ÄúVerily, I am of those who have surrendered themselves to God‚Äù?
4252: But [since] good and evil cannot be equal, repel thou [evil] with something that is better and lo! he between whom and thyself was enmity [may then become] as though he had [always] been close [unto thee], a true friend!
4253: Yet [to achieve] this is not given to any but those who are wont to be patient in adversity: it is not given to any but those endowed with the greatest good fortune!
4254: Hence, if it should happen that a prompting from Satan stirs thee up [to blind anger], seek refuge with God: behold, He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing!
4255: Now among His signs are the night and the day, as well as the sun and the moon: [hence,] adore not the sun or the moon, but prostrate yourselves in adoration before God, who has created them - if it is Him whom you [really] worship.
4256: And though some be too proud [to listen to this call], they who [in their hearts] are with thy Sustainer extol His limitless glory by night and by day, and never grow weary [thereof].
4257: For among His signs is this: thou seest the earth lying desolate - and lo! when We send down water upon it, it stirs and swells [with life]! Verily, He who brings it to life can surely give life to the dead [of heart as well]: for, behold, He has the power to will anything.
4258: VERILY, they who distort the meaning of Our mes¬≠sages are not hidden from Us: hence, which [of the two] will be in a better state - he that is [destined to be] cast into the fire, or he that shall come secure [before Us] on Resurrection Day? Do what you will: verily, He sees all that you do.
4259: Verily, they who are bent on denying the truth of this reminder as soon as it comes to them - [they are the losers]: for, behold, it is a sublime divine writ:
4260: no falsehood can ever attain to it openly, and neither in a stealthy manner, [since it is] bestowed from on high by One who is truly wise, ever to be praised.
4261: [And as for thee, O Prophet,] nothing is being said to thee but what was said to all [of God‚Äôs] apostles before thy time. Behold, thy Sustainer is indeed full of forgiveness - but He has also the power to requite most grie¬≠vously!
4262: Now if We had willed this [divine writ] to be a discourse in a non-Arabic tongue, they [who now reject it] would surely have said, ‚ÄúWhy is it that its messages have not been spelled out clearly? Why - [a message in] a non-Arabic tongue, and [its bearer] an Arab?‚Äù Say: ‚ÄúUnto all who have attained to faith, this [divine writ] is a guidance and a source of health; but as for those who will not believe - in their ears is deafness, and so it remains obscure to them: they are [like people who are] being called from too far away.
4263: Thus, too, have We vouchsafed revelation unto Moses aforetime, and thereupon disputes arose about it. And [then, as now,] had it not been for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Sustainer, all would indeed have been decided between them [from the outset]. As it is, behold, they [who will not believe in this divine writ] are in grave doubt, amounting to suspicion, about what it portends.
4264: WHOEVER does what is just and right, does so for his own good; and whoever does evil, does so to his own hurt: and never does God do the least wrong to His creatures.
4265: In Him alone is vested the knowledge of when the Last Hour will come. And no fruit bursts forth from its calyx, and no female ever conceives, nor ever gives birth, save with His knowledge. And so, on the Day when He shall call out to them, ‚ÄúWhere, now, are those [alleged] partners of Mine?‚Äù - they will [surely] answer, ‚ÄúWe confess unto Thee that none of us can bear witness [to anyone‚Äôs having a share in Thy divinity]!‚Äù
4266: And so, all that they were wont to invoke aforetime will have forsaken them; and they shall know for certain that there is no escape for them.
4267: MAN NEVER TIRES of asking for the good [things of life]; and if evil fortune touches him, he abandons all hope, giving himself up to despair.
4268: Yet whenever We let him taste some of Our grace after hardship has visited him, he is sure to say, ‚ÄúThis is but my due!‚Äù - and, ‚ÄúI do not think that the Last Hour will ever come: but if [it should come, and] I should indeed be brought back unto my Sus¬≠tainer, then, behold, the ultimate good awaits me with Him! But [on the Day of Judgment] We shall most cer¬≠tainly give those who were bent on denying the truth full understanding of all that they ever did, and shall most certainly give them [thereby] a taste of suffering severe.
4269: And, too, when We bestow Our blessings upon man, he tends to turn aside and keep aloof [from remembering Us]; but as soon as evil fortune touches him, he is full of wordy prayers!
4270: HAVE YOU given thought [to how you will fare] if this be truly [a revelation] from God, the while you deny its truth? Who could be more astray than one who places himself [so] deeply in the wrong?
4271: In time We shall make them fully understand Our messages [through what they perceive] in the utmost horizons [of the universe] and within them¬≠selves, so that it will become clear unto them that this [revelation] is indeed the truth. [Still,] is it not enough [for them to know] that thy Sustainer is witness unto everything?
4272: Oh, verily, they are in doubt as to whether they will meet their Sustainer [on Judgment Day]! Oh, verily, He encompasses everything!
4275: THUS has God, the Almighty, the Wise, revealed [the truth] unto thee, [O Muhammad,] and unto those who preceded thee:
4276: His is all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth; and most exalted, tremendous is He.
4277: The uppermost heavens are well-nigh rent asunder [for awe of Him]; and the angels extol their Sustainer‚Äôs limitless glory and praise, and ask for¬≠giveness for all who are on earth. Oh, verily, God alone is truly-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
4278: NOW AS FOR those who take aught beside Him for their protectors - God watches them, and thou art not responsible for their conduct.
4279: [Thou art but entrusted with Our message:] and so We have revealed unto thee a discourse in the Arabic tongue in order that thou mayest warn the foremost of all cities and all who dwell around it to wit, warn [them] of the Day of the Gathering, [the coming of] which is beyond all doubt: [the Day when] some shall find themselves in paradise, and some in the blazing flame.
4280: Now had God so willed, He could surely have made them all one single community: none the less, He admits unto His grace him that wills [to be admitted] whereas the evildoers shall have none to protect them and none to succour them [on Judgment Day].
4281: Did they, perchance, [think that they could] choose protectors other than Him? But God alone is the Protector [of all that exists], since it is He alone who brings the dead to life, and He alone who has the power to will anything.
4282: AND ON WHATEVER you may differ, [O believers,] the verdict thereon rests with God. [Say, therefore:] ‚ÄúSuch is God, my Sustainer: in Him have I placed my trust, and unto Him do I always turn!‚Äù
4283: The Originator [is He] of the heavens and the earth. He has given you mates of your own kind just as [He has willed that] among the beasts [there be] mates - to multiply you thereby: [but] there is nothing like unto Him, and He alone is all-hearing, all-seeing.
4284: His are the keys of the heavens and the earth: He grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, unto whomever He wills: for, behold, He has full knowledge of everything.
4285: In matters of faith, He has ordained for you that which He had enjoined upon Noah - and into which We gave thee [O Muhammad] insight through revelation as well as that which We had enjoined upon Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus: Steadfastly uphold the [true] faith, and do not break up your unity therein. [And even though] that [unity of faith] to which thou callest them appears oppressive to those who are wont to ascribe to other beings or forces a share in His divinity, God draws unto Himself everyone who is willing, and guides unto Himself everyone who turns unto Him.
4286: And [as for the followers of earlier revelation,] they broke up their unity, out of mutual jealousy, only after they had come to know [the truth]. And had it not been for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Sustainer, [postponing all decision] until a term set [by Him], all would indeed have been decided between them [from the outset]. As it is, behold, they who have inherited their divine writ from those who preceded them are [now] in grave doubt, amounting to suspicion, about what it por¬≠tends.
4287: Because of this, then, summon [all mankind], and pursue the right course, as thou hast been bidden [by God]; and do not follow their likes and dislikes, but say: ‚ÄúI believe in whatever revelation God has be¬≠stowed from on high; and I am bidden to bring about equity in your mutual views. God is our Sustainer as well as your Sustainer. To us shall be accounted our deeds, and to you, your deeds. Let there be no contention between us and you: God will bring us all together - for with Him is all journeys‚Äô end.‚Äù
4288: And as for those who would [still] argue about God after He has been acknowledged [by them] all their arguments are null and void in their Sustainer‚Äôs sight, and upon them will fall [His] condemnation, and for them is suffering severe in store:
4289: [for] it is God [Himself] who has bestowed revelation from on high, setting forth the truth, and [thus given man] a balance [wherewith to weigh right and wrong]. And for all thou knowest, the Last Hour may well be near!
4290: Those who do not believe in it [mockingly] ask for its speedy advent whereas those who have attained to faith stand in awe of it, and know it to be the truth. Oh, verily, they who call the Last Hour in question have indeed gone far astray!
4291: GOD is most kind unto His creatures: He provides sustenance for whomever He wills - for He alone is powerful, almighty!
4292: To him who desires a harvest in the life to come, We shall grant an increase in his harvest; whereas to him who desires [but] a harvest in this world, We [may] give something thereof - but he will have no share in [the blessings of] the life to come.
4293: Is it that they [who care for no more than this world] believe in forces supposed to have a share in God‚Äôs divinity, which enjoin upon them as a moral law something that God has never allowed? Now were it not for [God‚Äôs] decree on the final judgment, all would indeed have been decided be¬≠tween them [in this world]: but, verily, grievous suffering awaits the evildoers [in the life to come].
4294: [In that life to come,] thou wilt see the evil¬≠doers full of fear at [the thought of] what they have earned: for [now] it is bound to fall back upon them. And in the flowering meadows of the gardens [of paradise thou wilt see] those who have attained to faith and done righteous deeds: all that they might desire shall they have with their Sustainer: [and] this, this is the great bounty ‚Äì
4295: that [bounty] whereof God gives the glad tiding to such of His servants as attain to faith and do righteous deeds. Say [O Prophet]: ‚ÄúNo reward do I ask of you for this [message] other than [that you should] love your fellow-men.‚Äù For, if anyone gains [the merit of] a good deed, We shall grant him through it an increase of good: and, verily, God is much-forgiving, ever responsive to gratitude.
4296: DO THEY, perchance, say, ‚Äú[Muhammad] has attri¬≠buted his own lying inventions to God‚Äù? But then, had God so willed, He could have sealed thy heart [forever]: for God blots out all falsehood, and by His words proves the truth to be true. Verily, He has full knowledge of what is in the hearts [of men];
4297: and it is He who accepts repen¬≠tance from His servants, and pardons bad deeds, and knows all that you do,
4298: and responds unto all who attain to faith and do righteous deeds; and [it is He who, in the life to come,] will give them, out of His bounty, far more [than they will have deserved], whereas for the deniers of the truth there is [but] suffering severe in store.
4299: For, if God were to grant [in this world] abundant sustenance to [all of] His servants, they would behave on earth with wanton insolence: but as it is, He bestows [His grace] from on high in due measure, as He wills: for, verily, He is fully aware of [the needs of] His creatures, and sees them all.
4300: And it is He who sends down rain after [men] have lost all hope, and unfolds His grace [thereby]: for He alone is [their] Protector, the One to whom all praise is due.
4301: And among His signs is the [very] creation of the heavens and the earth, and of all the living creatures which He has caused to multiply throughout them: and [since He has created them,] He has [also] the power to gather them [unto Him¬≠self] whenever He wills.
4302: Now whatever calamity may befall you [on Judgment Day] will be an outcome of what your own hands have wrought, although He pardons much;
4303: and you cannot elude Him on earth, and you will have none to protect you from God [in the life to come], and none to bring you succour.
4304: And among His signs are the ships that sail like [floating] mountains through the seas:
4305: if He so wills, He stills the wind, and then they lie motion¬≠less on the sea‚Äôs surface - [and] herein, behold, there are messages indeed for all who are wholly patient in adversity and deeply grateful [to God];
4306: or else He may cause them to perish because of what they have wrought; and [withal,] He pardons much.
4307: And let them know, those who call Our mes¬≠sages in question, that for them there is no escape.
4308: AND [remember that] whatever you are given [now] is but for the [passing] enjoyment of life in this world - whereas that which is with God is far better and more enduring. [It shall be given] to all who attain to faith and in their Sustainer place their trust;
4309: and who shun the more heinous sins and abominations; and who, whenever they are moved to anger, readily forgive;
4310: and who respond to [the call of] their Sustainer and are constant in prayer; and whose rule [in all matters of common concern] is consultation among themselves; and who spend on others out of what We provide for them as sustenance;
4311: and who, whenever tyranny afflicts them, defend themselves.
4312: But [remember that an attempt at] requiting evil may, too, become an evil: hence, whoever par¬≠dons [his foe] and makes peace, his reward rests with God - for, verily, He does not love evildoers.
4313: Yet indeed, as for any who defend themselves after having been wronged - no blame whatever attaches to them:
4314: blame attaches but to those who oppress [other] people and behave outrageously on earth, offending against all right: for them there is grievous suffering in store!
4315: But withal, if one is patient in adversity and forgives - this, behold, is indeed something to set one‚Äôs heart upon!
4316: AND [thus it is:] he whom God lets go astray has henceforth no protector whatever: and so thou wilt see such evildoers [on Judgment Day, and wilt hear how] they exclaim as soon as they behold the suffering [that awaits them], ‚ÄúIs there any way of return?‚Äù
4317: And thou wilt see them exposed to that [doom], humbling themselves in abasement, looking [around] with a furtive glance - the while those who had attained to faith will say, ‚ÄúVerily, lost on [this] Day of Resurrection are they who have squandered their own and their followers‚Äô selves!‚Äù Oh, verily, the evildoers will fall into long-lasting suffering,
4318: and will have no protector whatever to succour them against God: for he whom God lets go astray shall find no way [of escape].
4319: [Hence, O men,] respond to your Sustainer before there comes, at God‚Äôs behest, a Day on which there will be no turning back: [for] on that Day you will have no place of refuge, and neither will you be able to deny aught [of the wrong that you have done].
4320: BUT IF they turn away [from thee, O Prophet, know that] We have not sent thee to be their keeper: thou art not bound to do more than deliver the message [entrusted to thee]. And, behold, [such as turn away from Our mes¬≠sages are but impelled by the weakness and incon¬≠stancy of human nature: thus,] when We give man a taste of Our grace, he is prone to exult in it; but if misfortune befalls [any of] them in result of what their own hands have sent forth, then, behold, man shows how bereft he is of all gratitude!
4321: God‚Äôs alone is the dominion over the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He wills: He bestows the gift of female offspring on whomever He wills, and the gift of male offspring on whomever He wills;
4322: or He gives both male and female [to whomever He wills], and causes to be barren whomever He wills: for, verily, He is all-knowing, infinite in His power.
4323: And it is not given to mortal man that God should speak unto him otherwise than through sudden inspiration, or [by a voice, as it were,] from behind a veil, or by sending an apostle to reveal, by His leave, whatever He wills [to reveal]: for, verily, He is exalted, wise.
4324: And thus, too, [O Muhammad,] have We revealed unto thee a life-giving message, [coming] at Our behest. [Ere this message came unto thee,] thou didst not know what revelation is, nor what faith [implies]: but [now] We have caused this [message] to be a light, whereby We guide whom We will of Our ser¬≠vants: and, verily, [on the strength thereof] thou, too, shalt guide [men] onto the straight way ‚Äì
4325: the way that leads to God, to whom all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth belongs. Oh, verily, with God is the beginning and the end of all things!
4327: CONSIDER this divine writ, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth:
4328: behold, We have caused it to be a discourse in the Arabic tongue, so that you might encompass it with your reason.
4329: And, verily, [originating as it does] in the source, with Us, of all revelation, it is indeed sublime, full of wisdom.
4330: [O YOU who deny the truth!] Should We, perchance, withdraw this reminder from you altogether, seeing that you are people bent on wasting your own selves?
4331: And how many a prophet did We send to people of olden times!
4332: But never yet came a prophet to them without their deriding him ‚Äì
4333: and so, [in the end,] We destroyed them [even though they were] of greater might than these: and the [very] image of those people of old became a thing of the past.
4334: Yet thus it is [with most people]: if thou ask them, ‚ÄúWho is it that has created the heavens and the earth?‚Äù - they will surely answer, ‚ÄúThe Almighty, the All-Knowing has created them.‚Äù
4335: He it is who has made the earth a cradle for you, and has provided for you ways [of livelihood] thereon, so that you might follow the right path.
4336: And He it is who sends down, again and again, waters from the sky in due measure: and [as] We raise therewith dead land to life, even thus will you be brought forth [from the dead].
4337: And He it is who has created all opposites. And He [it is who] has provided for you all those ships and animals whereon you ride,
4338: in order that you might gain mastery over them, and that, whenever you have mastered them, you might remember your Sustainer‚Äôs blessings and say: ‚ÄúLimitless in His glory is He who has made [all] this subservient to our use - since [but for Him,] we would not have been able to attain to it.
4339: Hence, verily, it is unto Him that we must always turn.‚Äù
4340: AND YET, they attribute to Him offspring from among some of the beings created by Him! Verily, most obviously bereft of all gratitude is man!
4341: Or [do you think], perchance, that out of all His creation He has chosen for Himself daughters, and favoured you with sons?
4342: For [thus it is:] if any of them is given the glad tiding of [the birth of] what he so readily attributes to the Most Gracious, his face darkens, and he is filled with suppressed anger:
4343: ‚ÄúWhat! [Am I to have a daughter -] one who is to be reared [only] for the sake of ornament?‚Äù and thereupon he finds himself torn by a vague inner conflict.
4344: And [yet] they claim that the angels - who in themselves are but beings created by the Most Gracious - are females: [but] did they witness their creation? This false claim of theirs will be recorded, and they will be called to account [for it on Judgment Day]!
4345: Yet they say, ‚ÄúHad [not] the Most Gracious so willed, we would never have worshipped them!‚Äù [But] they cannot have any knowledge of [His having willed] such a thing: they do nothing but guess.
4346: Or have We, perchance, vouchsafed them, before this one, a revelation [to the contrary,] to which they are still holding fast?
4347: Nay, but they say, ‚ÄúBehold, We found our forefathers agreed on what to believe - and, verily, it is in their footsteps that we find our guidance!‚Äù
