4348: And thus it is: whenever We sent, before thy time, a warner to any community, those of its people who had lost themselves entirely in the pursuit of pleasures would always say, ‚ÄúBehold, we found our forefathers agreed on what to believe - and, verily, it is but in their footsteps that we follow!‚Äù
4349: [Whereupon each prophet] would say, ‚ÄúWhy, even though I bring you guidance better than that which you found your forefathers believing in?‚Äù - [to which] the others would reply, ‚ÄúBehold, we deny that there is any truth in [what you claim to be] your messages!‚Äù
4350: And so We inflicted Our retribution on them: and behold what happened in the end to those who gave the lie to the truth!
4351: AND WHEN Abraham spoke to his father and his people, [he had this very truth in mind:] ‚ÄúVerily, far be it from me to worship what you worship!
4352: None [do I worship] but Him who has brought me into being: and, behold, it is He who will guide me!‚Äù
4353: And he uttered this as a word destined to endure among those who would come after him, so that they might [always] return [to it].
4354: Now [as for those who did come after him,] I allowed them - as [I had allowed] their forebears - to enjoy their lives freely until the truth should come unto them through an apostle who would make all things clear:
4355: but now that the truth has come to them, they say, ‚ÄúAll this is mere spellbinding eloquence‚Äù - and, behold, we deny that there is any truth in it!‚Äù
4356: And they say, too, ‚ÄúWhy was not this Qur‚Äôan bestowed from on high on some great man of the two cities?‚Äù
4357: But is it they who distribute thy Sustainer‚Äôs grace? [Nay, as] it is We who distribute their means of livelihood among them in the life of this world, and raise some of them by degrees above others, to the end that they might avail themselves of one another‚Äôs help - [so, too, it is We who bestow gifts of the spirit upon whomever We will]: and this thy Sustainer‚Äôs grace is better than all [the worldly wealth] that they may amass.
4358: And were it not that [with the prospect of boundless riches before them] all people would become one [evil] community, We might indeed have provided for those who [now] deny the Most Gracious roofs of silver for their houses, and [silver] stairways whereon to ascend,
4359: and [silver] doors for their houses, and [silver] couches whereon to recline,
4360: and gold [beyond count]. Yet all this would have been nothing but a [brief] enjoyment of life in this world - whereas [happiness in] the life to come awaits the God-conscious with thy Sustainer.
4361: But as for anyone who chooses to remain blind to the remembrance of the Most Gracious, to him We assign an [enduring] evil impulse, to become his other self:
4362: whereupon, behold, these [evil impulses] bar all such from the path [of truth], making them think that they are guided aright!
4363: But in the end, when he [who has thus sinned] appears before us [on Judgment Day], he will say [to his other self], ‚ÄúWould that between me and thee there had been the distance of east and west!‚Äù for, evil indeed [has proved] that other self!
4364: On that Day it will not profit you in the least [to know] that, since you have sinned [together], you are now to share your suffering [as well].
4365: CANST THOU, perchance, [O Muhammad,] make the deaf hear, or show the right way to the blind or to such as are obviously lost in error?
4366: But whether We do [or do not] take thee away [ere thy message prevails] - verily, We shall inflict Our retribution on them;
4367: and whether We show thee [or do not show thee in this world] the fulfillment of what We have promised them - verily, We have full power over them!
4368: So hold fast to all that has been revealed to thee: for, behold, thou art on a straight way;
4369: and, verily, this [revelation] shall indeed become [a source of] eminence for thee and thy people: but in time you all will be called to account [for what you have done with it].
4370: Yet [above all else,] ask any of Our apostles whom We sent forth before thy time whether We have ever allowed that deities other than the Most Gracious be worshipped!
4371: THUS, INDEED, have We sent Moses with Our messages unto Pharaoh and his great ones; and he said: ‚ÄúBehold, I am an apostle of the Sustainer of all the worlds!‚Äù
4372: But as soon as he came before them with Our [miraculous] signs, lo! they derided them,
4373: although each sign that We showed them was weigh¬≠tier than the preceding one: and [each time] We took them to task through suffering, so that they might return [to Us].
4374: And [every time] they exclaimed: ‚ÄúO thou sorcerer! Pray for us to thy Sustainer on the strength of the covenant [of prophethood] which He has made with thee: for, verily, we shall now follow the right way!‚Äù
4375: But whenever We removed the suffering from them, lo! they would break their word.
4376: And Pharaoh issued a call to his people, say¬≠ing: ‚ÄúO my people! Does not the dominion over Egypt belong to me, since all these running waters flow at my feet? Can you not, then, see [that I am your lord supreme]?
4377: Am I not better than this contemptible man who can hardly make his meaning clear?
4378: ‚ÄúAnd then - why have no golden armlets been bestowed on him? or why have no angels come together with him?‚Äù
4379: Thus he incited his people to levity, and they obeyed him: for, behold, they were people depraved!
4380: But when they continued to challenge Us, We inflicted Our retribution on them, and drowned them all:
4381: and so We made them a thing of the past, and an example to those who would come after them.
4382: NOW WHENEVER [the nature of] the son of Mary is set forth as an example, [O Muhammad,] lo! thy people raise an outcry on this score,
4383: and say, ‚ÄúWhich is better - our deities or he?‚Äù [But] it is only in the spirit of dispute that they put this comparison before thee: yea, they are conten¬≠tious folk!
4384: [As for Jesus,] he was nothing but [a human being -] a servant [of Ours] whom We had graced [with prophethood], and whom We made an example for the children of Israel.
4385: And had We so willed, [O you who worship angels,] We could indeed have made you into angels succeeding one another on earth!
4386: AND, BEHOLD, this [divine writ] is indeed a means to know [that] the Last Hour [is bound to come]; hence, have no doubt whatever about it, but follow Me: this [alone] is a straight way.
4387: And let not Satan bars you [from it] - for, verily, he is your open foe!
4388: NOW WHEN Jesus came [to his people] with all evidence of the truth, he said: ‚ÄúI have now come unto you with wisdom, and to make clear Unto you some of that on which you are at variance: hence, be conscious of God, and pay heed unto me.
4389: ‚ÄúVerily, God is my Sustainer as well as your Sustainer; so worship [none but] Him: this [alone] is a straight way!‚Äù
4390: But factions from among those [who came after Jesus] began to hold divergent views: woe, then, unto those who are bent on evildoing - [woe] for the suffering [that will befall them] on a grie¬≠vous Day!
4391: ARE THEY [who are lost in sin] but waiting for the Last Hour - [waiting] that it come upon them of a sudden, without their being aware [of its approach]?
4392: On that Day, [erstwhile] friends will be foes unto one another - [all] save the God-conscious.
4393: [And God will say:] ‚ÄúO you servants of Mine! No fear need you have today, and neither shall you grieve ‚Äì
4394: [O you] who have attained to faith in Our messages and have surrendered your own selves unto Us!
4395: Enter paradise, you and your spouses, with happiness blest!‚Äù
4396: [And there] they will be waited upon with trays and goblets of gold; and there will be found all that the souls might desire, and [all that] the eyes might delight in. And therein shall you abide, [O you who believe:]
4397: for such will be the paradise which you shall have inherited by virtue of your past deeds:
4398: fruits [of those deeds] shall you have in abundance, [and] thereof shall you partake!
4399: [But,] behold, they who are lost in sin shall abide in the suffering of hell:
4400: it will not be lightened for them; and therein they will be lost in hopeless despair.
4401: And it is not We who will be doing wrong unto them, but it is they who will have wronged them¬≠selves.
4402: And they will cry: ‚ÄúO thou [angel] who rulest [over hell]! Let thy Sustainer put an end to us!‚Äù - whereupon] he will reply: ‚ÄúVerily, you must live on [in this state]
4403: INDEED, [O you sinners,] We have conveyed the truth unto you; but most of you abhor the truth.
4404: Why - can they [who deny the truth ever] determine what [the truth] should be?
4405: Or do they, perchance, think that We do not hear their hidden thoughts and their secret confabulations? Yea, indeed, [We do,] and Our heavenly forces are with them, recording [all].
4406: Say [O Prophet]: ‚ÄúIf the Most Gracious [truly] had a son, I would be the first to worship him!‚Äù
4407: Utterly remote, in His glory, is the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth - the Sustainer, in almigh¬≠tiness enthroned from all that they may attribute to Him by way of definition!
4408: But leave them to indulge in idle talk and play [with words] until they face that [Judgment] Day of theirs which they have been promised:
4409: for [then they will come to know that] it is He [alone] who is God in heaven and God on earth, and [that] He alone is truly wise, all-knowing.
4410: And hallowed be He unto whom the dominion over the heavens and the earth and all that is between them belongs, and with whom the knowledge of the Last Hour rests, and unto whom you all shall be brought back!
4411: And those [beings] whom some invoke beside God have it not in their power to intercede [on Judgment Day] for any but such as have [in their lifetime] borne witness to the truth, and have been aware [that God is one and unique].
4412: Now if thou ask those [who worship any being other than God] as to who it is that has created them, they are sure to answer, ‚ÄúGod.‚Äù How perverted, then, are their minds!
4413: [But God has full knowledge of the true be¬≠liever] and of his [despairing] cry: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Verily, these are people who will not believe!‚Äù
4414: Yet bear thou with them, and say, ‚ÄúPeace [be upon you]!‚Äù - for in time they will come to know [the truth].
4416: CONSIDER this divine writ, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth!
4417: Behold, from on high have We bestowed it on a blessed night: for, verily, We have always been warning [man].
4418: On that [night] was made clear, in wisdom, the distinction between all things [good and evil]
4419: at a behest from Ourselves: for, verily, We have always been sending [Our messages of guidance]
4420: in pur¬≠suance of thy Sustainer‚Äôs grace [unto man]. Verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing,
4421: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them - if you could but grasp it with inner certainty!
4422: There is no deity save Him: He grants life and deals death: He is your Sustainer as well as the Sustainer of your forebears of old.
4423: Nay, but they [who lack inner certainty] are but Dying with their doubts.
4424: WAIT, THEN, for the Day when the skies shall bring forth a pall of smoke which will make obvious [the approach of the Last Hour],
4425: enveloping all mankind, [and causing the sinners to exclaim:] ‚ÄúGrievous is this suffering!
4426: O our Sustainer, relieve us of suffering, for, verily, we [now] believe [in Thee]!‚Äù
4427: [But] how shall this remembrance avail them [at the Last Hour], seeing that an apostle had pre¬≠viously come unto them, clearly expounding the truth,
4428: whereupon they turned their backs on him and said, ‚ÄúTaught [by others] is he, a madman‚Äù?
4429: [Still,] behold, We shall postpone this suffer¬≠ing for a little while, although you are bound to revert [to your evil ways: but]
4430: on the Day when We shall seize [all sinners] with a most mighty onslaught, We shall, verily, inflict Our retribution [on you as well]!
4431: AND, INDEED, [long] before their time did We try Pharaoh‚Äôs people [in the same way]: for there came unto them a noble apostle, [who said:]
4432: ‚ÄúGive in unto me, O God‚Äôs bondmen! Verily, I am an apostle [sent] unto you, worthy of trust!
4433: ‚ÄúAnd exalt not yourselves against God: for, verily, I come unto you with a manifest authority [from Him];
4434: and, behold, it is with my Sustainer - and your Sustainer - that I seek refuge against all your endeavours to revile me.
4435: And if you do not believe me, [at least] stand away from me!‚Äù
4436: But then, [when they beset him with their enmity,] he called out to his Sustainer, ‚ÄúThese are [indeed] people lost in sin!‚Äù
4437: And [God said]: ‚ÄúGo thou forth with My servants by night, for you will surely be pursued;
4438: and leave the sea becalmed [between thee and Pharaoh‚Äôs men]: for, verily, they are a host destined to be drowned!‚Äù
4439: [And so they perished: and] how many gardens did they leave behind, and water-runnels,
4440: and fields of grain, and noble dwellings,
4441: and [all that] life of ease in which they used to delight!
4442: Thus it was. And [then] We made another people heirs [to what they had left],
4443: and neither sky nor earth shed tears over them, nor were they allowed a respite.
4444: And, indeed, We delivered the children of Israel from the shameful suffering
4445: [inflicted on them] by Pharaoh, seeing that he was truly outstand¬≠ing among those who waste their own selves;
4446: and indeed, We chose them knowingly above all other people,
4447: and gave them such signs [of Our grace] as would clearly presage a test.
4449: ‚ÄúThat [which is ahead of us] is but our first [and only] death, and we shall not be raised to life again.
4450: So then, bring forth our forefathers [as witnesses], if what you claim is true!‚Äù
4451: Are they, then, better than the people of Tubba and those before them, whom We destroyed because they were truly lost in [the same] sin?
4452: For [thus it is:] We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in mere idle play:
4453: none of this have We created without [an inner] truth: but most of them under¬≠stand it not.
4454: VERILY, the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false] is the term appointed for all of them:
4455: the Day when no friend shall be of the least avail to his friend, and when none shall be succoured
4456: save those upon whom God will have bestowed His grace and mercy: for, verily, He alone is almighty, a dispenser of grace.
4457: Verily, [in the life to come] the tree of deadly fruit
4458: will be the food of the sinful:
4459: like molten lead will it boil in the belly,
4460: like the boiling of burning despair.
4461: [And the word will be spoken:] ‚ÄúSeize him, [O you forces of hell,] and drag him into the midst of the blazing fire:
4462: then pour over his head the anguish of burning despair!
4463: Taste it - thou who [on earth] hast considered thyself so mighty, so noble!
4464: This is the very thing which you [deniers of the truth] were wont to call in question!‚Äù
4465: [As against this -] verily, the God-conscious will find themselves in a state secure,
4467: wearing [garments] of silk and brocade, facing one another [in love].
4468: Thus shall it be. And We shall pair them with companions pure, most beautiful of eye.
4469: In that [paradise] they shall [rightfully] claim all the fruits [of their past deeds], resting in security;
4470: and neither shall they taste death there after having passed through their erstwhile death. Thus will He have preserved them from all suffer¬≠ing through the blazing fire-
4471: an act of thy Sustainer‚Äôs favour: and that, that will be the triumph supreme!
4472: THUS, THEN, [O Prophet,] have We made this [divine writ] easy to understand, in thine own [human] tongue, so that men might take it to heart.
4473: So wait thou [for what the future will bring]: behold, they, too, are waiting.
4475: THE BESTOWAL from on high of this divine writ issues from God, the Almighty, the Wise.
4476: Behold, in the heavens as well as on earth there are indeed messages for all who [are willing to] believe.
4477: And in your own nature, and in [that of] all the animals which He scatters [over the earth] there are messages for people who are endowed with inner certainty.
4478: And in the succession of night and day, and in the means of subsistence which God sends down from the skies, giving life thereby to the earth after it had been lifeless, and in the change of the winds: [in all this] there are messages for people who use their reason.
4479: These messages of God do We convey unto thee, setting forth the truth. In what other tiding, if not in God‚Äôs messages, will they, then, believe?
4481: who hears God‚Äôs messages when they are conveyed to him, and yet, as though he had not heard them, persists in his haughty disdain! Hence, announce unto him grievous suffering ‚Äì
4482: for when he does become aware of any of Our messages, he makes them a target of his mockery! For all such there is shameful suffering in store.
4483: Hell is ahead of them; and all that they may have gained [in this world] shall be of no avail whatever to them, and neither shall any of those things which, instead of God, they have come to regard as their protectors: for, awesome suffering awaits them.
4484: [To pay heed to God‚Äôs signs and messages:] this is [the meaning of] guidance; on the other hand, for those who are bent on denying the truth of their Sustainer‚Äôs messages there is grievous suffering in store as an outcome of [their] vileness.
4485: IT IS GOD who has made the sea subservient [to His laws, so that it be of use] to you so that ships might sail through it at His behest, and that you might seek to obtain [what you need] of His bounty, and that you might have cause to be grateful.
4486: And He has made subservient to you, [as a gift] from Himself, all that is in the heavens and on earth: in this, behold, there are messages indeed for people who think!
4487: Tell all who have attained to faith that they should forgive those who do not believe in the com¬≠ing of the Days of God, [since it is] for Him [alone] to requite people for whatever they may have earned.
4488: Whoever does what is just and right, does so for his own good; and whoever does evil, does so to his own hurt; and in the end unto your Sustainer you all will be brought back.
4489: AND, INDEED, [already] unto the children of Israel did We vouchsafe revelation, and wisdom, and prophethood; and We provided for them sustenance out of the good things of life, and favoured them above all other people [of their time].
4490: And We gave them clear indications of the purpose [of faith]; and it was only after all this knowledge had been vouchsafed to them that they began, out of mutual jealousy, to hold divergent views: [but,] verily, thy Sustainer will judge be¬≠tween them on Resurrection Day regarding all whereon they were wont to differ.
4491: And, finally, [O Muhammad,] We have set thee on a way by which the purpose [of faith] may be fulfilled: so follow thou this [way], and follow not the likes and dislikes of those who do not know [the truth].
4492: Behold, they could never be of any avail to thee if thou wert to defy the will of God for, verily, such evildoers are but friends and protectors of one another, whereas God is the Protector of all who are conscious of Him.
4493: This [revelation, then,] is a means of insight for mankind, and a guidance and grace unto people who are endowed with inner certainty.
4494: Now as for those who indulge in sinful doings - do they think that We place them, both in their life and their death, on an equal footing with those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds? Bad, indeed, is their judgment:
4495: for, God has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an inner] truth, and [has therefore willed] that every human being shall be recompensed for what he has earned and none shall be wronged.
4496: HAST THOU ever considered [the kind of man] who makes his own desires his deity, and whom God has [thereupon] let go astray, knowing [that his mind is closed to all guidance], and whose hearing and heart He has sealed, and upon whose sight He has placed a veil? Who, then, could guide him after God [has abandoned him]? Will you not, then, bethink your¬≠selves?
4497: And yet they say: ‚ÄúThere is nothing beyond our life in this world. We die as we come to life, and nothing but time destroys us.‚Äù But of this they have no knowledge whatever: they do nothing but guess.
4498: And [so,] whenever Our messages are conveyed to them in all their clarity, their only argument is this: ‚ÄúBring forth our fore¬≠fathers [as witnesses], if what you claim is true!‚Äù
4499: Say: ‚ÄúIt is God who gives you life, and then causes you to die; and in the end He will gather you together on Resurrection Day, [the coming of] which is beyond all doubt - but most human beings under¬≠stand it not.‚Äù
4500: For, God‚Äôs is the dominion over the heavens and the earth; and on the Day when the Last Hour dawns - on that Day will be lost all who [in their lifetime] tried to reduce to nothing [whatever they could not understand].
4501: And [on that Day] thou wilt see all people kneeling down [in humility]: all people will be called upon to [face] their record: ‚ÄúToday you shall be requited for all that you ever did!
4502: This Our record speaks of you in all truth: for, verily, We have caused to be recorded all that you ever did!‚Äù
4503: Now as for those who have attained to faith and done righteous deeds, their Sustainer will admit them to His grace: that will be [their] manifest triumph!
4504: But as for those who were bent on denying the truth, [they will be told:] ‚ÄúWere not My messages conveyed to you? And withal, you gloried in your arrogance, and so you became people lost in sin:
4505: for when it was said, ‚ÄòBehold, God‚Äôs promise always comes true, and there can be no doubt about [the coming of] the Last Hour‚Äô - you would answer, ‚ÄòWe do not know what that Last Hour may be: we think it is no more than an empty guess, and [so] we are by no means convinced!‚Äô‚Äù
4506: And [on that Day,] the evil of their doings will become obvious to them, and they will be over¬≠whelmed by the very thing which they were wont to deride.
4507: And [the word] will be spoken: ‚ÄúToday We shall be oblivious of you as you were oblivious of the coming of this your Day [of Judgment]; and so your goal is the fire, and you shall have none to succour you:
4508: this, because you made God‚Äôs messages the target of your mockery, having allowed the life of this world to beguile you!‚Äù On that Day, therefore, they will not be brought out of the fire, nor will they be allowed to make amends.
4509: AND THUS, all praise is due to God, Sustainer of the heavens and Sustainer of the earth: the Sustainer of all the worlds!
4510: And His alone is all majesty in the heavens and on earth; and He alone is almighty, truly wise!
4512: THE BESTOWAL from on high of this divine writ I issues from God, the Almighty, the Wise.
4513: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them otherwise than in accord¬≠ance with [an inner] truth, and for a term set [by Us]: and yet, they who are bent on denying the truth turn aside from the warning which has been conveyed unto them.
4514: Say: ‚ÄúHave you [really] given thought to what it is that you invoke instead of God? Show me what these [beings or forces] have created anywhere on earth! Or had they, perchance, a share in [creating] the heavens? [If so,] bring me any divine writ pre¬≠ceding this one, or any [other] vestige of knowledge - if what you claim is true!‚Äù
4515: And who could be more astray than one who invokes, instead of God, such as will not respond to him either now or on the Day of Resurrection, and are not even conscious of being invoked?
4516: such as, when all mankind is gathered [for judgment], will be enemies unto those [who worshipped them], and will utterly reject their worship?
4517: But whenever Our messages are conveyed to them in all their clarity, they who are bent on denying the truth speak thus of the truth as soon as it is brought to them: ‚ÄúThis is clearly nothing but spell¬≠binding eloquence!‚Äù
4518: Or do they say, ‚ÄúHe has invented all this‚Äù? Say [O Muhammad]: ‚ÄúHad I invented it, you would not be of the least help to me against God. He is fully aware of that [slander] into which you so reck¬≠lessly plunge: enough is He as a witness between me and you! And [withal,] He alone is truly-forgiving, a true dispenser of grace.‚Äù
4519: Say: ‚ÄúI am not the first of [God‚Äôs] apostles; and [like all of them,] I do not know what will be done with me or with you: for I am nothing but a plain warner.‚Äù
4520: Say: ‚ÄúHave you given thought [to how you will fare] if this be truly [a revelation] from God and yet you deny its truth? - even though a witness from among the children of Israel has already borne wit¬≠ness to [the advent of] one like himself, and has believed [in him], the while you glory in your arro¬≠gance [and reject his message]? Verily, God does not grace [such] evildoing folk with His guidance!‚Äù
4521: But they who are bent on denying the truth speak thus of those who have attained to faith: ‚ÄúIf this [message] were any good, these [people] would not have preceded us in accepting it!‚Äù And since they refuse to be guided by it, they will always say, ‚ÄúThis is [but] an ancient falsehood!‚Äù
4522: And yet, before this there was the revelation of Moses, a guide and a [sign of God‚Äôs] grace; and this [Qur‚Äôan] is a divine writ confirming the truth [of the Torah] in the Arabic tongue, to warn those who are bent on evildoing, and [to bring] a glad tiding to the doers of good:
4523: for, behold, all who say, ‚ÄúOur Sustainer is God‚Äù, and thereafter stand firm [in their faith] - no fear need they have, and neither shall they grieve:
4524: it is they who are destined for paradise, therein to abide as a reward for all that they have done.
4525: NOW [among the best of the deeds which] We have enjoined upon man is goodness towards his parents. In pain did his mother bear him, and in pain did she give him birth; and her bearing him and his utter dependence on her took thirty months. and so, when he attains to full maturity and reaches forty years, he [that is righteous] prays: ‚ÄúO my Sustainer! Inspire me so that I may forever be grateful for those blessings of Thine with which Thou hast graced me and my parents, and that I may do what is right [in a manner] that will meet with Thy goodly acceptance; and grant me righteousness in my offspring [as well]. Verily, unto Thee have I turned in repentance: for, verily, I am of those who have surrendered themselves unto Thee!‚Äù
4526: It is [such as] these from whom We shall accept the best that they ever did, and whose bad deeds We shall overlook: [they will find themselves] among those who are destined for paradise, in fulfillment of the true promise which they were given [in this world].
4527: But [there is many a one] who says to his parents [whenever they try to imbue him with faith in God]: ‚ÄúFie upon both of you! Do you promise me that I shall be brought forth [from the dead], although [so many] generations have passed away before me?‚Äù And [while] they both pray for God‚Äôs help [and say], ‚ÄúAlas for thee! For, behold, God‚Äôs promise always comes true!‚Äù - he but answers, ‚ÄúAll this is nothing but fables of ancient times!‚Äù
4528: It is [such as] these upon whom the sentence [of doom] will fall due, together with the [other sinful] communities of invisible beings and humans that have passed away before their time. Verily, they will be lost:
4529: for, [in the life to come,] all shall have their degrees in accordance with whatever [good or evil] they did: and so, He will repay them in full for their doings, and none shall be wronged.
4530: And on the Day when those who were bent on denying the truth will be brought within sight of the fire, [they will be told:] ‚ÄúYou have exhausted your [share of] good things in your worldly life, having enjoyed them [without any thought of the hereafter]: and so today you shall be requited with the suffering of humiliation for having gloried on earth in your arrogance, offending against all that is right, and for all your iniquitous doings!‚Äù
4531: AND REMEMBER that brother of [the tribe of] Ad, how - seeing that [other] warnings had already come and gone within his own knowledge as well as in times beyond his ken - he warned his people [who lived] among those sand-dunes: ‚ÄúWorship none but God! Verily, I fear lest suffering befall you on an awesome day!‚Äù
4532: They answered: ‚ÄúHast thou come to seduce us away from our gods? Bring, then, upon us that [doom] with which thou threaten us, if thou art a man of truth!‚Äù
4533: Said he: ‚ÄúKnowledge [of when it is to befall you] rests with God alone: I but convey unto you the message with which I have been entrusted; but I see that you are people ignorant [of right and wrong]!‚Äù
4534: And so, when they beheld it in the shape of a dense cloud approaching their valleys, they exclaimed, ‚ÄúThis is but a heavy cloud which will bring us [wel¬≠come] rain!‚Äù [But Hud said:] ‚ÄúNay, but it is the very thing which you [so contemptuously] sought to hasten - a wind bearing grievous suffering,
4535: bound to destroy everything at its Sustainer‚Äôs behest!‚Äù And then they were so utterly wiped out that nothing could be seen save their [empty] dwellings: thus do We requite people lost in sin.
4536: And yet, We had established them securely in a manner in which We have never established you, [O people of later times;] and We had endowed them with hearing, and sight, and [knowledgeable] hearts: but neither their hearing, nor their sight, nor their hearts were of the least avail to them, seeing that they went on rejecting God‚Äôs messages; and [in the end] they were overwhelmed by the very thing which they had been wont to deride.
4537: Thus have We destroyed many a [sinful] community living round about you; and yet, [before destroying them,] We had given many facets to [Our warning] messages, so that they might turn back [from their evil ways].
4538: But, then, did those [beings] whom they had chosen to worship as deities beside God, hoping that they would bring them nearer [to Him], help them [in the end]? Nay, they forsook them: for that [alleged divinity] was but an outcome of their self-delusion and all their false imagery.
4539: AND LO! We caused a group of unseen beings to incline towards thee, [O Muhammad,] so that they might give ear to the Qur‚Äôan; and so, as soon as they became aware of it, they said [unto one another], ‚ÄúListen in silence!‚Äù And when [the recitation] was ended, they returned to their people as warners.
4540: They said: ‚ÄúO our people! Behold, we have been listening to a revelation bestowed from on high after [that of] Moses, confirming the truth of what¬≠ever there still remains [of the Torah]: it guides towards the truth, and onto a straight way.
4541: ‚ÄúO our people! Respond to God‚Äôs call, and have faith in Him: He will forgive you [whatever is past] of your sins, and deliver you from grievous suffering [in the life to come].
4542: But he who does not respond to God‚Äôs call can never elude [Him] on earth, nor can he has any protector against Him [in the life to come]: all such are most obviously lost in error.‚Äù
4543: ARE, THEN, they [who deny the life to come] not aware that God, who has created the heavens and the earth and never been wearied by their creation, has [also] the power to bring the dead back to life? Yea, verily, He has the power to will anything!
4544: And so, on the Day when those who were bent on denying the truth will be brought within sight of the fire [and will be asked], ‚ÄúIs not this the truth?‚Äù - they will answer, ‚ÄúYea, by Our Sustainer!‚Äù [And] He will say: ‚ÄúTaste, then, this suffering as an outcome of your denial of the truth!‚Äù
4545: REMAIN, then, [O believer,] patient in adversity, just as all of the apostles, endowed with firmness of heart, bore themselves with patience. And do not ask for a speedy doom of those [who still deny the truth]: on the Day when they see [the fulfillment of] what they were promised, [it will seem to them] as though they had dwelt [on earth] no longer than one hour of [an earthly] day! [This is Our] message. Will, then, any be [really] destroyed save iniquitous folk?‚Äù
4546: AS FOR THOSE who are bent on denying the truth and on barring [others] from the path of God - all their [good] deeds will He let go to waste;
4547: whereas those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds, and have come to believe in what has been bestowed from on high on Muhammad - for it is the truth from their Sustainer - [shall attain to God‚Äôs grace:] He will efface their [past] bad deeds, and will set their hearts at rest.
4548: This, because they who are bent on denying the truth pursue falsehood, whereas they who have attained to faith pursue [but] the truth [that flows] from their Sustainer. In this way does God set forth unto man the parables of their true state.
4549: NOW WHEN you meet [in war] those who are bent on denying the truth, smite their necks until you overcome them fully, and then tighten their bonds; but thereafter [set them free,] either by an act of grace or against ransom, so that the burden of war may be lifted: thus [shall it be]. And [know that] had God so willed, He could indeed punish them [Himself]; but [He wills you to struggle] so as to test you [all] by means of one another. And as for those who are slain in God‚Äôs cause, never will He let their deeds go to waste:
4550: He will guide them [in the hereafter as well], and will set their hearts at rest,
4551: and will admit them to the paradise which He has promised them.
4552: O you who have attained to faith! If you help [the cause of] God, He will help you, and will make firm your steps;
4553: but as for those who are bent on denying the truth, ill fortune awaits them, since He will let all their [good] deeds go to waste:
4554: this, because they hate [the very thought of] what God has bestowed from on high and thus He causes all their deeds to come to nought!
4555: Have they, then, never journeyed about the earth and beheld what happened in the end to those [willful sinners] who lived before their time? God destroyed them utterly: and the like thereof awaits all who deny the truth.
4556: This, because God is the Protector of all who have attained to faith, whereas they who deny the truth have no protector.
4557: Verily, God will admit all who attain to faith and do righteous deeds into gardens through which running waters flow, whereas they who are bent on denying the truth shall have - even though they may enjoy their life [in this world] and eat as cattle eat - the fire [of the hereafter] for their abode.
4558: And how many a community of greater power than this thy community which has driven thee out, [O Muhammad,] have We destroyed, with none to succour them!
4559: CAN, THEN, he who takes his stand on a clear evidence from his Sustainer be likened Unto one to whom the evil of his own doings [always] seems goodly, and unto such as would follow but their own lusts?
4560: [And can] the parable of the paradise which the God-conscious are promised [a paradise] wherein there are rivers of water which time does not corrupt, and rivers of milk the taste whereof never alters, and rivers of wine delightful to those who drink it, and rivers of honey of all impurity cleansed, and the enjoyment of all the fruits [of their good deeds] and of forgiveness from their Sustainer -: can this [parable of paradise] be likened unto [the parable of the recompense of] such as are to abide in the fire and be given waters of burning despair to drink, so that it will tear their bowels asunder?
4561: Now among those [hapless sinners] are such as [pretend to] listen to thee, [O Muhammad,] and then, as soon as they leave thy presence, speak [with scorn] unto those who have understood [thy mes¬≠sage]: ‚ÄúWhat is it that he has said just now?‚Äù It is such as these whose hearts God has sealed because they [always] followed but their own lusts
4562: just as for those who are [willing to be] guided, He increases their [ability to follow His] guidance and causes them to grow in God-consciousness.
4563: Are, then, they [whose hearts are sealed] wait¬≠ing for the Last Hour - [waiting] that it come upon them of a sudden? But it has already been foretold! And what will their remembrance [of their past sins] avail them, once it has come upon them?
4564: Know, then, [O man,] that there is no deity save God, and [while there is yet time,] ask forgive¬≠ness for thy sins and for [the sins of] all other believing men and women: for God knows all your comings and goings as well as your abiding [at rest].
4565: NOW THOSE who have attained to faith say, ‚ÄúWould that a revelation [allowing us to fight] was bestowed from on high!‚Äù But now that a revelation clear in and by itself, mentioning war, has been bestowed from on high, thou canst see those in whose hearts is disease look¬≠ing at thee, [O Muhammad,] with the look of one who is about to faint for fear of death! And yet, far better for them would be
4566: obedience [to God‚Äôs call] and a word that could win [His] approval: for, since the matter has been resolved [by His revelation], it would be but for their own good to remain true to God.
4567: [Ask them:] ‚ÄúWould you, perchance, after having turned away [from God‚Äôs commandment, pre¬≠fer to revert to your old ways, and] spread corruption on earth, and [once again] cut asunder your ties of kinship?‚Äù
4568: It is such as these whom God rejects, and whom He makes deaf [to the voice of truth], and whose eyes He blinds [to its sight]!
4569: Will they not, then, ponder over this Qur‚Äôan? - or are there locks upon their hearts?
4570: VERILY, those who turn their backs [on this mes¬≠sage] after guidance has been vouchsafed to them, [do it because] Satan has embellished their fancies and filled them with false hopes:
4571: [they do turn their backs on it] inasmuch as they are wont to say unto those who abhor all that God has revealed, ‚ÄúWe will comply with your views on some points.‚Äù But God knows their secret thoughts:
4572: hence, how [will they fare] when the angels gather them in death, striking their faces and their backs?
4573: This, because they were wont to pursue what God con¬≠demns and to hate [whatever would meet with] His goodly acceptance: and so He has caused all their [good] deeds to come to nought.
4574: Or do they in whose hearts is disease think, perchance, that God would never bring their moral failings to light?
4575: Now had We so willed, We could have shown them clearly to thee, so that thou wouldst know them for sure as by a visible mark: but [even so,] thou wilt most certainly recognize them by the tone of their voice. And God knows all that you do, [O men;]
4576: and most certainly We shall try you all, so that We might mark out those of you who strive hard [in Our cause] and are patient in adversity: for We shall put to a test [the truth of] all your assertions.
4577: Verily, they who are bent on denying the truth and on barring [others] from the path of God, and [who thus] cut themselves off from the Apostle after guidance has been vouchsafed to them, can in no wise harm God; but He will cause all their deeds to come to nought.
4578: O you who have attained to faith! Pay heed unto God, and pay heed unto the Apostle, and let not your [good] deeds come to nought!
4579: Verily, as for those who are bent on denying the truth and on barring [others] from the path of God, and then die as deniers of the truth - indeed, God will not grant them forgiveness!
4580: AND SO, [when you fight in a just cause,] do not lose heart and [never] beg for peace: for, seeing that God is with you, you are bound to rise high [in the end]; and never will He let your [good] deeds go to waste.
4581: The life of this world is but a play and a passing delight: but if you believe [in God] and are conscious of Him, He will grant you your deserts. And withal, He does not demand of you [to sacrifice in His cause all of] your possessions:
4582: [for,] if He were to demand of you all of them, and urge you, you would niggardly cling [to them], and so He would [but] bring out your moral failings.
4583: Behold, [O believers,] it is you who are called upon to spend freely in God‚Äôs cause: but [even] among you are such as turn out to be niggardly! And yet, he who acts niggardly [in God‚Äôs cause] is but niggardly towards his own self: for God is indeed self-sufficient, whereas you stand in need [of Him]; and if you turn away [from Him], He will cause other people to take your place, and they will not be the likes of you!
4584: VERILY, [O Muhammad,] We have laid open before thee a manifest victory,
4585: so that God might show His forgiveness of all thy faults, past as well as future, and [thus] bestow upon thee the full measure of His blessings, and guide thee on a straight way,
4586: and [show] that God will succour thee with [His] mighty succour.
4587: It is He who from on high has bestowed inner peace upon the hearts of the believers, so that - seeing that God‚Äôs are all the forces of the heavens and the earth, and that God is all-knowing, truly wise - they might grow yet more firm in their faith;
4588: [and] that He might admit the believers, both men and women, into gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide, and that He might efface their [past bad] deeds: and that is, in the sight of God, indeed a triumph supreme!
4589: And [God has willed] to impose suffering [in the life to come] on the hypocrites, both men and women, and on those who ascribe divinity to aught beside Him, both men and women: all who entertain evil thoughts about God. Evil encompasses them from all sides, and God‚Äôs condemnation rests upon them; and He has rejected them [from His grace], and has readied hell for them: and how evil a journey‚Äôs end!
4590: For, God‚Äôs are all the forces of the heavens and the earth; and God is indeed almighty, truly wise!
4591: VERILY, [O Muhammad,] We have sent thee as a witness [to the truth], and as a herald of glad tidings and a warner ‚Äì
4592: so that you [O men] might believe in God and His Apostle, and might honour Him, and revere Him, and extol His limitless glory from morn to evening.
4593: Behold, all who pledge their allegiance to thee pledge their allegiance to God: the hand of God is over their hands. Hence, he who breaks his oath, breaks it only to his own hurt; whereas he who remains true to what he has pledged unto God, on him will He bestow a reward supreme.
4594: Those of the bedouin who stayed behind will say unto thee: ‚Äú[The need to take care of] our chat¬≠tels and our families kept us busy: do then, [O Prophet,] ask God to forgive us!‚Äù [Thus,] they will utter with their tongues something that is not in their hearts. Say: ‚ÄúWho, then, has it in his power to avert from you aught that God may have willed, whether it be His will to harm you or to confer a benefit on you? Nay, but God is fully aware of what you do!
4595: Nay, you thought that the Apostle and the believers would never return to their kith and kin: and this seemed goodly to your hearts. And you entertained [such] evil thoughts because you have always been people devoid of all good!‚Äù
4596: Now as for those who will not believe in God and His Apostle - verily, We have readied a blazing flame for all [such] deniers of the truth!
4597: But God‚Äôs is the dominion over the heavens and the earth: He forgives whomever He wills, and imposes suffering on whomever He wills - and [withal,] He is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
4598: As soon as you [O believers] are about to set forth on a war that promises booty, those who stayed behind [aforetime] will surely say, ‚ÄúAllow us to go with you‚Äù - [thus showing that] they would like to alter the Word of God. Say: ‚ÄúBy no means shall you go with us: God has declared aforetime [to whom all spoils shall belong].‚Äù Thereupon they will [surely] answer, ‚ÄúNay, but you begrudge us [our share of booty]!‚Äù Nay, they can grasp but so little of the truth!
4599: Say unto those bedouin who stayed behind: ‚ÄúIn time you will be called upon [to fight] against people of great prowess in war: you will have to fight against them [until you die] or they surrender. And then, if you heed [that call], God will bestow on you a goodly reward; but if you turn away as you turned away this time, He will chastise you with grievous chastisement.‚Äù
4600: No blame attaches to the blind, nor does blame attach to the lame, nor does blame attach to the sick [for staying away from a war in God‚Äôs cause]; but whoever heeds [the call of] God and His Apostle [in deed or in heart], him will He admit into gardens through which running waters flow; whereas him who turns away will He chastise with grievous chastise¬≠ment.
4601: INDEED, well-pleased was God with the believers when they pledged their allegiance unto thee [O Muhammad] under that tree, for He knew what was in their hearts; and so He bestowed inner peace upon them from on high, and rewarded them with [the glad tiding of] a victory soon to come
4602: and [of] many war-gains which they would achieve: for God is indeed almighty, wise.
4603: [O you who believe!] God has promised you many war-gains which you shall yet achieve; and He has vouchsafed you these [worldly gains] well in advance, and has stayed from you the hands of [hostile] people, so that this [your inner strength] may become a symbol to the believers [who will come after you], and that He may guide you all on a straight way.
4604: And there are yet other [gains] which are still beyond your grasp, [but] which God has already encompassed [for you]: for God has the power to will anything.
4605: And [now,] if they who are bent on denying the truth should fight against you, they will indeed turn their backs [in flight], and will find none to protect them and none to bring them succour:
4606: such being God‚Äôs way which has ever obtained in the past - and never wilt thou find any change in God‚Äôs way!
4607: And He it is who, in the valley of Mecca, stayed their hands from you, and your hands from them, after He had enabled you to vanquish them; and God saw indeed what you were doing.
4608: [It was not for your enemies sake that He stayed your hands from them: for] it was they who were bent on denying the truth, and who debarred you from the Inviolable House of Worship and prevented your offering from reaching its destina¬≠tion. And had it not been for the believing men and believing women [in Mecca], whom you might have unwittingly trampled underfoot, and on whose account you might have become guilty, without knowing it, of a grievous wrong-: [had it not been for this, you would have been allowed to fight your way into the city: but you were forbidden to fight] so that [in time] God might admit to His grace whomever He wills. Had they [who deserve Our mercy and they whom We have condemned] been clearly discernible [to you], We would indeed have imposed grievous suffering [at your hands] on such of them as were bent on denying the truth.
4609: Whereas they who are bent on denying the truth harboured a stubborn disdain in their hearts - the stubborn disdain [born] of ignorance God bestowed from on high His [gift of] inner peace upon His Apostle and the believers, and bound them to the spirit of God-consciousness: for they were most worthy of this [divine gift], and deserved it well. And God has full knowledge of all things.
4610: Indeed, God has shown the truth in His Apostle‚Äôs true vision: most certainly shall you enter the Inviolable House of Worship, if God so wills, in full security, with your heads shaved or your hair cut short, without any fear: for He has [always] known that which you yourselves could not know. And He has ordained [for you], besides this, a victory soon to come.
4611: He it is who has sent forth His Apostle with the [task of spreading] guidance and the religion of truth, to the end that He make it prevail over every [false] religion; and none can bear witness [to the truth] as God does.
4612: MUHAMMAD is God‚Äôs Apostle; and those who are [truly] with him are firm and unyielding towards all deniers of the truth, [yet] full of mercy towards one another. Thou canst see them bowing down, pros¬≠trating themselves [in prayer], seeking favour with God and [His] goodly acceptance: their marks are on their faces, traced by prostration. This is their parable in the Torah as well as their parable in the Gospel: [they are] like a seed that brings forth its shoot, and then He strengthens it, so that it grows stout, and [in the end] stands firm upon its stem, delighting the sowers. [Thus will God cause the believers to grow in strength,] so that through them He might confound the deniers of the truth. [But] unto such of them as may [yet] attain to faith and do righteous deeds, God has promised forgiveness and a reward supreme.
4613: O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not put yourselves forward in the presence of [what] God and His Apostle [may have ordained], but remain conscious of God: for, verily, God is all-hearing, all-knowing!
4614: O you who have attained to faith! Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet, and neither speak loudly to him, as you would speak loudly to one another, lest all your [good] deeds come to nought without your perceiving it.
4615: Behold, they who lower their voices in the presence of God‚Äôs Apostle - it is they whose hearts God has tested [and opened] to consciousness of Himself; [and] theirs shall be forgiveness and a reward supreme.
4616: Verily, [O Prophet,] as for those who call thee from without thy private apartments - most of them do not use their reason:
4617: for, if they had the patience [to wait] until thou come forth to them [of thine own accord], it would be for their own good. Still, God is much forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
4618: O YOU who have attained to faith! If any iniquitous person comes to you with a [slanderous] tale, use your discernment, lest you hurt people unwittingly and afterwards be filled with remorse for what you have done.
4619: And know that God‚Äôs Apostle is among you: were he to comply with your inclinations in each and every case, you would be bound to come to harm [as a community]. But as it is, God has caused [your] faith to be dear to you, and has given it beauty in your hearts, and has made hateful to you all denial of the truth, and all iniquity, and all rebellion [against what is good]. Such indeed are they who follow the right course
4620: through God‚Äôs bounty and favour; and God is all-knowing, truly wise.
4621: Hence, if two groups of believers fall to fighting, make peace between them; but then, if one of the two [groups] goes on acting wrongfully towards the other, fight against the one that acts wrongfully until it reverts to God‚Äôs commandment; and if they revert, make peace between them with justice, and deal equitably [with them]: for verily, God loves those who act equitably!
4622: All believers are but brethren. Hence, [when¬≠ever they are at odds,] make peace between your two brethren, and remain conscious of God, so that you might be graced with His mercy.
4623: O YOU who have attained to faith! No men shall deride [other] men: it may well be that those [whom they deride] are better than themselves; and no women [shall deride other] women: it may well be that those [whom they deride] are better than them¬≠selves. And neither shall you defame one another, nor insult one another by [opprobrious] epithets: evil is all imputation of iniquity after [one has attained to] faith; and they who [become guilty thereof and] do not repent - it is they, they who are evildoers!
4624: O you who have attained to faith! Avoid most guesswork [about one another] for, behold, some of [such] guesswork is [in itself] a sin; and do not spy upon one another, and neither allow your¬≠selves to speak ill of one another behind your backs. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Nay, you would loathe it! And be conscious of God. Verily, God is an accep¬≠tor of repentance, a dispenser of grace!
4625: O men! Behold, We have created you all out of a male and a female, and have made you into nations and tribes, so that you might come to know one another. Verily, the noblest of you in the sight of God is the one who is most deeply conscious of Him. Behold, God is all-knowing, all-aware.
4626: THE BEDOUIN say, ‚ÄúWe have attained to faith.‚Äù Say [unto them, O Muhammad]: ‚ÄúYou have not [yet] attained to faith; you should [rather] say, ‚ÄòWe have [outwardly] surrendered‚Äô - for [true] faith has not yet entered your hearts. But if you [truly] pay heed unto God and His Apostle, He will not let the least of your deeds go to waste: for, behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.‚Äù
4627: [Know that true] believers are only those who have attained to faith in God and His Apostle and have left all doubt behind, and who strive hard in God‚Äôs cause with their possessions and their lives: it is they, they who are true to their word!
4628: Say: ‚ÄúDo you, perchance, [want to] inform God of [the nature of] your faith although God knows all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth? Indeed, God has full knowledge of every¬≠thing!‚Äù
4629: Many people think that they have bestowed a favour upon thee [O Prophet] by having surrendered [to thee]. Say thou: ‚ÄúDeem not your surrender a favour unto me: nay, but it is God who bestows a favour upon you by showing you the way to faith - if you are true to your word!‚Äù
4630: Verily, God knows the hidden reality of the heavens and the earth; and God sees all that you do.
4632: But nay - they deem it strange that a warner should have come unto them from their own midst; and so these deniers of the truth are saying, ‚ÄúA strange thing is this!
4633: Why - [how could we be resurrected] after we have died and become mere dust? Such a return seems far-fetched indeed!‚Äù
4634: Well do We know how the earth consumes their bodies, for with Us is a record unfailing.
4635: Nay, but they [who refuse to believe in resurrection] have been wont to give the lie to this truth whenever it was proffered to them; and so they are in a state of confusion.
4636: Do they not look at the sky above them - how We have built it and made it beautiful and free of all faults?
4637: And the earth - We have spread it wide, and set upon it mountains firm, and caused it to bring forth plants of all beauteous kinds,
4638: thus offering an insight and a reminder unto every human being who willingly turns unto God.
4639: And We send down from the skies water rich in blessings, and cause thereby gardens to grow, and fields of grain,
4640: and tall palm-trees with their thickly-clustered dates,
4641: as sustenance appor¬≠tioned to men; and by [all] this We bring dead land to life: [and] even so will be [man‚Äôs] coming-forth from death.
4642: [Long] before those [who now deny resur¬≠rection] did Noah‚Äôs people give the lie to this truth, and [so did] the folk of Ar-Rass, and [the tribes of] Thamud
4643: and Ad, and Pharaoh, and Lot‚Äôs brethren,
4644: and the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan], and the people of Tubba: they all gave the lie to the apostles - and thereupon that whereof I had warned [them] came true.
4645: Could We, then, be [thought of as being] worn out by the first creation? Nay - but some people are [still] lost in doubt about [the possibility of] a new creation!
4646: NOW, VERILY, it is We who have created man, and We know what his innermost self whispers within him: for We are closer to him than his neck-vein.
4647: [And so,] whenever the two demands [of his nature] come face to face, contending from the right and from the left,
4648: not even a word can he utter but there is a watcher with him, ever-present.
4649: And [then,] the twilight of death brings with it the [full] truth that [very thing, O man,] from which thou wouldst always look away! ‚Äì
4650: and [in the end] the trumpet [of resurrection] will be blown: that will be the Day of a warning fulfilled.
4651: And every human being will come forward with [his erstwhile] inner urges and [his] conscious mind,
4652: [and will be told:] ‚ÄúIndeed, unmindful hast thou been of this [Day of Judgment]; but now We have lifted from thee thy veil, and sharp is thy sight today!‚Äù
4653: And one part of him will say: ‚ÄúThis it is that has been ever-present with me!‚Äù
4654: [Whereupon God will command:] ‚ÄúCast, cast into hell every [such] stubborn enemy of the truth,
4655: [every] withholder of good [and] sinful aggressor [and] fomentor of distrust [between man and man ‚Äì everyone]
4656: who has set up another deity beside God: cast him, then, cast him into suffering severe!‚Äù
4657: Man‚Äôs other self‚Äô will say: ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! It was not I that led his conscious mind into evil [nay,] but it had gone far astray [of its own accord]!
4658: [And] He will say: ‚ÄúContend not before Me, [O you sinners,] for I gave you a forewarning [of this Day of Reckoning].
4659: The judgment passed by Me shall not be altered; but never do I do the least wrong unto My creatures!‚Äù
4660: On that Day We will ask hell, ‚ÄúArt thou filled?‚Äù- and it will answer, ‚Äú[Nay,] is there yet more [for me]?‚Äù
4661: And [on that Day] paradise will be brought within the sight of the God-conscious, and will no longer be far away; [and they will be told:]
4662: ‚ÄúThis is what you were promised - [promised] unto every¬≠one who was wont to turn unto God and to keep Him always in mind ‚Äì
4663: [everyone] who stood in awe of the Most Gracious although He is beyond the reach of human perception, and who has come [unto Him] with a heart full of contrition.
4664: Enter this [paradise] in peace; this is the Day on which life abiding begins!‚Äù
4665: In that [paradise] they shall have whatever they may desire - but there is yet more with Us.
4666: AND HOW MANY a generation have We destroyed before those [who now deny the truth] people of greater might than theirs; but [when Our chastise¬≠ment befell them,] they became wanderers on the face of the earth, seeking no more than a place of refuge
4667: In this, behold, there is indeed a reminder for everyone whose heart is wide-awake -that is, [every¬≠one who] lends ear with a conscious mind -
4668: and [who knows that] We have indeed created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six aeons, and [that] no weariness could ever touch Us.
4669: HENCE, [O believer,] bear thou with patience what¬≠ever they may say, and extol thy Sustainer‚Äôs limit¬≠less glory and praise before the rising of the sun and before its setting;
4670: and in the night, too, extol His glory, and at every prayer‚Äôs end.
4671: And [always] listen for the day when He who issues the call [of death] shall call [thee] from close-by;
4672: [and bethink thyself, too, of] the Day on which all [human beings] will in truth hear the final blast - that Day of [their] coming-forth [from death].
4673: Verily, it is We who grant life and deal death; and with Us will be all journeys‚Äô end
4674: on the Day when the earth is riven asunder all around them as they hasten forth [towards God‚Äôs judgment]: that gathering will be easy for Us [to encompass].
4675: Fully aware are We of what they [who deny resurrection] do say; and thou canst by no means force them [to believe in it]. Yet none the less, remind, through this Qur‚Äôan, all such as may fear My warning.
4676: CONSIDER the winds that scatter the dust far and wide,
4677: and those that carry the burden [of heavy clouds],
4678: and those that speed along with gentle ease,
4679: and those that apportion [the gift of life] at [God‚Äôs] behest!
4680: Verily, that which you are promised is true indeed,
4681: and, verily, judgment is bound to come!
4682: CONSIDER the firmament full of starry paths!
4683: Verily, [O men,] you are deeply at variance as to what to believe:
4684: perverted in his views thereon is he who would deceive himself!
4685: They but destroy themselves, they who are given to guessing at what they cannot ascertain ‚Äì
4686: they who blunder along, in ignorance lost ‚Äì
4687: they who [mockingly] ask, ‚ÄúWhen is that Day of Judgment to be?‚Äù
4688: [It will be] a Day when they will be sorely tried by the fire,
4689: [and will be told:] ‚ÄúTaste this your trial! It is this that you were so hastily asking for!‚Äù
4690: [But,] behold, the God-conscious will find themselves amid gardens and springs,
4691: enjoying all that their Sustainer will have granted them [because], verily, they were doers of good in the past:
4692: they would lie asleep during but a small part of the night,
4693: and would pray for forgiveness from their innermost hearts;
4694: and [would assign] in all that they possessed a due share unto such as might ask [for help] and such as might suffer priva¬≠tion.
4695: AND ON EARTH there are signs [of God‚Äôs exis¬≠tence, visible] to all who are endowed with inner certainty,
4696: just as [there are signs thereof] within your own selves: can you not, then, see?
4697: And in heaven is [the source of] your sus¬≠tenance [on earth] and [of] all that you are promised [for your life after death]:
4698: for, by the Sustainer of heaven and earth, this [life after death] is the very truth - as true as that you are endowed with speech!
4699: AND HAS the story of Abraham‚Äôs honoured guests ever come within thy ken?
4700: When those [heavenly messengers] came unto him and bade him peace, he answered, ‚Äú[And upon you be] peace!‚Äù - [saying to himself,] ‚ÄúThey are strangers.‚Äù
4701: Then he turned quietly to his household, and brought forth a fat [roasted] calf,
4702: and placed it before them, saying, ‚ÄúWill you not eat?‚Äù
4703: [And when he saw that the guests would not eat,] he became apprehensive of them; [but] they said, ‚ÄúFear not‚Äù - and gave him the glad tiding of [the birth of] a son who would be endowed with deep knowledge.
4704: Thereupon his wife approached [the guests] with a loud cry, and struck her face [in astonishment] and exclaimed: ‚ÄúA barren old woman [like me]!‚Äù
4705: They answered: ‚ÄúThus has thy Sustainer decreed; and, verily, He alone is truly wise, all- knowing!‚Äù
4706: Said [Abraham]: ‚ÄúAnd what [else] may you have in view, O you [heavenly] messengers?‚Äù
4707: They answered: ‚ÄúBehold, we have been sent unto a people lost in sin,
4708: to let loose upon them stone-hard blows of chastisement,
4709: marked out in thy Sustainer‚Äôs sight for [the punishment of] such as have wasted their own selves.‚Äù
4710: And in the course of time We brought out [of Lot ‚Äôs city] such [few] believers as were there:
4711: for apart from one [single] house We did not find there any who had surrendered themselves to Us.
4712: And so We left therein a message for those who fear the grievous suffering [which awaits all evildoers].
4713: AND IN [the story of Pharaoh and] Moses, too, [We left the same message: for] when We sent him unto Pharaoh with [Our] manifest authority,
4714: and he turned away in [the pride of] his power and said, ‚ÄúA sorcerer [is this Moses], or a madman!‚Äù ‚Äì
4715: We seized him and his hosts, and cast them all into the sea: and [none but Pharaoh] himself was to blame [for what happened].
4716: And [you have the same message] in [what happened to the tribe of] Ad, when We let loose against them that life-destroying wind
4717: which spared nothing of what it came upon, but caused [all of] it to become like bones dead and decayed.
4718: And in [the story of the tribe of] Thamud, too, when they were told, ‚ÄúYou shall enjoy your life for [but] a little while,‚Äù
4719: after they had turned with disdain from their Sustainer‚Äôs commandment - whereupon the thunderbolt of punishment overtook them while they were [helplessly] looking on:
4720: for they were unable even to rise, and could not defend themselves.
4721: And [thus, too, We destroyed] Noah‚Äôs people aforetime: for they were iniquitous folk.
4722: AND IT IS We who have built the universe with [Our creative] power; and, verily, it is We who are steadily expanding it.
4723: And the earth have We spread out wide - and how well have We ordered it!
4724: And in everything have We created oppos¬≠ites, so that you might bear in mind [that God alone is One].
4725: And so, [O Muhammad, say unto them:] ‚ÄúFlee unto God [from all that is false and evil]! Verily, I am a plain warner to you from Him!
4726: And do not ascribe divinity to aught side by side with God: verily, I am a plain warner to you from Him!‚Äù
4727: [But] thus it is: never yet came any apostle to those who lived before their time but they said, ‚ÄúA spellbinder [Lit., "sorcerer".] [is he], or a madman!‚Äù
4728: Have they, perchance, handed down this [way of thinking] as a legacy unto one another? Nay, they are people filled with overweening ar¬≠rogance!
4729: Turn, then, away from them, and thou shalt incur no blame;
4730: yet go on reminding [all who would listen]: for, verily, such a reminder will profit the believers.
4731: And [tell them that] I have not created the invisible beings and men to any end other than that they may [know and] worship Me.
4732: [But withal,] no sustenance do I ever demand of them, nor do I demand that they feed Me:
4733: for, verily, God Himself is the Provider of all sustenance, the Lord of all might, the Eternal!
4734: And, verily, they who are bent on doing evil shall have their share [of evil] like unto the share of their fellows [of old]: so let them not ask Me to hasten [their doom]!
4735: For, woe unto those who are bent on denying the truth - [woe] on the Day which they have been promised
4740: Consider the vault [of heaven] raised high!
4742: VERILY, [O man,] the suffering decreed by thy Sustainer [for the sinners] will indeed come to pass:
4743: there is none who could avert it.
4744: [It will come to pass] on the Day when the skies will be convulsed in [a great] convulsion,
4745: and the mountains will move with [an awesome] movement.
4746: Woe, then, on that Day to all who give the lie to the truth ‚Äì
4747: all those who [throughout their lives] but idly played with things vain ‚Äì
4748: on the Day when they shall be thrust into the fire with [an irresistible] thrust, [and will be told:]
4749: ‚ÄúThis is the fire which you were wont to call a lie!
4750: Was it, then, a delusion or is it that you failed to see [its truth]?
4751: Endure it [now]! But [whether you] bear yourselves with patience or without patience, it will be the same to you: you are but being requited for what you were wont to do.‚Äù
4752: [But,] verily, the God-conscious will find themselves [on that Day] in gardens and in bliss,
4753: rejoicing in all that their Sustainer will have granted them: for their Sustainer will have warded off from them all suffering through the blazing fire.
4754: [And they will be told:] ‚ÄúEat and drink with good cheer as an outcome of what you were wont to do,
4755: reclining on couches [of happiness] ranged in rows!‚Äù And [in that paradise] We shall mate them with companions pure, most beautiful of eye.
4756: And as for those who have attained to faith and whose offspring will have followed them in faith, We shall unite them with their offspring; and We shall not let aught of their deeds go to waste: [but] every human being will be held in pledge for whatever he has earned.
4757: And We shall bestow on them fruit and meat in abundance - whatever they may desire:
4758: and in that [paradise] they shall pass on to one another a cup which will not give rise to empty talk, and neither incite to sin.
4759: And they will be waited upon by [immortal] youths, [as if they were children] of their own, [as pure] as if they were pearls hidden in their shells.
4760: And they [who are thus blest] will turn to one another, asking each other [about their past lives].
4761: They will say: ‚ÄúBehold, aforetime - when we were [still living] in the midst of our kith and kin - we were full of fear [at the thought of God‚Äôs dis¬≠pleasure]:
4762: and so God has graced us with His favour, and has warded off from us all suffering through the scorching winds [of frustration].
4763: Verily, we did invoke Him [alone] ere this: [and now He has shown us] that He alone is truly benign, a true dispenser of grace!‚Äù
4764: EXHORT, then, [O Prophet, all men:] for, by thy Sustainer‚Äôs grace, thou art neither a soothsayer nor a madman.
4765: Or do they say, ‚Äú[He is but] a poet - let us wait what time will do unto him‚Äù?
4766: Say thou: ‚ÄúWait, [then,] hopefully; behold, I, too, shall hopefully wait with you!‚Äù
4767: Is it their minds that bid them [to take] this [attitude] - or are they [simply] people filled with overweening arrogance?
4768: Or do they say, ‚ÄúHe himself has composed this [message]‚Äù? Nay, but they are not willing to believe!
4769: But then, [if they deem it the work of a mere mortal,] let them produce another discourse like it - if what they say be true!
4770: [Or do they deny the existence of God?] Have they themselves been created without anything [that might have caused their creation]? or were they, perchance, their own creators?
4771: [And] have they created the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they have no certainty of anything!
4772: [How could they?] Are thy Sustainer‚Äôs treasures with them? Or are they in charge [of destiny]?
4773: Or have they a ladder by which they could [ascend to ultimate truths and] listen [to what is beyond the reach of human perception]? Let, then, any of them who have listened [to it] produce a manifest proof [of his knowledge]!
4774: Or, [if you believe in God, how can you believe that] He has [chosen to have] daughters, whereas you yourselves would have [only] sons?
4775: Or is it that [they who reject thy message, O Muhammad, fear lest] thou ask of them a reward, so that they would be burdened with debt [if they should listen to thee]?
4776: Or [do they think] that the hidden reality [of all that exists] is almost within their grasp, so that [in time] they can write it down?
4777: Or do they want to entrap [thee in contradic¬≠tions]? But they who are bent on denying the truth - it is they who are truly entrapped!
4778: Have they, then, any deity other than God? Utterly remote is God, in His limitless glory, from anything to which men may ascribe a share in His divinity!
4779: AND YET, if they [who refuse to see the truth] were to see part of the sky falling down, they would [only] say, ‚Äú[It is but] a mass of clouds!‚Äù
4780: Hence, leave them alone until they face that [Judgment] Day of theirs, when they will be stricken with terror:
4781: the Day when none of their scheming will be of the least avail to them, and they will receive no succour.
4782: But, verily, for those who are bent on doing evil, there is suffering in store [even] closer at hand than that [supreme suffering in the hereafter]: but most of them are not aware of it.
4783: And so, await in patience thy Sustainer‚Äôs judgment, for thou art well within Our sight. And extol thy Sustainer‚Äôs limitless glory and praise whenever thou risest up,
4784: and extol His glory at night, and at the time when the stars retreat.
4785: CONSIDER this unfolding [of God‚Äôs message], as it comes down from on high!
4786: This fellow-man of yours has not gone astray, nor is he deluded,
4787: and neither does he speak out of his own desire:
4788: that [which he conveys to you] is but [a divine] inspiration with which he is being inspired ‚Äì
4789: something that a very mighty one has imparted to him:
4790: [an angel] endowed with sur¬≠passing power, who in time manifested himself in his true shape and nature,
4791: appearing in the horizon‚Äôs loftiest part,
4792: and then drew near, and came close,
4793: until he was but two bow-lengths away, or even nearer.
4794: And thus did [God] reveal unto His servant whatever He deemed right to reveal.
4795: The [servant‚Äôs] heart did not give the lie to what he saw:
4796: will you, then, contend with him as to what he saw?
4797: And, indeed, he saw him a second time
4798: by the lote-tree of the farthest limit,
4799: near unto the garden of promise.
4800: with the lote-tree veiled in a veil of nameless splendour‚Ä¶.
4801: [And withal,] the eye did not waver, nor yet did it stray:
4802: truly did he see some of the most profound of his Sustainer‚Äôs symbols.
4803: HAVE YOU, then, ever considered [what you are worshipping in] Al-Lat and Al-Uzza,
4804: as well as [in] Manat, the third and last [of this triad]?
4805: Why - for yourselves [you would choose only] male offspring, whereas to Him [you assign] female:

5093: Verily, as for the men and women who accept the truth as true and who [thus] offer up unto God a goodly loan, they will be amply repaid, and shall have a noble reward [in the life to come].
5094: For, they who have attained to faith in God and His Apostle - it is they, they who uphold the truth, and they who bear witness [thereto] before God: [and so] they shall have their reward and their light! But as for those who are bent on denying the truth and on giving the lie to Our messages - it is they who are destined for the blazing fire!
5095: KNOW [O men] that the life of this world is but a play and a passing delight, and a beautiful show, and [the cause of] your boastful vying with one another, and [of your] greed for more and more riches and children. Its parable is that of [life-giving] rain: the herbage which it causes to grow delights the tillers of the soil; but then it withers, and thou canst see it turn yellow; and in the end it crumbles into dust. But [the abiding truth of man‚Äôs condition will become fully apparent] in the life to come: [either] suffering severe, or God‚Äôs forgiveness and His goodly acceptance: for the life of this world is nothing but an enjoyment of self-delusion.
5096: [Hence,] vie with one another in seeking to attain to your Sustainer‚Äôs forgiveness, and [thus] to a paradise as vast as the heavens and the earth, which has been readied for those who have attained to faith in God and His Apostle: such is the bounty of God which He grants unto whomever He wills - for God is limitless in His great bounty.
5097: NO CALAMITY can ever befall the earth, and nei¬≠ther your own selves, unless it be [laid down] in Our decree before We bring it into being: verily, all this is easy for God.
5098: [Know this,] so that you may not despair over whatever [good] has escaped you nor exult [unduly] over whatever [good] has come to you: for, God does not love any of those who, out of self-conceit, act in a boastful manner ‚Äì
5099: those who are niggardly [with God‚Äôs bounty] and bid others to be niggardly! And he who turns his back [on this truth ought to know that], verily, God alone is self-sufficient, the One to whom all praise is due!
5100: Indeed, [even aforetime] did We send forth Our apostles with all evidence of [this] truth; and through them We bestowed revelation from on high, and [thus gave you] a balance [wherewith to weigh right and wrong], so that men might behave with equity; and We bestowed [upon you] from on high [the ability to make use of] iron, in which there is awesome power as well as [a source of] benefits for man: and [all this was given to you] so that God might mark out those who would stand up for him and His Apostle, even though He [Himself] is beyond the reach of human perception. Verily, God is powerful, almighty!
5101: And, indeed, [to the same end] We sent forth Noah and Abraham [as Our message-bearers], and established prophethood and revelation among their descendants; and some of them were on the right way, but many were iniquitous.
5102: And thereupon We caused [other of] Our apostles to follow in their footsteps; and [in the course of time] We caused them to be followed by Jesus, the son of Mary, upon whom We bestowed the Gospel; and in the hearts of those who [truly] followed him We engendered compassion and mercy. But as for monastic asceticism - We did not enjoin it upon them: they invented it themselves out of a desire for God‚Äôs goodly acceptance. But then, they did not [always] observe it as it ought to have been observed: and so We granted their recompense unto such of them as had [truly] attained to faith, whereas many of them became iniquitous.
5103: O YOU who have attained to faith! Remain con¬≠scious of God, and believe in His Apostle, [and] He will grant you doubly of His grace, and will light for you a light wherein you shall walk, and will forgive you [your past sins]: for God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
5104: And the followers of earlier revelation should know that they have no power whatever over any of God‚Äôs bounty, seeing that all bounty is in God‚Äôs hand [alone]: He grants it unto whomever He wills - for God is limitless in His great bounty.
5105: GOD has indeed heard the words of her who pleads with thee concerning her husband, and complains Unto God. And God does hear what you both have to say: verily, God is all-hearing, all-seeing.
5106: As for those of you who [henceforth] separate themselves from their wives by saying, ‚ÄúThou art as unlawful to me as my mother‚Äù, [let them bear in mind that] they can never be [as] their mothers: none are their mothers save those who gave them birth: and so, behold, they but utter a saying that runs counter to reason, and is [therefore] false. But, behold, God is indeed an absolver of sins, much-forgiving:
5107: hence, as for those who would separate themselves from their wives by saying, ‚ÄúThou art as unlawful to me as my mother‚Äù, and thereafter would go back on what they have said, [their atonement] shall be the freeing of a human being from bondage before the couple may touch one another again: this you are [hereby] exhorted to do - for God is fully aware of all that you do.
5108: However, he who does not have the where¬≠withal shall fast [instead] for two consecutive months before the couple may touch one another again; and he who is unable to do it shall feed sixty needy ones: this, so that you might prove your faith in God and His Apostle. Now these are the bounds set by God; and grievous suffering [in the life to come] awaits all who deny the truth.
5109: Verily, those who contend against God and His Apostle shall be brought low even as those [evildoers] who lived before them were brought low after We had bestowed [on them] clear messages from on high. And [so,] for those who deny the truth there will be shameful suffering in store
5110: on the Day when God will raise them all from the dead and will make them truly understand all that they did [in life]: God will have taken [all of] it into account, even though they [themselves] may have forgotten it - for God is wit¬≠ness unto everything.
5111: ART THOU NOT aware that God knows all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth? Never can there be a secret confabulation between three persons without His being the fourth of them, nor between five without His being the sixth of them; and neither between less than that, or more, without His being with them wherever they may he. But in the end, on Resurrection Day, He will make them truly understand what they did: for, verily, God has full knowledge of everything.
