5112: Art thou not aware of such as have been for¬≠bidden [to intrigue through] secret confabulations, and yet [always] revert to that which they have been forbidden, and conspire with one another with a view to sinful doings, and aggressive conduct, and dis¬≠obedience to the Apostle? Now whenever such [people] approach thee, [O Muhammad,] they salute thee with a greeting which God has never countenanced; and they say to themselves, ‚ÄúWhy does not God chastise us for what we are saying?‚Äù Hell shall be their allotted portion: they shall [in¬≠deed] enter it - and how vile a journey‚Äôs end!
5113: [Hence,] O you who have attained to faith, when you do hold secret confabulations, do not conspire with one another with a view to sinful doings, and aggressive conduct, and disobedience to the Apostle, but [rather] hold counsel in the cause of virtue and God-consciousness: and [always] remain conscious of God, unto whom you all shall be gathered.
5114: [All other kinds of] secret confabulations are but of Satan‚Äôs doing, so that he might cause grief to those who have attained to faith; yet he cannot harm them in the least, unless it be by God‚Äôs leave: in God, then, let the believers place their trust!
5115: O YOU who have attained to faith! When you are told, ‚ÄúMake room for one another in your collective life‚Äù, do make room: [and in return,] God will make room for you [in His grace]. And whenever you are told, ‚ÄúRise up [for a good deed]‚Äù, do rise up; [and] God will exalt by [many] degrees those of you who have attained to faith and, [above all,] such as have been vouchsafed [true] knowledge: for God is fully aware of all that you do.
5116: O YOU who have attained to faith! Whenever you [intend to] consult the Apostle, offer up something in charity on the occasion of your consultation: this will be for your own good, and more conducive to your [inner] purity. Yet if you are unable to do so, [know that,] verily, God is much-forgiving, a dispen¬≠ser of grace.
5117: Do you, perchance, fear lest [you may be sinning if] you cannot offer up anything in charity on the occasion of your consultation [with the Apostle]? But if you fail to do it [for lack of opportunity], and God turns unto you in His mercy, remain but con¬≠stant in prayer and render [no more than] the purify¬≠ing dues, and [thus] pay heed unto God and His Apostle: for God is fully aware of all that you do.
5118: ART THOU NOT aware of those who would be friends with people whom God has condemned? They are neither of you [O believers] nor of those [who utterly reject the truth]: and so they swear to a falsehood the while they know [it to be false].
5119: God has readied for them suffering severe [in the life to come]. Behold, evil indeed is what they are wont to do:
5120: they have made their oaths a cover [for their falseness], and thus they turn others away from the path of God: hence, shameful suffering awaits them.
5121: Neither their worldly possessions nor their offspring will be of the least avail to them against God: it is they who are destined for the fire, therein to abide!
5122: On the Day when God will raise them all from the dead, they will swear before Him as they [now] swear before you, thinking that they are on firm ground [in their assumptions]. Oh, verily, it is they, they who are the [greatest] liars!
5123: Satan has gained mastery over them, and has caused them to remain oblivious of the remem¬≠brance of God. Such as these are Satan‚Äôs partisans: oh, verily, it is they, the partisans of Satan, who will truly be the losers!
5124: Verily, those who contend against God and His Apostle - it is they who [on Judgment Day] shall find themselves among the most abject.
5125: [For] God has thus ordained: ‚ÄúI shall most certainly prevail, I and My apostles!‚Äù Verily, God is powerful, almighty!
5126: Thou canst not find people who [truly] believe in God and the Last Day and [at the same time] love anyone who contends against God and His Apostle - even though they be their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or [others of] their kindred. [As for the true believers,] it is they in whose hearts He has inscribed faith, and whom He has strength¬≠ened with inspiration from Himself, and whom [in time] He will admit into gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide. Well-pleased is God with them, and well-pleased are they with Him. They are God‚Äôs partisans: oh, verily, it is they, the partisans of God, who shall attain to a happy state!
5127: ALL THAT IS in the heavens and all that is on earth extols God‚Äôs limitless glory: for He alone is almighty, truly wise.
5128: He it is who turned out of their homes, at the time of [their] first gathering [for war], such of the followers of earlier revelation as were bent on denying the truth. You did not think [O believers] that they would depart [without resistance] - just as they thought that their strongholds would protect them against God: but God came upon them in a manner which they had not expected, and cast terror into their hearts; [and thus] they destroyed their homes by their own hands as well as the hands of the believers. Learn a lesson, then, O you who are endowed with insight!
5129: And had it not been for God‚Äôs having ordained banishment for them, He would indeed have imposed [yet greater] suffering on them in this world: still, in the life to come there awaits them suffering through fire:
5130: this, because they cut themselves off from God and His Apostle: and as for him who cuts himself off from God and His Apostle - verily, God is severe in retribution!
5131: Whatever [of their] palm trees you may have cut down, [O believers,] or left standing on their roots, was [done] by God‚Äôs leave, and in order that He might confound the iniquitous.
5132: Yet [remember:] whatever [spoils taken] from the enemy God has turned over to His Apostle, you did not have to spur horse or riding-camel for its sake: but God gives His apostles mastery over whomever He wills - for God has the power to will anything.
5133: Whatever [spoils taken] from the people of those villages God has turned over to His Apostle - [all of it] belongs to God and the Apostle, and the near of kin [of deceased believers], and the orphans, and the needy, and the wayfarer, so that it may not be [a benefit] going round and round among such of you as may [already] be rich. Hence, accept [willing¬≠ly] whatever the Apostle* gives you [thereof], and refrain from [demanding] anything that he withholds from you; and remain conscious of God: for, verily, God is severe in retribution.
5134: [Thus, part of such war-gains shall be given] to the poor among those who have forsaken the domain of evil: those who have been driven from their homelands and their possessions, seeking favour with God and [His] goodly acceptance, and who aid [the cause of] God and His Apostle: it is they, they who are true to their word!
5135: And [it shall be offered, too, unto the poor from among] those who, before them, had their abode in this realm and in faith - [those] who love all that come to them in search of refuge, and who harbour in their hearts no grudge for whatever the others may have been given, but rather give them preference over themselves, even though poverty be their own lot: for, such as from their own covetousness are saved - it is they, they that shall attain to a happy state!
5136: And so, they who come after them pray: ‚ÄúO our Sustainer! Forgive us our sins, as well as those of our brethren who preceded us in faith, and let not our hearts entertain any unworthy thoughts or feelings against [any of] those who have attained to faith. O our Sustainer! Verily, Thou art compassionate, a dispenser of grace!‚Äù
5137: ART THOU NOT aware of how those who would always dissemble [their real feelings] speak to their truth-denying brethren from among the followers of earlier revelation: ‚ÄúIf you are driven away, we shall most certainly go forth with you, and shall never pay heed to anyone against you; and if war is waged against you, we shall most certainly come to your succour.‚Äù But God bears witness that they are most flagrantly lying:
5138: [for] if those [to whom they have pledged themselves] are indeed driven away, they will not go forth with them; and if war is waged against them, they will not come to their succour; and even if they [try to] succour them, they will most certainly turn their backs [in flight], and in the end will [themselves] find no succour.
5139: Nay, [O believers,] you arouse in their bosoms a fear more intense than [even their fear of] God: this, because they are people who fail to grasp the truth.
5140: Never will they fight you, [even] in unison, otherwise than from within fortified strongholds or from behind walls. Severe is their warlike discord among themselves: thou wouldst think that they are united, whereas [in fact] their hearts are at odds [with one another]: this, because they are people who will not use their reason.
5141: [To both kinds of your enemies, O believers, is bound to happen] the like of [what happened to] those who, a short while before them, had to taste the evil that came from their own doings, with [yet more] grievous suffering awaiting them [in the life to come]:
5142: the like of [what happens] when Satan says unto man, ‚ÄúDeny the truth!‚Äù - but as soon as [man] has denied the truth, [Satan] says, ‚ÄúBehold, I am not responsible for thee: behold, I fear God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!‚Äù
5143: Thus, in the end, both [the deniers of the truth and the hypocrites] will find themselves in the fire, therein to abide: for such is the recompense of evil¬≠doers.
5144: O YOU who have attained to faith! Remain conscious of God; and let every human being look to what he sends ahead for the morrow! And [once again]: Remain conscious of God, for God is fully aware of all that you do;
5145: and be not like those who are oblivious of God, and whom He therefore causes to be oblivious of [what is good for] their own selves: [for] it is they, they who are truly depraved!
5146: Not equal are those who are destined for the fire and those who are destined for paradise: those who are destined for paradise - it is they, they [alone] who shall triumph [on Judgment Day]!
5147: HAD WE bestowed this Qur‚Äôan from on high upon a mountain, thou wouldst indeed see it humbling itself, breaking asunder for awe of God. And [all] such parables We propound unto men, so that they might [learn to] think.
5148: GOD IS HE save whom there is no deity: the One who knows all that is beyond the reach of a created being‚Äôs perception, as well as all that can be wit¬≠nessed by a creature‚Äôs senses or mind: He, the Most Gracious, the Dispenser of Grace.
5149: God is He save whom there is no deity: the Sovereign Supreme, the Holy, the One with whom all salvation rests, the Giver of Faith, the One who determines what is true and false, the Almighty, the One who subdues wrong and restores right, the One to whom all greatness belongs! Utterly remote is God, in His limitless glory, from anything to which men may ascribe a share in His divinity!
5150: He is God, the Creator, the Maker who shapes all forms and appearances! His [alone] are the attributes of perfection. All that is in the heavens and on earth extols His limitless glory: for He alone is almighty, truly wise!
5151: O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not take My enemies - who are your enemies as well - for your friends, showing them affection even though they are bent on denying whatever truth has come unto you, [and even though] they have driven the Apostle and yourselves away, [only] because you believe in God, your Sustainer! If [it be true that] you have gone forth [from your homes] to strive in My cause, and out of a longing for My goodly acceptance, [do not take them for your friends,] inclining towards them in secret affection: for I am fully aware of all that you may conceal as well as of all that you do openly. And any of you who does this has already strayed from the right path.
5152: If they could but overcome you, they would [still] remain your foes, and would stretch forth their hands and tongues against you with evil intent: for they desire that you [too] should deny the truth.
5153: But [bear in mind that] neither your kinsfolk nor [even] your own children will be of any benefit to you on Resurrection Day, [for then] He will decide between you [on your merit alone]: and God sees all that you do.
5154: Indeed, you have had a good example in Abraham and those who followed him, when they said unto their [idolatrous] people: "Verily, we are quit of you and of all that you worship instead of God: we deny the truth of whatever you believe; and between us and you there has arisen enmity and hatred, to last until such a time as you come to believe in the One God!" The only exception was Abraham's saying to his father "I shall indeed pray for [God's] forgiveness for thee, although I have it not in my power to obtain anything from God in thy behalf." [And Abraham and his followers prayed:] "O our Sustainer! In Thee have we placed our trust, and unto Thee do we turn: for unto Thee is all journeys' end.
5155: O our Sustainer! Make us not a plaything for those who are bent on denying the truth! And forgive us our sins, O our sustainer: for Thou alone art, almighty, truly wise!"
5156: In them, indeed, you have a good example for everyone who looks forward [with hope and awe] to God and the Last Day. And if any turns away, [let him know that] God is truly self-sufficient, the One to whom all praise is due."
5157: [But] it may well be that God will bring about [mutual] affection between you [O believers] and some of those whom you [now] face as enemies: for, God is all-powerful - and God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
5158: As for such [of the unbelievers] as do not fight against you on account of [your] faith, and neither drive you forth from your homelands, God does not forbid you to show them kindness and to behave towards them with full equity: for, verily, God loves those who act equitably.
5159: God only forbids you to turn in friendship towards such as fight against you because of [your] faith, and drive you forth from your homelands, or aid [others] in driving you forth: and as for those [from among you] who turn towards them in friendship; it is they, they who are truly wrongdoers!
5160: O YOU who have attained to faith! Whenever believing women come unto you, forsaking the domain of evil, examine them, [although only] God is fully aware of their faith; and if you have thus ascertained that they are believers, do not send them back to the deniers of the truth, [since] they are [no longer] lawful to their erstwhile husbands, and these are [no longer] lawful to them. None the less, you shall return to them whatever they have spent [on their wives by way of dower]; and [then, O believers,] you will be committing no sin if you marry them after giving them their dowers. On the other hand, hold not to the marriage-tie with women who [continue to] deny the truth, and ask but for [the return of] whatever you have spent [by way of dower] -just as they [whose wives have gone over to you] have the right to demand [the return of] whatever they have spent. Such is God's judgment: He judges between you [in equity] - for God is all-knowing, wise.
5161: And if any of your wives should go over to the deniers of the truth, and you are thus afflicted in turn, then give unto those whose wives have gone away the equivalent of what they had spent [on their wives by way of dower], and remain conscious of God, in whom you believe!
5162: O Prophet! Whenever believing women come unto thee to pledge their allegiance to thee, [pledging] that [henceforth] they would not ascribe divinity, in any way, to aught but God, and would not steal, and would not commit adultery, and would not kill their children, and would not indulge in slander, falsely devising it out of nothingness: and would not disobey thee in anything [that thou declarest to be] right - then accept their pledge of allegiance, and pray to God to forgive them their [past] sins: for, behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
5163: O YOU who have attained to faith! Be not friends with people whom God has condemned! They [who would befriend them] are indeed bereft of all hope of a life to come - just as those deniers of the truth are bereft of all hope of [ever again seeing] those who are [now] in their graves.
5164: ALL THAT IS in the heavens and all that is on earth extols God's limitless glory: for He alone is almighty, truly wise!
5165: O YOU who have attained to faith! Why do you say one thing and do another?
5166: Most loathsome is it in the sight of God that you say what you do not do!
5167: Verily, God loves [only] those who fight in His cause in [solid] ranks, as though they were a building firm and compact.
5168: Now when Moses spoke to his people, [it was this same truth that he had in mind:] "O my people! Why do you cause me grief, the while you know that I am an apostle of God sent unto you?" And so, when they swerved from the right way, God let their hearts swerve from the truth: for God does not bestow His guidance upon iniquitous folk.
5169: And [this happened, too,] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said: "O children of Israel! Behold, I am an apostle of God unto you, [sent] to confirm the truth of whatever there still remains of the Torah, and to give [you] the glad tiding of an apostle who shall come after me, whose name shall be Ahmad." But when he [whose coming Jesus had foretold] came unto them with all evidence of the truth, they said: "This [alleged message of his] is [nothing but] spellbinding eloquence!"
5170: And who could be more wicked than one who invents [such] a lie about [a message from] God, seeing that he is [but] being called to self-surrender unto Him? But God does not bestow His guidance upon evil-doing folk.
5171: They aim to extinguish God's light with their utterances: but God has willed to spread His light in all its fullness, however hateful this may be to all who deny the truth
5172: He it is who has sent forth His Apostle with [the task of] spreading guidance and the religion of truth, to the end that He make it prevail over all [false] religion, however hateful this may be to those who ascribe divinity to aught but God.
5173: O YOU who have attained to faith! Shall I point out to you a bargain that will save you from grievous suffering [in this world and in the life to come]?
5174: You are to believe in God and His Apostle, and to strive hard in God's cause with your possessions and your lives: this is for your own good - if you but knew it!
5175: [If you do so,] He will forgive you your sins, and [in the life to come] will admit you into gardens through which running waters flow, and into goodly mansions in [those] gardens of perpetual bliss: that [will be] the triumph supreme!
5176: And [withal, He will grant you] yet another thing that you dearly love: succour from God [in this world], and a victory soon to come: and [thereof, O Prophet,] give thou a glad tiding to all who believe.
5177: O YOU who have attained to faith! Be helpers [in the cause of God - even as Jesus, the son of Mary, said unto the white-garbed ones, "Who will be my helpers in God's cause?" - whereupon the white-garbed [disciples] replied, "We shall be [thy] helpers [in the cause] of God!" And so [it happened that] some of the children of Israel came to believe [in the apostleship of Jesus], whereas others denied the truth. But [now] We have given strength against their foes unto those who have [truly] attained to faith: and they have become the ones that shall prevail.
5178: ALL THAT IS in the heavens and all that is on earth extols the limitless glory of God, the Sovereign Supreme, the Holy, the Almighty, the Wise!
5179: He it is who has sent unto the unlettered people an apostle from among themselves, to convey unto them His messages, and to cause them to grow in purity, and to impart unto them the divine writ as well as wisdom - whereas before that they were indeed, most obviously, lost in error
5180: and [to cause this message to spread] from them unto other people as soon as they come into contact with them: for He alone is almighty, truly wise!
5181: Such is God's bounty: He grants it to anyone who is willing [to receive it]: for God is limitless in His great bounty.
5182: THE PARABLE of those who were graced with the burden of the Torah, and thereafter failed to bear this burden, is that of an ass that carries a load of books [but cannot benefit from them]. Calamitous is the parable of people who are bent on giving the lie to God's messages - for God does not bestow His guidance upon such evildoing folk!
5183: Say: "O you who follow the Jewish faith! If you claim that you [alone] are close to God, to the exclusion of all other people, then you should be longing for death - if what you say is true!"
5184: But never will they long for it, because [they are aware] of what their hands have wrought in this world; and God has full knowledge of evildoers.
5185: Say: "Behold, the death from which you are fleeing is bound to overtake you - and then you will be brought back unto Him who knows all that is beyond the reach of a created being's perception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature's senses or mind, whereupon He will make you truly understand all that you were doing [in life].
5186: O YOU who have attained to faith! When the call to prayer is sounded on the day of congregation, hasten to the remembrance of God, and leave all worldly commerce: this is for your own good, if you but knew it.
5187: And when the prayer is ended, disperse freely on earth and seek to obtain [something] of God's bounty; but remember God often, so that you might attain to a happy state!
5188: Yet [it does happen that] when people become aware of [an occasion for] worldly gain or a passing delight, they rush headlong towards it, and leave thee standing [and preaching]. Say: "That which is with God is far better than all passing delight and all gain! And God is the best of providers!"
5189: WHEN THE HYPOCRITES come unto thee, they say, "We bear witness that thou art indeed God's Apostle!" But God knows that thou art truly His Apostle; and He bears witness that the hypocrites are indeed false [in their declaration of faith].
5190: They have made their oaths a cover [for their falseness], and thus they turn others away from the Path of God. Evil indeed is all that they are wont to do:
5191: this, because [they profess that] they have attained to faith, whereas [inwardly] they deny the truth - and so, a seal has been set on their hearts so that they can no longer understand [what is true and what false].
5192: Now when thou seest them, their outward appearance may please thee; and when they speak, thou art inclined to lend ear to what they say. [But though they may seem as sure of themselves] as if they were timbers [firmly] propped up, they think that every shout is [directed] against them. They are the [real] enemies [of all faith], so beware of them. [They deserve the imprecation,] "May God destroy them!" How perverted are their minds!
5193: for, when they are told, "Come, the Apostle of God will pray [unto God] that you be forgiven", they turn their heads away, and thou canst see how they draw back in their false pride.
5194: As for them it is all the same whether thou dost pray that they be forgiven or dost not pray for them: God will nor forgive them - for, behold, God does not bestow His guidance upon such iniquitous folk.
5195: It is they who say [to their compatriots], "Do not spend anything on those who are with God's Apostle, so that they [may be forced to] leave." However, unto God belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth: but this truth the hypocrites cannot grasp.
5196: [And] they say, "Indeed, when we return to the City [we,] the ones most worthy of honour will surely drive out therefrom those most contemptible ones!" However, all honour belongs to God, and [thus] to His Apostle and those who believe [in God]: but of this the hypocrites are not aware.
5197: O YOU who have attained to faith! Let not your worldly goods or your children make you oblivious of the remembrance of God: for If any behave thus - it is they, they who are the losers!
5198: And spend on others out of what We have provided for you as sustenance, ere there come a time when death approaches any of you, and he then says, "O my Sustainer! If only Thou wouldst grant me a delay for a short while, so that I could give in charity and be among the righteous!"
5199: But never does God grant a delay to a human being when his term has come; and God is fully aware of all that you do.
5200: ALL THAT IS in the heavens and all that is on earth extols God's limitless glory: His is all dominion, and to Him all praise is due; and He has the power to will anything.
5201: He it is who has created you: and among you are such as deny this truth, and among you are such as believe [in it]. And God sees all that you do.
5202: He has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an inner] truth, and has formed you - and formed you so well; and with Him is your journey's end.
5203: He knows all that is in the heavens and on earth; and He knows all that you keep secret as well as all that you bring into the open: for God has full knowledge of what is in the hearts [of men].
5204: HAVE THE STORIES of those who, in earlier times, refused to acknowledge the truth never yet come within your ken? [They denied it -] and so they had to taste the evil outcome of their own doings, with [more] grievous suffering awaiting them [in the life to come]:
5205: this, because time and again there came unto them their apostles with all evidence of the truth, but they [always] replied, "Shall mere mortal men be our guides?" And so they. denied the truth and turned away. But God was not in need [of them]: for God is self-sufficient, ever to be praised.
5206: They who are bent on denying the truth claim that they will never be raised from the dead! Say: "Yea, by my Sustainer! Most surely will you be raised from the dead, and then, most surely, will you be made to understand what you did [in life]! For, easy is this for God!"
5207: Believe then, [O men,] in God and His Apostle, and in the light [of revelation] which We have bestowed [on you] from on high! And God is fully aware of all that you do.
5208: [Think of] the time when He shall gather you all together unto the Day of the [Last] Gathering - that Day of Loss and Gain! For, as for him who shall have believed in God and done what is just and right, He will [on that Day] efface his bad deeds, and will admit him into gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide beyond the count of time: that will be a triumph supreme!
5209: But as for those who are bent on denying the truth and on giving the lie to Our messages - they are destined for the fire, therein to abide: and how vile a journey‚Äôs end!
5210: NO CALAMITY can ever befall [man] unless it be by God's leave: hence, whoever believes in God guides his [own] heart [towards this truth]; and God has full knowledge of everything.
5211: Pay heed, then, unto God, and pay heed unto the Apostle; and if you turn away, [know that] Our Apostle's only duty is a clear delivery of this message:
5212: God - there is no deity save Him! In God then let the believers place their trust.
5213: O YOU who have attained to faith! Behold, some of your spouses and your children are enemies unto you: so beware of them! But if you pardon [their faults] and forbear, and forgive-then, behold, God will be much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
5214: Your worldly goods and your children are but a trial and a temptation, whereas with God there is a tremendous reward.
5215: Remain, then, conscious of God as best you can, and listen [to Him], and pay heed. And spend in charity for the good of your own selves: for, such as from their own covetousness are saved ‚Äì it is they, they that shall attain to a happy state!
5216: If you offer up to God a goodly loan, He will amply repay you for it, and will forgive you your sins: for God is ever responsive to gratitude, forbearing,
5217: knowing all that is beyond the reach of a created being's perception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature's senses or mind - the Almighty, the Wise!
5218: O PROPHET! When you [intend to divorce women, divorce them with a view to the waiting period appointed for them, and reckon the period [carefully], and be conscious of God, your Sustainer. Do not expel them from their homes; and neither shall they [be made to] leave unless they become openly guilty of immoral conduct. These, then, are the bounds set by God - and he who transgresses the bounds set by God does indeed sin against himself: [for, O man, although] thou knowest it not, after that [first breach] God may well cause something new to come about.
5219: And so, when they are about to reach the end of their waiting-term, either retain them in a fair manner or part with them in a fair manner. And let two persons of [known] probity from among your own community witness [what you have decided]; and do yourselves bear true witness before God: thus are admonished all who believe in God and the Last Day. And unto everyone who is conscious of God, He [always] grants a way out [of unhappiness],
5220: and provides for him in a manner beyond all expectation; and for everyone who places his trust in God He [alone] is enough. Verily, God always attains to His purpose: [and] indeed, unto everything has God appointed its [term and] measure.
5221: Now as for such of your women as are beyond, the age of monthly courses, as well as for such as do not have any courses, their waiting-period - if you have any doubt [about it] - shall be three [calendar] months; and as for those who are with child, the end of their waiting-term shall come when they deliver their burden. And for everyone who is conscious of God, He makes it easy to obey His commandment:
5222: [for] all this is God's commandment, which He has bestowed upon you from on high. And unto everyone who is conscious of God will He pardon [some of] his bad deeds, and will grant him a vast reward.
5223: [Hence,] let the women [who are undergoing a waiting-period] live in the same manner as you live yourselves, In accordance with your means; and do not harass them with a view to making their lives a misery. And if they happen to be with child, spend freely on them until they deliver their burden; and if they nurse your offspring [after the divorce has become final], give them their [due] recompense; and take counsel with one another in a fair manner [about the child's future]. And if both of you find it difficult [that the mother should nurse the child], let another woman nurse it on behalf of him [who has begotten it].
5224: [In all these respects,] let him who has ample means spend in accordance with his amplitude; and let him whose means of subsistence are scanty spend in accordance with what God has given him: God does not burden any human being with more than He has given him - [and it may well be that] God will grant, after hardship, ease.
5225: AND HOW MANY a community has turned with disdain from the commandment of its Sustainer and His apostles! -whereupon We callled them all to account with an accounting severe, and caused them to suffer with a suffering unnameable:
5226: and thus they had to taste the evil outcome of their own doing: for, [in this world,] the end of their doings was ruin,
5227: [the while] God has readied for them [yet more] suffering severe [in the life to come] Hence, remain conscious of God, O you who are endowed with insight - [you] who have attained to faith! God has indeed bestowed on you a reminder from on high:
5228: [He has sent] an apostle who conveys unto you God's clear messages, so that He might those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds out of the depths of darkness into the light. And whoever believes in God and does what is right and just, him will He admit into gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide beyond the count of time: indeed, a most goodly provision will God have granted him!
5229: GOD is He who has created seven heavens, and, like them, [the many aspects] of the earth. Through all of them flows down from on high, unceasingly, His [creative] will, so that you might come to know that God has the power to will anything, and that God encompasses all things with His knowledge.
5230: O PROPHET! Why dost thou, out of a desire to please [one or another of] thy wives, impose [on thyself] a prohibition of something that God has made lawful to thee? But God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace:
5231: God has already enjoined upon you [O believers] the breaking and expiation of [such of] your oaths [as may run counter to what is right and just]: for, God is your Lord Supreme, and He alone is all-knowing, truly wise.
5232: And lo! [It so happened that] the Prophet told something in confidence to one of his wives; and when she thereupon divulged it, and God made this known to him, he acquainted [others] with some of it and passed over some of it. And as soon as he let her know it, she asked, "Who has told thee this?" - [to which] he replied, "The All-Knowing, the All-Aware has told me."
5233: [Say, O Prophet:] "Would that you two turn unto God in repentance, for the hearts of both of you have swerved [from what is right]! And if you uphold each other against him [who is God's message-bearer, know that] God Himself is his Protector, and [that,] therefore, Gabriel, and all the righteous among the believers and all the [other] angels will come to his aid."
5234: [O wives of the Prophet!] Were he to divorce [any of] you, God might well give him in your stead spouses better than you - women who surrender themselves unto God, who truly believe, devoutly obey His will, turn [unto Him] in repentance [whenever they have sinned] worship [Him alone] and go on and on [seeking His goodly acceptance] - be they women previously married or virgins.
5235: O YOU who have attained to faith! Ward off from yourselves and those who are close to you that fire [of the hereafter] whose fuel is human beings and stones: [lording] over it are angelic powers awesome [and] severe, who do not disobey God in whatever He has commanded them, but [always] do what they are bidden to do.
5236: [Hence,] O you who are bent on denying the truth, make no [empty] excuses today: [in the life to come] you shall be but recompensed for what you were doing [in this world].
5237: O you who have attained to faith! Turn unto God in sincere repentance: it may well be that your Sustainer will efface from you your bad deeds, and will admit you into gardens through which running waters flow, on a Day on which God will not shame the Prophet and those who share his faith: their light will spread rapidly before them, and on their right; [and] they will pray: "O our Sustainer! Cause this our light to shine for us forever, and forgive us our sins: for, verily, Thou hast the power to will anything!"
5238: O PROPHET! Strive hard against the deniers of the truth and the hypocrites, and be adamant with them. And [if they do not repent,] their goal shall be hell - and how vile a journey‚Äôs end!
5239: For those who are bent on denying the truth God has propounded a parable in [the stories of] Noah's wife and Lot's wife: they were wedded to two of Our righteous servants, and each one betrayed her husband; and neither of the two [husbands] will be of any avail to these two women when they are told [on Judgment Day], "Enter the fire with all those [other sinners] who enter it!"
5240: And for those who have attained to faith God has propounded a parable in [the story of] Pharaoh's wife as she prayed "O my Sustainer! Build Thou for me a mansion in the paradise [that is] with Thee, and save me from Pharaoh and his doings, and save me, from all evildoing folk!
5241: And [We have propounded yet another parable of God-consciousness in the story of] Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity, whereupon We breathed of Our spirit into that [which was in her womb], and who accepted the truth of her Sustainer‚Äôs words - and [thus,] of His revelations - and was one of the truly devout.
5242: HALLOWED be He in whose hand all dominion rests, since He has the power to will anything:
5243: He who has created death as well as life, so that He might put you to a test [and thus show] which of you is best in conduct, and [make you realize that] He alone is almighty, truly forgiving.
5244: [Hallowed be] He who has created seven heavens in full harmony with one another: no fault will thou see in the creation of the Most Gracious. And turn thy vision [upon it] once more: canst thou see any flaw?
5245: Yea, turn thy vision [upon it] again and yet again: [and every time] thy vision will fall back upon thee, dazzled and truly defeated‚Ä¶.
5246: And, indeed, We have adorned the skies nearest to the earth with lights, and have made them the object of futile guesses for the evil ones [from among men]: and for them have We readied suffering through a blazing flame ‚Äì
5247: for, suffering in hell awaits all who are [thus] bent on blaspheming against their Sustainer: and how vile a journey's end!
5248: When they are cast into that [hell], they will hear its breath indrawing as it boils up,
5249: well-nigh bursting with fury; [and] every time a host [of such sinners] is flung into it, its keepers will ask them, "Has no warner ever come to you?"
5250: They will reply: "Yea, a warner did indeed come unto us, but we gave him the lie and said, 'Never has God sent down anything [by way of revelation]! You [self-styled warners] are but lost in a great delusion!"'
5251: And they will add: "Had we but listened [to those warnings], or [at least] used our own reason, we would not [now] be among those who are destined for the blazing flame!"
5252: Thus will they come to realize their sins: but [by that time,] remote will have become all good from those who are destined for the blazing flame.
5253: [As against this,] behold, for those who stand in awe of God although He is beyond the reach of their perception, there is forgiveness in store and a great reward.
5254: AND [know, O men, that] whether you keep your beliefs secret or state them openly, He has full knowledge indeed of all that is in [your] hearts.
5255: How could it be that He who has created [all] should not know [all]? Yea, He alone is unfathomable [in His wisdom], aware!
5256: He it is who has made the earth easy to live upon: go about, then, in all its regions, and partake the sustenance which He provides: but [always bear in mind that] unto Him you shall be resurrected.
5257: Can you ever feel secure that He who is in heaven will not cause the earth to swallow you up when, lo and behold, it begins to quake?
5258: Or can you ever feel secure that He who is in heaven will not let loose against you a deadly stormwind, whereupon you would come to know how [true] My warning was?
5259: And, indeed, [many of] those who lived aforetime did give the lie [to My warnings]: and how awesome was My rejection [of them]!
5260: Have they, then, never beheld the birds above them, spreading their wings and drawing them in? None but the Most Gracious upholds them: for, verily, He keeps all things in His sight.
5261: [And] is there any, besides the Most Gracious, that could be a shield for you, and could succour you [against danger]? They who deny this truth are but lost in self- delusion!
5262: Or is there any that could provide you with sustenance if He should withhold His provision [from you]? Nay, but they [who are bent on denying the truth] stubbornly persist in their disdain [of God's messages] and in their headlong flight [from Him]!
5263: But then, is he that goes along with his face close to the ground better guided than he that walks upright on a straight way?
5264: SAY: "[God is] He who has brought you [all] into being, and has endowed you with hearing, and sight, and hearts: [yet] how seldom are you grateful!"
5265: Say: "It is He who has multiplied you on earth; and it is unto Him that you shall be gathered [on resurrection]."
5266: But they [only] ask, "When is this promise to be fulfilled? [Answer this, O you who believe in it,] if you are men of truth!"
5267: Say thou, [O Prophet:] "Knowledge thereof rests with God alone; and I am only a plain warner."
5268: Yet in the end, when they shall see that [fulfilment] close at hand, the faces of those who were bent on denying the truth will be stricken with grief; and they will be told, "This it is that you were [so derisively] calling for!"
5269: SAY [O Prophet]: "What do you think? Whether God destroys me and those who follow me, or graces us with His mercy - is there anyone that could protect [you] deniers of the truth from grievous suffering [in the life to come]?"
5270: Say: "He is the Most Gracious: we have attained to faith in Him, and in Him have we placed our trust; and in time you will come to know which of us was lost in manifest error."
5271: Say [unto those who deny the truth]: "What do you think? If of a sudden all your water were to vanish underground, who [but God] could provide you with water from [new] unsullied springs?"
5272: Nun. CONSIDER the pen, and all that they write [therewith]!
5273: Thou art not, by thy Sustainer's grace, a madman!
5274: And, verily, thine shall be a reward neverending ‚Äì
5275: for, behold, thou keepest indeed to a sublime way of life;
5276: and [one day] thou shalt see, and they [who now deride thee] shall see,
5277: which of you was bereft of reason.
5278: Verily, thy Sustainer alone is fully aware as to who has strayed from His path, Just as He alone is fully aware of those who have found the right way.
5279: Hence, defer not to [the likes and dislikes of] those who give the lie to the truth:
5280: they would like thee to be soft [with them], so that they might be soft [with thee].
5281: Furthermore, defer not to the contemptible swearer of oaths,
5282: [or to] the slanderer that goes about with defaming tales,
5283: [or] the withholder of good, [or] the sinful aggressor,
5284: [or] one who is cruel, by greed possessed, and, in addition to all this, utterly useless [to his fellow-men].
5285: Is it because he is possessed of worldly goods and children
5286: that, whenever Our messages are conveyed to him, such a one says, "Fables of ancient times"?
5287: [For this] We shall brand him with indelible disgrace!
5288: [As for such sinners,] behold, We [but] try them as We tried the owners of a certain garden who vowed that they would surely harvest its fruit on the morrow,
5289: and made no allowance [for the will of God]:
5290: whereupon a visitation for thy Sustainer came upon that [garden] while they were asleep,
5291: so that by the morrow it became barren and bleak.
5292: Now when they rose at early morn, they called unto one another,
5293: "Go early to your tilth if you want to harvest the fruit!"
5294: Thus they launched forth, whispering unto one another,
5295: "Indeed, no needy person shall enter it today [and come] upon you [unawares],"
5296: ‚Äì and early they went, strongly bent upon their purpose.
5297: But as soon as they beheld [the garden and could not recognize] it, they exclaimed, "Surely we have lost our way!"
5298: - [and then,] "Nay, but we have been rendered destitute!"
5299: Said the most right-minded among them: "Did I not tell you, 'Will you not extol God's limitless glory?‚Äô"
5300: They answered: "Limitless in His glory is our Sustainer! Verily, we were doing wrong!"
5301: - and then they turned upon one another with mutual reproaches.
5302: [In the end] they said: "Oh, woe unto us! Verily, we did behave outrageously!
5303: [But] it may be that our Sustainer will grant us something better instead: for, verily, unto our Sustainer do we turn with hope!"
5304: SUCH is the suffering [with which We try some people in this world]; but greater by far will be the suffering [which sinners shall have to bear] in the life to come - if they but knew it!
5305: For, behold, it is the God-conscious [alone] whom gardens of bliss await with their Sustainer:
5306: or should We, perchance, treat those who surrender themselves unto Us as [We would treat] those who remain lost in sin?
5307: What is amiss with you? On what do you base your judgment [of right and wrong]?
5308: Or have you, perchance, a [special] divine writ which you study,
5309: and in which you find all that you may wish to find?
5310: Or have you received a solemn promise, binding on Us till Resurrection Day, that yours will assuredly be whatever you judge [to be your rightful due]?
5311: Ask them which of them is able to vouch for this!
5312: Or have they, perchance, any sages to support their views? Well, then, if they are sincere in this their claim, let them produce those supporters of theirs
5313: on the Day when man's very being shall be bared to the bone, and when they [who now deny the truth] shall be called upon to prostrate themselves [before God], and shall be unable to do so:
5314: downcast will be their eyes, with ignominy overwhelming them - seeing that they had been called upon [in vain] to prostrate themselves [before Him] while they were yet sound [and alive].
5315: Hence, leave Me alone with such as give the lie to this tiding. We shall bring them low, step by step, without their perceiving how it has come about:
5316: for, behold, though I may give them rein for a while, My subtle scheme is exceedingly firm!
5317: Or is it that [they fear lest] thou ask them for a reward, [O Prophet,] so that they would be burdened with debt [if they listened to thee]?
5318: Or [do they think] that the hidden reality [of all that exists] is within their grasp, so that [in time] they can write it down?
5319: BEAR THEN with patience thy Sustainer's will and be not like him of the great fish, who cried out [in distress] after having given in to anger.
5320: [And remember:] had not grace from his Sustainer reached him, he would indeed have been cast forth upon that barren shore in a state of disgrace:
5321: but [as it was,] his Sustainer had elected him and placed him among the righteous.
5322: Hence, [be patient,] even though they who are bent on denying the truth would all but kill thee with their eyes whenever they hear this reminder, and [though] they say, "[As for Muhammad,] behold, most surely he is a madman!"
5323: [Be patient:] for this is nought else but a reminder [from God] to all mankind.
5324: OH, THE LAYING-BARE of the truth!
5325: How awesome that laying-bare of the truth!
5326: And what could make thee conceive what that laying-bare of the truth will be?
5327: THE LIE gave [the tribes of] Thamud and ‚ÄòAd to [all tidings of] that sudden calamity!
5328: Now as for the Thamud - they were destroyed by a violent upheaval [of the earth];
5329: and as for the ‚ÄòAd - they were destroyed by a storm wind furiously raging,
5330: which He willed against them for seven nights and eight days without cease, so that in the end thou couldst see those people laid low [in death], as though they were so many [uprooted] trunks of hollow palm trees:
5331: and dost thou now see any remnant of them?
5332: And there was Pharaoh, too, and [many of] those who lived before him, and the cities that were overthrown - [all of them] indulged in sin upon sin
5333: and rebelled against their Sustainer's apostles: and so He took them to task with a punishing grasp exceedingly severe!
5334: [And] behold: when the waters [of Noah's flood] burst beyond all limits, it was We who caused you to be borne [to safety] in that floating ark,
5335: so that We might make all this a [lasting] reminder to you all, and that every wide-awake ear might consciously take it in.
5336: Hence, [bethink yourselves of the Last Hour,] when the trumpet [of judgment] shall be sounded with a single blast,
5337: and the earth and the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed with a single stroke!
5338: And so, that which must come to pass will on that day have come to pass;
5339: and the sky will be rent asunder - for, frail will it have become on that Day -;
5340: and the angels [will appear] at its ends, and, above them, eight will bear aloft on that Day the throne of thy Sustainer‚Äôs almightiness‚Ä¶
5341: On that Day you shall be brought to judgment: not [even] the most hidden of your deeds will remain hidden.
5342: Now as for him whose record shall be placed in his right hand, he will exclaim: "Come you all!" Read this my record!
5343: Behold, I did know that [one day] I would have to face my account!
5344: And so he will find himself in a happy state of life,
5346: with its fruits within easy reach.
5347: [And all who are thus blest will be told:] "Eat and drink with good cheer in return for all [the good deeds] that you have sent ahead in days gone by!"
5348: But as for him whose record shall be placed in his left hand, he will exclaim: "Oh, would that I had never been shown this my record,
5349: and neither known this my account!
5350: Oh, would that this [death of mine] had been the end of me!
5351: Of no avail to me is all that I have [ever] possessed,
5352: [and] all my power of argument has died away from me!"
5353: Thereupon the command will go forth:] "Lay hold of him, and shackle him,
5354: and then let him enter hell,
5355: and then thrust him into a chain [of other sinners like him - a chain] the length whereof is seventy cubits:
5356: for, behold, he did not believe in God, the Tremendous,
5357: and did not feel any urge to feed the needy:
5358: and so, no friend has here today,
5359: nor any food save the filth
5360: which none but the sinners eat!"
5361: BUT NAY! I call to witness an that you can see,
5362: as well as all that you cannot see!
5363: Behold, this [Qur‚Äôan] is indeed the [inspired] word of a noble apostle,
5364: and is not ‚Äì however little you may [be prepared to] believe it - the word of a poet;
5365: and neither is it - however little you may [be prepared to] take it to heart - the word of a soothsayer:
5366: [it is] a revelation from the Sustainer of all the worlds.
5367: Now if he [whom We have entrusted with it] had dared to attribute some [of his own] sayings unto Us,
5368: We would indeed have seized him by his right hand,
5369: and would indeed have cut his life-vein.
5370: and none of you could have saved him!
5371: And, verily, this [Qur‚Äôan] is a reminder to all the God-conscious!
5372: And, behold, well do We know that among you are such as will give the lie to it:
5373: yet, behold, this [rejection] will indeed become a source of bitter regret for all who deny the truth [of God's revelation] ‚Äì
5374: for, verily, it is truth absolute!
5375: Extol, then the limitless glory of thy Sustainer's mighty name!
5376: ONE who is minded to ask might ask about the suffering which [in the hereafter] is bound to befall
5377: those who deny the truth. [Know, then, that] nothing can ward it off,
5378: [since it will come] from God, unto whom there are many ways of ascent:
5379: all the angels and all the inspiration [ever granted to man] ascend unto Him [daily,] in a day the length whereof is [like] fifty thousand years‚Ä¶
5380: Therefore, [O believer,] endure all adversity with goodly patience:
5381: behold, men look upon that [reckoning] as something far away ‚Äì
5382: but, We see it as near!
5383: [It will take place] on a Day when the sky will be like molten lead,
5384: and the mountains will be like tufts of wool,
5385: and [when] no friend will ask about his friend,
5386: though they may be in one another's sight: [for,] everyone who was lost in sin will on that Day but desire to ransom himself from suffering at the price of his own children,
5387: and of his spouse, and of his brother,
5388: and of all the kinsfolk who ever sheltered him,
5389: and of whoever [else] lives on earth, all of them - so that he could but save himself.
5390: But nay! Verily, all [that awaits him] is a raging flame,
5392: It will claim all such as turn their backs [on what is right], and turn away [from the truth],
5393: and amass [wealth] and thereupon withhold [it from their fellow-men].
5394: VERILY, man is born with a restless disposition.
5395: [As a rule,] whenever misfortune touches him, he is filled with self-pity;
5396: and whenever good fortune comes to him, he selfishly withholds it [from others].
5397: Not so, however, those who consciously turn towards God in prayer.
5398: [and] who incessantly persevere in their prayer
5399: and in whose possessions there is a due share, acknowledged [by them],
5400: for such as ask [for help] and such as are deprived [of what is good in life];
5401: and who accept as true the [coming of the] Day of Judgment;
5402: and who stand in dread of their Sustainer's chastisement ‚Äì
5403: for, behold, of their Sustainer's chastisement none may ever feel [wholly] secure;
5404: and who are mindful of their chastity,
5405: [not giving way to their desires] with any but their spouses - that is, those whom they rightfully possess [through wedlock] -: for then, behold, they are free of all blame,
5406: whereas such as seek to go beyond that [limit] are truly transgressors;
5407: and who are faithful to their trusts and to their pledges:
5408: and who stand firm whenever they bear witness;
5409: and who guard their prayers [from all worldly intent].
5410: These it is who in the gardens [of paradise] shall be honoured!
5411: WHAT, THEN, is amiss with such as are bent on denying the truth, that they run about confusedly to and fro before thee,
5412: [coming upon thee] from the right and from the left, in crowds?
5413: Does every one of them hope to enter [by this means] a garden of bliss?
5414: Never! For, behold, We have created them out of something that they know [only too well]!
5415: But nay! I call to witness [Our being] the Sustainer of all the points of sunrise and sunset: verily, well able are We
5416: to replace them with [people] better than they are; for there is nothing to prevent Us [from doing what We will].
5417: Hence, leave them to indulge in idle talk and play [with words] until they face that [Judgment] Day of theirs which they have been promised ‚Äì
5418: the Day when they shall come forth in haste from their graves, as if racing towards a goal-post,
5419: with downcast eyes, with ignominy overwhelming them: that Day which they were promised again and‚Ä¶
5420: BEHOLD. We sent Noah unto his people. [saying:] "Warn thy people ere grievous suffering befall them!
5421: [And Noah] said: "O my people! I am but a plain warner to you, [sent to tell you]
5422: that you should worship God [alone] and be conscious of Him. "Now do pay heed unto me,
5423: so that He may forgive you some of your sins, and grant you respite until a term known [to Him alone]: but, behold, when the term appointed by God does come, it can never be put back - if you but knew it!"
5424: [And after a time, Noah] said: "O my Sustainer! Verily, I have been calling unto my people night and day
5425: but my call has only caused them to flee farther and farther away [from Thee].
5426: And behold, whenever I called unto them with a view to Thy granting them forgiveness, they put their fingers into their ears, and wrapped themselves up in their garments [of sin]; and grew obstinate, and became [yet more] arrogant in their false pride.
5427: "And behold I called unto them openly;
5428: and, behold I preached to them in public; and I spoke to them secretly, in private;
5429: and I said: "'Ask your Sustainer to forgive you your sins - for, verily, He is all-forgiving!
5430: He will shower upon you heavenly blessings abundant,
5431: and will aid you with worldly goods and children, and will bestow upon you gardens, and bestow upon you running waters.
5432: "'What is amiss with you that you cannot look forward to God's majesty,
5433: seeing that He has created [every one of] you in successive stages?
5434: "'Do you not see how God has created seven heavens in full harmony with one another,
5435: and has set up within them the moon as a light [reflected] and set up the sun as a [radiant] lamp?
5436: "'And God has caused you to grow out of the earth in [gradual] growth; and thereafter He will return you to it [in death]:
5437: and [then] He will bring you forth [from It] in resurrection.
5438: "'And God has made the earth a wide expanse for you,
5439: so that you might walk thereon on spacious paths.‚Äô"
5440: [And] Noah continued: "O my Sustainer! Behold, they have opposed me [throughout], for they follow people whose wealth and children lead them increasingly into ruin,
5441: and who have devised a most awesome blasphemy [against Thee],
5442: inasmuch as they said [to their followers], 'Do not ever abandon your gods: abandon neither Wadd nor Suwa', and neither Yaghuth nor Ya‚Äôuq nor Nasr!'
5443: "And so they have led many a one astray: hence, ordain Thou that these evildoers stray but farther and farther away [from all that they may desire]!"
5444: And so, because of their sins, they were drowned [in the great flood], and were doomed to suffer the fire [of the hereafter]; and they found none who could succour them against God.
5445: And Noah prayed: "O my Sustainer! Leave not on earth any of those who deny the truth:
5446: for, behold, If Thou dost leave them, they will [always try to] lead astray those who worship Thee, and will give birth to nothing but wickedness and stubborn ingratitude.
5447: "O my Sustainer! Grant Thy forgiveness unto me and unto my parents, and unto everyone who enters my house as a believer, and unto all believing men and believing women [of later times]; and grant Thou that the doers of evil shall increasingly meet with destruction!"'
5448: SAY: "It has been revealed to me that some of the unseen beings gave ear [to this divine writ], and thereupon said [unto their fellow-beings]: "'Verily, we have heard a wondrous discourse,
5449: guiding towards consciousness of what is right; and so We have come to believe in it. And we shall never ascribe divinity to anyone beside our Sustainer,
5450: for [we know] that sublimely exalted is our Sustainer's majesty: no consort has He ever taken unto Himself, nor a son!
5451: "'And [now we know] that the foolish among us were wont to say outrageous things about God,
5452: and that [we were mistaken when] we thought that neither man nor [any of] the invisible forces would ever tell a lie about God.
5453: Yet [it has always happened] that certain kinds of humans would seek refuge with certain kinds of [such] invisible forces: but these only increased their confusion ‚Äì
5454: so much so that they came to think, as you [once] thought, that God would never [again] send forth anyone [as His apostle].
5455: "'And [so it happened] that we reached out towards heaven: but we found it filled with mighty guards and flames,
5456: notwithstanding that we were established in positions [which we had thought well-suited] to listening to [whatever secrets might be in] it: and anyone who now [or ever] tries to listen will [likewise] find a flame lying in wait for him!
5457: "'And [now we have become aware] that we [created beings] may not know whether evil fortune is intended for [any of] those who live on earth, or whether it is their Sustainer‚Äôs will to endow them with consciousness of what is right:
5458: Just as [we do not know how it happens] that some from among us are righteous, while some of us are [far] below that: we have always followed widely divergent paths.
5459: "'And, withal, we have come to know that we can never elude God [while we live] on earth, and that we can never elude Him by escaping [from life].
5460: Hence, as soon as we heard this [call to His] guidance, we came to believe in it: and he who believes in his Sustainer need never have fear of loss or injustice.
5461: "'Yet [it is true] that among us are such as have surrendered themselves to God - just as there are among us such as have abandoned themselves to wrongdoing. Now as for those who surrender themselves to Him - it is they that have attained to consciousness of what is right;
5462: but as for those who abandon themselves to wrongdoing - they are indeed but fuel for [the fires of] hell!‚Äô"
5463: [KNOW,] THEN, that if they [who have heard Our call] keep firmly to the [right] path, We shall certainly shower them with blessings abundant,
5464: so as to test them by this means: for he who shall turn away from the remembrance of his Sustainer, him will He cause to undergo suffering most grievous.
5465: And [know] that all worship is due to God [alone]: hence, do not invoke anyone side by side with God!
5466: Yet [thus it is] that whenever a servant of God stands up in prayer to Him, they [who are bent on denying the truth] would gladly overwhelm him with their crowds.
5467: Say: "I invoke my Sustainer alone, for I do not ascribe divinity to anyone beside Him."
5468: Say: "Verily, it is not in my power to cause you harm or to endow you with consciousness of what is right."
5469: Say: "Verily, no one could ever protect me from God, nor could I ever find a place to hide from Him
5470: if I should fail to convey [to the world whatever illumination comes to me] from God and His messages." Now as for him who rebels against God and His Apostle - verily, the fire of hell awaits him, therein to abide beyond the count of time.
5471: [Let them, then, wait] until the time when they behold that [doom] of which they were forewarned: for then they will come to understand which [kind of man] is more helpless and counts for less!
5472: Say: "I do not know whether that [doom] of which you were forewarned is near, or whether my Sustainer has set for it a distant term."
5473: He [alone] knows that which is beyond the reach of a created being's perception, and to none does He disclose aught of the mysteries of His Own unfathomable knowledge,
5474: unless it be to an apostle whom He has been pleased to elect [there for]: and then He sends forth [the forces of heaven] to watch over him in whatever lies open before him and in what is beyond his ken ‚Äì
5475: so as to make manifest that it is indeed [but] their Sustainer's messages that these [apostles] deliver: for it is He who encompasses [with His knowledge] all that they have [to say], just as He takes count, one by one, of everything [that exists].
5477: Keep awake [in prayer] at night, all but a small part
5478: of one-half thereof - or make it a little less than that,
5479: or add to it [at will]; and [during that time] recite the Qur‚Äôan calmly and distinctly, with thy mind attuned to its meaning.
5480: Behold, We shall bestow upon thee a weighty message ‚Äì
5481: [and,] verily, the hours of night the mind most strongly and speak with the clearest voice,
5482: whereas by day a long chain of doings is thy portion.
5483: But [whether by night or by day,] remember thy Sustainer's name, and devote thyself unto Him with utter devotion.
5484: The Sustainer of the east and the west [is He]: there is no deity save Him: hence, ascribe to Him alone the power to determine thy fate,
5485: and endure with patience whatever people may say [against thee], and avoid them with a comely avoidance.
5486: And leave Me alone [to deal] with those who give the lie to the truth - those who enjoy the blessings of life [without any thought of God] - and bear thou with them for a little while:
5487: for, behold, heavy fetters [await them] with Us, and a blazing fire,
5488: and food that chokes, and grievous suffering
5489: on the Day when the earth and the mountains will be convulsed and the mountains will [crumble and] become like a sand-dune on the move!
5490: BEHOLD, [O men,] We have sent unto you an apostle who shall bear witness to the truth before you, even as We sent an apostle unto Pharaoh:
5491: and Pharaoh rebelled against the apostle, whereupon We took him to task with a crushing grip.
5492: How, then, if you refuse to acknowledge the truth, will you protect yourselves on that Day which shall turn the hair of children grey,
5493: [the Day] on which the skies shall be rent asunder, [and] His promise [of resurrection] fulfilled?
5494: This, verily, is a reminder: let him who wills, then set out on a way to his Sustainer!
5495: BEHOLD, [O Prophet,] thy Sustainer knows that thou keepest awake [in prayer] nearly two-thirds of the night, or one-half of it, or a third of it, together with some of those who follow thee. And God who determines the measure of night and day, is aware that you would never grudge it: and therefore He turns towards you in His grace. Recite, then, as much of the Qur‚Äôan as you may do with ease. He knows that in time there will be among you sick people, and others who will go about the land in search of God's bounty, and others who will fight in God‚Äôs cause. Recite, then, [only] as much of it as you may do with ease, and be constant in prayer, and spend in charity, and [thus] lend unto God a goodly loan: for whatever good deed you may offer up in your own behalf, you shall truly find it with God - yea, better, and richer in reward. And [always] seek God's forgiveness: behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
5501: And do not through giving seek thyself to gain,
5502: but unto thy Sustainer turn in patience.
5503: And [warn all men that] when the trumpet-call [of resurrection] is sounded,
5504: that very Day shall be a day of anguish,
5505: not of ease, for all who [now] deny the truth!
5506: LEAVE Me alone [to deal] with him whom I have created alone,
5507: and to whom I have granted resources vast,
5509: and to whose life I gave so wide a scope:
5510: and yet, he greedily desires that I give yet more!
5511: Nay, verily, it is against Our messages that he knowingly, stubbornly sets himself
5512: [and so] I shall constrain him to endure a painful uphill climb!
5513: Behold, [when Our messages are conveyed to one who is bent on denying the truth,] he reflects and meditates [as to how to disprove them] ‚Äì
5514: and thus he destroys himself, the way he meditates:
5515: yea, he destroys himself, the way he meditates!
5516: and then he looks [around for new arguments],
5517: and then he frowns and glares,
5518: and in the end he turns his back [on Our message], and glories in his arrogance,
5519: and says, "All this is mere spellbinding eloquence handed down [from olden times]!
5520: This is nothing but the word of mortal man!"
5521: [Hence,] I shall cause him to endure hell-fire [in the life to come]!
5522: And what could make thee conceive what hell-fire is?
5523: It does not allow to live, and neither leaves [to die],
5524: making [all truth] visible to mortal man.
5526: For We have caused none but angelic powers to lord over the fire [of hell]; and We have not caused their number to be aught but a trial for those who are bent on denying the truth - to the end that they who have been granted revelation aforetime might be convinced [of the truth of this divine writ]; and that they who have attained to faith [in it] might grow yet more firm in their faith; and that [both] they who have been granted the earlier revelation and they who believe [in this one] might be freed of all doubt; and that they in whose hearts is disease and the who deny the truth outright might ask, "What does [your] God mean by this parable?" In this way God lets go astray him that wills [to go astray], and guides aright him that wills [to be guided]. And none can comprehend thy Sustainers forces save Him alone: and all this is but a reminder to mortal man.
5528: Consider the night when it departs,
5529: and the morn when it dawns!
5530: Verily, that [hell-fire) is Indeed one of the great [forewarnings] ‚Äì
5532: to everyone of you, whether he chooses to come forward or to hang back!
5533: [On the Day of Judgment,] every human being will be held in pledge for whatever [evil] he has wrought ‚Äì
5534: save those who shall have attained to righteousness:
5535: [dwelling] In gardens [of paradise], they will inquire
5536: of those who were lost in sin:
5538: They will answer: "We were not among those who prayed;
5539: and neither did we feed the needy;
5540: and we were wont to indulge in sinning together with all [the others] who indulged in it;
5541: and the Day of Judgment we were wont to call a lie ‚Äì
5542: until certainty came upon us [in death]."
5543: And so, of no benefit to them could be the intercession of any that would intercede for them.
5544: WHAT, THEN, is amiss with them that they turn away from all admonition
5545: as though they were terrified asses
5547: Yea, everyone of them claims that he [himself] ought to have been given revelations unfolded!
5548: Nay, but they do not [believe in and, hence, do not] fear the life to come.
5549: Nay, verily, this is an admonition ‚Äì
5550: and whoever wills may take it to heart.
5551: But they [who do not believe in the life to come] will not take it to heart unless God so wills: [for] He is the Fount of all God-consciousness, and the Fount of all forgiveness.
5552: NAY! I call to witness the Day of Resurrection!
5553: But nay! I call to witness the accusing voice of man's own conscience!
5554: Does man think that We cannot [resurrect him and] bring his bones together again?
5555: Yea indeed, We are able to make whole his very finger-tips!
5556: None the less man chooses to deny what lies ahead of him,
5557: asking [derisively], "When is that Resurrection Day to be?"
5558: But [on that Day,] when the eyesight is by fear confounded,
5560: and the sun and the moon are brought together
5561: on that Day will man exclaim "Whither to flee?"
5562: But nay: no refuge [for thee, O man]!
5563: With thy Sustainer, on that Day, the journey's end will be!
5564: Man will be apprised, on that Day, of what he has done and what he has left undone:
5565: nay, but man shall against himself be an eye-witness,
5566: even though he may veil himself in excuses.
5567: MOVE NOT thy tongue in haste, [repeating the words of the revelation:]
5568: for, behold, it is for Us to gather it [in thy heart,] and to cause it to be read [as it ought to be read].
5569: Thus, when We recite it, follow thou its wording [with all thy mind]:
5570: and then, behold, it will be for Us to make its meaning clear.
5571: NAY, but [most of] you love this fleeting life,
5572: and give no thought to the life to come [and to Judgment Day]!
5573: Some faces will on that Day be bright with happiness,
5575: and some faces will on that Day be overcast with despair,
5576: knowing that a crushing calamity is about to befall them.
5577: NAY, but when [the last breath] comes up to the throat [of a dying man],
5578: and people ask, "Is there any wizard [that could save him]?"
5579: the while he [himself] knows that this is the parting,
5580: and is enwrapped in the pangs of death
5581: at that time towards thy Sustainer does he feel impelled to turn!
5582: [Useless, though, will be his repentance: for [as long as he was alive] he did not accept the truth, nor did he pray [for enlightenment],
5583: but, on the contrary, he gave the lie to the truth and turned away [from it],
5584: and then went arrogantly back to what he had come from.
5585: [And yet, O man, thine end comes hourly] nearer unto thee, and nearer ‚Äì
5586: and ever nearer unto thee, and nearer!
5587: DOES MAN, then, think that he is to be left to himself to go about at will?
5588: Was he not once a [mere] drop of sperm that had been spilt,
5589: and thereafter became a germ-cell - whereupon He created and formed [it] in accordance with what [it] was meant to be,
5590: and fashioned out of it the two sexes, the male and the female?
5591: Is not He, then; able to bring the dead back to life?
5592: HAS THERE [not] been an endless span of time before man [appeared - a time] when he was not yet a thing to be thought of?
5593: Verily, it is We who have created man out of a drop of sperm intermingled, so that We might try him [in his later life]: and therefore We made him a being endowed with hearing and sight.
5594: Verily, We have shown him the way: [and it rests with him to prove himself] either grateful or ungrateful.
5595: [Now,] behold, for those who deny the truth We have readied chains and shackles, and a blazing flame
5596: [whereas,] behold, the truly virtuous shall drink from a cup flavoured with the calyx of sweet-smelling flowers:
5597: a source [of bliss] whereof God's servants shall drink, seeing it flow in a flow abundant.
5598: [The truly virtuous are] they [who] fulfil their vows, and stand in awe of a Day the woe of which is bound to spread far and wide,
5599: and who give food - however great be their own want of it - unto the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,
5600: [saying, in their hearts,] "We feed you for the sake of God alone: we desire no recompense from you, nor thanks:
5601: behold, we stand in awe of our Sustainer's judgment on a distressful, fateful Day!"
5602: And so, God will preserve them from the woes of that Day, and will bestow on them brightness and joy,
5603: and will reward them for all their patience in adversity with a garden [of bliss] and with [garments of] silk.
5604: In that [garden] they will on couches recline, and will know therein neither [burning] sun nor cold severe,
5605: since its [blissful] shades will come down low over them, and low will hang down its clusters of fruit, most easy to reach.
5606: And they will be waited upon with vessels of silver and goblets that will [seem to] be crystal ‚Äì
5607: crystal-like, [but] of silver - the measure whereof they alone will determine.
5608: And in that [paradise] they will be given to drink of a cup flavoured with ginger,
5609: [derived from] a source [to be found] therein, whose name is "Seek Thy Way".
5610: And immortal youths will wait upon them: when thou seest them, thou wouldst deem them to be scattered pearls;
5611: and when thou seest [anything that is] there thou wilt see [only] bliss and a realm transcendent
5612: Upon those [blest] will be garments of green silk and brocade; and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver. And their Sustainer will them to drink of a drink most pure.
5613: [And they will be told:] "Verily, all this is your reward since Your endeavour [in life] has met [God's] goodly acceptance!"
5614: VERILY, [O believer,] it is We who have bestowed from on high this Qur‚Äôan upon thee, step by step - truly a bestowal from on high!
5615: Await, then, in all patience thy Sustainer's judgment, and pay no heed to any of them, who is a wilful sinner or an ingrate;
5616: and bear in mind thy Sustainer's name at morn and evening
5617: and during some of the night, and prostrate thyself before Him, and extol His limitless glory throughout the long night.
5618: Behold, they [who are unmindful of God] love this fleeting life, and leave behind them [all thought of] a grief-laden Day.
5619: [They will not admit to themselves that] it We who have created them and strengthened their make - and [that] if it be Our will We can replace them entirely with others of their kind.
5620: VERILY, all this is an admonition: whoever, then, so wills, may unto his Sustainer find a way.
5621: But you cannot will it unless God wills [to show you that way]: for, behold, God is indeed all-seeing, wise.
5622: He admits unto His grace everyone who wills [to be admitted]; but as for the evildoers - for them has He readied grievous suffering [in the life to come].
5623: CONSIDER these [messages,] sent forth in waves
5624: and then storming on with a tempest's force!
5625: Consider these [messages] that spread [the truth] far and wide,
5626: thus separating [right and wrong] with all clarity,
5627: and then giving forth a reminder,
5628: [promising] freedom from blame or [offering] a warning!
5629: BEHOLD, all that you are told to expect will surely come to pass.
5630: Thus, [it will come to pass] when the stars are effaced,
5631: and when the sky is rent asunder,
5632: and when the mountains are scattered like dust,
5633: and when all the apostles are called together at a time appointed...
5634: For what day has the term [of all this] been set?
5635: For the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false]!
5636: And what could make thee conceive what that Day of Distinction will be?
5637: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
5638: Did We not destroy [so many of] those [sinners] of olden days?
5639: And We shall let them be followed by those of later times:
5640: [for] thus do We deal with such as are lost in sin.
5641: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
5642: Did We not create you out of a humble fluid
5643: which We then let remain in [the womb's] firm keeping
5645: Thus have We determined [the nature of man's creation]: and excellent indeed is Our power to determine [what is to be]!
5646: Woe, on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
5647: Have We not caused the earth to hold within itself
5649: and have We not set on it proud, firm mountains, and given you sweet water to drink?
5650: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
5651: GO ON towards that [resurrection] which you were wont to call a lie!
5652: Go on towards the threefold shadow
5653: that will offer no [cooling] shade and will be of no avail against the flame
5654: which ‚Äì behold!- will throw up sparks like [burning] logs,
5656: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth ‚Äì
5657: that Day on which they will not [be able to] utter a word,
5658: nor be allowed to proffer excuses!
5659: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth ‚Äì
5660: that Day of Distinction [between the true and the false, when they will be told]: "We have brought you together with those [sinners] of olden times;
5661: and if you [think that you] have a subterfuge left, try to outwit Me!"
5662: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
5663: [AS AGAINST this,] behold, the God-conscious shall dwell amidst [cooling] shades and springs,
5664: and [partake of] whatever fruit they may desire;
5665: [and they will be told:] "Eat and drink in good cheer in return for what you did [in life]!"
5666: Thus, behold, do We reward the doers of good;
5667: [but] woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
5668: EAT [your fill] and enjoy your life for a little while, O you who are lost in sin!
5669: [But] woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth,
5670: and when they are told, "Bow down [before God]", do not bow down:
5671: woe on that Day unto those who give the to the truth!
5672: In what other tiding, then, will they, after this, believe?
5673: ABOUT WHAT do they [most often] ask one another?
5676: Nay, but in time they will come to understand [it]!
5677: And once again: Nay, but in time they will come to understand!
5678: HAVE WE NOT made the earth a resting-place [for you],
5680: And We have created you in pairs;
5681: and We have made your sleep [a symbol of] death
5683: and made the day [a symbol of] life.
5684: And We have built above you seven firmaments,
5685: and have placed [therein the sun,] a lamp full of blazing splendour.
5686: And from the wind-driven clouds We send down waters pouring in abundance,
5687: so that We might bring forth thereby grain, and herbs,
5689: VERILY, the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false] has indeed its appointed time:
5690: the Day when the trumpet [of resurrection] is sounded and you all come forward in multitudes;
5691: and when the skies are opened and become [as wide-flung] gates;
5692: and when the mountains are made to vanish as if they had been a mirage.
5693: [On that Day,] verily, hell will lie in wait [for those who deny the truth] ‚Äì
5694: a goal for all who are wont to transgress the bounds of what is right!
5695: In it shall they remain for a long time.
5696: Neither coolness shall they taste therein nor any [thirst-quenching] drink ‚Äì
5697: only burning despair and ice-cold darkness:
5699: Behold, they were not expecting to be called to account,
5700: having given the lie to Our messages one and all:
5701: but We have placed on record every single thing [of what they did].
5702: [And so We shall say:] "Taste, then, [the fruit of your evil doings,] for now We shall bestow on you nothing but more and more suffering!"
5703: [But,] verily for the God-conscious there is supreme fulfilment in store:
5707: No empty talk will they hear in that [paradise], nor any lie.
5708: [All this will be] a reward from thy Sustainer, a gift in accordance with [His Own] reckoning ‚Äì
5709: [a reward from] the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Most Gracious! [And] none shall have it in their power to raise their voices unto Him
5710: on the Day when all [human] souls and all the angels will stand up in ranks: none will speak but he to whom the Most Gracious will have given leave; and [everyone] will say [only] what is right.
5711: That will be the Day of Ultimate Truth: whoever wills, then, let him take the path that leads towards his Sustainer!
5712: Verily, We have warned you of suffering near at hand - [suffering] on the Day when man shall [clearly] see what his hands have sent ahead, and when he who has denied the truth shall say, "Oh, would that I were mere dust...!"
5713: CONSIDER those [stars] that rise only to set,
5714: and move [in their orbits] with steady motion,
5715: and float [through space] with floating serene,
5716: and yet overtake [one another] with swift overtaking:
5717: and thus they fulfil the [Creator's] behest!
5718: [HENCE, think of] the Day when a violent convulsion will convulse [the world],
